developerResponse: {'id': 42370940, 'body': "I appreciate your review and feedback here! It's great that you are enjoying YNAB and it's helpful to know that you'd like to see more reports in the mobile app. \\- Natalie @ YNAB", 'modified': '2024-03-04T20:39:30Z'}
review:
YNAB‚Äôs budgeting method is the envelope method with a unique ‚Äúready to assign‚Äù addition that makes it one of the best budgeting apps. It‚Äôs a learning curve, but helps users to understand what every penny is doing for them.

The app itself is clean, has a light/dark mode option, and a few other options like icon and budget bar display choices. Even though the app looks somewhat basic, clicking longer over a budget unlocks all the detailed features like category activity and targets. You can also add accounts a sync them to your bank. This app is slower at syncing than other budget apps, but I‚Äôve not found that to be an issue since you should be adding transactions manually to keep your accounts as up to date as possible. 

The reports in this app are very basic. You can only see net worth and filter that number by accounts. The only other option is age of money. The more useful reports are charts for budget history and net income. Those are not a part of this app and I think a big miss on YNAB‚Äôs part.
title: Excellent budgeting method, poor reports

review:
I challenge anyone to find a better budgeting app; there are so many positives, I‚Äôm overwhelming as I start to write out this review.

In no particular order:

They don‚Äôt take your payment details before you sign up for the trial, so you won‚Äôt have to remember to cancel - you just don‚Äôt get charged. I can only think of one other app that does that these days!

The app (and in-browser software) were created around financial principles that have proven to work for generations. Nothing fancy, just a streamlined way of getting clear on your priorities and not spending more than you bring in.

The functionality works for variable income - would have LOVED this when I was self-employed.

The customer service is incredible. There‚Äôs no problem too big or too small for them, and they‚Äôre always super friendly and helpful.

There‚Äôs a bit of learning curve to credit cards but there are plenty of free resources to help you through, AND once it clicks, it‚Äôs incredibly helpful. I‚Äôve been getting $500+ back every year with no stress (and no debt) because of the way YNAB helps me manage CC payments.

YNAB helped us save $11k for our first baby in four months, pay off $9k of student loans in three months, and buy our first house (and hopefully pay it off early!), not to mention the annual cash back.

The price tag might look spendy, but there‚Äôs no other app I could see being THIS worth it.

If you‚Äôre still reading, go download the app now! You won‚Äôt be sorry!
title: Life Changing!

review: I‚Äôve used YNAB for a few years now. It started out as being so helpful to my life after I struggled to use a cheaper app that required entering every transaction. While I was very careful it somehow always got off. This app being far more expensive said it automatically uploaded transactions so you didn‚Äôt have to worry about missing. I invested in it and for a long time it was useful. However a few years ago a credit card disconnected and I unknowingly went over budget that took months to overcome. This has now happened multiple times with increasing frequency. They always default to ‚Äúyou can manually enter expenses‚Äù but if I wanted to do that I would have stuck to the cheaper apps. I will not be continuing with YNAB after the renewal comes up. They keep losing connections now and I have no desire to pay such a high price to have my credit cards and bank accounts constantly disconnecting. The last disconnection I experienced took almost a year to fix (from May to March) and now not even a month later another account disconnected. Hopefully the improve soon and will not cause more damage to future and remaining customers.
title: Declining usefulness

developerResponse: {'id': 39872670, 'body': 'Wow, thank you so much for being such a longtime YNABer! I love that YNAB has helped you so much over the last 11 years. That is a huge deal! \\- Natalie @ YNAB', 'modified': '2023-11-01T14:39:55Z'}
review: I‚Äôve been a YNABer for over 11 years. It still remains the best budgeting software I‚Äôve ever used. It is powerful, easy to understand, and can do as much or as little as you like. I‚Äôve met coworkers who also use YNAB and we use it as conversation topics over lunch. Although, in recent years the new features have cluttered the experience, for me. Luckily, YNAB does have options to hide some of these additions if you don‚Äôt want to take advantage of them. I don‚Äôt like the subscription requirement or the move to an online only interface compared to the old local/non-internet platform. I paid $45 for my upgrade to YNAB4 years ago and then had to move to the subscription to keep budgeting when they moved to the web app. But YNAB wouldn‚Äôt be able to do the amazing things they‚Äôve done without the regular revenue. So I understand it and continue to support the YNAB community with my dollars. This is the longest subscription product I‚Äôve had so that says a lot.
title: Eleven Years and Use It Everyday

review: YNAB allows me to fully grasp where my money is going. I‚Äôm in a constant pursuit of taking advantage of credit card bonuses. I don‚Äôt carry a balance from month to month so to not accrue interest charges, but I could never fully grasp the cycle of cash inflow vs the credit card payment cycle. YNAB puts EVERYTHING together to show me how much cash I actually have even if my bank balances are higher. It automatically accounts for spending done with a credit card so that there‚Äôs no confusion on my part. All the reports and invaluable free resources YNAB provides is a massive cherry on top. I have tried many free budgeting apps, but nothing has given me the peace of mind that YNAB does. It is well worth the cost‚Ä¶and when the bill drops, you won‚Äôt be surprised by it because you‚Äôll already have budgeted for it! If you‚Äôre still in search of your perfect budgeting solution, you should absolutely give YNAB a shot. If you‚Äôre anything like me, you‚Äôll be saying ‚ÄúTAKE MY MONEY‚Äù before the free trial ends!
title: Peace of mind

developerResponse: {'id': 37584123, 'body': "I'm so glad YNAB has helped you feel in control of your finances, that is a big deal! If you ever have questions about credit card payments or need help with a bank connection, we are always happy to help. You can email us at help@ynab.com! \\- Natalie @ YNAB", 'modified': '2023-07-10T12:18:27Z'}
review:
I‚Äôve been using YNAB for a couple of years and it has changed my life for the better. I am in a PhD program so my finances are quite lean. When I first started using YNAB, I felt very sad and anxious to see exactly how little money I have. But after sitting with the reality of my finances for a while, I began to feel more empowered and in control of my money. 

It did take a while for me to feel competent using this system. For example, I figured out just last month how and why it‚Äôs important to reconcile my accounts. I‚Äôm sure there are more features that I‚Äôll learn as I continue. 

I love the app and will continue using it for the foreseeable future. However, I‚Äôm giving 4 stars because of some issues that others in recent reviews have mentioned, mainly that credit card payments get confusing, and that some of my accounts become unlinked quite frequently. I think the price is also kinda steep. I hope the app continues to get updated and improved, and I hope the price doesn‚Äôt go up over time.
title: Love YNAB, but a couple of issues

review: This app is just absolutely awesome, it helped me gain so much in such a short time I was able to set up my budget. It offers carry over of your income for instance let‚Äôs say you have a particular savings where you put money in every month it rolls over to the next month wants it untouched and love that about it. The app allows to create goals let‚Äôs say you have a debt to pay off in a certain date it advises the amount you must put away a month and if you don‚Äôt go track it adjusts to it can gives you the new figure and also tells you what you need to stay on track. You can see past month expenditures and it helped me too really allocate money properly each month and I was able save a lot more cause of this I became more aware of what I am spending my money on am so glad for this app. Thank you to the creators of this app. Probably to only thing that was a bit difficult for me was the payment only offers yearly and not monthly. But they have good reasons and it is worth it.
title: Keeps you on track

developerResponse: {'id': 35581638, 'body': 'Hi LeeC20, Thanks for sharing your experience and for being such a long time YNABer! We love to hear that YNAB has had such a positive impact on your life and the lives of those you have shared it with. We so appreciate the kind words and thank you for spreading the word! Sasha@YNAB', 'modified': '2023-03-25T13:33:45Z'}
review: I rarely write reviews but I‚Äôve been using YNAB for 7 years and there is nothing like it. I have my whole family on it and it‚Äôs changed all our lives. It‚Äôs the best software I‚Äôve ever seen and used for personal finance and I cannot recommend this enough. I recommend it to anyone who opens up about personal finance woes with me. Those who take my advice and try it never go back. I know the initial cost can be a burden but it‚Äôs life changing and it‚Äôs less than a mediocre sandwich a month which people spend all the time without thinking. Once you get past the learning curve you‚Äôll be forever changed and enhanced. You learn that the ways you thought about money beforehand were based on bad assumptions and you will reword your brain to be more successful with money and see your finances on a timeline where you honor your future self. This builds a sense of calm and certainty that only builds one‚Äôs confidence. I cannot rave enough about YNAB
title: Best personal finance software hands down

developerResponse: {'id': 44535894, 'body': "Thanks for sharing your review! If you're having trouble with Direct Import, please reach out to us at help@ynab.com. We are able to resolve many (though not all) Direct Import issues! You may also consider File Based Import as an alternative to manual entry- we can chat more about that too! ~Phil@YNAB", 'modified': '2024-06-11T16:48:49Z'}
review: Honestly, I really like the app/website. You don‚Äôt NEED this (I have a friend who created her own manual version via spreadsheet once I told her the concept). I‚Äôve managed with a spreadsheet budget in the past but wanted something nicer and didn‚Äôt require me manually adding in every transaction. I‚Äôm paying for convenience. I love convenience. EXCEPT it‚Äôs not convenient if you have a smaller, not well-known bank. Multiple times my bank connection isn‚Äôt working/isn‚Äôt linking for whatever reason and it‚Äôs infuriating to have to go through and manually add everything instead of just verifying it like I do with my other account from a bigger, well-known bank. It can be a big (or small) lift depending on how many days I‚Äôve gone without tracking my expenses. It would be one thing if it happened just once in a blue moon, but it got to the point where I unlinked one bank completely. It wasn‚Äôt worth the hassle. If I unlink my main bank account, then I‚Äôm not sure what‚Äôs the point of paying $100 a year for something that consistently doesn‚Äôt work.
title: Great ONLY if you have a well-known bank

review:
I love this program because of the support team!!!!!!!  I have been using it for at least a year. I live on retirement and have a limited income.  Staying on top or my finances is very important to to me.  I used to be extremely stressed about not spending too much money.  No more.  This program helps me keep on to of how much I can spend for everything.  I love the goals for each category so I can see what is coming down the road and am on top of any money needed.  Any time, I have ANY issues, I write a note to support and they are simply amazing.  They set this program apart from any other financial or budgeting software.  I highly recommend it.

I also love that no one can get into my financial information.  I enter each transaction my self so I am not connected to any bank or credit care.  I reconcile it every day and with one checking and one credit card account, I takes me maybe 10 minutes.  Then I relax and know where I am and the stress is gone!
title: A life saver

review:
Yes, they‚Äôve doubled the costs as everyone in the reviews has mentioned. That, in of itself, isn‚Äôt a bad thing but how it was communicated and rolled out was very poor. Especially since the early OG users were promised a grandfathered rate and there were no reasonings for the increase. This is all poor customer service, so keep that in mind if you plan on subscribing. 

Onto the product, it‚Äôs a pretty decent products with some nice features (goals, recurring transactions, budgeting, basic reports) but I‚Äôve found myself more annoyed that my bank imports are constantly disconnected. I still track every transaction but I rely on my accounts staying up to date with the various bank interest and fees that if I go too long without a sync there inevitably pending imports to reconcile which are very annoying. Their reports are basic and the previous YNAB 4 version had far superior charts. 

Overall, a decent app with poor customer service. I‚Äôm still going to pay for the service because it‚Äôs valuable to me, but once a stronger competitor comes along I‚Äôll be the first one in line go try it out.
title: Product is decent, customer service is poor

review:
On the educational side of things, YNAB is absolutely amazing. I spent most of my life budgeting money in my head like most people do, ‚ÄúI need $X for rent, $Y for food, etc‚Äù but would still end up with too much month at the end of my money. Watching the videos and reading the articles really helped me understand the different budgeting concepts which helped me understand how to organize my money and how I spend it. I don‚Äôt know how I ever got by not managing my money in this way.

YNAB isn‚Äôt teaching or selling a new concept. And to be fair, they‚Äôve never pretended that they were. At its core, it‚Äôs the ‚Äúenvelope system‚Äù for managing your money. But YNAB is special because of the technology they‚Äôve built around the concept. It‚Äôs super super easy and intuitive to use the app and move money around as needed. 

YNAB is also accessible for people who have never budgeted like this before. But once you start using YNAB and seeing your financial life change, you‚Äôll never go back.
title: Absolutely Life Changing

developerResponse: {'id': 45728747, 'body': 'We LOVE to hear this. Thanks for the review and for being a YNABer, taswope - we appreciate you!!!', 'modified': '2024-08-03T17:20:10Z'}
review:
I have tried several other budgeting softwares over the past 10 years, and YNAB is the first one I‚Äôve used for multiple years. It is simply the best I‚Äôve found. I appreciate so much about it. Monty budget rollover is a huge feature that some other softwares don‚Äôt have. The complex progress bars are great. It is constantly being developed. The ability to track and sync multiple accounts from checking to mortgage to IRAs is fantastic. It runs on all the devices (web, iOS, and watchOS). I‚Äôm sure there has been, but I can‚Äôt remember running into a single bug. It is easy to learn (or relearn if you‚Äôve fallen off the budget bus). One recent feature that has been incredibly nice is the ability to snooze targets. That was really smart, and it gives us more control over the need to move money and adjust funds throughout the month. 

It has made the difference in my family‚Äôs finances. Thank you, thank you, thank you, YNAB.
title: Could not live without YNAB

review:
YNAB has let us completely turn around our finances. There is a learning curve, but with a little persistence and effort I‚Äôm confident anyone can master it. You can also choose to keep it very simple, and then as your comfort with the system grows, you can use all the features to accurately track and plan your finances.

I love how YNAB gives us the ability to spend money guilt free, because we have a plan for every dollar we spend. If life throws a wrench at us, it doesn‚Äôt derail everything either like it used to; we just grab money from a different category and adjust our plan. Plus the system really makes you feel what a spur of the moment splurge costs. You can‚Äôt just ignore it, you deliberately have to cover it with money that was allocated somewhere else. And because of that you get a direct understanding of what those one off really cost. 

The credit card features are great also. We can actually use them without worrying about accruing a balance that only grows and never shrinks. 

At the end of the day, nobody else is going to care about how well you manage your hard earned money more than you. With YNAB, you get all the tools to do it right. It has easily saved us 10x or more in just the first six months vs the annual cost of the app. It doesn‚Äôt matter if you‚Äôre good with your money already or you‚Äôre swimming in a vicious cycle of credit card debt, I couldn‚Äôt recommend it enough!
title: A total game changer

review:
I have used YNAB for a while and love it. I do use the app on a daily basis. I highly recommend this for people who want their budget to work with them instead of being a hassle. They make it easy to organize categories and adjust things as you go. I also love the charts and reports that they offer. 
One thing that is frustrating: the ‚Äúcover with‚Äù feature. When you overspend in one category and want to simply and quickly cover it with another category. It is easy on the website but the mobile app is frustrating. The app offers to take money out of the category you have selected (which is always the one I want to ADD money to) and put it somewhere else. I don‚Äôt know why it doesn‚Äôt work the same way the website does. 
One thing I would like to see is something in the reports about projected debt payoff information and tools. I love to watch my net worth love but it doesn‚Äôt have any calculators that project pay off or reaching wealth goals. 
Overall an amazing app. Thank you guys!
title: Great app

developerResponse: {'id': 43793497, 'body': "Hey Jessi, thanks for taking the time to write a review ‚Äî we do have a connection for Apple Card, Apple Cash, and Savings with Apple Card accounts! It also sounds like your Target connection could stand a look from our support team. If you decide to give it another go, shoot us a note at help@ynab.com so we can help.\n\nI've passed your feedback along about the auto split/categorization, that's a great idea!", 'modified': '2024-05-09T01:09:30Z'}
review:
There are multiple accounts (Target Redcard, Apple credit card, Apple Cash, and Apple savings) that never connect on their own. If you want to update them you have to manually reconnect and then wait 24 hours for the information to appear. You might as well just manually track your transactions at that point, so it‚Äôs not worth the $15 a month. 

Also, I‚Äôm not complaining about this but it would be nice if the target redcard account could also communicate with my target app to automatically categorize and split categories for purchases. Right now if I want it to be accurate I have to manually go through and add up each category. If the YNAB app could just connect to my target app and automatically know that the charge on my credit card for $11 was $6 of groceries and $5 of personal care that would be super helpful. You could also maybe add a way to scan receipts and categorize based off of that, but doing it automatically would be preferable. 

If they made these changes I would start paying the subscription again but right now it‚Äôs just not worth it.
title: Would be great if connections actually worked

developerResponse: {'id': 42715990, 'body': 'Thanks for your review! It sounds like YNAB was a great fit for how you handle money, and I love how you highlighted the awesome YNAB community as well. üòä \\- Aubrey @ YNAB', 'modified': '2024-03-20T16:08:26Z'}
review: I really love this app. If I‚Äôm üíØ honest, I will admit that there can be a significant learning curve for new users but I did not find that to be the case for me. The learning curve mostly involves learning a whole new way to think about your money. Fortunately, I had mostly encountered the idea of designating ‚Äújobs‚Äù for all my money by using the Mvelopes app previously, so most of my learning had to do with the nuances between Mvelopes and YNAB. But my favorite thing about this app is that it comes with an amazing community of developers, users, and fans. This is what sets this app apart. No app is perfect, but YNAB as a company takes its profits from the VERY REASONABLE subscription fee and invests it heavily back into keeping the app running smoothly, making themselves readily available for troubleshooting, developing new features and teaching anyone who will listen how to succeed (and thrive!) in their day-to-day finances. Totally worth the cost and I plan on sticking with these guys forever!
title: Excellent, useful tool

review: I have always tried to be responsible and stay on top of my finances and monthly expenditures. However NONE of the many computer programs made it ALL make sense until NOW!!!! I am able to see the little mistakes I was making every month that kept me feeling like spending on non-essentials or just treating myself digging a ditch and a personal crime...but YNAB is my ‚Äúget out of jail free‚Äù card! I can see CLEARLY where every penny is going and where it‚Äôs coming from! I‚Äôm organized, saving, paying down debts, and guilt free!!  It might not all make sense at first, but I promise you if you work at it just a bit, the tutorials are amazing and the whole spirit of the company is friendly, approachable, and helpful! The (yearly or monthly) cost (which is not that much for what it‚Äôs done for me) is well worth it!! I actually look forward to each month‚Äôs budget because I already know, I‚Äôm going to win! üôåüèæüí∞ I feel like I‚Äôll never be in the dark about my monthly bills, finances, and savings again! THANK YOU! #iloveynab
title: FINALLY!!!

review:
I can say so many great things about YNAB and how helpful it‚Äôs been for our family‚Äôs budget. The iPad app especially is easy to use, customer service is human and always friendly, and there‚Äôs a helpful community at your finger tips if you have questions.

The app itself is so much better than the one on a phone. It‚Äôs easier to add accounts, move money from category to category, and budget month to month.

I only gave it four stars because it‚Äôs missing two incredibly important features that the web app has: searching and reports. If you want to look at say, how much you spent at Starbucks for the year, you can‚Äôt search at all on the app. This is a really basic feature and not having it on here is especially frustrating (you can‚Äôt access the web app through Chrome on the iPad either, it automatically redirects you to the iPad app). Since there‚Äôs a yearly cost to use the program I‚Äôd expect the app and web app to have identical features.
title: Saved us so much for years

review: I was always super annoyed by all the YNAB reviews that talked about how this changed people‚Äôs relationship with $$, but now I say the same thing every time I talk about YNAB.  I went from doing my best to not know what I was spending and based it on how much credit I had left, to having complete confidence in how I spend my money and have a few months bills in savings.  Using YNAB‚Äôs system, in 18 months, I paid off all of my credit card debt from grad school and now have actual savings ‚Äî and it kept me okay through the early parts of the pandemic when I lost my income.  It does have a bit of a learning curve, but Nick True‚Äôs 101 videos really helped as does the amazing support from the YNAB customer service folks who were able to help me identify where I went wrong.   I also use it to manage the very complicated budget for my business!   Cannot recommend this enough - but you really have to want it for it to work!
title: Literally life changing

review:
YNAB has truly transformed how I handle my finances. Before using YNAB, I often felt nervous about my money, as if I was always playing catch-up without a clear plan. Budgeting seemed overwhelming, and I never felt in full control. 

Since I started using YNAB, that feeling has completely changed. The app‚Äôs approach to budgeting brings clarity and purpose to every dollar. Now, I have a clear picture of where my money is going each month, and I feel confident about my financial decisions. YNAB‚Äôs proactive budgeting system is more than just tracking expenses-it‚Äôs about making conscious choices and being intentional with my money. 

With YNAB, there‚Äôs no more mystery about my finances. I no longer feel that sense of anxiety or helplessness. Instead, I feel empowered and secure, knowing I‚Äôm building a solid foundation for my future.  For anyone looking to take control of their finances and finally feel confident about money, YNAB is an invaluable tool.
title: Best Budgeting App Period

developerResponse: {'id': 35664170, 'body': "Thank you for sharing your inspiring story and this review. We're celebrating you BIG TIME, especially for your wellbeing shift! It's a huge deal. ‚ù§Ô∏è P.S. If you're paying monthly, switch to annual and save on the subscription cost! - Dela @ YNAB", 'modified': '2023-03-29T22:37:43Z'}
review:
Combine trying to pay off stubborn debt with a high APR and trying to plan a wedding, and you have a recipe for severe money anxiety, including panic attacks almost nightly for over a year.

Enter YNAB. I had spent so much time being fearful about my money situation and getting frustrated that other forms of budgeting didn‚Äôt seem to work that I ignored the problem, which just made it worse. In one month of using YNAB, I learned real tools to pay off my debt, don‚Äôt spend more than I have, and actually have money to put in savings beyond what I‚Äôm putting towards my debt and the wedding for the first time in 5 years.

I was hesitant to pay $15 for an app that should be helping me save, but I‚Äôve managed to save WELL more than that and it‚Äôs paid for itself. I‚Äôm so grateful to this app, and can‚Äôt recommend it enough for anyone who is interested in financial stability, which always seemed so far out of reach for me.
title: The first time I haven‚Äôt had money anxiety

review:
YNAB has proven to be pretty good, but not perfect. 

YNAB has been able to provide all of the things that I've needed to do to create a financial plan. When I put in an expense or income, I can give it a category, payee, name, and date. I can see a report of all of the expenses I've done, net worth, income vs. expense and many other reports in the forms of pie graphs, bar graphs, and line graphs. I can make several accounts to have different people manage their money, and can also put in money to be budgeted (put in or out) each week, month, or at other increments. The app provides a tutorial when you first get it, so it is making sure you have an idea on how to operate their complicated app. 

That brings the subject to its complicity. I believe that the app has many useful features, but for me many of these features are useless and unnecessary, in other words for people who only need a simple financial plan. I also don‚Äôt understand all of the functions of YNAB yet, and it would help if it were easier to understand everything the app has to offer. It‚Äôs also hard to find transactions from long ago if you need to edit them or just see what the payment was. 

Overall however, it is good and I recommend it for anyone making a financial plan of any kind. It could just be improved by being able to find past transactions, being a little more simple, and being easier to understand off the bat.
title: Very good finance app

review: I have never been able to follow a budgeting system. The automated systems always categorized my expenses incorrectly and it was way too much work to go back and fix it all while keeping up with what was new. Then, I found YNAB. It took me a solid day to figure out how it worked because it only allows you to budget the money you have. It coaches you through budgeting your immediate obligations first then other things from there. Because I don‚Äôt have my accounts connected automatically I log every transaction manually. This app makes it a total breeze, and even shows you (real time) how your budget category goes down with that purchase. This entire system is a game changer. Try it, you‚Äôll love it. Kudos to the developers for their great work. The only thing I‚Äôve come across that I wish I could change is that I can‚Äôt figure out how to reconcile my account on the app. ü§∑üèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è I hope you decide to try this system!
title: Thinking of trying this? The answer is DO IT.

review:
I‚Äôm not one to write reviews, but this app has been life changing for me. The ability to choose which accounts to include and exclude has allowed me to isolate the exact view I need into my finances. Other apps automatically pull in every account, which for me meant shared accounts with my partner and savings accounts. What I really wanted was to see only my personal active spending accounts. This app allows for that. So now I have an accurate running balance that includes my credit card balances and my bank account. It helps me keep from spending more on my credit cards than I can pay off per month. 

The other thing the app does is require you to review and approve every expense that comes through. When I used Mint, the automation was actually very unhelpful because it would constantly miscategorize without validating so it always felt overwhelming when I checked in, like I needed to untangle a mess. YNAB makes suggestions based on your previous categorizations, but leaves the final decision to you. 

After using this app for a year now, I can confidently say I am so much more aware of my spending patterns. Where I used to be like ‚Äúugh where did all my money go?!‚Äù Now I‚Äôm acutely aware of my spending patterns and habits. I‚Äôm able to predict, plan ahead, and spend/save with much more confidence and intentionality.

Also their customer care folks are wonderful!

Thank you, YNAB!!
title: Fundamentally changed how I view my money

review: Let me start by saying that YNAB is the best budgeting app out there, and I‚Äôve tried pretty much all of them. That being said, it‚Äôs not perfect, and I find it lacking some key components. Chief among them is the ability to see planned income VS scheduled expenditures. Maybe I‚Äôm wrong, but there‚Äôs no easy way to see how much money I expect to earn in a given month, compared to scheduled bills for the month. I get paid weekly, and that amount varies based on overtime, so what I end up doing is planning week by week, but I have no way of knowing if I‚Äôm meeting my obligations for the month without constant review of scheduled transactions. If I look through the budget, all underfunded categories appear in yellow, but there‚Äôs no hard and fast method to see all bills for the month compared to what I expect to earn for the month, in order to see how much discretionary spending I can afford for the month. Otherwise, the methodology behind YNAB is fantastic and is laser focused on budgeting. If you struggle with your personal finances, You Need A Budget!
title: Best Budgeting App Out There

review:
I‚Äôve been happy with YNAB in general. In Spring 2020, YNAB started using a 3rd-party system, Plaid, to get updates from banks. For some banks, this probably went fine. For USAA bank, which requires 2-factor authentication, the interaction to sync with bank accounts went from a couple extra taps to about 15, including re-entering a password every time you want to update and receiving TWO separate SMS codes. It‚Äôs a drag, and it makes using YNAB a lot less fun than it used to. 

I talked to YNAB customer service (which is personal and responsive and generally great, btw!) early on about the bad interaction pattern. They were aware and sympathized, and warned that this could take several months to resolve. I‚Äôm a developer, too, and I understand that some issues need to be delayed while you handle the really pressing issues. But, after three months, every time I use YNAB, there‚Äôs a handy reminder that I‚Äôm paying them $85/ year to not be a priority. If you‚Äôre a USAA account holder, know that YNAB has been really great in the past, and may be again.. but you‚Äôre in for some frustration and stonewalling for the moment.
title: ‚ÄòPlaid‚Äô integration really messed up USAA account holders

review:
I have been using YNAB for a while, hoping to streamline my budgeting process, especially with my Amex accounts. However, my experience has been marred by consistent and frustrating connectivity issues. Despite numerous attempts and following all suggested troubleshooting steps, the connection to my Amex account never seems to work reliably.

The problem isn‚Äôt transient; it‚Äôs been a recurring issue that hampers the core functionality of the app for me. What adds to the disappointment is the lack of effective support from YNAB‚Äôs customer service team. Each time I reached out, I received generic responses that did not address the specific nature of my problem.

This ongoing issue has significantly impacted my ability to track my finances accurately, which is the primary reason I turned to YNAB in the first place. As a customer, I expected a more reliable service and proactive support, especially for such a crucial feature. Unfortunately, this experience has left me questioning the overall reliability of YNAB for my financial management needs.
title: Persistent Issues with Amex Connection in YNAB - Disappointing Experience

review: I‚Äôve gotten two families using YNAB so far and I spread the word to anyone who will listen. Using this budget program makes handling your finances so easy. My husband and I saved and bought a home successfully because of YNAB. Now that we‚Äôre in our home it helps keep us on track with saving for the future. I can‚Äôt believe how often I hear adults saying they only have $$$ in their account for the rest of the month and have no idea where each penny will be spent. I NEVER worry about bills being paid or how I‚Äôm going to pay for Christmas/big expenses because thanks to YNAB I‚Äôve planned out how every penny is spent. The program is flexible and allows for you to be imperfect while you‚Äôre getting used to budgeting for the first time. I had at least 4 ‚ÄúFresh Starts‚Äù before getting into the groove. This features gives beginners some grace and allows them to make mistakes without wanting to give up on budgeting entirely.
title: Makes budgeting a no brainer

developerResponse: {'id': 38429460, 'body': "I love this!! You are totally right \\- with YNAB, managing your finances is a freeing situation, not restrictive at all. It's amazing that you got your wife on board and started managing your combined finances in the best way. Thanks for budgeting with us! \\- Natalie @ YNAB", 'modified': '2023-08-21T12:08:59Z'}
review: Ever since I started using YNAB about 3 years ago it has drastically improved my money habits. I used to think of budgeting as restrictive and time consuming, but it‚Äôs the opposite. It saves you time and is more freeing because you already know where each dollar is going before you spend it. As soon as I got married I got my wife on board with YNAB. We got a joint bank account where all of our money goes and we sit down together on payday and budget out our money, which takes no more than 10 minutes now. It has helped so much. Our arguments about money have gone to near zero compared to when we were just dating and engaged. No more ‚Äúwho‚Äôs gonna pay for this?‚Äù Or ‚Äúwhere did this money go?‚Äù You always hear about money being one of the main causes for fights in marriage, so I think this app is a must for married couples if you want to have more peace with your finances.
title: Life saver

developerResponse: {'id': 30809217, 'body': "Hi Katie! Yes, you can cancel your subscription at any time and you'll continue to have access until the end of your subscription. Refunds or pro-rated refunds are subject to how the subscription was purchased. Our cancellation/refund policy are outlined here: https://www.youneedabudget.com/cancellation/. ~Renae@YNAB", 'modified': '2022-07-10T11:44:31Z'}
review:
YNAB advertises on all subscription levels that you can ‚Äúcancel anytime‚Äù. As a consumer, what does that convey? It conveys that you‚Äôre not ‚Äúlocked in‚Äù in any way. But that‚Äôs not the case with YNAB. They make you finish out your subscription period regardless of when you cancel.

I paid for an annual subscription under this guise of ‚Äúcancel anytime‚Äù; the app turned out to be much too complicated and I realized I wasn‚Äôt getting an accurate picture of my finances at all using YNAB. I cancelled my subscription with 7 months left in the subscription period, believing that YNAB would be true to the sentiment their cancellation policy expresses and give me a prorated refund. They refused, even after I pointed out to them that their website says ‚Äúcancel anytime‚Äù.

The app being too complicated to use is one thing; if I had more time and energy to put into it right now I would, because I do believe in the envelope system and I like the concept of YNAB- but now I will never use YNAB again and I will never recommend it to anyone being that their advertising is deceptive. Very unfortunate for a company whose mission is supposedly to ‚Äúhelp people‚Äù financially.
title: Deceitful Cancellation Policy

developerResponse: {'id': 38173664, 'body': "Hey there! Thanks for this thoughtful review! I'm so glad to hear you've found YNAB the app and the team so helpful! I love that you've been able to take advantage of the free college year! Thanks for your feedback on a student pricing plan! Keep up the awesome work! \\- Kat @ YNAB", 'modified': '2023-08-08T16:03:52Z'}
review:
I love YNAB, I actually have an entire story about how I started my budgeting journey! YNAB is definitely the most user friendly and simple budgeting app that I have ever used. I‚Äôve tried free alternatives that are good but definitely don‚Äôt offer the same quality of life features that this app does. I love this app and the team that has made it! The support I have gotten whenever I have questions or concerns has always been great!

My only point that I can make that is difficult is as a student with a low income, $15 a month can add up and it becomes a bit hard to keep a consistent subscription. Budgeting has definitely improved my finances and YNAB is my favorite. I am happy that I was able to redeem my free year of college and it really helped as a freshman! I only wish there could be a student pricing plan! Thanks for creating such an intuitive and helpful app!
title: Absolutely Incredible! Only one thing‚Ä¶

review: We were introduced to YNAB a couple months after getting married. We were in our last year of college, my husband had just started a new job after having been laid off/unemployed for 5 months, and we had $2,000 credit card debt from our wedding. YNAB helped us get out of credit debt and get on a budget that stuck! It helped us keep grad school loans down as much as possible in an expensive city on a lean income. It helped us to afford having kids. And it helped us pay off $100,000 student loans 2 years after finishing grad school. It has changed the way we look at money and budgeting and strengthened our marriage by helping us communicate our priorities and create goals for our money and (more importantly) our life. 6 years after starting to use YNAB we‚Äôre in a completely different financial space, expecting another kid, and planning for purchasing a home and working towards financial independence. Thank you YNAB!
title: We love YNAB!

developerResponse: {'id': 35169427, 'body': "Thank you for taking the time to share this. While we're often able to troubleshoot direct import issues, the Amex integration has recently proven more difficult than most. We hope the Amex connection will be fixed soon, and we'll be sure to let our Amex users know when that happens! - Jill@YNAB", 'modified': '2023-03-02T17:17:09Z'}
review: I‚Äôm a primarily AMEX credit card and HYSA user and this has turned into a syncing NIGHTMARE for me! At the beginning I had no problems with syncing transactions but now I‚Äôm constantly having to reauthenticate to all my Amex accounts every single day. If you use AMEX, do not use this app. And don‚Äôt come at me with oh you should manually import everything. This is a paid service and it should work as intended without compensating. This app is so integral to my daily life that I can‚Äôt really move off the platform so I tolerate this. I should love this app but it‚Äôs hard to experience this issue day in and day out only to hear it‚Äôs not a problem with YNAB, rather a third party service. That designation doesn‚Äôt matter to your customers. We pay YNAB for a subscription and third party services are as much part of your product as your native service is. To me they‚Äôre one in the same. Fix this and I‚Äôll be a loyal customer for life but when my subscription comes due I‚Äôll be considering other alternatives.
title: Great app with TERRIBLE sync issues

review:
I‚Äôve used YNAB in the past and loved it. I‚Äôve switched to iPhone and so far this has some annoyances. I re-subscribed to the service and the app closed while trying to ‚Äúload‚Äù the a screen that, I‚Äôm guessing, would confirm my subscription. I never got that screen. I did get the charge and the receipt email but the YNAB service apparently can‚Äôt match that to my account. I‚Äôve contacted Customer Service and can update this rating based on their response. I‚Äôve never had this issue with almost any other subscription even if the apps closes. 

On iPhone they also need to update the login screen (I‚Äôm on iPhone 12). If you aren‚Äôt using Google or Apple for the account, you can enter an email but you can‚Äôt scroll down to see that you‚Äôre entering a password (to count characters, or just to see it‚Äôs being entered) and the screen won‚Äôt automatically move down after entering your email. Small annoyance but still really annoying to have to guess that I entered the correct number of characters for the password while I‚Äôm typing it.
title: Bugs need fixing

review:
My husband and I have a big goal ‚Äî pay off debt and save for a $100k home renovation‚Ä¶ and we were looking for a tool to assist us in making this happen. We make a decent amount of money, save for retirement and had an emergency fund, and thought we were doing ok financially (not top notch‚Ä¶ but our credit is great and we lived a good life). 

Within one month of downloading the app and getting serious, this app illuminated so much that we weren‚Äôt paying attention to: small subscriptions that both of us were paying for, things we paid for we didn‚Äôt need/use, and money we were spending in the wrong places (like paying off debt with 0% interest instead of debt with higher rates). 

Within two months, the average amount of money in our checking/savings account almost quadrupled (with every cent accounted for in the app)‚Ä¶ and we started intentionally setting financial goals. 

We love watching our net worth increase every month‚Ä¶. we love knowing exactly how much we have agreed to spend on various projects/events‚Ä¶ and we weirdly like saying no to things when we know it will take away from our goals.  

The app gives us flexibility‚Ä¶ and also serves as a communication tool. Every time we get paid, we have conversations about goals. 

I have started telling everyone I know about the app! It‚Äôs the best $15 I spend each month.
title: Get it!

review:
I'd been looking for years for a bridge off Quicken that wouldn't keep me tied to a PC or exposed to deteriorating quality after Quicken was sold to private equity. I was a Quicken power user. Finally gave YNAB a try, and after taking a few weeks to learn the system, I haven't looked back and have stopped updating Quicken altogether. The support and community are excellent as well, with plenty of help available online to help you recreate your old system. In my case the key thing was being able to set up rollover amounts with monthly funding targets to simulate Quicken 'savings goals' - implementing that in YNAB was much cleaner than in Mint. 

Regarding Mint, I tried it five or six times before trying YNAB, since it has the brand name and I therefore perceived it as more likely to be high quality, polished, and professional. I was wrong; YNAB runs faster and with fewer bugs, and with the subscription model I don't worry about my data being sold
title: Excellent app and community

developerResponse: {'id': 44510816, 'body': 'Hey Armestam! Thanks for being a long time YNABer, we appreciate you! We\'ve definitely made improvements in YNAB\'s functionality over the last several years, but it sounds like they\'ve not been the ones you\'re looking for. Reports on Mobile is high on our radar - and can you write into our support team about what you mean by "budget for upcoming"? We have auto-assign functionality that lets you set a target in a category, and quickly assign that target amount so that it\'s set aside for your upcoming expenses, so would love to hear more about what you\'re looking for! You can send us a note at help@ynab.com. Looking forward to hearing from you!', 'modified': '2024-06-10T20:34:36Z'}
review:
I have been a daily user of YNAB for five years. Generally I love it. But I pay a hefty fee every year and feel like I‚Äôm not getting any new functions added. A few of the updates over the years even took functionality away. For example they removed they ability to Budget for Upcoming, which automatically added money to a category to account for that months upcoming expenses. I used that feature to plan out several months of expenses. I really miss that feature. I‚Äôve had recent bugs with expenses being double matched to the same bank transaction with no way to undo it. That never happened when I first got YNAB. 

After five years there are still only two reports available in the app. None of the web reports appear here, like spending by category, or by month.  The whole reports tab on the app looks unfinished after five years. 

I genuinely believe the YNAB I paid for five years ago had better functionality, and paying yearly for an app that has actively become worse is pushing me away.
title: Great App - No Improvements in years

developerResponse: {'id': 41376599, 'body': "Hi there! Thanks for your review. I'd love to have you share that wishlist directly with our developers via our feature feedback form: https://youneedabudget.typeform.com/to/Pt6cek?typeform\\-source=support.ynab.com. \\- Aubrey @ YNAB", 'modified': '2024-01-18T13:28:13Z'}
review:
I am a Mint user looking for an alternative and did the 1 month free trial.  Unfortunately while the concept is good and there is some functionality in the app, it seems that a large number of functions are only available through the PC version.  I rarely use my computer and am looking for an app, like Mint, that met my needs 99% through the app.

Wishlist for the app: 
-the ability to organize accounts into categories (for example credit cards, checking accounts, savings accounts)
-the ability to analyze income by category (or even by who/where it‚Äôs coming from)
-the ability to enter credit card payment due dates so I can keep track of where I‚Äôm at with them
-the ability to analyze anything‚Äîthere are no reports or graphs available in the app other than the ‚Äúage of money‚Äù graph

I really like the YNAB concept and now am torn about what to do‚Äîwhether to limp through with this app and try to change my lifestyle so I power up my old laptop more often.  Or whether to look for another app that has the ability to ‚Äúassign‚Äù cash to budget categories, to help me stay on track.

This app is best for people who use their computer mostly and use the app secondarily.  Or who don‚Äôt care about the features I listed on my wishlist.

I just can‚Äôt justify spending so much on an app that doesn‚Äôt do so many of those basic things.  I hope YNAB invests in making its app as robust as Mint‚Äôs (which isn‚Äôt even that great in some ways, but was more functional than this).
title: App needs more functionality

review: I found YNAB on my search for a good billing app. I never knew I needed a budget app until I found YNAB. The only issue I have is that I sometimes forget when my bills are due and there isn‚Äôt a calendar or ‚Äúbilling‚Äù app function built into YNAB. So, I have to use two apps in order to accomplish what I want to get done. I can see myself no longer paying for YNAB after this year due to needing the billing function more than the budget function. I‚Äôm not sure if it‚Äôs something YNAB would create in the future, but it would be awesome to have a tab that is just for monthly bills like utilities and mortgage‚Ä¶etc. something that goes in order based on when it is due and is somehow integrated in with the budget and works with it. Being able to pay my bills on time comes before assigning my money to various places‚Ä¶that is my only complaint. So, it‚Äôs almost perfect, but for the money. It doesn‚Äôt do everything I want it to do.
title: Almost perfect

developerResponse: {'id': 38779926, 'body': "Thanks for leaving this review. Our Support Team would be happy to answer your questions around how credit cards work in YNAB. If you haven't already, you can email us at help@ynab.com and we'll go from there! \\- Natalie @ YNAB", 'modified': '2023-09-07T12:16:08Z'}
review: This app is very useful for granular tracking of different areas of your budget, saving up for larger purchases, setting money aside for specific emergency situations, etc. it‚Äôs almost like being able to have ‚Äúvirtual‚Äù checking and savings accounts within your actual accounts. That part I like. The part that is really frustrating (at least for me) is how credit card payment transactions work. If you are one of those people who uses their credit card as a debit card and pays your entire balance every month, you will probably run into the same issues. There is no way that I have found to get this app to work properly while doing this other than to just leave all transactions (both inflow and outflow) for credit card payments uncategorized. Otherwise I end up with massively negative values in ‚Äúready to assign‚Äù, and I can‚Äôt figure out why. Hopefully their support can clarify this as their articles related to this hasn‚Äôt made it any less confusing.
title: Mixed bag

review:
Revised review ‚Äî maybe it‚Äôs just my new iPad. I‚Äôve been using YNAB on chrome under W10/Surface and just switched to iPad. YNAB won‚Äôt let me use the web version on the iPad. It force redirects me to the mobile app - ugh...  I‚Äôm going to submit a help ticket to see if there‚Äôs alternatives. I need this app - it‚Äôs super. Just don‚Äôt like the Mobile only option on the iPad. 
‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî-
I‚Äôve used the app a while and yes I love it. But this upgrade‚Ä¶ Really? 
   Dark green on dark gray in a small font for totals ‚Äúreally pops‚Äù - really?  Totals are the numbers you want to quickly reference and track - they should pop and IMO they don‚Äôt. 
    Yes I use my iPad in the dark. My choice. I should still be able to read it. Turquoise on white and dark green on dark gray just doesn‚Äôt cut it for me. I guess I‚Äôm stuck between using the classic with it‚Äôs bugs or upgrading and fighting the UI. Bummer‚Ä¶
title: Love the app, but not the iPad mobile version

review:
I've used a lot of different budgeting software. YNAB is my favorite, and the only one that I've stuck with. You get the most out of it if you enter your transactions manually then just use sync to verify everything. Really happy that iPhone X is fully supported now. I realize that we are a small minority and I appreciate that the time was taken to update the app for us, even though it took a bit longer than I would have liked. I'm impatient.

The website is where I do most of my budgeting. The app is great for entering transactions on the go and importing synced transactions.

I've read a bunch of the one star reviews and I think they're all ridiculous. Some rate the app 1 star because of one bug they encounter. Others rate it one star and complain about things in a way that I can't even figure out what they're complaining about. Must be really frustrating as a developer. I just don't get it.
title: Best budgeting software

review: This app and way of budgeting has changed my life over the past year. Even though I have plenty of money I would get overdraft charges because I had no visibility into exactly how much was in my account since transactions were floating all over the place. Now every time I get a paycheck, I budget every dollar into different categories. When an expense happens, I add it to my register and take it out of the appropriate category. I manually enter transactions I make and mark them when they‚Äôve cleared. It literally takes me less than five minutes a day to do this - not exaggerating. I have been able to save so much money on the side because I always know how much money I have to work with at any given time. I have been not so great with money my whole life. This system has changed everything for the positive.
title: Checking account balanced to penny for over a year

review: I have too many apps to count but this is the first I ever reviewed. On New Years Eve, I made a resolution to simplify financially. I was disgusted by the overspending of Christmas and as usual, found myself heading into the new year with a bunch of financial obligations that I hadn‚Äôt planned for. This app seemed highly rated so I decided to give it a chance. Wow - best decision ever! It took me a few weeks to get the hang of it but now that I have I would never consider leaving. We view our spending so differently - it‚Äôs all planned in advance and there are no surprises anymore. In nine months I have paid down $56,000 on our Home Equity line, increased my credit score by 40 points and feel 100% in control of my financial destiny. One tip is to link your accounts immediately. I was manually transcribing the information from my credit card and bank accounts. Once I auto linked the accounts it cut my time way down. Thanks YNAB!
title: Life changing app

review: Seriously this is the best app/service I‚Äôve ever used. I never really could get into budgeting. I tried a few apps and spreadsheets over the years but never could stick to it and it just seemed too hard.  I was never someone who was paycheck to paycheck so I didn‚Äôt value budgeting the way I probably should have.  This service take a little adjusting to at first.  It is different than most budgeting systems out there and it is worth the time to invest in a few minutes to a few hours in watching their instructional videos to learn how to use the app.  Once you are all setup and start tracking your spending and setting up goals you‚Äôll think about your finances in a totally new way.  Just download the app and start your free trial.  You won‚Äôt regret it! Also,in addition to the YNAB support there are Facebook groups if you have additional questions and want to talk to actual users.
title: This app changed my life!

developerResponse: {'id': 34885386, 'body': "Thanks for the review, coldcash57! It's always great to hear from our longtime YNABers. Thank you for sharing and recommending YNAB! - Natalie @ YNAB", 'modified': '2023-02-15T13:09:29Z'}
review:
I still haven‚Äôt learned everything about it, but enough to track my finances. There was a bit of a learning curve but it was worth it!Their support is fantastic. The Private Facebook group, where you post questions and problems, have people there willing to help out even during a holiday!  
There are only 2 things I feel would make YNAB complete. 1. A way to back up, and restore. I like to do projections and the Web version doesn't allow for that like the old version did. With the old version, I could correct a mistake through restoring a backup. But in doing this I NEVER HAD TO LEARN about the app. The Web version has forced me to learn and become better at it. 
You can get a 34-day free trial, followed by a 2nd free 34 day trial upon asking. This should give one enough time to see if YNAB is a good fit. I recommend YNAB for all!
title: Has a bit of a learning curve, but still GREAT!

review: I loved this app when I first got it. But over the past few months, YNAB has not been able to connect to my bank accounts. Because of this, my budget is constantly off and the balances are not correct. What good is a budgeting app that you pay for if your account balances are rarely correct? I have messaged customer service several times and have gone through their steps at resolving this issue but have not been successful. The other problem is that there is no customer support that you can call on the phone to walk you through your issues with the software. I message their customer support and have to wait a day for their response, but by the time I get a response back it‚Äôs been a full day and I can‚Äôt immediately work on the issue because I‚Äôm at work or busy or otherwise preoccupied. It‚Äôs a huge hassle. YNAB is a great idea but in my personal experience, it is still lacking in major areas if they‚Äôre going to charge you as much as they do - especially all at once as opposed to a one time charge.
title: Bad bank connections and bad customer service

review:
I have a degree  if Family Finance. I know how to budget. I used an offline version of the YNAB system for years growing up. Fast forward to marriage‚Ä¶my husband didn‚Äôt like budgeting and my system. The short version is that YNAB allowed us to finally stick to our budget and was simple enough for my spouse to do it too. I‚Äôve shared this system with my teenage children and they love it. It‚Äôs better than other apps (we tried them). Importing transactions saves me so much time! Our budget is better than ever and part of that is YNAB. 

I recommend this app all the time as a college adjunct professor of Family Resource Management, to friends, to family. The best budgeting all is one you‚Äôll use, and we‚Äôve found YNAB to be the best at tracking your categories and spending‚Äîwhich is the real issue with sticking to a budget. üëçüèªüëçüèª
title: Best app for actually sticking to a budget once you make it

review:
The app is very stable and the transition from web app to the phone app is seamless. Only thing missing from the app that bugs me is the inability reconcile your account. This functionality would be really nice to have. 

Can‚Äôt leave a review of the app without speaking to the service and the customer service at YNAB... again phenomenal. If you have issues keeping track of spending and planning for the future, this is the service for you. I‚Äôve been on it for almost a year, and for the first time since being married, I have no credit card debt for the year. All bills have been cash flowed including several medical bills that included imaging and blood work. Always before I would have around 2k worth of debt by now, thanks to YNAB and simply knowing what I have coming in and out, no debt. Wish I had discovered YNAB, or at least budgeting, years ago.
title: Phenomenal

review:
My wife and I were using another budgeting app when we first got married four years ago. We did it for a year, but it was a constant source of stress. It was complicated to maintain, complex to understand, and the app was missing so many helpful functions. We could never really tell where we were spending our money. It was frustrating and was a relationship strainer at times.

When we made the switch to YNAB, there was an immediate difference. The app was simple and powerful, their getting started guides were helpful and easy to understand, we were able to manage our budget easily and actually see where our money was going, and my wife and I actually enjoyed using it!

We‚Äôve used YNAB for years now and would recommend it to anyone! We look forward to using it for many years to come. üôåüôå
title: Absolute life changer

developerResponse: {'id': 30248429, 'body': "Hi Sarah! Thanks so much for taking the time to leave this feedback! We're so glad the YNAB Method has given you a healthy mindset. If you ever have any bank trouble, don't hesitate to reach out at help@ynab.com. Happy budgeting! ‚Äì JD @ YNAB", 'modified': '2022-06-08T23:39:48Z'}
review: I love this app. It lets me customize to my heart‚Äôs content, and it‚Äôs so easy to use. If you understand and buy in to the ‚Äúevery dollar has a job‚Äù concept and the idea of only being able to budget money already in your bank account, then this app will be a great fit. It subtly enforces a healthy money mindset, and I love that I can link it to my accounts and it remembers my patterns‚Ä¶ for example it knows that Tom Thumb is usually assigned to groceries. And if I also get cleaning supplies, I can easily split out that transaction between my groceries and cleaning supplies categories. I also love trying to increase my Age of Money month over month. Can‚Äôt say enough good things. The only downer is if you have a small town bank that isn‚Äôt super up to speed on online banking‚Ä¶ I switched to Chase just to get a better YNAB user experience.
title: Like Every Dollar but better

developerResponse: {'id': 45122296, 'body': "Thanks for sharing your experience! We'd love to giv eyou some guidance on these issues- credit cards, viewing all transactions and how to handle reimbursements! Send us a note to help@ynab.com and we can talk you through those items! ~Phil@YNAB", 'modified': '2024-07-08T13:22:32Z'}
review:
Overall, the app is made really well, but there are a few things that drive me totally nuts even after using it for a couple years. I get a little angry every month when we use it for our monthly budgeting.

First, I cannot wrap my head around how it treats credit card balances and budgeting ‚Äîit‚Äôs terribly confusing. It seems to have some concept of budgeting credit card spending, which makes no sense to me; I just want to budget actual spending categories (like groceries, rent, etc.), it doesn‚Äôt make sense to budget accounts (like checking accounts or credit cards). Second, I want to be able to easily view all purchases within a certain spending category, but it‚Äôs not easy like it should be. Third, the system doesn‚Äôt let negative balances carry over from one month to the next, which means we can‚Äôt have a ‚Äúreimbursable‚Äù category that we use for work purchases, etc.
title: Expensive service, frustrating features

review: I have never submitted an App Store review before, but after a recent experience I felt compelled to sing the praises of YNAB. Over the summer I, as so many others around the world, was furloughed due to COVID-19. I started using YNAB only a month before my paychecks stopped. I‚Äôm not sure what I would have done without it. I was able to make it through my two month furlough, stretching my unemployment pay, without racking up significant debt. (I do feel the need to recognize my privilege as a white male coming from an upper middle class family. An app will not erase the wage inequities in our country, but it also, hopefully, won‚Äôt hurt.) I would recommend YNAB to anyone looking to master their budget. The app itself is very user friendly, the videos and articles are really helpful, and the staff were very friendly and responsive when I had questions. Give YNAB a try, you won‚Äôt regret it.
title: You will not regret YNAB

review:
I like this app more than most I‚Äôve tried. Money management while neurodiverse is a trip. There are some improvements that may be a bit helpful (maybe even to those like me) such as  giving the option to budget per pay period as opposed to only monthly, weekly, and yearly. Like ask for a start date and then set the due days 14 days from then or however the user needs to customize the frequency. Maybe a periodic budget/evaluation questionnaire for guided analysis/reevaluation. Also maybe improved automation with tracking and grouping expenses. It seems like the the app considers repeat vendors as an individual entity then the transaction/invoice numbers are different. And honorable mention to a possible debt progress chart.

Otherwise, super dope app! Love what you guys have so far!
title: I really enjoy this app, but there‚Äôs always room for improvement

developerResponse: {'id': 46671807, 'body': "Thanks for taking the time to leave us a review, and share that feedback about the new money move flow! I've passed all of that along to our designers. Feel free to drop us a note in support if there's anything that we can do to help with workarounds, etc. at help@ynab.com!", 'modified': '2024-09-12T01:36:11Z'}
review: This is regression through and through. Having to slide up to select anything not in the top of the list is horrible and clunky. Should be either fully expanded to start with or not be using that UI element at all. You are not able to proceed without a selection so why make it more difficult. After selecting a category the keyboard should be presented immediately instead of the need to select what is now a much smaller text box. It must be designed to have the keyboard opened with how much dead space there is on the lower half of the screen and you need to enter a value so why is it hidden to begin with. I guess the slider is fine if the keyboard opens instantly but I don‚Äôt know who in their right mind would want to enter numbers that way. For cover overspending the category list should not require an additional swipe to access the full list. Please fix these issues or do a rollback because I‚Äôd rather use the website if possible when I would have previously picked up my phone to do both of these actions.
title: New move money update

developerResponse: {'id': 47051795, 'body': "Hi there! Thank you for this review and sharing the impact YNAB has had. We're really excited to hear that you're enjoying the changes to the reflect tab so far, and I've passed along your request for more options to filter by date on to our designers. If there's anything else you'd like to share with us, please get in touch at help@ynab.com anytime! - Caity @ YNAB", 'modified': '2024-09-27T17:55:14Z'}
review:
I‚Äôve been using YNAB for about five years now, and I can confidently say that it has changed my life for the better. I used to not understand where my money went every month, and each month I found myself spending pretty much all of what I made. With YNAB I was able to develop a complete picture of my finances and through the power of budgeting begin actually SAVING money every month.

I love YNAB. Aside from being a phenomenal personal finance tool, it‚Äôs great software. The app and website are both fast and well-designed. I use either the app or the website on a daily basis!

I really appreciate that YNAB has recently been improving the ‚Äúreports‚Äù section of the app (recently renamed to ‚Äúreflect‚Äù). Reporting has always been a weakness of YNAB, but with the recent changes to reflect I‚Äôm seeing the beginnings of some really nice reporting tools.

One request for reflect: you have options to see stats for the most recent three/six/12 months, but these presets include the current month. I would like to be able to see stats for the trailing three months exclusive of the current month, since the current month is generally always incomplete and can lead to misleading reports being generated, especially for the spending breakdown report.
title: Life-Changing and worth every penny

developerResponse: {'id': 34992301, 'body': 'Hi there, I appreciate your feedback here. We are always working to make YNAB more accessible and I will pass your message along to the team. - Natalie @ YNAB', 'modified': '2023-02-21T13:17:55Z'}
review:
I really wanted this app to work for me and tried to make it work for several months, but it‚Äôs simply too complex to even answer my simplest budget needs. If you need to watch a dozen videos, read several articles, and request customer support a couple times just to get the basic functionality right, it‚Äôs not accessible enough.

The balance of my credit card is never accurate, it‚Äôs difficult to understand your total spending vs total budget for the month, and cash flows don‚Äôt work with my monthly payment cycle. It‚Äôs been more reliable to eyeball the spending across my accounts than to follow YNAB‚Äôs numbers.

This is disappointing because much of the functionality and idea is great and had given me some insight into where my money is going. But at the end of the day I need to know if my total spending last month was more than I can afford, not just how much went into each subcategory. Happy for everyone this worked for but I can see why it is not more popular.
title: Overcomplicated

review:
I‚Äôve been using YNABs products since 2014, including their apps, and have never had a single issue. Not one. It just works every time and is very easy to use. We YNABers are pretty fanatical, I‚Äôll admit. So if you‚Äôre on the fence know this: I ‚Äúfind‚Äù extra money **every single month** because of YNAB. 

When I divorced seven years ago, I was really worried about making ends meet. Because of YNAB, not only have I been able to make ends meet, but I can travel, pay for my hobbies, and I paid cash for my brand new Forester last year.  

I was sad to see YNAB move to a subscription based model a few years ago, but I understand they need to pay their bills too and I like supporting local businesses who pay their employees a fair wage. And the money I‚Äôm now able to save and ‚Äúfind‚Äù well exceeds the cost. I‚Äôm a lifetime subscriber for sure.
title: Long-time happy user

review: I am completely sold on YNAB and the app already! The customer service is absolutely amazing. I had trouble figuring out something in my budget and received personalized one on one help with a real human through the chat function at 7 am on a Saturday! My manually entered transactions ‚Äúautomagically‚Äù link as they‚Äôre imported. I had trouble linking one account but since it‚Äôs just a credit card I‚Äôm working on paying down I opted to link it manually, which works great too. I just love how much YNAB has helped changed my mindset about budgeting. There‚Äôs zero judgement and just the right amount of guidance. The app works almost perfectly on my iPhone XS. Sometimes the bottom menu bar vanishes but it comes back when I close and reopen the app. The simplicity of the phone app is great for on the go and the web browser app that it links with is even better. Keep up the great work!
title: A revelation!!

review:
Learned about the app last year but thought because I was making more money that I had my finances under control, little did I realized I crawled right back into debt in a year again. After that, I realized I needed to make a change and started to import my information to see where I was messing up at.. was able to track my spending and budget down to a dollar, the YNAB 4 rules really re-teach you how you should think about money and there‚Äôs tons of free resources to help you learn how to use the app efficiently. Now I don‚Äôt make a purchase before thinking about what I could be using the money on and save up for purchases before just spending Willy nily. Already cleared up half of my debt in 3 months of using and saved over 600$ this month, truly a game changer.

Thanks YNAB team!
title: Best in the market to get Finances on track.

review: For me it‚Äôs quite a learning curve - not using the app, that‚Äôs fairly intuitive and the emails I got during my trial gave lots of tips and clues. The learning curve is reminding myself I‚Äôm not listing expenses for a month - only listing and budgeting for  the expenses that fit the money I have on hand. When I have a deposit, it gets added in and I budget how it will be spent. YNAB has caused me to pay much more attention to what I‚Äôm spending and when I spend it. It has alerted me to areas of overspending I wasn‚Äôt aware of because I always ‚Äújuggled‚Äù. Well, I‚Äôm not juggling anymore (although you can, and the app shows you how to do it accurately) and after a month I‚Äôve decided to buy the subscription - it‚Äôs pricey for me, but that‚Äôs OK - I like the change I‚Äôm seeing in myself. On a relatively fixed income (semi-retired plus SS) I do want to have budgeting tools I can count on - this is it, for me!
title: I love this app!

developerResponse: {'id': 37846934, 'body': "Hey Kev! Thanks for this thoughtful review! You're right \\- the YNAB Method and only planning with money you have right now is such a game\\-changer. I'm so glad you and your wife are enjoying YNAB! \\- Kat @ YNAB", 'modified': '2023-07-23T17:18:58Z'}
review:
My wife and I have been using YNAB licensed version for 1.5 years and it has worked way better for us than any other budget tool. I love that it reconciles to my bank statement and credit card balance.  This has helped us ensure we are not missing transactions.  And YNAB‚Äôs philosophy of budgeting cash works great. It has really helped plan for the large infrequent expenses.

It takes a little getting used to since most other budgeting apps have no correlation to the cash in the bank.  If you have used other apps or learned budgeting in school, this is a little different.  Once you get used to it, then it makes a lot of sense since you are planning with your actual cash and then anticipating the future.  

I am an accountant by trade and this has taken a lot of the frustration out of finances for my wife and I.
title: Love the App

review: I love YNAB! The new app is absolutely amazing and makes budgeting so easy. I've never stuck with a budget for very long but this app and the program in general are wonderful and I've stuck with it for six months with no sign of stopping anytime soon. This app has helped me pay for classes without going into debt and just generally helps me feel in control of my money. Update: 4 years in and I‚Äôm still totally in love. If anything, my complaint is that budgeting is TOO easy now. üôÉ I really do love it, and this app will forever have made a difference in my life. I‚Äôve now saved up enough money for a very healthy down payment, and I didn‚Äôt have to give up having fun for the last four years to save. Update; 5 years in, just game add about the price increase, and I still TOTALLY feel that this app is more than worth it.
title: Love it!

review: My husband and I have used the envelope system of budgeting all 28 years of our married life. As technology has stepped into the budgeting arena, we‚Äôve tried many different things. YNAB is by far the very best tool we‚Äôve ever used to budget. Even after being faithful budgeters for almost 3 decades, YNAB is improving our spending habits more than I thought possible. The ‚Äúage of money‚Äù and green/orange/red colors on amounts in categories is really motivating. I will say that when the first month ‚Äúrolled over‚Äù we weren‚Äôt prepared...and just a bit unhappy. But it‚Äôs become our new best budgeting friend. If you‚Äôre using mvelopes, do yourself a favor and get YNAB. You will have more time in your day and actually smile as you track spending. The YNAB support team is hands down THE BEST of any app or program I have EVER used. And no I was not paid to write this. I‚Äôm a just very happy YNAB customer. ü•∞ü•∞ü•∞
title: ABSOLUTELY AMAZING!!!

developerResponse: {'id': 40493422, 'body': "Thanks for taking the time to leave us a review\\-\\-we couldn't have said it any better ourselves! We're so glad you've found YNAB impactful, and you're so right, proactively giving every dollar a job is a real game\\-changer! And the flexibility to change that plan in real time is essential. üôå We're hopeful the Amex connection will improve. \\-Jill@YNAB", 'modified': '2023-12-04T14:16:31Z'}
review:
Used this for a month so far and I can already say after my experience with advanced spreadsheets and various other apps this is the most useful and practical one I have used so far. It‚Äôs basically perfect, the one gripe I have with it is with AMEX syncing, but that‚Äôs more or less an AMEX problem since it seems that AMEX doesn‚Äôt like playing nice with any finance app.

This app will not only sync and categorize you transactions but actually works as a tool to see where your money is going, and adjusting your budgets as you go. The ‚Äúmove‚Äù feature which allows you to move funds from one category to another is a godsend when you may have unspent money in one budget and need a little extra in another.

This app allows you to plan and stay on top of your finances but allows for flexibility when you need to, all the while staying within what you have and not overspending. Even if you overspend a little bit, it helps you track it and carry it over to the next month so you can plan for it, allowing you to make sure you cover your debts before they can get out of control.

Don‚Äôt know why I didn‚Äôt get on this sooner, but I‚Äôm pretty sure I‚Äôll be on this one for a while, maybe forever!
title: An actual tool not just information collection!

developerResponse: {'id': 30171989, 'body': "Thank you so much for the 5-star rating and review, Default 1985! I'm so happy to hear that YNAB has had such an impact on your life. We're glad to have you in the budgeting family. ‚ù§Ô∏è - Kathryn @ YNAB", 'modified': '2022-06-05T17:15:04Z'}
review: I have been a YNAB subscriber since 2019. YNAB has literally changed mine and my family‚Äôs lives. We have broken the paycheck to paycheck cycle and paid off a mountain of debt.  I have been a desktop user for most of my YNAB life, but have started using the app more often lately since I can log transactions immediately.  There is somewhat of a learning curve but once you figure it out you‚Äôll be living by the 4 rules in no time. They have done a great job updating the app with features to make it easier for all budget related tasks.  I even had to contact customer support recently to help with something that was my fault (I literally deleted my budget by accident) and they responded very quickly and got me back up and running in no time.  Stop thinking, just download the app!
title: You‚Äôve never budgeted like this

developerResponse: {'id': 39851582, 'body': "Thanks for leaving a review. I'm sorry you ran into trouble with the loan accounts. If you'd like to give YNAB another try, we are happy to answer any questions and help get things up and running again. You can email us at help@ynab.com. Otherwise, I wish you all the best as you find the right finance management solution for you! \\- Natalie @ YNAB", 'modified': '2023-10-31T15:21:52Z'}
review: I downloaded a free trial and within 15 mins of setting up a budget, because frustrated enough to delete my account and subscription.
