I have used a lot of budgeting apps but have never used one that requires so many obscure steps to perform a single task. I set up a personal loan account in the app, set up my budgeted monthly payments, and then noticed that the app had me ‚Äúoverspending‚Äù for the entire loan amount this month. 10 minutes later, after clicking every option possible, I was completely unable to fix the issue. I tried to delete the loan account and start over - it also wouldn‚Äôt let me do that. I tried to reconcile the account and delete the budgeted amounts - it also wouldn‚Äôt let me do that. I am blocked at every turn simply because of some error entering a loan amount. I cannot even delete or reconcile the error. I have no idea why the developers decided to make this process so difficult but I don‚Äôt have the energy for it. I‚Äôll move on and find a better app.
title: Too many steps, not intuitive at all

review: I have used Q**n for many years. It was great but was essentially a PC based tool and was not that simple to use. My daughter gad been using YNAB for years and had tried to convert me but I was stuck in my rut ( which did work but had serious limitations). Late last year, I took a job that required me to be on the road a lot. I needed a tool that was not tied to the PC and was relatively straightforward so my non-technical spouse could use it and play an active role in budgeting and tracking spending, which had happened on a regular basis with Q. Now with almost 6 months of use , we both love the tool. We actively budget over the phone when I am on the road with both of us viewing budget and transaction history real time. An awesome tool. My only regret is that I didn‚Äôt heed my daughter‚Äôs advice from so many years ago.
title: Awesome tool

review:
I‚Äôve been using YNAB since 2014, and it‚Äôs helped me stop living paycheck to paycheck and to really keep track of my expenses and stick with a budget. As others have said, it takes some learning and set up in the beginning - and I wouldn‚Äôt suggest you start unless you genuinely want to learn how to budget and are willing to put at least a little effort in learning a new way. YNAB tutorials are great and the community has a ton of support. That said the payoff is 100% worth it!! I have introduced countless friends to this program and all love it. Plus, hands down better to support a small business than a big Corporation like Inuit/Mint. These guys built their business to help people manage and save money. 

And, I agree with other comments that this app has gotten more and more useful. Definitely a great and useful compliment to the web platform.
title: YNAB is the best budgeting system!

review:
It definitely takes some work to get the categories set up and to get used to tracking your spending but it‚Äôs worth it. It‚Äôs not just that the system is easy to use but the support you get is amazing. The whole system is set up to get you to accept that you may not get it right the first few times and to make it easy to start fresh and try again. It took us two months to get the hang of it and we had to start fresh right after our trial because we messed the first budget up so badly. I recommend this to anyone who is afraid of autopay just because they can‚Äôt be sure they‚Äôll be able to keep that money in the bank. I was there, I was the one that had to ‚Äúhide‚Äù
Money from myself. It‚Äôs not a miracle but it‚Äôs simple to get used to and it‚Äôs really helped me change the way I think about the money I have in the bank.
title: Game changer

review: I only wish I had a tool like this many years ago. I searched for years to find a tool like this. I can keep track of all my accounts and I know where each dollar is going to go to work for me. And each dollar goes to work for me where I assign it to work for me. I never knew that keeping track of my money like this would give me so much more money to work with. I am now clear of debt except for the mortgage and saving for vacations, home improvements, cars, electronics, gifts etc. and paying for all of them cash upfront and not putting them on a credit card. Additionally a considerable amount of dollars are being assigned to our retirement investment plans and it‚Äôs really comforting to watch that nest egg grow. The best thing is the peace of mind that comes with not living paycheck to paycheck.
title: You Need A Budget

review: I absolutely LOVE YNAB and the amount of awareness and control it has given me over my finances! As a small business owner, the option to run my (two!) businesses‚Äô budgets in addition to my personal at no extra cost is absolutely amazing. Not to mention that I‚Äôm also running my accounts receivable for both businesses using ynab as well. Having a fluctuating income can be difficult to manage with a budget but ynab totally accounts for it and I‚Äôve never found better budgeting software for fluctuating income! I can‚Äôt recommend ynab highly enough if you‚Äôre looking to take more control of your finances. It has to come with a mindset adjustment as well but I‚Äôve never in my life felt so in control of my money!! You can just 100% win financially and meet your goals regardless of your financial situation with ynab!!
title: Best budgeting software ever!

review:
I‚Äôve just started a higher paying job and need to start saving up for a major surgery, so I figured I would give this app a try after hearing from a couple people that they really liked it. I‚Äôve only had it for almost a month and I‚Äôm already seeing great results! With the help of this app, I‚Äôm projected to save almost enough for my surgery by the New Year!

While my bank (TD) currently won‚Äôt connect to this app, I find that putting in my paychecks as ‚Äòaccounts‚Äô have been working just as well as I could‚Äôve hoped! It‚Äôs definitely been able to help me visualize what I‚Äôm able to spend (something I‚Äôve really struggled with for the past six years).

The staff also are extremely accommodating if you reach out to them with any problems! I‚Äôm exceptionally happy with YNAB and would recommend it to just about anyone who needs help budgeting!
title: On A Savings Roll!

developerResponse: {'id': 39689542, 'body': "Hi there, thanks for this awesome review! ü§© We couldn't be happier to hear what an impact YNAB has had on your financial life! It sounds like you're really putting in the work, and we're so glad we could play a part in that. Full financial control is such a game changer! üôå \\- Jill@YNAB", 'modified': '2023-10-23T16:55:37Z'}
review: I‚Äôve been using YNAB for about 10 years. This app, along with the incredible financial wellness education provided by the company and their budgeting technique, have genuinely improved my relationship with money and my overall well-being. I tried other apps (you know, the ones that promise to categorize everything automatically, while they push credit card ads at you every day) and it never helped me feel in control of my spending, or even aware of what I needed to do to improve things. I first tried YNAB based on a raving recommendation in a popular Internet forum, and once I started applying their budgeting concepts and using the app regularly it helped make my personal finances feel manageable. I would even say that it‚Äôs fun now! I recommend it to everyone I know, constantly.
title: Life Changing Budget App

review: I hope there‚Äôs never another pandemic, but there will certainly be more twists and turns, stumbling blocks, gaping maw of the abyss, and Cliffs of Insanity before my journey‚Äôs done.  Had I not started using YNAB in 2017, I can‚Äôt imagine where I‚Äôd be today.  The learning curve was a moderate challenge for the first months to a year, but using it today is a breeze.  In 2020 I lost two jobs, lost 75% of my income (permanently), and was forced into semi-retirement.  The last couple of years have been much harder on many, and I‚Äôm not suggesting that anyone else‚Äôs difficulties could‚Äôve been avoided with a budget app.  But the transition was far less terrifying because I had the reins on my budget and knew exactly what and where I spent and why.  It‚Äôs kept me fed and housed, and I want to thank the folks at YNAB.  Your work makes a difference.
title: Pandemic ‚Äúprosperity‚Äù

review:
I can‚Äôt recommend this enough for someone that has tried other services and they haven‚Äôt worked out. I tried Mint and Clarity multiple times and found YNAB differs greatly that those show easily how much money you have and how much you‚Äôve spent in each category but it doesn‚Äôt put you one step ahead of allocating. 

Download your last few months of statements for your accounts and take the time to separate your purchases into categories. Set budgets based on this and make it habit to MANUALLY enter your transactions daily. Don‚Äôt link your accounts and try and just make it do your work for you in the background. Stick to it and within a couple months you‚Äôll have control of your money down to the penny. It‚Äôs amazing! Lots of videos online and info to help set these us and how to best organize it.
title: Highly recommended

review:
I had been keeping track of my spending in a high-touch spreadsheet that allowed me to retrospect, but didn‚Äôt help me plan for my future.

YNAB automates the high-touch, high-cognition tasks I was performing in my spreadsheet, and gives me the mental space to focus on being intentional about my spending.

I use the browser app heavily, and a couple accounts I use regularly don‚Äôt support integration yet (and may never?). The YNAB iOS app helps me keep track of purchases in those accounts in a low-touch way, so I don‚Äôt fall behind on accurate accounting. Other than lacking some reporting views and the ability to make a repeating transaction, the iOS app seems fully-featured, and I think I could do everything in it easily if I didn‚Äôt prefer the greater screen real estate of my computer.
title: Helpful tool and a joy to use

review: I truly do love this app more than any of the other budgeting tools put there however it‚Äôs missing a few key elements. The app version is different than the website version and you can‚Äôt ‚Äúsearch‚Äù transactions easily or look at your reports. Also, it‚Äôs slightly annoying that I may make a category for something but then in the future I‚Äôm not allowed to delete that category after it‚Äôs been used because then all the transactions will be ‚Äúuncategorized‚Äù I wish that this platform would allow flexibility as life often changes. Other than that, it‚Äôs super easy to use, a beautiful easy to navigate and read design, great goal setting features, and a great sync feature w/ financial accounts. And I love that my significant other and I have separate budgets but under 1 account so we can easily flip back and forth between the 2of us. I love spending time on this app and watching the progression towards my financial goals. Keeps me motivated!
title: Love it... BUT...

review: You‚Äôve taken a simple idea and made it SO much more difficult than necessary. I don‚Äôt want every dollar to ‚Äúhave a job‚Äù. Sometimes I want my money to sit in a savings or investment account without having to account for it it in my Assign Money amount. I also like to use and pay off my credit cards monthly, but for the life of me, I can‚Äôt make this process work on this app. When I try to watch the ‚ÄúHow to‚Äù videos, they start at 25 minutes. Who has hours to watch excessively long videos for an APP?! If your videos have to be that long, you‚Äôve made this process to difficult. And the format between the phone, tablet, and computer app is a nightmare. Some tasks are easier to do on a specific device, but no device is easy for all functions. I have started and re-started my budget 3 separate time to work out the kinks. Now I‚Äôm just going to cancel and find a budgeting app that doesn‚Äôt require hours to figure out.
title: It shouldn‚Äôt be this hard to budget‚Ä¶

review: The app is a checkbook register, accounts tracker and a budget planner. The difference with this app is it interacts with all three areas. You do not need to leave the checkbook register to find out the status of the budget. After each entry it displays the status of that category in the budget. I like the visual color cues indicating the status. After trying this app I went back to my old checkbook app and it was not the same. I realize my ideas about money had already changed. THE VERSON IS WONDERFUL **** They have added the features you needed for the person on go. Just give me the ability to change the colors and my old eyes will thank you. They added more meaningful reports to the mobile app as well. I am still finding new information about my budget.
title: Interacting accounts go YNAB

developerResponse: {'id': 35914561, 'body': "Hey T40o -- thank you for this thoughtful review! I'm glad you appreciate YNAB's focus on managing your money without the ads and offers! I'm happy to hear you're able to use the free college year. Keep up the great work using your money for things that matter to YOU! -Kat @ YNAB", 'modified': '2023-04-12T12:53:34Z'}
review:
TLDR : if you struggle to build your savings or struggle to keep your debts in check (and if we‚Äôre being honest, any debt greater then zero with few exceptions) GET THIS, it will help you budget like an adult‚Ä¶..

Genuinely the most slept on finance managing app. all the other big bank, credit card company banking apps that advertise you new credit cards, loans, refinances, bla bla bla PALE in comparison to the effectiveness of simplicity you get with this. I recommend it to everyone i get into a finance conversation with. the price is frankly a little on the steeper side for what your getting, an auto updating, prettier, and more organized, excel spreadsheet. But i‚Äôm a student so i get a discount, and it‚Äôs a price worth paying when compared to how much money you actually end up putting away into savings and into things that matter.
title: Incredible

review: This app is GREAT.  The customer support is better than anything I have ever seen.  There is a learning curve and I suggest you take some of the free webinar workshops.  I also suggest you give access to your account so they can answer you questions better.  I have received two CUSTOM videos thus far which completely answered my questions.  I do have an accounting background and that has helped me understand more quickly.  My PNC virtual account said I have almost $5K free... what free to  spend?  YPPI.   But when I allocated all of my future expenses I was breakeven.  I have spent about 15-20 hours learning the software but it‚Äôs totally worth it.  If I could give them 10 starts I would.  Plan on time to learn the program and, depending on your background a month may not be enough.  But trust me it‚Äôs worth your time.
title: I NEVER take the time to review apps

developerResponse: {'id': 35577343, 'body': "Hi there, thanks for taking the time to leave this fabulous review! ü§© You are absolutely right, YNAB is unique--which is of course what makes it so great--but it does mean it takes a little time to learn. We're so glad to hear that it's made a difference in your financial life, and that you've had good experiences with our support! - Jill@YNAB", 'modified': '2023-03-24T23:53:06Z'}
review: It is true. I need a budget. I have always struggled with budgeting. Granted, the REAL problem is not the software, rather my relationship with money, BUT having software that is powerful and elegant means I don‚Äôt have to struggle with the software AND my relationship with money. I can focus on the REAL problem. I will admit. The layout and some of the functionality of YNAB was pretty foreign at first. I definitely had to watch quite a few instructional videos several times before it clicked. But now that I understand the approach that YNAB is built on, using it is effortless. I‚Äôve used Mint. I‚Äôve used Everydollar. I‚Äôve used excel. YNAB blows them out of the water. AND, the customer support and pre-existing video and document resources are second to none. They could be charging double. I‚Äôd pay it in a heartbeat.
title: UN-FREAKING-BELIEVABLE

developerResponse: {'id': 34885309, 'body': "Hi BR0C0NN0R, thank you so much for your feedback here. I will definitely let our team know that you'd like to see reports in the mobile app. Thank you for being a longtime YNABer! - Natalie @ YNAB", 'modified': '2023-02-15T13:06:15Z'}
review:
I‚Äôve been using YNAB for ~8 years now. I love this software and it has become essential for me to feel confident and in control of my finances. However, it is mind-boggling to me that during that entire time I have not seen the ‚Äúreports‚Äù tab in the app change a single time. This is one of the greatest and most thoughtfully crafted budget planning apps out there and the analytics and data representation on mobile is a complete joke. You can see your net worth and the ‚Äúage‚Äù of your money but somehow not a breakdown of your spending, income vs. expenses, etc.

It would be nice if they included some features geared towards subscriptions since so many expenses are modeled in that fashion but that‚Äôs more of a cool gimmick than a gross oversight like the reports in my opinion.

I cannot encourage using this app enough but there is absolutely no way I can give a five star rating that this app deserves until they at least attempt to bring some of their browser-based reports over to mobile.
title: Incredible App (Missing HUGE Feature)

review: I started using YNAB after my partner convinced me to try it out when I started grad school and knew I needing to rein in my financial situation. I‚Äôve been using it for about 6 months now through the free year for students and cannot imagine not having it. Im not someone who enjoys budgeting or tracking finances like some do, so this app makes it ridiculously easy to track my day to day and monthly spending, while also pushing me to think about future savings goals. It takes less than 5 minutes a day to stay on top of with the bank linking features, and it‚Äôs worth it for the peace of mind. The subscription plan does seem a bit expensive long-term, but the convenience and reduced stress are unmatched. I‚Äôm very grateful for YNAB, and it‚Äôs an excellent tool to support my financial health.
title: Convenient and Sustainable

review:
I love this budget program!  I used to use Quicken, but just hated the cost and confusion of the routine ‚Äúupgrades‚Äù.  Never having had an accounting class, its underlying accounting ‚Äúlogic‚Äù confused me.
But YNAB is user-friendly, ‚Äúintuitive‚Äù, and easy to learn.  Their online classes, short tutorials, and well-written ‚Äúlessons‚Äù are delivered by an amazing group of folks.  They are even available to help in real time so my learning curve has been steep.
Best of all, YNAB has helped me get on top of and stay on top of my daily spending because I can carry it with me on my iPhone, enter my spending before I pocket my receipts, do a quick end-of-day review, and prepare for the planned and unplanned (!) spending for the days (weeks, months, and years) ahead.  
Check it out free for a month.  You will be hooked!
title: Portable, powerful, painless program

review:
I have been using YNAB from the beginning. I must tell you that I am very disappointed in the current version. This is the first year that I have tried to set up next year‚Äôs budget with the current version, and I am unable to do so. Maybe I am just not understanding how to use this version, but trying to use it tonight, I don‚Äôt like it. It is cumbersome and more difficult to simply add a budget expense. I have always set up my budget a year in advanced, and I make adjustments during the year. I can‚Äôt even access February next year to add my numbers.

I‚Äôm retired and my expenses are pretty much set for the most part. You guys really put me in a hole. I will most likely not renew my subscription. A budget program is supposed to be easy to use and flexible so the user won‚Äôt hesitate to use it. You have made it much more complicated to use and added so many rules that it is not worth it any longer.

This really infuriates me. You have taken a Life Changing program and turned into a something difficult to use.
title: Disappointed

review: Everything about this app is great and it‚Äôs really helped me better manage my money. There seems to be a glitch at the moment tho that messes up how the app records which account a transaction is coming from/going to. I‚Äôve only had the issue today (been using the app for several months). This morning it was attributing my investment account as the recipient of transactions, and this evening it is showing the same account as the one being withdrawn *from*. I have done nothing with my investment account for over a month and even checked on it to make sure I didn‚Äôt have any scheduled activity and I did not, the account is how I left it when I last checked a month ago. It would be awesome if the YNAB team could figure out what‚Äôs causing the glitch and remedy it, I'd definitely appreciate it!
title: Best budget tool out there

review:
Really enjoying the app! It has increased my financial well being tremendously! 
Wish I could adjust the budget goal so I can tell it to how much I already have and what my goal is. So for example an emergency fund, I want $5000 in there but had a $1000 car repair last month, I want to be able to enter a starting balance of $4000 and set a budget to make my balance $5000 again in 3 months. 
I also wish I could put income into future month. I get paid sometimes up to 4-5 days before the 1st due to weekends and holidays and I hate having to ‚Äúbe smarter than the app‚Äù to make it think I didn‚Äôt pay double rent in October when I just paid November rent a few days early, if that makes sense. 
Just minor things that aren‚Äôt that hard to overcome but could make an awesome app even better!
title: Great app could use some minor adjustments

review:
Honestly this app is wonderful. Just one tiny issue. The fact that you can‚Äôt count future income. For me this creates a problem. When I sit down to create my monthly budget, there is no way to get out of the red. This just isn‚Äôt logical to me. If I am able to budget out where my money is going over the course of the month, it only makes sense that future income be counted. This way, when all numbers are in, I can see exactly what‚Äôs left over at the end of the month. And then as things change during the month. It‚Äôs very easy from a quick glance to know how far off track I am. 

I know you take the approach budgeting for money you have now, but that‚Äôs not how budgets really work. Especially when attempting to budget over the course of a month or so. Please consider this change. I am a premium member but this alone has me looking at other solutions.
title: Great app but....

review:
That is not an exaggeration. This app has changed the way we do money. We have always tried to keep a budget but it wasn‚Äôt until this app that we took on the philosophy of ‚Äúevery dollar has a job‚Äù. 

Previously we would put any extra into a broad category of ‚Äúsavings‚Äù but always had to take money out for things we hadn‚Äôt planned on, which then made us feel anxious and made it difficult to enjoy fun things that came up unplanned. It has helped us be very intentional about the things for which we want to save. 

Additionally, it requires a great deal of transparency with yourself about how you spend your money. While that might be uncomfortable in the beginning, it did not take long for us to just create a category for those things and accept that this really is something we are willing to spend money on...or not. Until we sat down and categorized all of it, we had a very general idea of where our money was going. Now there‚Äôs no question. 

The ease of connecting bank accounts and credit cards makes it really easy to navigate all types of purchases. So nothing falls through the cracks. 

It takes a couple months to get the hang of it but it has been so worth the effort. 

Thank you so much YNAB!!
title: This app has changed our lives

review: Takes a few to switch your mind on how YNAB works compared to other budgeting software, but the video tutorials out there really help. While I was only a few days into my trial I had a import issue with a bank that would have prevented me from keeping the software, wrote to customer service and they replied immediately and had a fix in less then 2 days, uh-maxing! Based on that I was determined to push past the learning curve and give the software a real try. I love it! Only reason for my 2 stars is that one of my banks keeps having time outs on pulling data. Also, my husband and I have the credit cards from the same bank, so sometimes it mixes up which card a payment went to or which card a charge came from, not to difficult for me to fix manually, but I definitely have to be aware if it seems off.
title: Great budgeting software, customer service rocks too

developerResponse: {'id': 43353896, 'body': "Hi there!\n\nI'm so glad to hear that YNAB has made such a strong, positive impact on your life. No stress, no guilt! We love it!! It sounds like you're loving the way you spend your money now and we couldn't be happier for you! Phil from YNAB", 'modified': '2024-04-18T13:18:24Z'}
review: For the longest time I was afraid of money. Afraid to spend afraid to put bills on autopay, afraid of not making enough as an entrepreneur and always felt guilty purchasing anything for myself! Then I listened to Ramits book and he mentions YNAB. I looked it up. Did my 34 day trial and have not looked back since! Im only 9 months in but I‚Äôm no longer stressing about having enough to pay bills or feeling guilty for buying myself something and I‚Äôve managed to pay off all my credit cards & increase my credit score.  My money mindset was and has been completely changed! If only I had known about this 10 yrs ago! It is truly empowering and as a psychotherapist I share this with patients who have financial fear or trauma! Trust me, it‚Äôs a thing! FREE workshops! I can‚Äôt say enough!
title: Changed money mindset

review: This app takes some time to understand but is much better than other budget apps. It forces you to pay attention to your money which is a good thing. My two favorite features are transaction reconciliation and the fact you can use this App when not connected to internet. Transaction reconciliation means I can enter the transaction when I make a purchase and a few days later this App will tell me when the money is taken out of my account or credit card (without causing duplicate transaction). And if I forget or don‚Äôt feel like entering a transaction I will still see it occur a few days later in YNAB since it automatically downloads transactions. I feel by entering transactions when I make them it forces me to manage my budget in the present and not the past.
title: YNAB is best budget app I have used

review:
Honestly, I really do love this app, and I just can‚Äôt give it less than a 5 star rating.  However, I wish you could see your ongoing  balance, so that, you can compare it to your running online balance at the bank‚Äôs website.  It helps for troubleshooting any issues.  The bank automatically downloads have had a few moments where I lost connection to my bank and it took some time to resolve.

Now that was the bad, and it‚Äôs seriously minor!   YNAB allows you to budget from multiple platforms.  It syncs between them.  It ages your money, so that you know that you are not living paycheck to paycheck!   Once you get the hang of it... it‚Äôs easy!   I‚Äôm terrible with budgeting, and it has taking years for me to get control over my finances, and YNAB has been a big part of it!
title: Amazing, but a few hiccups

review:
Edit: and yet another price increase. Peace ‚úåÔ∏è 

So first and foremost, yes the price increase was absurd. They pulled a landlord tenant situation. Knowing that most people are tied to their service they decided to increase the price dramatically in one month with little notice. Definitely left a bad feeling. But what‚Äôs worse is their support. If I‚Äôm paying a premium price for a software then support should be premium. Is that not what you justify the price for? So that your employees can earn more money? Presumably because you value them and want them to do a good job? Well, they‚Äôre not doing a good job when they have to resolution for your customers other than to say ‚Äújust manually put it in‚Äù‚Ä¶ I don‚Äôt think a customer wants to pay $100 for a subscription to do more work‚Ä¶ for that I will just use my spreadsheets and make my own budget. Which is where I moved onto. Now I can put my subscription budget into a different category. Thank you for teaching me how to roll with the punches.
title: Plaid is bad

developerResponse: {'id': 46280682, 'body': "Hi Shannuse, I appreciate you sharing this experience, and can relate; I've been an hourly wage worker for most of my time using YNAB, and it took time to develop a budget setup & routine that was simple *and* flexible! If you or anyone reading this is interested, we have resources about using YNAB with variable income, and our Support team is always eager to dive into questions or specifics: https://support.ynab.com/en_us/variable-income-BynJaHZ09", 'modified': '2024-08-27T03:34:29Z'}
review: I wish I liked this app. We tried two different times with this app for several months each time, and it is infuriating. I wanted to throw the computer across the room every time I worked on our budget with this. I spent hours trying to get it to realize me paying off our credit cards was not suddenly ‚Äúmore money‚Äù to spend- never did get that figured out. I could never get it to automatically ‚Äúverify‚Äù things we purchased regularly, so we could have to go in and spend an hour clicking buttons every month to get the purchases organized. Finally, my numbers never ever matched theirs. I had no idea why we had to allocate so much or why we couldn‚Äôt just adjust spend or income without the app adjusting literally everything else to accommodate. I am an hourly wage worker, I don‚Äôt have a regular income, so it changes every week. This wasn‚Äôt conducive to that in the slightest. I will forever tell people to run from this app. DON‚ÄôT WASTE YOUR MONEY or your time!!!
title: Overly complicated

review:
Being able to budget per category and see where my spending occurs is a godsend. Helps keep an eye on over five checking accounts and three credit cards. Even though it doesn‚Äôt give future projections, it does tell where I‚Äôm overshooting and what areas I could take money from to meet other bill payments. Most other apps I had to manually enter transactions and how to calculate the totals of each category. This does it all for you. Far exceeded any app. I love categorizing and approving and how it auto recognizes which category to fall under after the first time categorizing.

A feature I would want added is notes under each category to record account numbers, phone number and other info I didn‚Äôt want to forget.
title: Excited to use, does what I wished my bank‚Äôs app would do.

review: I can‚Äôt say too many good things about this program. If you are just getting started, take the free online classes. It‚Äôs a bit of a learning curve, as it‚Äôs philosophy is different than most other budgeting programs out there, but once you get your mind wrapped around it, it makes sense. As with any budgeting program, you have to put the work into it! This app is an extremely helpful tool to budget on the go, but it won‚Äôt do the work for you! Manually input your transactions and let the direct import feature help you along the way. Sometimes the direct import can be a bit buggy, but if you‚Äôre using the program the way that is intended, it won‚Äôt make that much of a difference. I totally recommend this program and app to anyone who wants to better themselves financially.
title: Awesome program

review:
I have used YNAB for almost 2 years now. Here are the bullet points I generally share with friends. 

- The savings budgeting has given me FAR exceeds the monthly/annual fee. 
- A company that lets you sign up and use a product without attaching some form of future payment is a company that values their product. 
- Nothing is ever free, those ‚Äúfree‚Äù budgeting apps are data collecting, selling your info, or just pushing ads on you. How much do you value your finances? 
- This app has single handedly reduced/eliminated all ‚Äúmoney fights‚Äù between myself and my spouse. We are now on the same page. No more extremely confusing excel sheets that are difficult to access and keep up with. - don‚Äôt get me wrong, I love a good excel sheet, but we needed something that  automated transactions, was accessible, and we could customize to our needs. YNAB is the holy grail. 
- My final thought on YNAB; YNAB doesn‚Äôt gate-keep, read the book, watch videos etc. the entire philosophy is available and can easily be applied with an excel sheet or pen and paper. 

Stop letting your finances control you. Most people can out spend their earnings without even realizing it. Find a system that works and stick to it!
title: Best Budgeting App

developerResponse: {'id': 36890800, 'body': "ü§© Wow, what an awesome review! It's great to hear that YNAB has helped you so much. Thanks for budgeting with us! \\- Natalie @ YNAB", 'modified': '2023-06-02T15:32:40Z'}
review: I have used Quicken, Mint, Everydollar, and now YNAB. YNAB has been the best one yet. It really forces me to plan a budget and keep it accurate allowing us to see our expenditures. I believe it is the way it handles credit and bank accounts while seamlessly connecting budgets. It allows me to enter target dates and savings goals and it does the math for how much I need to contribute. This tool has saved us more than its cost. The other tools allowed me to fudge numbers and gave me a false sense of entry. You need a budget forces you to account for expenditures by earmarking the proper funds. It is like a digital envelope system. In the envelope system, if you had to spend extra in one budget you would have to pull the cash from another envelope - YNAB is the equivalent. I love this tool!!!
title: Best Budgeting Tool

developerResponse: {'id': 36987293, 'body': "Thank you for this thoughtful feedback. You're spot on, when your spending is aligned with your priorities, and you have the flexibility to change your spending plan when those priorities change, budgeting becomes much more enjoyable. üôå We're so glad to hear that you've enjoyed using YNAB, and that it's made a difference in your financial life!", 'modified': '2023-06-07T17:02:13Z'}
review:
I‚Äôve been using YNAB for years now. And the app is constantly improving, there are some capabilities on the app that I even prefer to using the browser version. The the strength of the browser version is the depth of detail, which would be too much for an app. 
I‚Äôve struggled with saving and knowing where my money is going in years past, but not since using YNAB. I‚Äôm one of those sickos who loves filling out forms, and in that way, YNAB app kind of feels like a game satisfying that love. The only game on my phone is YNAB üòÇ the subscription fee has been fully worth it for me, though I wish they offered a sliding scale or financial hardship subscription that one could apply for given I certainly have friends who are interested in using it but balk at the annual cost.
title: Budgeting Savior

review: YNAB is life changing. I tell everyone I know about it. I honestly cannot imagine our financial life without it. We started YNAB four years ago with the goal of (finally) paying off my student loans in a year. We achieved that and the YNAB method became foundational in our personal finance education. People often question the price for ‚Äújust an app,‚Äù but your subscription pays for so much more-a method, an education, a community, and second to none customer support-plus, in our case, it immediately paid for itself in the savings it helped us find. I love the ease of the app, but also use the web-based desk top version daily. YNAB is like no other method out there and the YNAB team are always working hard to make it the best it can be. I highly recommend the live webinar classes when you‚Äôre getting started.
title: I LOVE YNAB!

review:
The Copilot App has one of the most diverse and easy to use UI‚Äôs. It is also filled with many features that end users find attractive when it comes to managing their budgets, income streams, expenses and other pertinent finances data. 
However, my biggest complaint against this app is that although they claim that they do not collect or sell your personal info, the provider they utilize, Plaid, does. This in turn negates the privacy policy as the third party company still harvests and collects a lot of your personal information as well as your banking habits. Such a shame that they rely on utilizing on a third party service that is not interested in safeguarding the privacy and information of its users. 

Additionally, Plaid has been accused of posing as a number of banking institutions in order to collect financial data from people when they signed up for payment apps and are currently settling a class action lawsuit pertaining to this issue.
title: Looks promising, however, lacks in Privacy protection

review:
I have no idea what took me so long to stick with this budget thing but I can assure you a lot of it had to do with the lack of an easy all-in-one app to use UNTIL I found YNAB. At first I laughed at the yearly price bc if I need help w a budget I sure as heck shouldn‚Äôt shell out money so easily....but it‚Äôs the best money I have ever spent.

It took me a couple  months to get used to the system but it has several helpful videos (especially for the credit card use one). And has been the most simple and best budgeting tool I have found. 

I no longer use credit cards and literally know where every dollar of my paychecks are going. What in the world did I do before?! I don‚Äôt even want to think about it. Yes download this app if you are thinking about it and get ahold of your finances now!
title: Don‚Äôt wait! Do this now!

review:
I‚Äôm not strong when it comes to financial acumen and I get anxious when it comes to budgeting but YNAB has been a breath of fresh air in relieving all of that worry. The platform is intuitive and makes managing a budget for anyone who‚Äôs looking to have one easy. The setup is simple and there are helpful resources to ensure you‚Äôre setting up your budget in a comprehensible way that will help you keep consistency, confidence, and understanding with your budget management. 

From a customer service standpoint, I always receive helpful answers to any questions I have within 24 hours.

I also highly recommend taking advance of their free workshops (and there are a lot) as these will give you more confidence and knowledge that will pay off both in the short- and long-term.
title: Perfect for anyone who needs a budget

developerResponse: {'id': 43878645, 'body': "Hi there! So glad to hear that YNAB has helped you be more mindful about your money! If you're having trouble with your connections \\(Apple Card or otherwise\\) please reach out to us, we'd love to help! You can write us at help@ynab.com. ~Phil@YNAB", 'modified': '2024-05-13T13:19:28Z'}
review:
It sounds really over the top but this has been so transformative for me. I was just able to spend six weeks traveling using just they money I had budgeted. Without YNAB I think it would have felt like a risky financial decision, but since I knew I had saved enough I was able to do it without fear. I got laid off from my job, but I know exactly how far out I have my rent covered, and so in times of crisis it helps things feel‚Ä¶ less catastrophic. Recommend really highly. 

Downside: we tried the Apple Card integration and it‚Ä¶. Doesn‚Äôt really work. It also can be a bit fussy with my credit union. It takes a bit (or a lot?) of getting used to, but once you do it is a really valuable part of your daily routines.
title: Best subscription I have

developerResponse: {'id': 39132337, 'body': "Hi there! Thanks so much for this awesome review. We're thrilled to hear that you love using YNAB, and that it's help you get out of debt\\-\\-that's such a huge win! It sounds like you've really put the YNAB method to work for you. ü§© \\- Jill@YNAB", 'modified': '2023-09-25T17:55:02Z'}
review:
I‚Äôve been using this app for the past year and it has helped me get out of debt. It‚Äôs the best budgeting app out there.

 It‚Äôs easy to use, easy to learn, and the budgeting strategies are better than other apps because you can only budget money you have within your possession. You can‚Äôt project into the future. This is powerful because projections don‚Äôt tend to be accurate and because this creates space for unexpected fluctuations (which is real life). YNAB‚Äôs budgeting strategy also doesn't roll over assigned money so that categories don‚Äôt accumulate unspent money. If I budget $100 for line item A every month but this month I only spent $20, next month line item A will have $80 whereas other apps will display line item A at $0 forcing you to assign $100 when you really only need $20. It always shows an accurate representation of your money.

Another great tool this app has is tracking debt and credit. You can put your total balance and interest rate and it will grow accurately in line with your real life account. It also has debt payoff projection simulations that are really helpful when paying off debt. 

Love love love this app. Highly recommend!
title: Best budgeting app

developerResponse: {'id': 41209352, 'body': "Hi there! It sounds like direct import is a top priority for you, and file\\-based importing on your Fidelity accounts isn't what you were looking for. Thanks for giving YNAB a try! \\- Aubrey @ YNAB", 'modified': '2024-01-10T17:44:55Z'}
review: Great concept, particularly articles and videos around changing one‚Äôs relationship with money. However, they don‚Äôt support the bank integration methods that are going to be more frequently used in the future. YNAB‚Äôs position is that we (the customer) should complain to said banks (in my case Fidelity, which accounts for 30% of my assets) and/or manually upload statements. Sorry- NOT GOOD ENOUGH- you are a for-fee product and need to provide multiple types of connections to third parties. As an added piece of information, WealthFront, Copilot, CreditKarma/Mint etc. all provide support for Fidelity. YNAB is either underinvesting in development or just has no plans to evolve. Either way it‚Äôs a no-go product if you don‚Äôt want to have to change yet again in a year or two as more and more financial institutions use methods other than third party aggregators to share data.  Disappointing.  Try Copilot, Monarch or even free tools that are just as good- well maybe not the free ones.
title: No product plan

review: Let me start by saying that I really like YNAB and I love the fact that I only have to budget the money I have on hand. It has helped me stay on track of my spending and I like that I know I have enough to payoff my credit card at the end of the month. However, the app is super buggy!! I have to constantly disconnect and reconnect my bank account if not transactions will never load (even after waiting days). Also, sometimes when I reconnect transactions are lost in space so I have to enter them manually. This is very frustrating because I wish everything would sync daily with no issues. I have contacted support a few times and although they are very helpful, I have not received a final solution for my problem.
title: Good app BUT‚Ä¶

review: A few years ago I could not imagine how me and my fianc√© were going to move forward in our lives with our massive amounts of debt and achieve our dreams of owning a great home for our upcoming family. Fast forward one year and we have paid off all our debt and saved enough for our down payment for a half million dollar house. YNAB showed us our true expenses and where we could cut back. We have finally achieved our dreams and faster than we could ever imagine thanks to YNAB. We have a lot of dreams going forward and I would never think to ever do it without YNAB. It has been the single best thing that we have done and I would never imagine any life where we don‚Äôt have this app! I am excited for what we can achieve by letting YNAB guide our spending and saving. Thank you YNAB!!
title: LOVE LOVE LOVE Changed my life

review:
The concept of this app is like no other budgeting tool I‚Äôve ever used. It can take a while to wrap your head around, but there are so many resources available to help you learn, and if you put in the effort you can be fully up to speed within the trial period. After a while it becomes addicting to enter transactions and watch your debt go down while your net worth goes up. Set goals for your savings and always ensure you don‚Äôt over spend on a credit card. This app covers it all, but it ALSO has use charts and graphs to show improvements over time. 
Like I said it‚Äôs been completely life changing and is well well worth the annual fee. Give it a try, it might be tough to understand at first, but once you figure it out your life will change for the better I promise.
title: Life changing

developerResponse: {'id': 39013380, 'body': "Hi there! Thanks for taking the time to leave us this awesome review. You said it so well, knowing what each dollar needs to do is such a game changer. It's a level of financial control that brings clarity and helps make sure your spending is aligned with your priorities! üôå \\- Jill@YNAB", 'modified': '2023-09-19T16:38:36Z'}
review: What an amazing budgeting tool. There‚Äôs a little bit of a learning curve but their videos are super helpful. Just take the time to watch them and it‚Äôll make such a different. I had tried other traditional budgeting apps and would still let myself overspend. I initially thought how could their system be that much different. The different philosophy with YNAB gives me such a better picture of my money and let‚Äôs me see what I have to spend where. Rather than just seeing the lump sum in my bank account this is such a better system. The management of my credit card makes so much sense. It‚Äôs a great app and technically works much better than other apps I‚Äôve used in regards to syncing with my bank and automatically categorizing.
title: Amazing

review:
For the first time in my life I‚Äôm getting my head above water. I‚Äôm paying off debt and savings at the same time. I‚Äôm able to plan my expenses out, and spend only what I have and live in my means. I still have a long way to go but for the first time in my life, I‚Äôm able to see a small light at the end of the tunnel. I tried YNAB before, got confused and gave up. But this time around it was more personal than ever. This time around I was doing it. This time around, would be the last. 

I guess the only feedback I would give, is give the option for ‚Äúbank import‚Äù across all apps and devices. 

My advice, take the time. Learn the way this works and really take a hold and have a passion to move your life.
title: Finally, getting my head above water.

review:
Take my word for it... you NEED this app! I can‚Äôt even stress to you how much this program has helped me and my family. For some reason, budgeting just boggles my mind. UNTIL I found this program. YNAB just makes sense! You only budget the money you have. It helps my brain understand sooo much more. AND the stuff I don‚Äôt understand, I just start up a chat with one of their reps and they walk me through it. They literally have the BEST customer service. 

Seriously can‚Äôt get over this! My husband and I even took Dave Ramsey‚Äôs course, ‚Äúgraduated‚Äù his Financial Peace program and STILL couldn‚Äôt get my brain to understand where our money was going! All I needed was this app and this program. So, just take my word for it and try it! You won‚Äôt regret it! ü•≥üí∞‚ò∫Ô∏è
title: You need YNAB!

review: YNAB has given me control over my family‚Äôs finances, and with it, a new sense of calm around money. YNAB has converted me from reactive to proactive when it comes to my finances, and it‚Äôs actually even kind of fun. It takes just moments a day to log and approve transactions in the app, and another few minutes each week to reconcile on the desktop website. The supporting 20-minute live webinars on their site are super helpful for learning how to set up YNAB, as well topics like managing credit cards, handling cash, savings, and more. Yes, there is a learning curve, so I recommend starting on the website before downloading the app.  I was a trial member for months before finally committing to just learning how to use the thing, and I am sorry I waited.  I really can‚Äôt recommend it highly enough.
title: YNAB changed my life

review:
I am so in love with this app. I‚Äôve been using budgeting apps (first Quicken, then Mint, then LearnVest) for about 20 years. I was never quite satisfied with any, and always a little stressed from not knowing how much we were spending (married, six kids, four [old] cars, tithing - ie lots to keep track of!!!)

I started using YNAB four months ago, and it is something close to perfect! Not only does it have a completely natural and common sense approach to budgeting, but also the interface is really pleasant to use. I must be weird, but I now actually *enjoy* the 2 minutes or so per day I spend on it to keep up to date. 

I recommend taking the time to watch their videos, and then spend a bit more time thinking through and experimenting with what categories you want to use, etc.
title: Best app ever

developerResponse: {'id': 46764050, 'body': "We love to hear that Ned! I'm so glad to see that YNAB has helped you feel better about how you spend your money and has given you insight so you can be more intentional with your spending. That's amazing!", 'modified': '2024-09-16T13:29:08Z'}
review:
This app unironically changed my relationship with money. It has helped me to be more intentional with my spending by giving me a real-time and holistic view of what I have, what I am saving for, and what I can spend without feeling the squeeze.

I can now spend money without a single shred of worry because I know all the important stuff is covered. Also, it wasn‚Äôt directly caused by the app but the more intentional spending has made me think harder about the products and companies I give money to. I‚Äôve started saving to buy quality products instead of cheap stuff from dubious companies and places, and that makes me feel better too. 

Best app I‚Äôve ever put on my phone.
title: Hands down the best thing that ever happened to my wallet.

review:
I love the YNAB system for budgeting. It truly can be life changing and it has definitely helped my wife and I be smarter about our finances. 

The App itself leaves a bit to be desired, both on the iPad and iPhone. For example, the app still does not support split screen on the iPad, despite a major upgrade / re-release being completed in the past few months. It also took them an incredibly long time to natively support the 12.9‚Äù iPad screen size natively ‚Äî almost two full years after the device was first released. I fear the same thing is in store for the iPhone X ‚Äî while almost every app I used had an update on day one or within a day or two, all the YNAB team has said is that they are ‚Äúdefinitely working on it.‚Äù The phone was announced and Xcode updated almost two months ago. 

While these are not Earth-shattering issues, they do show a lack of attention to detail and care in their mobile apps. Neither of these things are particularly difficult to implement for most apps, and I would like to see them be quicker to adopt and adapt to new technologies. Even having one real, dyed in the wool Apple fanboy on the team would alleviate almost all of these little niggling concerns. 

Sorry to be so critical... again if you are looking for a budgeting system BUY YNAB! It‚Äôs worth every single penny...
title: Great System, OK App

review: I have always considered myself moderately skilled with my budget. Whether it was spreadsheets or some other tool (cash envelopes or even separate bank accounts), I thought I managed my money pretty well. And then YNAB came into my life. At first it was confusing because it helps you in ways that I wasn‚Äôt ready for and hadn‚Äôt done with budgeting in the past. Honestly, if you have never budgeted before, it might be easier to find you groove rather than re-training your brain. Either way‚Ä¶I wasn‚Äôt moderately skilled. Mainly just fooling myself. YNAB is a game changer for me and my family. Take advantage of the free trial offer to get your feet under you. The customer support is second to none‚Ä¶and super patient. Kudos to YNAB!
title: Even if you think you don‚Äôt need it‚Ä¶

review: I‚Äôve been a paid subscriber to YNAB for nearly a year, and also used the app for about a year on a free trial. This app has NEVER failed to consistently have issues with importing transactions from the multiple banks I have linked to my budget. Everyday that I go in, I have to reset one of my connections. The other account just never even bothers to import, and I‚Äôm forced to contact help support, wait a day for them to respond and try to troubleshoot, and then wait an additional day for those changes to take affect. This is, of course, after already waiting two days to see if the transactions would show up‚Äîeven BEFORE contacting support. While the support team had been very nice, as others have mentioned this app is faulty. I paid for the ease of immediate reconciliation between my accounts and my budget because that is what would help me stay on track and this app doesn‚Äôt do that. I‚Äôve asked for a refund.
title: Not sure why this rates highly

review:
I‚Äôm all for a facelift but this redesign terrible and the UX team needs a talking to. Half of the features that made YNAB quick to use have been removed, integral data points(net worth/assets/debts, you know, the reason for the app) have been moved away and require more steps than it did before to access. The icons/type now blend in with the background the entire app is so bright it‚Äôs painful. Don‚Äôt even get me started on the terrible new date picker. 

The budgeting system is probably the best available but it‚Äôs like they deliberately handicap the app to force you to use their website. The app doesn‚Äôt even give you an overview of your spending and if you don‚Äôt have a computer those features just aren‚Äôt available to you. Instead of incorporating some of those features and making that app more useful we get a terrible redesign. Just really disappointed I spend this much money every year I have yet to see any significant improvement.
title: Redesign is terrible

review: Using this budgeting app for last 6-months (Including the trial time), started seeing money stick around for more days after pay day; surely developing better financial planning & habit for me;  I am getting better in using the app by budgeting over & over following pay days; now I use the app effectively than when I started. Free trial helps in knowing the app & let me go through few pay days but I had to  subscribe after trial period. I never needed to use their customer support likely because I attend  their short online webinars on how to use this app. I purchased annual subscription after trial, going well. I never tried any other app but Microsoft excel this is my first budgeting app & hopefully last one I need! It runs both on iPhone & computer.
title: Develops Good Financial Habbits

review: I love YNAB. It‚Äôs simple and helps you keep you on track to your goals. I love that you can sync to your bank now and the way it manages credit cards is great. There are some major steps back though with the new web client version. My two biggest are that I can plan a future month until the paycheck is in the bank and that the reports screen is lacking. I liked how in the old version you could put in a future pay check and plan that month in advance. Now you have to wait till it‚Äôs in the account. There are some other minor things missing that I miss too as far as user interface. But the system itself is still great, just hope the web app gets back on the same level as the client based app was.
title: A Step Back From The Old YNAB

review:
YNAB review
YNAB is an impressive app and has lots of great features that you can find on there that other budgeting apps wouldn‚Äôt have. One of the things that makes this app stand out is the fact that you don‚Äôt have to create your own categories, so it‚Äôs very easy to set up for new users. All of the categories are in your budgeting page already. One thing I would change about this though is the fact that you can‚Äôt change your balance unless you add it to a category. Sometimes people can loose money from their jobs and it would be a lot more convenient if there was an option to edit your balance without adding or subtracting the money from a category. That‚Äôs my main complaint about this app and hopefully there will be a future update with this. But overall this is a great budget app considering the fact that it‚Äôs free and easy to use.
title: Needs improvements

developerResponse: {'id': 34888622, 'body': "I love this Amanda! It's awesome that you are having fun with YNAB. Who would have ever thought managing your money could be fun?! - Natalie @ YNAB", 'modified': '2023-02-15T15:43:31Z'}
review: I‚Äôm a long-term budgeter in spreadsheets and have wanted this for years, but wasn‚Äôt sure if it was worth it since what I had worked. It is soooo worth it!  Instead of a weekly spreadsheet project and lots of time spent reconciling, YNAB provides quick gamified entries on the go, easy (and frequent) reconciling, accurate overview of available $ to spend at the ready with details at the touch of a button, flagged items for tracking special projects, and nice simple reports to provide a good review of how you‚Äôre doing over time. . It took a couple of months to set up targets and tweak it the way I want it, but now it‚Äôs just a well run machine. The toughest part is figuring out whether to budget the annual YNAB expense in ‚ÄúHousehold‚Äù or ‚ÄúEntertainment.‚Äù
title: Budgeting Simplified

review:
Powerful app and ‚Äúprogram‚Äù - if you follow it. Updates continue to improve useability. Suggestion if you‚Äôre new and you really want to change your finances: listen to YNAB podcast, read all of the tutorials and most important of all, I think, personally, is to manually track all of your input and output. Don‚Äôt use import - initially - for the first year at least. To really understand how you spend money, you have to manually look at it every day. Sounds laborious but it will change your financial, and possibly, entire life. 

Only thing I wish, and this may may silly, is for the top line of the budget to have a ‚Äútotal budgeted‚Äù and ‚Äútotal spent‚Äù line. Seems like an easy fix, but I‚Äôm having trouble finding a contact to make that suggestion.
title: Saved my everything.

review:
I've tried a lot of budgeting and expense tracking apps, and this is the one that comes closest to what I need. It really helps you get on track in terms of saving for goals and keeping spending under control. I also find it easy to use this to budget for different income scenarios, which gives me a sense of security. 

One strange thing about the mobile app is that there's no way to see an itemized list of income for the month in one place, or even total income. Um, hello, I want to know exactly how much income hit this month from different sources. It would be helpful if that was in the budget report (income from current month plus carryover) or at least by tapping the monthly budget amount, just like the detailed list of transactions you can get by tapping on expense categories.
title: Good app, but missing some important functionality

review: YNAB changed my life. The philosophy, educational support and app helped my family pay off six figure student loans. It freed me to feel comfortable throwing more and more extra payments toward loan pay down because I could see that everything else was accounted for. That feeling of ‚Äúwhat if something comes up‚Äù fades, even for a risk-averse catastrophic thinker like me, when you‚Äôve been budgeting and tracking your spending for a while. My friend and I sometimes joke about how much we would have saved if we‚Äôd discovered YNAB before having babies...or when we moved to NYC...or when we got our first ‚Äúreal jobs‚Äù or in college. Imagine!!! Or don‚Äôt, just start now. It‚Äôs never too late and never too early. Ask my 8 year old. ;)
title: Bye bye grad school loans

review: This service/app seriously changed my life forever. It took a few months to get the hang of it, but they have so many great training guides, resources and even live assistance so you can have any question answered by a professional. If you need a budget, and let‚Äôs be honest - we all do, you NEED this service. If you‚Äôre in debt, you‚Äôll get out of debt and never go back. If you have a pile of cash just dumped into your savings account with no plan or action, you‚Äôll start to realize your dreams and take those trips, save for that event, or just make sure all your bills are paid. I‚Äôll use this service until the day I die. Thanks YNAB team for giving me the tools to change my entire life. :)
title: Best App Ever - Can‚Äôt Live Without It!

developerResponse: {'id': 41349444, 'body': "Thanks for this awesome review, Rolf! We're thrilled that YNAB has had such an impact on your financial life. ü§© It sounds like you really put in the work, and we're glad we could play a part in that. Huge congratulations on getting off the credit card float and into saving for those true expenses proactively. üéâ That's such a win! \\- Jill@YNAB", 'modified': '2024-01-17T14:08:18Z'}
review: We began using YNAB over a year ago. I had been a little reluctant because of the annual fee, but decided to try it after a family member recommended it. It is worth every penny! We have better handle on our finances more than ever. It helped us get out of a credit card float, plan for our true annual expenses (annual fees, car and house maintenance, etc) and go on a family vacation without going into debt. This year when Christmas came I was better prepared. I did have to move some money around as unexpected expenses did arise, but it wasn‚Äôt a big deal. I would highly recommend YNAB to help anyone with their budgeting! It is easy to use and plenty of support from their team to make sure you succeed!
title: YNAB has been worth it!

developerResponse: {'id': 35025298, 'body': "Yes!! üôå We are overjoyed that you've created a spending plan that meets your needs, even ‚Äî and especially! ‚Äî as they change. #totalcontrolofyourmoney #loveit - Dela@YNAB", 'modified': '2023-02-23T02:23:35Z'}
review:
I absolutely love this app! I legitimately recommend it to everyone I know. I also like how you can completely tailor it to what you want to focus on. If you really want to make sure you have enough to go out with friends, just put more money there. If you want make sure you have enough to pay off your credit cards, then put your money there first. Anything you want. Had promotion/raise. Up your targets a bit or put more in savings!

Also getting to the point where next months money is set aside before you get to next months (in the YNAB world known as your age of money being more than 30 days) is really awesome! 

Overall great app! Couldn‚Äôt recommend it more!
title: If you need a budget. You need a budget

review: The concept of giving every dollar a job, which is the heart of YNAB, is not difficult to understand. Without this program, though, it is unlikely it will be properly and consistently applied. YNAB has taught my family about budgeting and for the first time we all refer to our accounts, and provisions in those accounts, before making purchases. Previously we looked at bank balances. In 9 months the age of our money has gone from 12 days to 96 days. We are in the last week of December yet applying inflows to February. This is entirely due to YNAB. As an accountant I have worked with several bookkeeping systems and nothing else has assisted us in family budgeting as effectively as YNAB. My financial stress is 5% of what it was.
title: YNAB SOLVES FAMILY BUDGET ISSUES

review: I have had YNAB since its conception, and it does a fantastic job of helping me keep track of spending and maintaining a budget. The only reason for not giving it a full 5 stars is there‚Äôs no way to calculate sub totals when splitting a purchase into different accounts. So, if I buy groceries and household supplies at Walmart, I might need a separate calculator to add up the items that are things like dish soap, napkins, etc., to put them under that account, while the remainder goes under ‚Äúgroceries.‚Äù I‚Äôve requested this several times, and still hasn‚Äôt happened. One other minor complaint is it seems as though when I enter a purchase while I‚Äôm at the location it no longer automatically fills in the store. It used to be very consistent and now it rarely works.
title: Use daily

review: I am a long time user of another software (starting with Q) and Ive been so frustrated with them for so many years I had to try something new. I found YNAB and instantly fell in love. They make it so easy. I absolutely love the app - you can enter in transactions on the go and it syncs automatically. Beautiful. I will say that it took some adjusting. But only because I‚Äôve been using something else for so long - anything ‚Äúnew‚Äù was different. But I hung in there and the forums and classes are so helpful. Give this a try. It really will make you save more and make smart decisions. Now I can see at a glance my ‚ÄúDining Out‚Äù budget is low - so I can opt to stay in. OR change things around to give me flexibility.  If you are serious about changing your spending habits - this is a great tool.
title: Amazing App

review: I grew up in a financially insecure family, which affects one‚Äôs attitude toward life, and what you see as opportunities for yourself. You limit your vision of what you can do. This app has and is changing my life. (I‚Äôm in my 70‚Äôs) I am confident now. I know that I have the money I need. I know what I need, and I am able to be realistic, prepared, prioritized. I love checking in on my budget daily. It‚Äôs fun! The fact that it is linked with my bank accounts makes it simple. It takes a bit of effort and time to set up, but so so worth it. I tell everyone about it. Been doing it now for a number of years. You can also take online live little classes daily if you like. Great way to begin getting one‚Äôs life under control. Go for it!
title: Changed my life

developerResponse: {'id': 32364911, 'body': 'Thanks for the five star review and the kind words, Keith! ~Renae@YNAB.com', 'modified': '2022-10-03T17:06:02Z'}
review: I‚Äôve used mint for the past 6 years and while it‚Äôs nice to keep track of money, that‚Äôs all it was really good for. I found it hard to include regular recurring payments into the budget as it would always report I had money I could spend until suddenly I didn‚Äôt. YNAB is completely different. Every single dollar is tracked in a very thorough way, allowing me to actually include ALL of my expenses and not be surprised when payments occur. Absolutely wonderful job on the app (though there definitely was an hour or two needed to grasp the concept and features of the app/website.) the idea of budget what you have now, and not what you think you‚Äôll have is how it should be and I love it.
title: Take a different approach

review: Let me start off by saying that I have been budget fanatic. I started budgeting using an excel spreadsheet many many years ago. Then and technology and other program became available I slowly transition to those. YNAB has by far been the easiest most, user friendly, and adaptable budgeting software I have used. Super simply and easy to start. The most time consuming part was taking the time identifying my expenses and built out the budget. Once that was done, the rest was price of cake. The money allocation tool allows you to move funds from one category to another to cover any overage. This tool has really change the way my wife and I look at money. I‚Äôve always started to reach my 11 and 6 year old daughters how to budget.
title: Much easier than I thought

review:
For a long time, I‚Äôve used YNAB classic with Dropbox to keep everything in sync between devices. Then, when I was abroad, a syncing issue wiped out about a month of data. That‚Äôs when I decided to try the new version. I used it for the whole trial version and found that I didn‚Äôt miss the classic app at all. Sure, the new version is missing some reports, but the data syncing is seamless.

Regarding the recurring subscription fee, I got an additional discount due to being an existing customer. I think of it as a necessary cost to help the devs with server maintenance, bug fixing, etc. I also have the subscription set as a budget item so I don‚Äôt get surprised when the annual bill is due.

All in all a terrific app that helps me to track my finances.
title: The only budget app I need

review:
I‚Äôm a huge control freak. I love order in all parts of my life, and money is no exception. I know exactly what my income is going to be for that month on the 1st of every month, and I was looking for a way to chunk that income, proactively, into buckets, so I know what I can spend each month. I thought YNAB was that way ‚Äì I was terribly mistaken. As other people has said, good system, terrible app.

YNAB‚Äôs zero-budget system is great in theory. In practice, the app has so many UX bugs, it‚Äôs nearly unusable. I‚Äôve had to click next buttons 10 times or more before it actually takes (and if it‚Äôs ‚Äúthinking,‚Äù there should be some processing indicator). The UX is also not at all intuitive, and I‚Äôve found myself scratching my head at how it would be assumed that people would use the program in such a workflow.

All in all, love the concept, but here it‚Äôs poorly executed. Definitely cannot justify paying for the product based upon concept alone.
title: Frustrating free trial

review:
I was a YNAB fan early on, even owned the standalone application. I loved the ability to sync to my phone and to even keep up two different budgets (household and personal). I was not thrilled when it became an online application with a $45 a year price tag, but I figured I would give it a shot. 

After a year and a half, I am running into new ways that they want to control my budgeting process and I am done. In the old days, I could choose how to handle a budget category in the red: move funds from another category, charge to available balance or carry to the next month. Now they will carry credits forward, but not debits. Those are automatically charged to available funds. No choice, no workaround. This is a deal breaker for me. They do a great job of helping people in debt or who have tight finances. Neither is true for me so I want more flexibility. For $45 a year, that doesn't seem like too much to ask.
title: The Online App is Now Very Rigid

review: Great app, and have been using it for years.  However, the new goal updates are unintuitive and not useful. Was very dissatisfied and disappointed. The monthly contribution is described as ‚ÄúSpend up to this amount each month‚Äù but that‚Äôs not the function of that goal. For example, if I set a monthly spending goal of $100 for utilities, but I only spent $75 in the current month, then I would only want to allocate $75 the following month so that the utilities budgets stays at $100 given that‚Äôs my monthly spending goal. However, the app is asking to allocate the full $100 on that following month, meaning my next month‚Äôs budget would be $125, which is more than I would want. This problem would just continue to grow over time after each month. Not useful and not practical when trying to plan future spending.
title: Good app, but the goal updates took a step backwards

review:
If you like budgeting but find your spreadsheet labor intensive, or the ‚Äútracking‚Äù apps unsatisfying in ways that might be hard to explain, YNAB will feel like coming home‚Ä¶ as you start it couldn‚Äôt be simpler, as you get momentum it couldn‚Äôt be more fluid and efficient, and soon it does everything you think you want to try.

The app doesn‚Äôt make you look back and put in all the effort to just tell you where you‚Äôve been financially. It helps you see your future money choices, answers questions or concerns about your future money choices, and gives you confidence that once the app says you can do something there is no doubt. You can spend that money you set aside for braces and not think twice how or if it will affect next summer‚Äôs vacation. 

It‚Äôs fundamentally sound in its concepts and remarkably bug free, so I have zero frustration using it. The pay off for the effort in using the app is instant and high over time, too. 

It removes the guess work on purchase timing or mental accounting common with budget apps that give you budget category ‚Äúgoals‚Äù based upon ‚Äúexpected‚Äù or future income. That way lies madness! YNAB‚Äôs way is certainty and confidence.
title: Perfect if you like budgeting

review: I consider myself a Budget Nerd. I was raised in a budgeting household and I learned the art and science of budgeting very young. Naturally, I was searching for the best software to allow me the ability to budget in a meticulous but clear way. I tried Mint‚Ä¶I tried Dave Ramsey‚Äôs version‚Ä¶but nothing allowed me the ability or freedom to do it the way I wanted. Enter YNAB. It‚Äôs revolutionary. It‚Äôs beautiful. It‚Äôs stupendous. Not only can I budget down to the very last dollar, it allows me to roll with the punches, move money to cover certain categories, and I can fund areas of my life I know I‚Äôll need money later. You won‚Äôt be disappointed. This product is fantastic. The brand and marketing even better. It will change your life.
title: Best Budget Software In The Game

review: I‚Äôve used budgeting apps for almost 10 years. Everything from bank budget apps to Mint to about 4 years with EveryDollar. I switched to YNAB about a year and a half ago and it has been the best swap I‚Äôve  ever made. The way it helps you budget, track, and guide your spending, along with reporting and easy methods of moving to cover overspends, auto application of historical spending to get more accurate forecasted budgeting, etc, it does it all phenomenally. The only thing remotely close to a downside for this platform is there is a small learning curve but that is to be expected with something that has as much capability as this - spend the time and learn it and you‚Äôll never go back.
title: Best budget app there is

developerResponse: {'id': 35581534, 'body': 'Hey MelisaGerst! We are so thrilled to hear that YNAB clicked for you and is making a difference for you and your whole family! Woohoo! Thanks for taking the time to leave a review and for spreading the word about YNAB. We appreciate it! Sasha@YNAB', 'modified': '2023-03-25T13:18:21Z'}
review: We have tried Quicken with a background of being Dave Ramsey fans‚Ä¶. But nothing clicked and made such a difference as YNAB! Love the idea of budgeting ONLY what you HAVE and not forecasting! LOVE the app‚Ä¶ I do all my budgeting on my phone. Love that my husband and I can be using the same budget in real time! Has made a wonderful difference in our financial lives. We also got our daughter (21) set up and she is using it to successfully live on her own in a high cost area of the US to on a moderate salary. Love the coaching videos and podcasts (Hannah and budget nerds are my favorite!üòäJesse‚Äôs good tooüòâ.) I tell everyone who is interested about this life changing wonderful app/program!!
title: A year and a half later it has changed our budgeting life!

review:
I‚Äôve been using YNAB for a long time now, and this latest update makes it the best YNAB yet. More than that, this is, by far, the best budgeting app I‚Äôve ever used; and I‚Äôve used a lot.

This app has literally changed my life. Since I started using it, I have had less money-related stress, was able to buy my first house easily, have bought a new truck that, just a couple of years ago, would‚Äôve been far out of my reach, and have greatly improved my credit score.

Not only is it the best budgeting app, but they have the best customer service I‚Äôve ever interacted with. Any time I‚Äôve had an issue or a question, they‚Äôve responded very quickly, often within minutes. (I must admit to being a bit high-maintenance, as I‚Äôve contacted them many, MANY times.)

I, frankly, was not happy when they went cloud-based, I would still prefer to keep my data locally, but I've tried many alternatives, and none even come close to YNAB.

UPDATE: I still love YNAB. Everything I said above is unchanged, but I did remove a star because the app is missing 1 crucial feature: in-app reconciling. The service is still worth far more to me than the amount I pay, but this is a major hole in the app.
title: App is great, customer service is second to none.

review: I'm a 68 year old business owner with a degree in accounting, but couple that with ADD and I could never work out a budget I could stick with  ...mostly having trouble considering all future expenses.  I ended up with multiple bank accounts that got unwieldy.   I saw several people in a Dave Ramsey post say they used this.  Better late than never!!     I've been using YNAB since February 2021.    It is clearly the best budgeting software I've seen...it juggles all things.  It is a masterful thing!  I dedicated at least 30 minutes a day to this for the first month...used Nick True's you tube tutorials.  It has a learning curve, but all questions can be answered easily by the vast number of dedicated  YNABers out there.
title: YNAB, Y did I wait so long!

review: We have been using YNAB for a few years now and love how it helps us to be proactive in how we spend our money. We almost always use the mobile version and there‚Äôs some features from the desktop that I wish were on mobile, such as the reports. On the mobile the reports only show age of money and net worth, but on the desktop you can breakdown your monthly spending and see your trends by specific categories and timeframes. This would be amazing to have on mobile, even if I could just easily see the total for how much I have spent for each month that would be awesome. That being said we are very happy with YNAB and plan to continue using it for a long time to come.
title: LOVE YNAB

developerResponse: {'id': 46892395, 'body': "Hi there!\n\nThanks for sharing your experience with these recent changes! We love hearing about how YNAB can continue to be improved! I wanted to let you know you can tap on the category in the move money flow to pull up your keyboard and enter an amount directly, you can also add multiple categories to cover overspending from! If you'd like to share more about your experiences or ask any questions - especially regarding the assign money flow, please send a note to help@ynab.com, we'd love to hear from you! ~Phil@YNAB", 'modified': '2024-09-21T12:37:26Z'}
review:
