I've been absolutely loving YNAB and have used it for years now. It really changed how we manage our credit cards, floating checks, and other "delayed" expenses. I'll recommend it to anyone I can get to sit still long enough.

However, recently there was a change to the money move screen. The new flow is some how simpler and more complicated than before. Instead of being able to type in how much money to move I have to adjust a slider which is annoying and imprecise. Also, with all the animations it takes much longer than previously.

Then, the new assign money flow only shows assigned money, not available money, so I have no way to be able to tell how much money I have available in my grocery category, just how much I assigned this month, which just isn't helpful for how we use YNAB.
title: Die hard fan disappointed by recent changes

review: I have been a YNAB user for over 8 years! I originally started with the beta version of YNAB 4. It‚Äôs been great to see how the company has developed over time and improved their service. YNAB is 100% worth the investment. The customer service is always so helpful and timely. Anytime I had some import issues or got myself tangled up with my budget, I was able to do a live chat with a specialist that help me sort it out. I used YNAB to help me plan how to pay off 70k of student loans in 2.5 years. It was a fantastic journey. My wife and I are now using YNAB to plan the savings for a new home and help budget for everything in between. Don‚Äôt hesitate. Subscribe and start controlling your finances. You won‚Äôt regret it.
title: YNAB User for over 8 years!

review: YNAB is worth every penny and I‚Äôm cheap. ;) I‚Äôve been using Mvelopes for over 2 years and they have terrible customer service. I did a YNAB trial before but didn‚Äôt want to invest the money. I‚Äôm so glad I did now! I can‚Äôt tell you how frustrating it was to pay a monthly fee and get no response for months. Literally months, on a problem only they could fix, and not through a chat because it was almost always a coding error. Not only was it never fixed by one request, they would send one email saying they had ‚Äúescalated‚Äù the request, then I‚Äôd never hear from them again until I contacted them. YNAB staff has educated me every time and got stuck and been so gracious about my newbie mistakes. YNAB is worth every penny! Best customer service ever!
title: Worth EVERY Penny

review: I never learned how to budget. My version was to track my spending and make sure it didn‚Äôt exceed my income. Even so, I could never figure out where my money went and why I couldn‚Äôt get ahead. I hesitated to try YNAB for a long time because I didn‚Äôt want to pay, but decided to go for it when I saw the trial doesn‚Äôt require a credit card. Now I wonder how much money I could‚Äôve saved if I had just sucked it up. I‚Äôm in week three of my trial and am totally hooked. I love the control of knowing not just where my money is going, but how I‚Äôm spending it, and how to balance so that everything so that I‚Äôm covered in the long run. I laughed when I read that the average user saves $600 in the first month but it‚Äôs totally true. It‚Äôs like found money!!
title: Love. This. App.

review: While I like the concept it uses for budgeting, simple tasks are more complicated than they should be. Transferring money from checking to savings is tedious and took hours to make it look right. I also still don‚Äôt understand the idea behind including savings as part of ‚ÄúTo be budgeted‚Äù when you don‚Äôt want to spend it.  And when you do actually budget it, the transactions don‚Äôt look right at all. On top of all that, there are serious bugs that ruin the app. I had been using the app with no issues when it suddenly couldn‚Äôt connect to make bank accounts. Reconnecting them resulted in duplicate transactions of literally everything I‚Äôd budgeted so far and reset the available amounts for groups that I moved money from, completely screwing up the totals for everything. I tried to fix it manually but no luck. Due to these issues I can‚Äôt justify the $84/year price tag.
title: Unnecessarily Complicated & Full of Bugs

review: It is a way for everyday people to look at their expenses and income every day. It clearly displays where you are financially. It takes a while to be proficient in using YNAB, but once you are comfortable you won‚Äôt want to switch to another program. As you learn you will find easy ways to enter transactions and see the overall status. It makes decision making easier. It follows the rule that all money should be assigned but allows you to take money from one category to another if you need to. You can set goals and YNAB with let you know how much to assign each month to teach your goal. The mobile app is fabulous and connects to your laptop budget.
title: Really lets me track my spending

developerResponse: {'id': 37584060, 'body': "Thanks for the review. It's helpful to know that you'd like to see more insights into your spending on the mobile app. I will definitely pass that along to our team! \\- Natalie @ YNAB", 'modified': '2023-07-10T12:16:36Z'}
review:
I honestly can‚Äôt figure out why people like this app. I only keep using it because I paid for a year, but I get absolutely nothing out of it. I watched almost all the videos and really tried to make it work, but it just doesn‚Äôt help. It just tells you whether you have money for what you already paid for. 

If that works for you, fine, but it doesn‚Äôt work for me. But that‚Äôs not the main reason for my bad review. It‚Äôs because the app offers ZERO insights. It focuses 100% on how much money you have RIGHT NOW and the transactions from this month. There‚Äôs no way to look at old transactions, no way to look at trends and try to figure out where you can cut back. I‚Äôm probably better off manually working on a spreadsheet. It‚Äôll probably take less time than this app and give me much better insights into how to better plan and change behaviors.
title: No insights

developerResponse: {'id': 36002011, 'body': "Hi there, I'm sorry for the frustration you have experienced! YNAB is a different way of budgeting so we like to have lots of resources available for users to learn how to use the app. Our support team works hard to reply within 24 hours so I hope you'll email us at help@ynab.com with your questions if you haven't already, we would love to help! - Natalie @ YNAB", 'modified': '2023-04-17T12:28:11Z'}
review:
First of all this app costs a good amount of money per year. I am still in the trial phase so this is not my final rating, yet.

This app is good in the beginning and seems easy once you get used to it but when it actually comes to keeping track of things, it starts to be a head ache. Categories and accounts get confusing. Transactions are all over the place. There is no undue button. Auto assign feature is useless in helping fund categories.

I‚Äôm fighting to keep this app, but I have large goals that I‚Äôm not sure it‚Äôs going to be a help or hindrance for and I hate that asking customer service anything is such a slow process. You have to watch videos to understand anything about this app. If you have to watch videos to understand anything, it‚Äôs probably over complicated.

I‚Äôm indecisive because there are newer apps out there that would be more effective and not so much of a head ache. Also, I just learned about one time fee Budget templates on Etsy that are simple, thorough and aesthetic This app makes me feel like I‚Äôm in 2016 and it hasn‚Äôt been undated since then.

I don‚Äôt know but I just know I‚Äôm frustrated  with how it feels like a puzzle using this app. I really want to understand it but I don‚Äôt and I don‚Äôt want to have to keep reading articles and watching videos for it to make sense.
title: Not sure if it‚Äôs worth the hype

review: I have tried so many apps trying to find just the right fit and always fell back to using free apps simply because they were free. I would always find myself frustrated just trying to use them. YNAB and it‚Äôs way of budgeting is like no other in so many great ways. The ability to set goals and see the progress is fabulous. Setting future transactions no matter how far away means I never have to worry about remembering them or budgeting the money to cover them because YNAB will take care of that for me. Thanks YNAB and your great customer service team because their work and response time is better than any company I have ever dealt with, budgeting or otherwise! I highly recommend giving YNAB a try, you won‚Äôt be disappointed!
title: Love this app

review:
It‚Äôs a bit intimidating to get started and works quite differently than other tools like Mint. We‚Äôve been using it for 6 months and money stress and arguments are all but gone. We know exactly what we have saved for what goal (bills, vacations, groceries, etc) and can pay down loans without worry. 

BUT this is a different beast and you have to keep and open mind. Watch the tutorials. Take it slow. Try connecting to just your main spending/checking account first and slowly grow from there. We tried to manage everything quickly and got all turned around and had to restart after a month. The support is amazing. They will always get back to you.
title: New to budgeting? Give YNAB a try. It will change the way you think about money.

review: I could cry with how this changed my financial life! I was never ontop of things no matter what system I tried. I have adhd and just couldn‚Äôt ever get it together. I‚Äôm 35 years old, married and lots of kids and I had just accepted I‚Äôll never be organized with my money. Then someone told me about YNAB. At first it was HARD. A big learning curve but I pushed through and was determined to figure it out to give it a true test. This WORKS for even the most unorganized scatter brained person like me! I‚Äôm a few months in and i haven‚Äôt had less than $5000 in my account since I started, when before I was dipping below $0 several times a month. I‚Äôm less stressed and much happier, lighter, better wife and mom.
title: Life changing!

review: I have been using and recommending this app for almost 3 years now. I recommend it to folks ALL of the time and my son uses it. Until this app, I really struggled to project my budgeting needs in the future and to be able to see my money, how It was either helping or hindering my stated goals, and how I could move it around to get back on track. The developers have made many wonderful improvements since the first beta for both the online website and the app, which are easy to navigate. I‚Äôm sure I am not using it to its full potential because it keeps improving with time. All in all, this is one of the few truly useful, well-designed and simple money tools on the market right now.
title: Best Budgeting App for Adults & Teenagers

review: I have been an advocate of this app for years. There were seasons throughout high school and college where I would fall off of budgeting but YNAB makes it easy to get back on track when you want to get serious about your finances. My wife and I learned to budget with YNAB together from the start of our marriage and we are so grateful we did. Money is one of the ‚ÄúBig 3‚Äù things couples argue most about in marriage and thanks to YNAB we have been united and on the same page with our financial decisions. If you want to be able to aggressively pay off debt, see progress on your savings, and set financial goals for the future that help you obtain financial freedom, then YNAB will help you!
title: Helps you live life so much more freely

review:
Financial prowess has never been a strong suit for me. 

Now I find balancing my budget relaxing and empowering. I won‚Äôt shut up about this app to my friends.   Whaaaat?!

I have YNAB to thank for this turnaround. I use Dave Ramsey‚Äôs baby steps, but this helps me manage my dollars in an even more conservative fashion (and YNAB has a great blog post on how to use Financial Peace University and their system together). 

It took me an evening with a couple glasses of wine, my statements, and my old spreadsheet to input everything and get YNAB set up.  
From there it‚Äôs a snap, and this super well-designed app is always synced, allowing me to take this show on the road. It works as well as it is intuitive and beautiful. A complete pleasure to use. 

Spend $ at the gas station? GPS knows it‚Äôs my usual gas station and bring it up automatically when I go to enter the transaction. SEAMLESS. 

It will always make you verify against your bank, which is awesome. I don‚Äôt want to have a set-and-forget system. This will make you account for every dollar, even the so-called ‚Äúextra‚Äù ones.  This is the kind of functionality that has given me control and a birds-eye view of my finances. Thank you YNAB. ‚ù§Ô∏è
title: Life-changing

review:
A few pet peeves:
1) The lack of a running balance makes planning payments into the future impossible in the app, even on my laptop.  This means I have had to design a separate spreadsheet to do this.  Ironically, the original version of YNAB was built on a spreadsheet.
2) The latest app update (April 16, 2018) added calculators everywhere, but did so at the expense of having a useable numeric keypad (it‚Äôs now way too small, unnecessarily so), making quick entry of the amount spent on the go unnecessarily clumsy.  What on earth were you thinking?
3)  After 2 plus years of development, useable reports should be available, both on the mobile app, and on the browser based ‚Äúdesktop‚Äù app.  Considering YNAB is now a subscription service, I *expect* ongoing development AND RESULTS.
4) Speaking of ‚Äú4‚Äù, YNAB4 is still a better product.  I‚Äôm running them in parallel.  If the SAAS version was good enough (see above pet peeves) I could happily move forward with it.
title: Lacks key features.  And the new numeric keypad is AWFUL!

review:
I have been using YNAB since it was an Excel spreadsheet, and I have never strayed to another budgeting platform. When it went to a subscription, I was a little leery, but I also knew that it had saved my life from bankruptcy, credit card debt, learning to live on one salary following divorce (which put me even more in debt). I ended up with over 40,000 in credit card debt plus another 50k in student loans on a meager salary. 

Now I recommend YNAB to everyone I know, my kid has been using it since she was 18. I am now debt-free aside from my mortgage, which I am paying down aggressively. And my kid has no debt (not even student loans) at the age of 21. Instead she has the beginnings of retirement savings.

I recommend YNAB to everyone I know. It‚Äôs a great product at a reasonable cost when compared to paying astronomical credit card fees.

I strongly recommend the videos or live events to get on board. Even now I revisit those now and then. They are also always are making the product better which is great. Even so I hope they will continue to keep the cost reasonable.
title: YNAB is the best budgeting software out there

Send us an email to help@ynab.com and we can help guide you through! You can also find walkthrough videos on our YouTube channel and live workshops on our website! I'm confident we can help get you up and running! ~Phil@YNAB", 'modified': '2024-10-07T12:56:06Z'}
review: I‚Äôve tried using this app for 2 months now. I like the mindset behind it, but the different functions in the app just don‚Äôt work very well. Keeping up with account balances, transferring money, managing purchases, waiting for transactions to clear, internal transfers, UGH. I never really feel confident about how much money I have available when using this. I‚Äôve had to restart multiple times. Things keep getting messed up. Im spending hours every week just trying to unfudge this thing and it gets messed up so easily, no matter how conscious i am about whether a transaction has cleared my bank, how sure i am i assigned the right payee for an internal transfer, how many times i reconcile my balances, it just causes me more headache. It‚Äôs easier to just make a spreadsheet and manually record all my transactions and balances (which also saves me on that CRAZY $15+ subscription fee!)
title: Big price for a big headache

Thanks for sharing! (And if you or others want tips on managing YNAB with ADHD, get in touch at help@ynab.com ‚Äî we'd love to support you!) - Dela@YNAB", 'modified': '2023-02-23T01:22:53Z'}
review: Never thought I‚Äôd be the type to use something like this or uphold a budget well. I was very used to running out of money a few days before my next paycheck, because it all looked like one lump some to spend in my bank account & I‚Äôd forget about upcoming expenses. ADHD makes navigating time and money difficult, but this system has absolutely turned things around for me. I never find myself in the negative now. My credit card is paid off every month, my savings account is growing, and I‚Äôm so relieved. From someone who didn‚Äôt see this as possible before, please try it. I‚Äôm practically begging my friends & family - this could make a huge difference for you. üß°
title: Life Saver

developerResponse: {'id': 35014820, 'body': 'What a review, erika_bby! I love that you find YNAB so worth it and that it has changed your life. Thank you for being such an awesome YNABer! - Natalie @ YNAB', 'modified': '2023-02-22T13:09:53Z'}
review:
I‚Äôve had YNAB for 2-3 years now and can attest that this is a literal life changing system. Of course there is the learning curve but it is SO WORTH IT. There are tons of resources that YNAB offers to assist ‚Äî videos, articles, a fun weekly email with info/tips, online workshops (free), etc. etc. etc. Not to mention the sub on Reddit, r/YNAB üòä It may take a bit but once you get the hang of it you will not want to go back. Take the time to practice and learn and your life will be changed, no exaggeration. I‚Äôve fallen off the wagon a couple of times but it‚Äôs easy to get back on it. 

Thank you, YNAB, for being so awesome and helping me change the way I think about money, budgeting, and finances.
title: Life changing! Worth the effort of the learning curve

review: I‚Äôm pretty smart, pretty frugal, and have been using a budget via excel spreadsheet with my husband since we got married 6 years ago. But after I started my business and had our second kid, we started feeling really tight financially speaking. Covering two daycares and student loans and all our other expenses while only having basically one income was rough.... add to that the thought of spending $12/mo on YNAB? What are you, crazy? But I was intrigued so I tried the 30day trial. And it completely revolutionalized our lives. I made an extra $3k payment toward my student loans my first month. Financial stress has gone out the window. The app is really really smartly built and 100% worth its cost. Highly recommend!
title: The best.

review: I‚Äôve had YNAB for only a few weeks.  I‚Äôm married, work full time and just wanted to manage my own $ and spending.  Other apps were too comprehensive & I found the good old fashion spreadsheet or check register to be more useful until . . . YNAB.  This is EXACTLY what I was searching for.  YNAB does all the heavy lifting for you YET it‚Äôs customizable & flexible.  Have as few or as many categories as you want.  Sounds simple & it is for the user!  How it works is AMAZING!!  I cannot get enough of the 20 minute workshops!!  They pop up ‚ÄúLive‚Äù on my FB feed whenever I‚Äôm scrolling or I can scroll through them when I need a refresher.  It‚Äôs like a Fitbit for your $.  Try it for a month free.  Watch the workshops and see for yourself.
title: YNAB is like a Fitbit for your $

review: Don‚Äôt worry about spending money on YNAB to help you manage your money. I‚Äôve been using it for nearly a year now and I can‚Äôt imagine not using budgeting software in the future. It takes so much of the worry about what you have to spend in what areas (grocery/fuel/eating out). I don‚Äôt recall how it was to set up, but day to day use is so easy. I‚Äôm a big fan of the split transactions, especially around Christmas. It makes it easy to split out gifts or food court purchases at the grocery store from my regular grocery shopping. Balances pop up at the bottom and change as you enter a transaction and remaining balances are super clear. All in all it‚Äôs a very pretty app and easy to use. And a large online community if you need it.
title: Worth the money

review: I know many people have said it before, but I will say it again...YNAB HAS CHANGED MY LIFE. Before I started using YNAB it was hard for me to wrap my head around how to properly budget or if using a budget could really change my financial life. Then I found YNAB and it all clicked. The ease of using the app coupled with the 4 YNAB rules has taught me he power of budgeting. I no longer live paycheck to paycheck and am just a month away from paying off all my credit card debt, I have an emergency fund, and money to travel like I have always wanted to. Being able to link it to my bank accounts took it to a whole other level. It‚Äôs so easy to log things and reconcile now I am amazed. Thank you for helping me finally obtain financial freedom.
title: This App Has Changed My Life

developerResponse: {'id': 45937419, 'body': "We're SO glad you found us!", 'modified': '2024-08-12T17:27:52Z'}
review: I‚Äôve used an ‚Äúenvelope‚Äù budgeting system for almost 25 years. When the previous system I used closed up shop, I was terrified I wouldn‚Äôt find a replacement. Well, sometimes you receive blessings you never really even asked for. This system runs circles around my previous one. It‚Äôs super smooth and amazingly glitch free. For those worried about the cost, if you follow it, you will save many multiples of your investment. The peace of mind knowing where every dollar is allocated in your budget is well worth the price. I promise you, once you start using it faithfully, it will change how you view and manage your finances. You will not regret it.
title: Best Budgeting System I‚Äôve Ever Used!

developerResponse: {'id': 37402436, 'body': 'Hi there, thanks for taking the time to leave us a review. If your subscription is through YNAB directly, deleting your account will trigger an automatic refund for any remaining subscription time. However, if your subscription was through Google or Apple, they handle all billing, and we are required to default to their refund policies. \\-Jill@YNAB', 'modified': '2023-06-29T13:27:13Z'}
review:
The system is fine, if not also very unintuitive. It takes some getting used to, but can be figured out after a while.
Unfortunately, one of the main perks - being able to connect to your checking account and automatically import transactions- was completely broken. My bank is not a small company by any means, but YNAB just couldn‚Äôt hack it. It would often take 6,7 sometimes 8 or 9 days for the transactions to import. Trying to maintain a budget with that level of information lagging was stupid.

I wrote them, telling them I‚Äôd like to cancel and would like a refund for the prior two months (I‚Äôd used it for longer, but figured there was no reason to push it). They wrote back and said they can not issue a refund (which, come on, of course you ‚Äúcan‚Äù, you‚Äôre just choosing not to). So rather than pursue the time wasting work required to hunt down my $30 or whatever, I chose to write a review

There has to be better budgeting apps. I‚Äôm very disappointed in both the platforms functioning, as well as the canned and obnoxiously uncaring response to my request. 

I‚Äôd suggest checking out their ‚ÄúStatus‚Äù page, as it shows which banking companies they are struggling to import with. It‚Äôs not exactly a short list.

Look elsewhere. I know I am .
title: Ugh

review: I can‚Äôt say enough about how helpful YNAB has been in my life. As an entrepreneur with a variable income, this app is a LIFE SAVER. If I could give it 10 stars, I would. My partner and I started using this app about 5 years ago and it has been a complete game changer ever since. Seriously, it works and actually works for life. I always feel more at peace when my YNAB app is up to date by reflecting all of my current spending, income and budget. It‚Äôs just so good. If you really use it consistently, it can seriously change your life and relieve SO MUCH STRESS about money and budgeting. This is the most important app on my phone. 100% honest review. Thank you to the developer for making this. I‚Äôm so grateful.
title: My Most Valued App

developerResponse: {'id': 30152605, 'body': 'Hi Brad! Thanks for the feedback! We love working hard for you and are glad that work translates to the app. ü§© Happy budgeting! ‚Äì JD @ YNAB', 'modified': '2022-06-03T21:47:39Z'}
review:
This company works hard to just help people get their life in order and the app just oozes quality at every turn.  

I have been using for about 4 years now with about 10-12 accounts from about 7 different financial institutions. There were some bumps with connections years ago but they worked hard to support me through those bumps. As more institutions move to some common standards the connections continue to get more stable. 

In the end the connections aren‚Äôt critical for most, as using the app for real time manual entry is easy. But for me it has saved hours from years ago trying to reconcile statements month after month.
title: Just a great app by a great company

review: The envelope/zero-based budgeting methodology has quite literally changed my life. And YNAB is an incredible tool & support community to facilitate this. The digital tools are continuously updated with features that are incredibly useful. And the company provides an enormous knowledge base of articles, videos, forums, etc. that is an invaluable learning tool. YNAB has completely changed the way I think about money and enabled me to pull myself out of 6-figure debt (student loans & consumer). I now have a 6-month emergency fund, paid for my wedding in cash, have purchased 2 houses, and am saving up for some exciting long-term goals. YNAB is honestly the best money I‚Äôve ever spent; I‚Äôm a life-long convert for sure.
title: Life-changing (no exaggeration)

review:
The app itself ‚Äî and the principles behind it ‚Äî took a few weeks to adjust to (compared to a basic money tracker like Mint or Clarity) but that‚Äôs probably why it works so much better. The apps are seamless between the phone, iPhone, and desktop versions, all of which I use to help track my budgeting on a daily and weekly basis. 

But ‚Äî beyond the tech ‚Äî I can‚Äôt speak highly enough of the customer support team. Beyond their team that plans and leads events and courses, their support team consistently goes above and beyond. I had a question that was quickly answered, and when I emailed in a follow-up, their support and tech teams emailed back a customized video explaining how something worked. Simply incredible.
title: Great app + fantastic support team

title: Hands down the best budgeting tool!

developerResponse: {'id': 37560151, 'body': "Hey noluck! We work with Plaid and MX \\- two options for import providers. Mint is owned by Intuit, so they definitely have more pull with their providers than us. If you're having trouble with a bank connection, continue through that chat prompt to the end and we'll get back to you and troubleshoot from there! We're here to help! \\- Kat @ YNAB", 'modified': '2023-07-09T12:28:29Z'}
review: Be sure to sort reviews by ‚Äúmost recent‚Äù to see the most commonly reported issue, connectivity issues. YNAB uses Plaid for connectivity to banks, and is plagued by disconnects, delayed imports, and downtime. A connection will often be classified as ‚Äúimports delayed‚Äù, which can last for days. Essentially, it is out. I also use Mint, which maintains connections with no issue. The connectivity issues greatly impact the functionality of the app and make it more of a frustration to track finances than a convenience. The chat bot will go through recommended steps: reauthorize, check the YNAB web page for reports and trouble tracking of connectivity issues by banking institution, disconnect the account and reconnect‚Ä¶. The balance of time troubleshooting these issues versus actually managing a budget is unfortunately skewed in the wrong direction.
title: Persistent connectivity issues

review: After years of not having a budget we decided we needed one and an easy way to track and manage it. For us in particular, effectively managing credit card spend what important. This app manages credit card spend perfectly. In addition, I like the way that they think about the money that you have been assigned to get out to your spending priorities. Basically, this app works like a digital envelope system. I also like the fact that it‚Äôs easy to use on my iPad, iPhone and easy to look at quickly on my Apple Watch. It does take a little time to set up and some effort to manage and track transactions ‚Ä¶ but for me this is the perfect budgeting app.
title: Awesome app!

review:
Promise‚Äî I don‚Äôt work for these guys. I‚Äôm just a guy who gets paid for his time by the job. Some months I work a lot, some months I don‚Äôt. Some months they pay me right away ‚Äî sometimes they wait 60 days or more. 

YNAB has taken the stress out of variable income life. Takes about an hour to set up the first time. The internal logic of the program is not difficult, but it is so different from your usual thinking about money that you really have to settle into the pattern for a little while before it clicks in your head.

Before ‚Äî ‚ÄúWow, it‚Äôs December and I already spent my money on presents. Oh, crap, my annual insurance payment is due!! Guess it goes on Master Card.‚Äù Now ‚Äî ‚ÄúHere‚Äôs the money for presents and I need to write the check for that insurance. Is there any more coffee?‚Äù No stress, because I set the money aside (easily) in advance.

Regular budgeting feels like a diet with all restrictions and no fun. YNAB is about flexibility and freedom within your financial reality.

They have lots of video tutorials ‚Äî well done ‚Äî as well as streaming live classes. You don‚Äôt need to be a CPA to do this.
title: Best tool for variable income finances

review:
Until I got this app.  Seriously, I am so relieved to be able to spend money without worrying about whether or not I really have it.  I also haven‚Äôt had an overdraft fee since getting this, and likely will never again!  That alone has saved me probably $40 a month. 

The ability to enter in transactions and have them match up automatically with transactions in your connected account is amazing, and being linked to my bank account ensures I always know about transactions I forgot to enter manually or that happened without my knowledge.  

It‚Äôs so easy to organize and plan too ‚Äî I have student loans that require me to pay five different amounts at random times of year, and with this app, I‚Äôm always prepared for them because I can set recurring goals. 

I never would have thought an app could change my life so much.  I went from feeling like I‚Äôm drowning multiple times a month to being able to buy things that improve my quality of life, like snow tires, air conditioning, winter clothes and so on, without worrying at all.
title: Never in my whole life have I had savings

review: I have been using YNAB for close to two years now and it has honestly changed my life. I have never been very good at saving or even sometimes pay bills üòÇ but YNAB has taught me that I don‚Äôt need to spend every penny when I get it. I can now put stuff on auto payment and not worry about if I have enough money or not in my account. I also now feel comfortable getting a credit card to help rebuild my credit after a bankruptcy 5 years ago. This truly only happened with YNAB. I also love that the translation entry is super easy and it predicts where you are so you have less fields to enter. Oh and last thing, I love how funny they are! If you actually read their app updates you will find your self chuckling.
title: Best budget app!

review: This is by far the best budgeting app I have ever used.  I bought classic YNAB (one-time payment) back in 2014 and used it for years.  When YNAB upgraded to having to pay every year, I wanted to see what else was out there.  Tried mint, didn't like it.  I was excited when Dave Ramsey‚Äôs EveryDollar came out but the interface is not good and it doesn't have the memory that YNAB has.  I finally decided to pay for this new YNAB and it is worth every penny.  It is so convenient to use and it syncs well with our bank account.  It‚Äôs very easy to make adjustments from the app unlike the classic YNAB.  I will continue to pay for YNAB every year b/c it has helped us reach some financial goals this past year and we feel hopeful for the future.
title: I use this everyday!

review:
I have been using this for 5 months and it changed my life.  My excel budget was too complicated (Especially because I earn and spend money in 2 countries), so did not consistently use it. This app is like having lots of bank accounts organized to my needs, all on one screen. 

I have paid more student loan debt off in the last few months than I thought possible because I feel comfortable making larger payments knowing I have sinking funds, an emergency fund, and am using this month's paycheck for next month. I  am motivated not to buy, because at the end of the month I transfer all the leftovers in each category (even if it's 15 cents left over for gas money) to make one extra loan payment. It adds up. This money used to disappear before YNAB.  

Having an app track  what I spend is also making me realize I need to put more money aside for things like teaching supplies and birthday present so those don't become emergencies. 

That being said, it was a learning process and I am constantly changing how I use it. However, I find this good bc it keeps me motivated to pay off these loans!
title: Changed My Life

review: I‚Äôve used multiple apps to try to use a categorization system that actually gave me real time information as to how to spend or not spend my money. I also have multiple bank accounts. Other apps I have used either do not give you that real time data and they just tell you after the fact how you spent the money or they don‚Äôt have a firewall between accounts such that you could accidentally assign money from one bank account to a category in another bank account. YNAB is so easy to use after a little bit of training. The help videos are so great and the support is so great. I cannot recommend YNAB enough!
title: Literally the best app for budgeting

developerResponse: {'id': 3152133, 'body': "Hi jodav - Just a quick note to let you know I've passed along your feedback to our design team for review. I'm sorry I can't do more for you!", 'modified': '2018-04-16T21:12:59Z'}
review: YNAB removed the ability to see a running account balance with this version. YNAB4 has it. All other checkbook register type budgeting softwares have it. But YNAB took it away. Also, they intentionally changed the ‚Äúenter now‚Äù feature for putting future dated transactions into the register by having it change the future dated transaction to ‚Äútoday‚Äôs‚Äù date, creating a pickle for those who like to schedule and enter their committed expenses beyond ‚Äútoday‚Äôs‚Äù date. Why????  I‚Äôve been asking YNAB support for over 2 years. They won‚Äôt put it back on the roadmap for development. I guess I‚Äôll never know why they took away our ability to see our balance and plan our financial future. If you want to be blind and only in the know on up-to-today‚Äôs spend, then this version is for you. As a former YNAB enthusiast, I‚Äôm sorry to have to say, I won‚Äôt recommend this company or product anymore. üòî
title: REMOVED running account balance and ability to enter now the future spend!

review:
I‚Äôve struggled with budgeting applications before. I‚Äôve tried all the major ones and even a few open source apps for money management. YNAB hits it out of the park! I‚Äôve been using YNAB for 8 months now, and I am absolutely in love with it! It was like finding myself soulmate... well maybe that‚Äôs a bit extreme, but I would absolutely recommend the average money spender (that‚Äôs you) to give YNAB a shot.

I have recommended it to all of my friends and family because it takes the headache out of managing your budget and building your net worth. After their 34 day free trial, it was a no-brainer to sign up and pay the membership to keep using it. In my mind, the cost of membership is well worth not having the budgeting headaches I was facing every month. I‚Äôve watched my age of money climb higher and higher over the last 8 months, and a big part of me being able to achieve this was thanks to YNAB.

The support documentation is fantastic. The chat support is outstanding. This company cares more about its customers than making a profit. That is crystal clear to me.

Nothing else competes. Do yourself a favor and try out YNAB.
title: YNAB Changed My Life

developerResponse: {'id': 39614032, 'body': 'Thank you so much for this review, Susan. I love hearing how YNAB has helped you. Setting money aside for those "what if" situations is a total game changer! \\- Natalie @ YNAB', 'modified': '2023-10-19T12:34:22Z'}
review:
I‚Äôve been a YNAB user for years now. I went from spending next month‚Äôs paycheck to only spending what I have now. I have zero credit card debt. I plan for future expenses (auto insurance and registration, annual fees, AAA, etc.) so I‚Äôm not caught off guard. Plus, I put money aside monthly for those ‚Äúwhat ifs‚Äù like veterinarian bills and car problems.

If you want to get control of your finances, get this app. Be religious about tracking your spending. Set your long term goals so you are encouraged to save every month. And when you‚Äôve gotten to the point where you are in charge of your money and not the other way around, write a review like I just did.
title: YNAB has literally changed my life

review: This app saved my financial life. Before I started using it, I basically ran a zero-balance account- the day before payday my checking account basically at zero. But by learning YNAB and the four rules, I have not made one purchase on debt. NOT ONE. and there is not only money in my account, but I have planned for the future. I know where my money is going and how to compensate if there really is a purchase that must be made that wasn‚Äôt fully budgeted. Try this app, watch some videos (it‚Äôs a little bit of a learning curve) and give it at least two months. If you don‚Äôt feel more secure about your finances, you‚Äôre not consistently following the steps.
title: Turned my life around.

review: nYNAB is a huge step backwards from YNAB4, very stripped down. Many features that most users would consider standard in financial software are flat out missing. No calculator, space for check numbers, inability to have future transactions affect your balances now... The program it's self is very buggy, with things like the inability to use the mouse to enter categories and problems entering split transactions. You can no longer send money forward to future months to budget, but it's easy to over spend without a clear indicator you have done so until it's too late. Currently there is no way to export data and no report function. There is no way to import current YNAB data. My recommendation would be to wait until the YNAB team improves the program. Right now it feels like a Beta version that you are required to pay for the privilege of participating in.
title: New version isn't ready for release

review:
YNAB has helped me more in the past year and a half than anything else. I have been able to pay down credit cards, begin to use them to my advantage, not incur further debt and increase the amount of money left between paychecks. It is not just about the app but a whole and better way of looking at money. 
I personally love the app. There are a few features on the web version that you can‚Äôt do on the app such as recording a credit card payment but that doesn‚Äôt bother me. It is easy to record a transaction in real time and even budget right from the app. I can‚Äôt recommend this app and YNAB enough! It‚Äôs changed my life for the better
title: Best budgeting app ever

review:
I started using YNAB officially on June 1 after spending the month of May putting it through its paces and understanding how it works.  

I have to say it literally has saved my life. On Monday June 18, 2018 during the first tropical storm of the season down here on South Padre Island I was awakened to water literally pouring into my third floor apartment. The HOA was in the middle of replacing the roof and the worst possible thing happened.  

In a matter of a couple of hours everything I owned was ruined. But with all of my money had been given specific jobs and I was able to weather the storm, pun intended. 

Not only was I able to handle having to stay in a hotel till Friday. Peak season on the island isn‚Äôt cheap.  But because I had money set aside for emergencies I was able to find a new even better place to live and could easily afford it. And as fate would have it I was able to move in on Friday. 

Currently the age of my money is only 17 days and I was still able to handle all of this upset stress free. I can hardly wait till the age of money goes past 30 days. 

Thank you YNAB for saving my life.

Padre Island Steve
title: YNAB saved my life - literally

review: Game-changer app. What's different about YNAB and other apps is that YNAB is NOT set it and forget it. No because then I won't be able to pay my bills." YNAB helps you know when to STOP spending. My vacation to Europe was paid in full ahead of time. All hail YNAB!

YNAB completely reframed the way we think about spending and budgeting, almost over night. Finances had been the single biggest source of conflict in our marriage‚ÄîYNAB has made budgeting something that‚Äôs fun and that we actually look forward to (seriously!). It simultaneously made spending feel guilt-free, but we still managed to save almost $1000 extra during the 2 month free trial, just from thinking about our spending differently.  We now have an annual subscription, cannot recommend highly enough for folks at any income level.
title: Worth 20x the price

review:
I‚Äôve been using YNAB since the desktop version‚Äî I still say it‚Äôs the best $60 I ever spent.  First budget to keep my spouse and me on the same page.  We saved well over $1000 in our first 7 months with no changes to income.  

When every dollar has a job, we transfer our gaze to what our budget says we have, not our bank account. We log every transaction.   It‚Äôs kept us from overspending- we love green categories.   The new web-based app is so simple to use, and they‚Äôre always improving it.  

If you‚Äôre looking for something uncomplicated, and you‚Äôre ready to change the way you think about your money, you won‚Äôt be disappointed with YNAB.

review: You have to really commit to the mindset and method. Once you do, it becomes super intuitive and kinda shifts your mental model of personal finance. I‚Äôve considered making my own version of YNAB in a spreadsheet, but ultimately having the functionality that the iOS app and web interface provide are worth the price of admission. The app is one piece of the puzzle, and is best for quickly moving / categorizing funds or checking how much you‚Äôve allocated to a category before you make a purchase. Use the web interface for budgeting paychecks, creating goals and running reports.
title: Great Tool

review: This is the one and only app out there that you can use to plan with the money that you already ACTUALLY have and plan again with each paycheck, assessing your priorities continually. It gives every dollar that you have a specific job. Your budget decisions will roll in real-time (just like life) rather than by the month, setting you easily up for success rather than holding you to an unrealistic goal that will ultimately be thrown by life‚Äôs day-to-day complications. In a weird way, this way of budgeting is actually FUN as the results build quite quickly and you find ways to budget for both financial growth and life‚Äôs daily enjoyment.
title: The ONLY Budget Software To Use

developerResponse: {'id': 36498636, 'body': "Hi there, what an awesome review! Congratulations on getting 1\\+ month ahead. That's a huge accomplishment, and you're absolutely right, it really is a game changer. üôå Thanks for being a loyal YNABer all these years, and for taking the time to share your feedback with us! \\- Jill@YNAB", 'modified': '2023-05-13T13:07:04Z'}
review: I have lengthened my money's "age" and we are at least a month ahead. Love the way credit card transactions pull money from categories and gets pooled together so the sum is ready for a credit card payment -- I used to have to do this and everything via excel for every expense. This was a game changer as I couldnt find any app that integrated this into the method of assigning every dollar. I use my credit card like a debit card and zero out my balance every month close so no debt. Husband is less of a budgeter than me but YNAB has gotten him on board this budgeting method and keep track of his credit card. We have been using YNAB for 5 years!
title: Annual fee is worth it!

review: This budgeting app is unlike any other. I bought this years ago and had a lot of trouble with it largely because I thought too much based off what I knew from other budgeting apps. If you follow the steps and then continue to follow the steps this will work. But it is a little counter intuitive only because our intuition is based off standard budgeting programs. That being said, once you get the hang of it, it is the most fun of all the budgeting apps. I actually look forward to logging transactions and seeing how much I can save. This app has had its bumps in the road in the past but it looks like those are far behind. Well done Team YNAB!
title: Great program but you must actually follow for it to help

review:
I love YNAB. For the longest time we would gauge our finances very loosely, and every time I paid a large bill or my credit card I had a feeling of unease and even dread. 
Now, I actively enjoy paying our mortgage and credit card balances because they‚Äôre already budgeted for; the act of actually paying them is just a formality. 

The learning curve is high, but YNAB provides an impressive range of tutorials on how to get started including videos, podcasts, or a surprisingly fun-to-read set of blog posts for different topics. Within a month or two I felt like a pro and have never needed to use more advanced help options, but feel confident that if I did I would find them useful. 

The interface itself is intuitive and easy to use; I love using the web portal to sit down and assign paychecks twice a month, and the mobile app is perfect for entering individual transactions or shifting money on the go. 

Overall, couldn‚Äôt recommend more highly for those looking to feel more in control of their finances.
title: Has Changed My Relationship with Money

developerResponse: {'id': 3246793, 'body': "Hi Glad_e - thanks for the feedback! We can definitely walk you through those areas you don't understand.  (For instance, you would budget your savings to a category you are saving for - i.e., emergency fund or car down payment.  And, your credit card payment category gets higher after a budgeted purchase because your budget is showing you that you have more money set aside to make a payment.)  \n\nWe're constantly working on improving our apps to make them more user friendly, though - so check us out in the future if you still need a budget! üëç", 'modified': '2018-04-24T19:36:58Z'}

I work for a financial planner at an investment firm. I have my series 7 and 66 licenses. And I can‚Äôt understand this app. I hate that it includes my savings account as part of my ‚ÄúTo Be Budgeted‚Äù. So it‚Äôs constantly showing I have thousands to use when I keep a limited amount in my checking account. I‚Äôm also confused how credit card payments work because when I make a payment OR spend money, the available balance for that credit card gets higher then rolls over to the next month. Same goes for my mortgage, I pay it off in full and the credit somehow rolls over to next month. I wish I could start at zero each month and categorize everything again.

I appreciate the free online classes but it doesn‚Äôt make using the app worth it for me. A rep was even nice enough to email me an explanation of how the budget categories work but I don‚Äôt have time to study an app and figure out how it works. I canceled my subscription.

I am working toward getting ahead of my spending. This app allows me to see every transaction and make a plan for my money without being to prescriptive. Doing the quick math in my head never caught everything. 

One issues I had was it takes a solid amount of effort to learn. I had to watch a few videos and red through the website. It would be nice to have a basic ‚Äúhow to use‚Äù page that is easy to find on the website. It felt like everything pointed to information on why to budget or budgeting strategies.

review:
I have used many budgeting apps over the years but after a couple of weeks to a month I would always switch back to my detailed and trusty budget spreadsheet... until I came across YNAB.  I decided to give it a chance, as I wasn‚Äôt familiar with giving every $dollar a job.    O  M  Mother  Mother  G!  I have never felt so free and on top of my finances when it comes to paying bills and using credit cards, to get cash back without paying interest, to planning vacations and large purchases.  I can not describe the freedom!  Best App ever.  God bless the developers and everyone else involved in making YNAB available.  My hat‚Äôs off too you guys; and I‚Äôm having a bad hair day :-)

title: Freedom

review:
I paid for more than a year‚Äôs worth of YNAB. It‚Äôs a good idea with flawed execution:

First the good-zero budgeting is great and a solid way to manage household finances. YNAB has a good interface that makes it easy to keep track of your money.

Here‚Äôs the bad- the data importing from bank accounts or credit card companies is increasingly unstable and unreliable. 

I‚Äôm not sure if this is YNAB‚Äôs problem or their reliance on PLAID or MX their other service. I‚Äôve had to use both due to weird import problems. Here‚Äôs the deal and the bottom line and why I finally got fed up: my bank account and American Express account transactions keep getting either not imported or when imported mischaracterized or misidentified by YNAB as credits rather than expenses. If you can‚Äôt download my transactions, or can‚Äôt download them properly, into the system for budgeting, I‚Äôve got to do it myself. And if I‚Äôve got to do it myself, I‚Äôm not sure why I‚Äôm paying you for a fancy excel spreadsheet. So I quit. 

The only reason I have it two stars is the customer service is solid. I really enjoyed it for a while before the technical issues started being too much of a problem. It‚Äôs a good idea increasingly poorly executed.
title: Used for more than a year - glitchy and unreliable

review:
Very effective and efficient budget app. It‚Äôs turned into a staple app I refer to almost daily now. There‚Äôs an adjustment period of learning and getting it right for you but with some effort it becomes convenient, stable, and routine. I tried Mint at one point(before YNAB) and hated it. Seemed clunky, transactions lagged hard, restrictive.. almost made budgeting harder then it really is so convenience went out the window.

Pros:
-Highly realistic, it only works with what you have. Simple concept.
- building your budget is highly customizable  to your lifestyle and choices. 
-the convenient concepts is what really makes this app IMO. It really tries to break down tedious aspects of budgeting(such as receipts) into manageable actions. 

Cons:
-Credit Card transactions can be a little tricky at first but they make sense after understanding the process. 
-kinda pricey(I find it silly to budget in the cost of the appüòÜ)

Overall this thing is a powerhouse that when learned and set up right for your own lifestyle, is convenient and necessary. +customer service is awesome and responsive.
title: Very effective

review: We‚Äôve had YNAB for 1 year now and it has been amazing, I can‚Äôt recommend it enough. My wife and I were never really able to save money but this app has given us the awareness to save over $10,000 in the past 12 months! It‚Äôs super easy to use and the support team is incredible if things get confusing. I‚Äôve reached out with 3 separate issues and they always responded quickly and clearly and told me exactly what I needed to do to fix my problem. They even emailed me a month ago to let me know my subscription was about to renew! Truly this team cares about the financial success of it‚Äôs users above all else. We‚Äôll be using it for a long long time.
title: Amazing app - incredible support

review:
I‚Äôve become a fan of YNAB after using it over the past couple months. It‚Äôs gives me a real sense of control over my money and a continuous sense of whether I‚Äôm on track or not. 

I think the genius of this app is that it has helped me for a habit of paying attention to my money daily. It does this via the key daily action it requires: categorizing transactions as they are imported from my bank. This has become a daily habit and it feels good to know every day where we stand with our money. Categorizing every transaction may sound tedious, but once you start you can‚Äôt stop! It becomes a habit loop, just like checking email or the FB newsfeed. 

Thanks for the great work YNAB!
title: Great way to start a budgeting habit!

I‚Äôve been using YNAB for years and it has gotten better and better over time. I‚Äôve tried others, but have always returned to YNAB. While it can be a little pricey, you won‚Äôt find an app this good any cheaper. They also have an impressive video library that details how to use the every facet of the app, easing the app learning curve. 

Even more impressive is their excellent customer service. I recently have had issues with one of my accounts that wouldn‚Äôt sync. They respond quickly and get right on it, providing regular updates and status reports. They won‚Äôt let up until it‚Äôs fixed; they‚Äôre tenacious!
title: Best personal budgeting app!

review:
My wife and I are hooked on this program for setting up our monthly budget, recording expenses, and planning for bigger purchases.  We‚Äôve used for a number of years now and watched our Age of Money increase tremendously now to over 6 months.

One area of suggested improvement is in their Reporting abilities.  We can do an Income/Expense report from a desktop computer, but I haven‚Äôt figured out how to do it from an iPad.  Often when I want to see how we did in staying within budget the month before, I only have an iPad with me when traveling.  Hoping they shore up Reports area in the future for our portable electronics.

title: Great App

review: I just got engaged to my fianc√©e in October, and needless to say, we‚Äôve really needed to get a hold on our budget so that we can save for the wedding. Nothing was working, and I found out that YNAB offers students access to the app for free for a year, so decided we should try it. After using a few variations of some excel spreadsheets, Mint, EveryDollar, noes of them were working. We‚Äôve been using YNAB now for less than 2 months, and because of the envelope system, we‚Äôve been able to get past our psychological hurdles and have already put $500 in our wedding budget. I would absolutely recommend this app to anyone. Being YNAB-poor makes saving so much easier!
title: YNAB is the only budgeting tool that works for us.

developerResponse: {'id': 41183847, 'body': 'Wow, thanks for your review! I love that YNAB supports the approach you already had for spending and saving. üòä \\- Aubrey @ YNAB', 'modified': '2024-01-09T17:22:13Z'}
review:
Like so many other users, I found myself suddenly in a budgetless void recently. What to switch to? I had tried YNAB many years ago before finally settling on mint. At the time, YNAB was very young and lacking features. I recalled liking the idea, though, so‚Ä¶ sure, i‚Äôll give them another try.

With Mint, I always rolled my budgets over from one month to the next and tried to create a buffer, but I had trouble when I needed to move money from one budget ‚Äúenvelope‚Äù to another due to unexpected expenses. When I started using YNAB, the interface was beyond familiar - it was what I had been trying to do all along, badly, with Mint. 

I also hated using a free budgeting app - I know that companies have to get money from SOMEWHERE to pay their workers, and if I‚Äôm not the customer, then I‚Äôm the product. That‚Äôs a little scary in a finance app. So I‚Äôm not at all sorry to pay for a good budgeting app - as long as it‚Äôs a good one. YNAB is.

Thanks Mint for ceasing to exist and forcing me to find something better suited to my needs!
title: The app I didn‚Äôt realize I was trying to turn Mint into.

If you need a hand with any credit card mysteries, our support team would love to answer your questions at help@ynab.com. - Nicole @ YNAB', 'modified': '2023-01-31T22:04:30Z'}
review:
It took a good bit of effort for me to learn this system. I had to struggle to understand some of the procedures, especially credit cards. But, after 6 months of using YNAB, I love it.  Can‚Äôt live without it.   

We now understand where our money is going, how to effectively prepare for upcoming expenses and how to decide when and how much discretionary money we can spend. 

 If your budget is tight, you need this tool even more. It‚Äôll show exactly where your budget can‚Äôt cover some expense and why.  It‚Äôll show you how small changes in spending can make a big difference over time Good luck
title: Takes time to learn, requires discipline but it‚Äôs excellent

review: This is not one of those apps that just smushes its desktop experience onto a phone. It‚Äôs very thoughtfully designed, seems optimized for entering transactions on the go. If you‚Äôre someone who‚Äôs bank is not working well with Plaid for automation transaction imports, having the mobile app can be a life saver. Especially when paired with iPhone‚Äôs native app screen widget. The only functionality missing from mobile that you so get on desktop is the in depth reporting (you can however see your net worth on mobile, just can‚Äôt filter on it), but I think that‚Äôs entirely appropriate considering what I mentioned above.
title: Exceptional mobile user experience

review:
I don't often write reviews, and when I do, it is only because I have used them at least over a year. I have used YNAB for several years now since YNAB 4 for desktop, and it is an excellent budget app. The sync between devices is excellent, as well as the sync with my three banks and 7 accounts. The app nicely and relativity quickly imports all my bank transactions, and is quick and easy to approve each one. YNAB has only improved over the years. The app is MUCH better than it was with YNAB 4! I no longer have any complaints as I did with the previous app. The desktop app is no longer absolutely necessary, but I do recommend it highly. 
Well done YNAB, keep improving.
title: Excellent budget app

review:
YNAB is the best budgeting app out there, allowing me to responsibly manage my money, maintain savings, set goals, and responsibly use credit, gaming the system and using the rewards in a way where I never pay any interest.

My only complaint is that if there is any overspending in a month when it transitions to the next one, there is no alert or anything, and money is missing from my credit card payment category. In addition, if I‚Äôve budgeted next month and it turns out I overbudgeted this month, it doesn‚Äôt complain until I look at next month‚Äôs budget. Budgeting inconsistencies like overspending and over budgeting are usually accidental and should be prominent and obvious, not hidden.
title: Best budgeting app out there

review: I like this app. I‚Äôve tried hundreds of budgeting apps to help my husband & I communicate budget. I used to manage this on my own but it‚Äôs become a challenge to focus on with 2 kids. So for my husbands growing business we recently found him & accountant to take that load off of me. But between working & raising my kids I still needed something to help me manage a personal budget on a regular basis but that would also allow me to free up a little time to focus on shopping or the kids. My only suggestion is to make the app have the ability to share amount 2 people or more. It would be a great deal if help if I set this up & shared it with him so that all he had to do was look at the same budget that I use & know how much he can spend.
title: Suggestion

review: I won't say the process is exclusive to YNAB, as it isn't. But with the support they offer and the auto import features to ensure you stay on top of your budget, you'll never have to wonder where you stand financially. Using this app for the past 2 years has changed my life and and money habits for the better. The cost is worth it. If you're on the fence, try the free trial. If you diligently save and work to change your spending habits, you'll more than save enough over the first couple of months to cover the cost. The desktop app is nice, but I almost exclusively use the mobile app as I can instantaneously enter any purchase I make and know my budget is accurate at all times.
title: Life Changer

review: This app has changed our life for the better. My husband and I are in our 40s and empty nesters. We have always lived paycheck to paycheck. We wanted to change our ways and to think about our future. We have had YNAB for 30 days and feel good about our money situation for the first time ever. We no longer worry about our bank balance but just check our budget amounts before spending. We are actually funding next month categories and Christmas at the same time. Highly recommend for those that are sick and tired of living paycheck to paycheck. Plus their support system answers questions quickly and knowledgeable. They help you get your budget off the ground!
title: Life changing!

developerResponse: {'id': 35025385, 'body': "Thank you for sharing your experience with YNAB! ‚ù§Ô∏è  What a journey. So excited for you and your family to realize even more financial dreams in the coming years. We'll have your back! - Dela@YNAB ", 'modified': '2023-02-23T02:31:45Z'}
review:
I‚Äôm now 6 years in and still worth every penny. I also now use it to manage finances for my wife‚Äôs small business and our rental property, all under the one account.

***
I‚Äôve been using YNAB for just over two years and can easily say it has changed my life. I had been using Mint for 8 years, but never felt it gave me a solid picture of how my account balances were allocated for future expenses. When my wife and I started talking about a second child and a new house, I realized I needed a much better tool to understand my cash flow throughout the year. I stumbled upon YNAB, and have been among the choir singing it‚Äôs praises ever since.
title: Life changing

review:
I love YNAB, it has helped me get a grip of my finances. I downloaded the app with the hopes of being able to carry my budget with me. The app itself is smooth and functions as intended. However, the desktop format is still more comfortable and insightful. 

The mobile version fonts, sizes, etc. takes up too much space on a small screen which makes it really hard to get an overall picture of my finances. Im not sure what to do: maybe shrink the size of categories, show more big-picture reports, make a see compact budget view? But overall its not quite as intuitive to use solely mobile so I hope YNAB team comes up with some more redesigning and research!
title: Great app, but not easy to use

review:
I can‚Äôt remember how many years I‚Äôve had this app but I loved it since day 1. It forces me to place my money in the appropriate categories. It helps me save money by not knowing how much money I actually have but rather how much I have to spend on the thing that I want. If I have it great, if I don‚Äôt then I‚Äôll try again on the next check. Or I can simply set a goal and feel ecstatic once I reach it.

My only dislike is the price went up on me after all of my years of loyalty. I actually downloaded another app to try out. I‚Äôll probably keep this one though once I‚Äôm no longer upset with them and I‚Äôve regained my emotional intelligence. ü§£üòÖüòÇ
title: Great App

review: I‚Äôm sure most people say these things, but YNAB was a literal life changer for my family and I. When I first started out, I didn‚Äôt get it, didn‚Äôt want to look too closely at my finances, and was a little nervous. When I finally worked up the courage to make YNAB work, I couldn‚Äôt believe why I waited so long, I ‚Äòfound‚Äô $1000 in our bank account! I had been randomly trying to save for future things (true expenses in YNAB lingo) but with the clarity of the app I saw I had arbitrarily moved money around from one account to the next with no clear rule book. I‚Äôm trying to get my friends and family on board so we‚Äôll see how wide the YNAB fam can get!
title: YNAB changed our life

review: I heavily rely on this app to manage our budget and savings plan, for which it is five stars-useful. However, I think the account balance syncing feature is not as useful; I have a checking account with a regional bank, and the app would only import some transactions. This was twice as much work for me to review what imported and did not, versus manually inputting all expenditures. If you are operating on a tight budget, or trying to review/reduce spending habits I think this app is really great because you can manually check in every time you pay for something. If you‚Äôre just looking for an auto-pilot budget option, it‚Äôs more of a three-star app due to the syncing issues.
title: Great Concept

review:
I just texted my partner ‚ÄúOmg budgeting is so fun! Who knew anyone would ever say something like that?!‚Äù
Been 2 weeks on YNAB and I am Loving it!! If you actually watch the tutorials it is a piece of cake! I pressed the wrong button and messed something up and customer service responded within seconds to help!
Highly, highly recommended! I used to use Mint which was good for looking at all my accounts at once, but YNAB gives you actual control over your money and the power to make better decisions. With mint I would look at my total balances but didn‚Äôt really know what that money was supposed to be for and had to keep track of things mentally which is exhausting and stressful.
title: Budgeting is fun now!

review:
I‚Äôve used a lot of different ways to budget over the years; from paper to spreadsheet to accounting software. YNAB is the perfect budgeting software to give me all I need. It allows me to visualize what I really have left to spend. It enables me to save for future expenses, while also understanding my past spending habits. 

I love the interface on the app and on my laptop. Both are easy to use. When updates come out they actually feel intentional and helpful for the users. 

I could go on and on about how much I love YNAB, but simply put it enables me to manage my money well and has always been worth the money I spend to have it.
title: Super Helpful!

review: I can‚Äôt recommend YNAB enough. In a couple months, I‚Äôve completely transformed my relationship with my money. I now have a plan to get out of debt (in about 18 months) and I‚Äôm saving money, too, which I‚Äôve never been great at. The key is the clarity and empowerment you get from YNAB. Now I think: ‚ÄúDo I really want those decorations for my apartment if it means I‚Äôll have to dip into my savings?‚Äù And I‚Äôm saving to launch a business, which is super important to me. So I wait to buy the decorations next month, and I‚Äôm STILL on track with my savings! I can do it all, just not all at once. THAT‚ÄôS the clarity of YNAB. It‚Äôll change your life. üôåüèΩ
title: Transformed my relationship with my money

review: I don‚Äôt have a problem with people making money. I pay for other apps that I find useful. What bothers me is, I was one of the first, bought the software that was a one-time purchase, trusted them when it went to an app on your phone for a $5/month service. When they first announced the change, they promised those who already had a subscription would be ‚Äúgrandfathered‚Äù in for $60/year for the rest of the time we stayed with YNAB (for life - if it lasted). Now they have taken away the perk of being one for the first, and the only reason I can see them not allowing those who were once grandfathered in at the original price is greed. It was good while it lasted. No more. I have one month to figure out where I‚Äôm going next (my entire extended family is leaving as well - the ones to whom I told ALL about it years ago.) Adios YNAB.
title: Loved it‚Ä¶. Until the GREED

review:
I use this app daily to track the lack of money I have. This app shows me to settle down with my wants and just chill. 

I only have good things to say about YNAB. I love this app so much I‚Äôm even looking to see if I can work for this company. My love of budgeting has definitely satisfied my need by this app. I recommend this to anyone and everyone. So if you‚Äôre reading this, I recommend it, learn it and you‚Äôll soon love it too. Once you love this app, it‚Äôll change your life for the better. I know you don‚Äôt know me, so why trust me right? Well reader of this review, read other reviews and I bet they said more good things about this app than me.
title: Best Budgeting App

review:
We started using YNAB for our family budget back in 2015. We were able to pay off debt, stop living paycheck to paycheck, save for big expenses, and finally see where we were spending our money. YNAB has continued to improve. From the desktop software, to the cloud based web app, and finally this amazing app update. There have been hiccups and delays with the capabilities of the iPhone app, but it's finally gotten to a place that I can do 100% of our budgeting from my phone. 

This app, the YNAB company, the company founder, the support and classes, everything is just phenomenal and only continues to get better. I'm excited to see what they have in store next!
title: YNAB continues to get better!

review: I USED to love YNAB for the 2 years I had been using it. That is before YNAB changed something about their interface or the way they connect with our banks. One of my bank accounts has not linked with YNAB since August and I am paying for this app every year. I have received an email from YNAB stating they know the link is no longer working for my bank, for anyone who banks there, and YNAB has admitted that it is on YNAB's end that the problem lies. Such a waste of time and money now, as I previously reconciled my accounts every morning on my cell phone, and now whenever I can do it on a computer I have to import the data, then reconcile, and it is a PAIN!! And it's hard for me to remember all my spendings and split categories for transactions so I spend so much more time completing something that used to be a breeze. Looking into other apps...
title: Doesn't link account anymore

review: The app and its associated twist on envelope budgeting has been a great way for both my girlfriend and I to get a handle on our expenses. That being said, I find myself wondering when the developers will add more reporting and graphing functionality to at least the iPad version of the software. I am able to enter/verify expenses and examine my budget more easily than any other budgeting app I‚Äôve seen for the iOS ecosystem, but find myself chained to a desk when I actually want to examine where my spending has been going in any comprehensive manner. Seems like it could be a small tweak that would add quite a bit to the user experience now that we are no longer chained to a Dropbox ecosystem.
title: Great app for looking forward, not so much for examining the past

review: Foe the longest time I would live bill to bill, hoping there was enough money in my checking to pay the bills, and would transfer from savings when there wasn‚Äôt. Then I would penny pinch the next month or two. And would repeat that cycle.   Is that I‚Äôve budgeted every dollar, I can regularly check in to see if there is enough money in the budget (instead of the checking account) which after about a year using YNAB aged my money by a few months and it is growing from there, almost at six months now. It feels sooo much better to be on top of my money instead of the other way around.
title: I‚Äôm on top now

review: I have had this app since 2019. I have loved this app. It's everything I need and has helped me stay on top of my budget and get further in our finances. Recently, the app has not been able to connect to my bank since July 2020 and I have done what the app has suggested to help reconnect, but it seems like their suggestions don't do anything. Others using this app have reviewed the connection issue a problem as well. I feel like this is an app problem or bank connection. It would be nice if the app company would give their users a heads up and what they're doing to fix it. Because I feel like we're getting ignored, yet I've paid money for this app which helps fund your company. If this persists, this app is not worth the $80/year.
title: Best budgeting system but terrible connection issues

review: Been using YNAB for 4yrs, since YNAB 4. Both this app and the software are great. The sync is instant which is the most important thing while using the app so that my spouse or I know what our budget is while we‚Äôre out and about. I‚Äôve tried all to other apps out there, none of them are perfect but YNAB comes the closest and their support of the software and budgeting gives you confidence that they‚Äôll be around to continue supporting and developing the app. Recently the support for the app has been great the last few releases have brought some really nice updates for usability, especially the contextual menu support...game changing! Way to go guys keep up the good work.
title: Best budgeting App/Software out there

review: YNAB has completely transformed how we spend and save our money. Not only is the app incredibly easy to use but it‚Äôs so easy to see where we‚Äôre overspending, how close we are to our spending goals, and also helps us keep track of our accounts without switching apps. We cannot say enough about YNAB. For the first time I feel like we have completely control of our finances. The $50 a year we spend for it is nothing compared to the amount we have saved! This is the best money you‚Äôll ever spend especially if you‚Äôre having trouble keeping track of your finances. Plus, you get the first 30 days free! Try it, you won‚Äôt regret it!
title: Totally Revolutionized Our Finances

review: YNAB has been indispensable in our day-to-day spending. We continue to see great value from an always up-to-date, high-level view of our finances. Being able to clearly see where our money is going and how much we are able to save each month is the true power of this system. With the new, web-based YNAB, budgeting has gotten even easier with direct import, goals, and easy category-to-category transfers. I was not on board with the subscription model at first, but seeing what they have been able to do with this product along with the constant stream of updates and bug fixes, I would say they have won me over.
title: Indispensable Budgeting Tool!

developerResponse: {'id': 5363495, 'body': "Hey there, newking83! So, relying only on imported transactions will definitely keep your budget in the past.  We recommend that you enter transactions on the go -- when you get paid, enter that transaction yourself.  Don't worry - when the bank syncs, those transactions will match up! This way you can budget on payday!  If  you want any other help, please reach out at help@ynab.com -- we can make sure you're all set!", 'modified': '2018-10-04T21:22:00Z'}
review: I think the premise behind YNAB is great and I was eager to try it out. My problem with the app is that it just takes way too long to update. I got paid last Thursday and was excited to start the new month with a new budget. But my paycheck didn‚Äôt show on the app until Saturday, almost a full 48 hours after I actually got paid. The app also wants you to allocate EVERY dollar that shows, including income, which can be difficult to figure out. I clearly classified something wrong because the amount remaining the be budgeted was way off so I ‚Äústarted fresh‚Äù with a new budget. I did that Saturday and as of Tuesday at 5pm, my accounts and transactions still have not updated üò°. I really want to love this app and use it, but it‚Äôs got to update more frequently in order for it to actually be effective. It doesn‚Äôt help to create a budget AFTER you‚Äôve already paid your bills üòï
title: Takes Way Too Long to Update

developerResponse: {'id': 36824119, 'body': "What a fabulous review, we couldn't have said it any better ourselves! Congratulations on paying off debt and reaching those financial goals. We're thrilled to have played a part. If you haven't already, consider sharing the request for additional reports on the mobile app here: https://youneedabudget.typeform.com/to/Pt6cek. \\- Jill@YNAB", 'modified': '2023-05-30T16:59:15Z'}
review: I have been using the mobile and desktop versions of YNAB for 2.5 years. Since then, I have paid off debt, saved money for goals, and use a credit card with clarity. None of those things were true before YNAB. I often find myself starring at my budget and watch my financial worries scatter like confetti while doing a reconciliation dance. While both the desktop and mobile versions are fantastic, I would like to see more reports on mobile. I have recently used the YNAB Together feature to help manage the finances of my parents and work towards paying off their debt. I may not be a real accountant, but I am on YNAB.
title: Financial Serenity

developerResponse: {'id': 47308258, 'body': "Ack, that shouldn't be happening! Can you send us a note at help@ynab.com so we can further diagnose what's causing that lag time/glitchiness? Looking forward to hearing from you!", 'modified': '2024-10-09T01:57:01Z'}
review: Overall, the app and philosophy is great, but the recent update that changed the way you transfer money between categories has cause the app to have extreme lag when moving money around. I just counted an 18 (yes, EIGHTEEN) second lag while trying to save a transfer of money from one category to another. If you press the send/save/confirm button (whatever it is) multiple times during this lag, it will record the move however many times you tap the button, causing faulty and glitchy and unwanted transfers to appear. For the amount of money we spend annually subscribing to this app, we should be able to expect that any feature modification has been fully tested and free of any heavy lag or glitches.
title: Glitchy update

developerResponse: {'id': 36988774, 'body': "Thanks for taking the time to leave us this feedback. We're always working to improve YNAB and provide top notch support and resources, so it's helpful to hear where users get stuck.
