We'd love to help you get everything sorted out with the credit card transactions that are giving you trouble! Please reach out to us at help@ynab.com. \\- Jill@YNAB", 'modified': '2023-06-07T19:01:34Z'}
review:
There‚Äôs a lot to like about this app. The overall categorization idea and monthly alottment work pretty well and do help you better manage your money.
Unfortunately, the way the app tracks credit card spending and alternate savings accounts is just a mess and requires viewing hours of tutorials as well as trial and error. It always seems to double count transfers leaving you with an extra transaction that you have to rectify to get the notification to go away. 

A price like $15/month would be reasonable if it worked a little bit smoother and didn‚Äôt require so many references to their tutorial videos, but as it stands it‚Äôs not worth it. The app will make you wish you had just made an excel sheet
title: Okay, but full of unintuive features

review:
I used to adore this app. Any time the topic of personal finance came up and talk about how great YNAB was. 

But then they removed the feature that lets you use the previous month‚Äôs budget for the current month from the mobile app. This was a critical feature for me and I‚Äôm still baffled about why they removed it. It is extremely frustrating to attempt to work around it or have to log in to the web app to do this one task.

I still use the app, and the other features are fantastic, but if they remove this feature from the web app as well, I‚Äôll probably move in to something else.
title: Removed a key feature

developerResponse: {'id': 31209169, 'body': "Thanks for leaving a review, jmarieb! We're honored to know that you've loved YNAB for so many years. ‚ù§Ô∏è I understand your concern about the recent price change. If you have any specific questions, please do reach out to help@ynab.com! - Kathryn @ YNAB", 'modified': '2022-08-01T11:39:10Z'}
review: We‚Äôve used YNAB for several years now and LOVE IT! When we started it was $40-something dollars per year. It is now $15/mo or almost $100/year (and this is the second price change). So despite our love for how seamless this app is to work with, I am admittedly looking for another option just due to the ongoing rising cost of using it. However, for someone who doesn‚Äôt mind the cost (and risk of another increase or two), it is an AMAZING app! Easy to work with, good customer service, and super cute ‚Äúloading‚Äù phrases that always make me smile. The training videos are really good too! I just don‚Äôt trust that it won‚Äôt be $120 in another year, so transitioning elsewhere seems inevitable based on our budget for this category.
title: Love the app, but ongoing price hikes are too much

review: But I actually do enjoy YNAB! It‚Äôs not the old style ‚Äúset arbitrary limits and flagellate self when you don‚Äôt meet the goal‚Äù.  No, with YNAB you start where you are and send your current dollars where they are most needed. Over time, you will determine your financial priorities and become a financial master. There is lots of support to learn the process and the program- all with a touch of humor. Though it took a bit more time in the beginning, these days I spend 5-10 minutes a day almost every day and enjoy the feeling of being in the driver‚Äôs seat regarding my finances. YNAB itself is a marvel- feature rich, but still easy to use. Kudos to the YNAB team!
title: Never thought I would enjoy budgeting

review: You download apps for fun, travel, dating, dining, photography, etc. etc.. Yet, your greatest joy and peace of mind comes from having your daily needs met, and there is none better in the App Store or online than YNAB at helping you plan where your cash is going. It really should be one of the first apps you download and it should be at the top left corner of your home screen. This program has helped me go from trying to cover expenses every week, to living on money I made 90 days ago. It didn‚Äôt happen overnight, but with the tools and tips they provide, we got there in about a year. I highly highly recommend this app, there is seriously none better.
title: Best out there...

review: YNAB is the most effective budgeting/ planning app that I‚Äôve used. I‚Äôve tried many well known, as well as independent budgeting apps over the past several years, but they all have the fatal flaw of being retrospective. Changing my perspective to a forward looking one took some effort, but the upfront work was well worth the effort. I‚Äôm especially grateful for the ability to plan for expenses that occur annually or on an adhoc basis. This is a feature that many budgeting apps don‚Äôt support. I was reluctant to try envelope budgeting until YNAB, but they have made the experience seamless and now I look forward to meeting my financial goals.
title: Great for planning

developerResponse: {'id': 35025464, 'body': "Genuinely, thank you for sharing your story and for breaking your streak to leave a review! In a world that doesn't teach the majority of us how to have a healthy relationship with money, we're committed to free education that empowers anyone at any age to find financial peace and control. Your experience is a beacon of hope. We celebrate you! üôå - Dela@YNAB", 'modified': '2023-02-23T02:39:02Z'}
review:
I have never once in my life given a review for an application, but this one is just so amazing that I have to share. It has literally changed my life. 
Before YNAB, I had no money management plan and was embarrassingly living paycheck to paycheck. Growing up poor left me ill equipped to manage money as an adult. 
YNAB offers free online webinars which coach you on how to use to app to manage money before you‚Äôve even installed it. These classes tell you how to do many things like setting goals for any category and paying off debt. 
The app integrates with all of my banking establishments and imports are completely autonomous. I have targets set for everything I spend money on and the yellow indicator tells me where I need to assign money every month. 
Another excellent feature is the ‚Äúage of money‚Äù tool which tells you how long you‚Äôve held onto your dollars. An age of 18 days means you earned that dollar 18 days ago. It‚Äôs a great indicator of the health of your spending overall. 
I highly recommend this application to EVERYONE.
title: Life Changing

review: It took me a few weeks and watching a couple online lessons to get the hang of it, and it can be intimidating at first- but stick with it! Suddenly, it just clicked and was so easy! Now I‚Äôm two months ahead on my bills and my credit cards are paid off. I‚Äôm on pace to pay off my truck a year early and I have the most savings I‚Äôve ever had. I don‚Äôt feel like I‚Äôm even trying to save or that I‚Äôm restricting anything, I just now have a plan for every single dollar that comes in. The desktop version works more seamlessly than the iOS app, for sure, but having both is awesome. Great app! Well worth the monthly subscription.
title: Fantastic budget app with a learning curve.

review: The title isn‚Äôt an exaggeration. I started using YNAB as an early college student to budget small items and maybe 1-2 checking accounts. Here I am about 7-8 years later balancing the 19 various accounts I hold throughout my life. I‚Äôve worked on Wall Street for the last 2 years and accumulated these various accounts and also keep track of a small consulting business all through YNAB (ML Algorithm Design). There isn‚Äôt an account you can‚Äôt track if you want to put in the time and effort. Everyone wants to know ‚Äúhow to become rich.‚Äù They see you with the fancy cars and buying virtually anything you want. This. This app. This mindset. This software. This is how it all starts.
title: Best Money App Ever

developerResponse: {'id': 36351208, 'body': "Hi Joshua, thanks so much for this thoughtful review. We love hearing that YNAB has made a difference in your financial life! If you haven't already shared the feedback about an undo button on the mobile app, I would encourage you to do so here: https://youneedabudget.typeform.com/to/Pt6cek. \\- Jill@YNAB", 'modified': '2023-05-05T13:50:44Z'}
review:
Using this app to log my transactions the moment after I make them, every time, has kept me in line with my budget. Updating my budget once per week would allow me much more slack to break the rules.
     This app is simple, intuitive, and works flawlessly. The desktop version on the web does have quite a few more features, such as graphs to track your spending habits and guides to teach you how to budget better. 
     The one feature that this app really needs added is an "undo" button. The feature is on desktop, and I often find that I could really use it on here.
title: Builds Good Habits

review:
I love YNAB!  

I used Quicken for decades and never realized what I was missing. I could keep track of my money but it was always in hindsight. And when I tried to budget, it was just too complex to manage. And the fact that it required the desktop made it a huge production when I got around to reconciling my accounts. I finally gave up on it. 

And now I‚Äôve found YNAB and I‚Äôm sold!  I get a clear view of my cash flow and I‚Äôm now in a position to get some control of our spending. 

I used the web version to get started and after trying out the features, I‚Äôve loaded up all the accounts and put my dollars to work. 

Now I use the phone app to take a quick look each day and approve the transactions imported from the credit cards. I‚Äôm tracking my own spend on the fly but, to be able to get my husband‚Äôs charges loaded with a day or two is a godsend. 

I now have a much easier way to have budget discussions and work with my husband to plan our projects. 

Thank you YNAB. I certainly did need a budget and I love your tool.
title: Exactly what I was looking for

review: There‚Äôs no free/lite version and naturally they make you agree to a subscription before you even start the free trial. Not going to bother with an app that immediately tries to set up a subscription before you even get a chance to see how it works. If it‚Äôs changed so the free trial unlocks the app for the designated period, then locks up and prompts the subscription after you‚Äôve had a whole month to try it out I would likely come back and try to use it again. Setting up subscriptions before you even get a chance to see if you like it is very akin to how gyms set up to charge you automatically regardless of whether or not you‚Äôve even utilized  the service in the past three months. There‚Äôs no reason to try this app out when there are numerous other budgeting apps that don‚Äôt charge anything to try them out (EveryDollar).
title: Didn‚Äôt even bother

review:
Multiple times over the past 7 years, ive rebooted my budget approach by looking for new apps, and every time, YNAB was on the list. I just never tried it because it seemed too confusing to get started.

But here‚Äôs the thing, I would keep rebooting because other tools weren‚Äôt working. Finally, I tried YNAB and the difference is incredible.

I‚Äôm talking about going out and spending money on dining out, bars, entertainment, and feeling confident in my spending instead of dreading that I‚Äôm spending money and should be saving.  

With YNAB, because you give every dollar a job, you can feel secure that the money you spend still allows you to hit your savings goals.

It‚Äôs more than an app ‚Äî you have to learn the system and the approach. That will take some learning and some time. And it will take you at least a month to get yourself on track and experience budgeting for a month with money you‚Äôve aged, but the result is total piece of mind and the ability to stop stressing about spending money and enjoying the things that you spend it on.
title: End your woes, use YNAB

developerResponse: {'id': 29514969, 'body': "Hi JoshyKong! Thanks so much for the five-star review! You're right‚Äîwe do use a monthly cycle for budgeting, but the good news is that works really great with the YNAB Method‚Äîassigning only the money you have on hand. As long as you've got the funds, you're able to assign those dollars however you like‚Äîassign them to a weekly target or even assign them to next month's budget, if you'd like! If you'd like more tips, reach out to us at help@YNAB.com! We'd love to hear from you. üôÇ - Renae@YNAB", 'modified': '2022-05-02T15:46:54Z'}
review: YNAB is fantastic! It takes some getting used to because it is rather complex. However, once you play with it a little and get used to it, that complexity works for you and allows you to do all sorts of things with your finances. The only criticism I have is that it only allows you to budget monthly. Apps like GoodBudget give you the option to budget weekly, biweekly, semimonthly, monthly, etc. (aka whenever you get paid). While budgeting monthly is a bit of an adjustment for me, the rest of the services YNAB provides well outweigh this inconvenience. Overall, fantastic program. Totally worth the $100/year!
title: 5/5 With One Drawback

review: I used to keep track of my budget on Excel, and had 4 accounts to keep track of savings for specific categories, normal expenses, long term savings, etc. Someone recommended YNAB to us, and I‚Äôve never looked back! It is easy to budget, sync to my accounts (I used to spend hours recording every transaction to excel), and my favorite feature‚Äîit carries your remaining balance from specific categories forward to the next month. I‚Äôm now down to a checking and a money market for my emergency fund.  If you‚Äôre looking for a simple, easy to use app that your family can use to work together to make your budget work, you should definitely give YNAB a try.
title: YNAB is awesome!

review: For anyone that does not have a financial system, as well as anyone that has ever had money troubles, here is YNAB. You will be able to easily see where your money goes. If you have trouble managing money, your troubles will subside. If you already do a descent with money, you will likely find money that was not doing what you wanted it to be doing.  There is money help in the YNAB community.  Watch videos, ask questions and simple as that you will get help.  As someone that never had a budget I hit a few speed bumps along the way.  I promise you that anything that causes you difficulty in YNAB will suddenly seem like magic with only a little help from the YNAB team.
title: You need this app

review: It sounds cliche, but this application/program has changed my life. It brings so much structure and organization to a life experience that wasn‚Äôt previously there. We no longer fight over money in our house. We have no mode debt (other than a mortgage) and have a system in place for funding our lives. Every time we put something on a credit card the program moves funds from our available balance to be ready to pay our bills when they come. It is brilliant‚Äîand worth every penny. The customer support is consistently helpful and they seem to really care about helping you to succeed in having a budget and living the life.
title: YNAB is life.

developerResponse: {'id': 42442862, 'body': "Thank you so much for your kind review! It's amazing to hear that YNAB has helped you so much and that you had a great experience with our support team. Thanks for YNABing with us! \\- Natalie @ YNAB", 'modified': '2024-03-07T16:18:10Z'}
review: YNAB is soooo worth it I can‚Äôt imagine living without it! It‚Äôs so cheap for the amount of time and energy it saves and how amazing, confident, and happy it makes me feel! It‚Äôs a game changer. Everything is so excellent, thought out, and secure when it comes to the budget layout and bank account linking, tracking your progress, organizing the budget, assistance and help, and planning. I had one question early on that I messaged them about, and they responded in no time and got it fixed, all with being so kind and curtious to me! Quality staff and a quality app. This is hands down my favorite app that I have on my phone!
title: YNAB to the rescue!!

developerResponse: {'id': 40760124, 'body': "I'm glad that YNAB's philosophy and function have been a good fit for you, Prayasht! I'll be sure to pass along your feedback about mobile reporting. Thanks for the review! \\- Aubrey @ YNAB", 'modified': '2023-12-18T20:49:01Z'}
review:
Thanks YNAB for making my life better. I love financial planning with this app. It keeps me accountable and truthful about my money and how it‚Äôs being used. It‚Äôs low stress and is just fun and kinda rewarding to build up your savings in this app.

I just wish the mobile experience was better when it comes to reporting. And I do wish the design was a little more modern since it looks a bit dated when compared to other apps like Copilot or Monarch. But those apps don‚Äôt have the functionality that YNAB does which is what keeps me subscribed to YNAB‚Äôs philosophy. Keep up the great work!
title: Excellent app ‚Äì mobile app leaves more to be desired!

review: I tried using YNAB on two different occasions, and at first it was difficult for me to understand. But third time is a charm! When utilizing the webinars, videos, and asking the support team questions, you gain a better understanding. I finally feel as though I‚Äôm taking control over my money, and not the other way around. The app and website are so user friendly. I was able to add my accounts, and it didn‚Äôt take forever for them to connect. I highly recommend this app to anyone who needs a little guidance on how to manage their money. It will change the way you view and spend money forever. Top notch, five stars, A++ for YNAB!
title: YNAB: Truly the best budgeting app!

review: I have been a religious YNAB user for nearly a decade, and it changed my life financially. YNAB4 was easy for a budget-hater to use, and forced me to evaluate every purchase before I made it.  I resisted the ‚Äúnew‚Äù YNAB because it heavily pushes linking your accounts, and I thought that was be less helpful.  I underestimated just how bad it would be.  There are automatic features in the new version that are extremely unintuitive, it is incredibly slow and the ability to carry over budget deficits from month to month is gone.  The linked account feature is inconsistent at best.  I have unlinked and relinked my accounts several times, as the help desk recommended, so now I have duplicate entries and can‚Äôt balance the account balances.  I‚Äôm so disappointed, but I‚Äôm looking for a new app.  I simply don‚Äôt have the time to fight with this thing every day when I try to enter or approve transactions.
title: From great to garbage...

review:
I rarely write reviews. Honestly, this is the first in over a year or so. I love how this app works, but it is far from perfect. There are a couple of designs I think they should implement from the desktop version and vice-versa (e.g., making the option on the desktop to consolidate an error in your amount available on your mobile app). A lot of it is merely some nitpicky things.

The look of the app, the customer service,  the resources the app offers to educate yourself on the program and the stress relief of knowing my spending is astronomical and are worth its cost. It also can be challenging to catch on and learn the program initially, but once you understand how everything works, you'll never regret it.
title: #1 budgeting app/desktop

review:
It is a great tool to help you control your expense. I like the premise of ‚ÄúYou don‚Äôt spend money that you don‚Äôt have‚Äù. Never spend money that you think you will receive. In this time, there‚Äôs no such thing as the assurance that you are going to get your next paycheck. 

On the contrary, the app encourages saving and working around goals. I love the fact that it is available EVERYWHERE, Mac, iPad, iPhone and even my Apple Watch! The tough part was getting my wife to use it but after three months, she‚Äôs on board!

The best investment I‚Äôve done in a subscription this year! I‚Äôve saved more money than the cost of the subscription.
title: It takes a bit to learn, but then‚Ä¶

review:
2-stars for bad layout of chat window:
We are pretty new to YNAB and want this to work, consequently we been working with Support and they‚Äôve been great. HOWEVER-  the chat window covers up the amounts and it is not movable around the screen. We‚Äôve been on YNAB for three months and working with support in chat and it is so absolutely annoying that we can‚Äôt ask a question about using YNAB and look at the column of numbers at the same time! In order to see my outflow an inflow, I have to close out the chat window and can‚Äôt refer to what they just said to do. How complicated is it to make that chat window something we can drag off to the side?
on another note: there is an obnoxious ‚Äú?‚Äù when clicking ‚Äúsave‚Äù transactions in the lower right column. It often blocks the save button.
Thanks for listening!
title: Poor UX on Support window (desktop)

developerResponse: {'id': 35024324, 'body': "So glad you've been digging the web app and our support team! Thanks for the review. If you're up for it, I know our design team would love to hear from you about the reports and other updates you'd like to see on mobile! You can send a feature request at https://support.ynab.com/en_us/feedback-and-feature-requests-an-overview-rJgD33fAq - Dela@YNAB", 'modified': '2023-02-23T01:03:15Z'}
review: Ynab is truly life changing, but not ideal for mobile-only users: the power truly is via desktop. Excellent reporting, visualization, etc., providing insight with extensive utility to change one‚Äôs relationship with money and perspective. However, Users have been asking for mobile app to include basic reporting, yet still only age of money (unless metric) and NW on mobile. Th software is great: aligning spending with values & priorities. Mobile is good for entering transactions on the go, but that‚Äôs pretty much the extent. Their customer service is top notch; they‚Äôll make you custom videos to problem solve and talk you through it by name, above and beyond truly!
title: Life changing software, app has room to grow

review: The highlight of my morning is sitting with my coffee and tweaking my budget.... I‚Äôve been a budget ‚Äúnerd‚Äù for 20+ years and this is by far the best program I‚Äôve used.  Very Dave Ramsey-compatible if that‚Äôs your thing, but their teaching philosophy is much less dogmatic and more enjoyable to digest; the videos and podcasts and such are fun and the customer service is superb!  Whenever I‚Äôve had a question I get a human within 24 hours if not sooner.  And they have a good sense of humor..... their website was down for a few minutes and they sent a playlist to listen to with budgeting parodies of popular songs üòúüòú join the YNAB family; you wont regret it!!!!
title: Changed my life!

review:
For the first time in my life I‚Äôm not storing all of my financial planning in my head. For the first time in my life, I have money saved not just save, but for specific, important things like birthdays, home and auto expenses. For the first time in my life I‚Äôm not constantly worried if our paycheck will make it to the next one. Thank you YNAB. A little confusing up front but the webinars are really helpful in learning the details. I see my cash so differently now. This is well worth the investment. 

Update: YNAB has kept our financial stress to a very low level during the COVID-19 situation. If you‚Äôre not convinced it works yet, ask yourself, we‚Äôre you financially prepared for a pandemic?
title: Y you need YNAB

review:
Love using YNAB but the ‚ÄúReports‚Äù feature is really lame. The only printable output I can get is a grossly formatted .csv file?! Really? Would it be that hard to allow a list filtered for the information I want to see?

Also, don‚Äôt understand why you won‚Äôt just allow a ‚ÄúRunning Total‚Äù like the old YNAB used to. I understand the philosophy of ‚Äúthe money I have now,‚Äù but in the real world, there is a need to project where I‚Äôll be by the time the next paycheck rolls in. Some of us get paid irregular amounts at irregular intervals. 

I have seen BOTH these issues brought up on forums and still there is no response. Both seem like ridiculously easy things to offer.
title: Reports Are Awful

review:
Using this for more than a week will make you feel in control of your finances. Heard about the service through Reddit. I had previously used mint and paper tracking but that never made me less stressed. You should know during the free trial period whether or not this is worth the money for you. Definitely worth a try!

The app itself needs some work - but anything you are having trouble with on the app in terms of organizing things can be done on a desktop browser, so it‚Äôs not actually that bad. (Moving stuff around categories wise is my problem).
title: The app interface could use some work but your stress level will go down

review:
I really want to like YNAB, but the learning curve is just too large. My husband is a software engineer, and I have an MA‚Äîso we both know how to do our due diligence and look up what we don‚Äôt understand‚Äîbut there are times when we both go, ‚Äúwait, how does that work again?‚Äù ‚ÄúHow do we do that again??‚Äù ‚ÄúWhy doesn‚Äôt this work??‚Äù I hate spending so much of my time trying to explain and research how the app works vs it just working.

YNAB is such a great idea, but it sort of goes out of it‚Äôs way to be difficult for the sake of being different‚Äîwhich means they have all manner of budgeting classes built into their system. None of which I can realistically get my partner to feel excited about.

The automatic transactions are the best and least-faulty out of many of the other budgeting apps out there‚Äîbetter then Mint etc. But my transactions seem to really confuse the app, since my husband and I move money around our accounts frequently. Next thing you know, the entire budget is broken and I have no idea how to fix it! Or it will say that we‚Äôve overspent because we moved money into a different savings account, when really, our money never went anywhere!

For $83...let‚Äôs just say I wish Northwestern hadn‚Äôt bought out Learnvest and then run them into the ground.
title: I miss LearnVest

developerResponse: {'id': 42693466, 'body': "Thanks for your review! You make a great point about YNAB's similarity to the envelope method, and how much easier it is to keep track of how you want to spend your money. We appreciate you sharing from your experience! \\- Aubrey @ YNAB", 'modified': '2024-03-19T19:58:44Z'}
review: I cant say enough good about this APP! I tell everyone about YNAB. Ive always wanted to do the envelope method of spending but going to the bank and getting cash and figuring out how much to leave in the bank for bills was daunting.  This makes it so simple. You tell it how much you need for each category and date,  then when you get paid it will sort it out for you. I actually have money in the bank because I know how much is in each category and if I overspend I have to figure out where I going to get it. So I‚Äôm much more careful with impulse spending.  Thank you YNAB for making this app so easy.
title: I Have Money?

developerResponse: {'id': 45828923, 'body': "HI there! Thanks for sharing your experience! The location of some items/ tools is different in the mobile app in order to take advantage of the differences between large and small screens! If you'd like to chat about how to find your favorite YNAB features in the mobile app send us a message to help@ynab.com! ~Phil@YNAB", 'modified': '2024-08-07T19:18:17Z'}
review:
My laptop died somewhat recently and I‚Äôve been trying to maintain everything in YNAB strictly out of the app rather than the web based version. 
In my experience, the app is completely different from the web version. The way you allocate money to your different budgets and the way to see goals is not intuitive and difficult to find. The web based version is far superior and the only good way to use this platform.
The app is useful to quickly reference how much you have left in a budget on the go and maybe creating transactions manually in a pinch. But forget trying to do all of your budgeting from here. I‚Äôll be doing my budgeting on my work computer until I‚Äôve saved up enough to replace my broken laptop.
title: Useful for referencing budget balances only

review:
This app changed my life. I come from a poor family where no one knew money management and debt was simply part of it. YNAB and their money management program/course was one of the tools that helped me climb out of the poverty trap. 

However, I find it difficult to recommend this app for those who find themselves in similar position‚Äî the cost has doubled since I first started using YNAB, and a hundred dollar annual subscription is difficult to justify when you have 20,000 in credit card debt and barely making 32k a year. 

If you‚Äôre one of the rich-poor; that is, you‚Äôre making well above the median us income, and 100 dollars is a manageable expense because you‚Äôre not actually poor and just can‚Äôt manage your money, this app is great. It will help you get a handle on your Cashflow and rethink how you think about money.

If you don‚Äôt fall into that category, please use one of the many other more affordable budgeting apps. YNAB is great but there are plenty of other budgeting apps out there that use just as valid methodologies with a lower annual fee.
title: Budgeting for the well off who can‚Äôt manage money

review:
I genuinely appreciate the philosophy of YNAB, and the idea of Only spending what you have. I.e. giving your money a ‚Äújob‚Äù.

After nearly 35 years of professional career, I‚Äôm a little bit ahead financially and also have been fortunate to have steady recurring paychecks and, being in sales, big chunks of money that come in quarterly.

As such I find this program extremely difficult to use because you can‚Äôt look out beyond the next two weeks. 

What would really make this app  valuable , is applying a little bit of, readily available, artificial intelligence to help predict when things were coming due in a ‚Äúcash flow calendar‚Äù that helps me so I‚Äôll see what is coming up on the horizon - to manage cash flow.

I‚Äôm dumbfounded as to why all the budgeting apps on the market today have not incorporated this very usable feature.

I want my tools to tell me, and show me, not force me to spend endless hours correcting category errors and putting things into the right buckets -which is what I find myself doing with this program. I spend more time making adjustments and fixing errors than I do analyzing my spending.
title: Not so great for people in good financial health and regular paychecks

review: I am the worst at budgeting. Often it feels like I‚Äôm just tracking spending. But thisTool not only helps me stay on track it helps me get back on track if I wander off too far. The best part is all the support you can get and all the ways that people use it to fit their needs. I can plan for annual items and subscription services and time everything correctly to my paycheck. I can use the tool on my iPad, computer, and phone I enter data as I leave the drive-thru...It‚Äôs just really easy, but super smart too! I‚Äôve never stayed with a tool this long that have to do with money.
title: Great for terrible budgeters

review:
The app is great and helps me keep a budget but there are two things I wish they‚Äôd fix. 

1) sometimes you spend money and don‚Äôt know what you spent or where. You just notice a difference between your checking account and what YNAB says you should have. The only way to fix this is to subtract the difference and then create a fake charge in order to balance the difference out. If you just adjust what‚Äôs in your bank account to match your YNAB account, you will be missing money you don‚Äôt even know about until you count it all

2) the synchronizing does not work and has never worked. Every charge must be manually entered. Make a habit it you fall behind
title: Great app. Could be some improvements

review: I was so hesitant to spend money on a budgeting app. I had already tried and failed to keep up with other apps, like mint. YNAB had a 30 day trial and I was hooked. It is quite the learning curve at first, but once everything is set up and you have your head wrapped around it, it is so easy! I never thought I was ‚Äòbad‚Äô with money, but 100% had no idea where it went every month. When I started in January 2019 my net worth (a report they give you on the app) was -$19k (thanks college). Now, November 2020, my net worth is $10k. I tell everyone that will listen how great this app is. It is amazing. So worth the money. Just stick with it through the learning curve!
title: 100% worth the money!

review: It takes about 30m-1h of tutorial reading or watching for this type of budgeting to click, but once it does, it's lifechanging. It's basically like opening a checking or savings account for every individual type of purchase or savings goal you have in your life. It helps you stay honest and plan where your money is going. It's seems like a high price at first for the subscription, but the cost ends up being low since it will help you get your finances in order - possibly for the first time ever. Makes playing the credit card cashback rewards game very simple, and you'll still pay them off all in time.
title: Best budgeting method

review:
It took me a year to get around to buying this app and now I don‚Äôt know why I waited so long. I am recently divorced and money will be much tighter for the next few years. Knowing that I have enough to cover my monthly expenses at a glance is so reassuring 

Yes, YNAB helps you allocate money towards things like mortgage and groceries. It‚Äôs more than that, though. You really start to ignore the balance in your checking account and think about finances differently. The way it handles your credit card transactions is fantastic once you get up the curve.

The iPhone app has improved even in the six months I‚Äôve used it. The most recent improvement I‚Äôve noticed is an easier workflow for single or split transactions. The only time I use the web site is when I allocate for the month. Everything else is done on the phone. I have so much more visibility into all my transactions and it only takes a few seconds a day. It‚Äôs almost fun.

The don‚Äôt ask for a credit card until AFTER the trial, so it‚Äôs worth giving it a try
title: So much more peace of mind

review:
I was blessed with parents who taught me the importance of money and staying out of debt (where possible). So YNAB‚Äôs principals are how I‚Äôve lived my adult life....no big change for me.

 However, finally having a great system that helps me see where I spend, and quickly adjust my budget, is fantastic.  It has shown me areas that I fritter money away needlessly (like eating out....and really? That‚Äôs how much I spend on coffee? I can do better). It helps me see that my inbound money is finite, and adjust my behavior to ensure I‚Äôm using my money on the things I truly value.

As an accountant, I realize that my passion for having all the data I want on my spending may exceed the normal person‚Äôs......but really, it‚Äôs a great tool. I love that I can log spending and view quick reports on my phone, but also spend time on my computer dreaming up the many ways I can make my money work better for me. (Including downloading spending data back into excel.......sometimes I just really want the raw data so I can pivot data to my hearts desire :)

Happy budgeting!
title: In Budget Love

review:
YNAB is an excellent idea and used to have an excellent product and good customer service. 

However, over the spring/ summer of 2020 they had a change in the server that linked the accounts to YNAB, and it basically killed the utility of the product.  I‚Äôve reached out a multitude of times, with radio silence from YNAB since June on the issues. 

When the accounts do randomly link, half of the debits enter as withdrawals and vice-versa. It‚Äôs a mess. And takes a half-hour to correct, if you‚Äôre lucky. 

If you want to manually  enter everything, the its still great, but not worth the $84/ year.  There are other products that can do that. 

It‚Äôs really a shame, they had a great product prior to that. And it‚Äôs still a great concept. If they‚Äôd have the customer service to work through this mess, they might keep their loyal base, too. But I don‚Äôt know how many people are going to keep paying $84/ year for a financial app that causes headaches.
title: Used to be good, but poor server recently and poor customer service

review: We have been using this app for about a year now. It is just ok. I wish generally there were more options with the service. I have been keeping a ‚Äòtraditional‚Äô budget for years and I am good at it. It would be nice if I could set it up to do more planning vs. what feels like budgeting in the moment. It would also be nice if there was a planning section. We budget specific amounts for trips and I still need to set up an Excel spreadsheet for that. I‚Äôd love it to all be in one place! I also wish negative amounts would carry over from one month to another. My biggest struggle with the app, though, is that there isn‚Äôt a calculator. Almost every time I use the app I am forced to switch out of it and back multiple times. For the money I am still not sure it is worth it.
title: Ok

review:
I have been a customer for 4+ years in one of the number one features as the search capability to find transactions especially when you get refunds to know what category to put the money back into to keep everything straight as well as other use cases where finding previous transactions while on the run and not near a computer. The reason why I say not near your computer is because currently searching is only supported in the web. 

Other than this the application it‚Äôs great and I would truly recommend to anyone looking for a financial management solutions or budget management to be more specific.
title: Great application and service but lacking search capabilities in mobile app

review:
I am a longtime YNAB user - way back to the original desktop software.  I liked it so much, I have recommended it to numerous people, many of whom started using YNAB.  Over the years, I have spent a fair amount of money using this product and was happy to do so.  In other words, I was a happy and loyal customer.

BUT‚Ä¶I just found out that my monthly subscription fee is going to more than double beginning next month.  No explanations were provided, just a ‚Äúsorry we have to raise our prices‚Äù.  What????  Where‚Äôs the loyalty to long-time customers?  And why does it suddenly need to become so expensive?  

Sorry YNAB, you just lost a loyal customer.  There are a number of other options these days that basically do the same thing.  I found one at the same price range I had been paying and have moved on.
title: Fantastic but expensive

review:
YNAB helped me to take control of my money so that it no longer slips ‚Äúthrough my fingers.‚Äù  I was able to break some old and useless spending habits and put my money where it should be.  Instead of living in the moment, I can forecast ahead and be prepared for spending that I know is coming. Good-bye Denial!  Overall, it is great for helping to understand the value of a nickel.  

The App on my IPhone is my favorite app!  It works well and is responsive.  I manually input my transactions because that forces me to look at my categories and how much I have.  Keeps my spending in control and brings a sense of peace.
title: Take control

review: I have been using YNAB for over 2 years after several years with other budgeting apps. This is the best, most user friendly service you will find. It has everything you want a budgeting app to have. Over the course of two years it has gotten better and easier through improvements made by YNAB. They are always responding to user feedback with improved features. I honestly love it. The free interactive webinars teach you everything you need to be able to make the most of YNAB. We have saved so much money and energy and we know where every single cent we spend goes. I can‚Äôt recommend it enough!
title: Best budgeting app you can find

developerResponse: {'id': 46912363, 'body': "Thanks for sharing your thoughts as a financial planner and a YNABer! We're proud that we don't sell ads or personal data‚Äîand that YNAB has changed the money game for so many folks. üôå ~ Lauren @ YNAB", 'modified': '2024-09-23T03:54:04Z'}
review: I do not typically write reviews or pay for apps but this is one app that is worth every penny. Actually value-add - seems to be a program built by someone trying to solve a real need versus a marketing gimmick. No ads, no annoying reminders to write a review every other day.. not to mention the budgeting component has completely changed the game for me. I have confidence in the budget and can execute on it. Takes a little learning curve and trial and error but if you stick to it you will build your net worth. Coming from someone who does financial planning for a living - this is the best!
title: Worth every penny

review: I have tried other budget apps and this one is solid! It operates off a unique philosophy but a helpful one. Once you embrace spending only money you have (even on credit cards) it makes sense. One of the biggest draws is the reconcile feature. Other apps don‚Äôt make it very easy to know your budgets match your actual account balances but this does! I also appreciate the auto import from my bank accounts but I did deduct a star because that isn‚Äôt always seamless. It‚Äôs actually the banks‚Äô security that prevents YNAB from being seamless but nonetheless some banks add an extra step that makes budgeting a little clunky. Overall, I really enjoy the experience and gladly pay for this app.
title: App provides financial confidence

review:
YNAB does exactly what it says and it is extremely helpful. It has helped our family secure a solid budget. However, it is average because it has issues. Even when banking with a major institution, expenses never ‚Äúsync‚Äù with YNAB in a timely fashion. If you use your check card over the weekend, sometimes those charges will not ‚Äúsync‚Äù with YNAB until the following Wednesday. This is an inconvenience at the beginning of the month when trying to finalize last month‚Äôs expenses.
The other issue is customer support. There is no 1-888 to discuss issues or trouble shoot. YNAB staff does reply quickly with messages however some of the answers are not clear. I will definitely so continue using the product just hope YNAB resolves these major issues soon.
title: Average.....

developerResponse: {'id': 42716692, 'body': "Thanks for your review! I'm glad to hear that the Apple Card integration has streamlined your YNAB routine. üòä \\- Aubrey @ YNAB", 'modified': '2024-03-20T17:01:57Z'}
review: I have been using it for a few years now and manually managed my daily Apple Card transactions.   I think that was feature I found most tedious, but it helped me realize my spending habits.   Now with automatic import of my transactions it makes them so much more convenient and accurate.   I‚Äôm excited when I can immediately find the transactions waiting to be approved for their category.   5 stars and can‚Äôt wait to keep enjoying the app.   Also doing my very best to help others on the track to better budget habits.   üëç
title: Was very good but with Apple Card integration it‚Äôs excellent

developerResponse: {'id': 38222328, 'body': "Thank you for this wonderful review! üôå We're thrilled to hear that YNAB is the best budget app you've used and that it's helped you save for big projects while confidently handling regular expenses. Less guessing and more progress is definitely something to celebrate. üéâ \\- Jill@YNAB", 'modified': '2023-08-10T17:40:14Z'}
review: I have tried other apps but this one is the most comprehensive. Some apps ask you to project your earnings and make a budget before your income is in the bank. I really like that I get to work with what comes into my account WHEN it gets there. I am able to save for big projects and know my bills are taken care of too. After a few months you are able to see the average of what you are spending in each line item so you can adjust how much money to assign or your spending habits. Less guessing and more progress. This app is a worthy purchase.
title: Best budget app I have used

developerResponse: {'id': 41008697, 'body': "I am so glad YNAB has helped you save money and reach your financial goal! Your feedback about the mobile app is super helpful and I'll pass it along to our team. If you have any questions about the app, we are happy to help! You can email us at help@ynab.com \\- Natalie @ YNAB", 'modified': '2024-01-01T15:21:54Z'}
review: I‚Äôve used YNAB for about a year now. I‚Äôve saved and reached my financial goal for the year (yay!) but I HATE the app in general because it is so difficult to use and I feel like even a year in I‚Äôm still learning. The app stresses me out so much, I feel like there‚Äôs so much in so little of a space, so I do prefer the desktop version and have decided to use it over the app. I get that not everything‚Äôs going to be easy to use, but I feel like it‚Äôs set up in a not user friendly way. I haven‚Äôt tried any other budgeting apps but I‚Äôll most likely stick with YNAB because my main goal was to organize my money better and bulk up my savings.
title: Helped me save so much money

review:
We started using YNAB in 2013 and made the painful move to the web. The move was a challenge but it was the best long term move by YNAB and has proven to work well.  Lots of improvements over the years. 

Our one area of disagreement with YNAB, and this has been a strong issue with Jessie as we have corresponded, is income.  There is no way to budget income in YNAB.  While one can work with saved money easily enough, it is difficult to schedule income and budgets months in advance in a real world scenario. We figured how to get around this limitation but it has always been always a kludge.
title: Great product only one ongoing issue

review:
YNAB is a reasonable finance app. It uses Plaid to connect to your finance institutions greatly simplifying your data entry. Budgeting is above average with flexibility to enter budgets for weekly, monthly, or other periodic items. 

The dealbreaker for me is the complete lack of flexibility to go negative on any carryover categories. I recognize that this is not ideal for budgeting, but it is a reality of life. This forces you to jump through hoops by mis-categorizing transactions or changing your current monthly budget (only to have to change it back in future months). The app should just allow the possibility to go negative on some categories (advanced - I know what I‚Äôm doing feature?), and this may be one of the better budgeting apps available.
title: Lacking a key flexibility

review:
I‚Äôve been a dedicated user of YNAB now for about 5-6 years and I can easily say that they are constantly striving to make the app better, more useful, and more user friendly!  Their latest update really makes it a lot more approachable and easy to learn.

I‚Äôm especially a fan of their new mobile ‚Äúauto assign‚Äù feature that really is a huge time saver when deciding which categories to put new money into.  I was skeptical at first, but after really kicking the tires on it, I love it! Especially since you can edit all the assignments it makes before they are final!
title: Always getting better!

review: I‚Äôve used a lot of budgeting apps and I just didn‚Äôt see the point in how they were going to help me save and budget my money better. This app is like no other.  It really makes it easy for you to stick to your budget, get tips and tutorials on how to budget and save for whatever your purpose may be. My problem is that I like to shop. I can no longer afford to do that now that I have made the decision to move across country next year. With this app, I know I can make it happen. Although, I am using the free trial at the moment, I definitely plan on purchasing this app! Trust me, the money you save will be totally worth it.
title: Best budgeting app ever!!

review: First off, the concepts behind YNAB take some adjustment as the way it works is to only let you spend money you already have in your accounts, rather than money you don‚Äôt have yet like some others. This forces you to make an effort build up your checking (or savings) balances so that there is always cushion in there for your budget categories. I‚Äôm 8-months in and love it. It has provided great historical data on spending so I can adjust categories to be more realistic than I had previously assumed. I now have real budget items for things like home repair that the money is actually in accounts for when it‚Äôs needed.
title: Solid Budgeting App

review:
For someone that‚Äôs in finance and managing his own money I find this budgeting system to be the most confusing and complex piece of application ever. It‚Äôs not very intuitive and requires some thinking, and work, to get everything right. We‚Äôre all busy with our everyday lives and a budgeting app should make it easy for us to know where we‚Äôre at financially. This app isn‚Äôt it. 

You‚Äôre better off with mint or clarity because they make things extremely manageable without having to think about which transactions should be categorize into which buckets; god forbid if you choose the incorrect payee and account because YNAB will force you to ‚Äúrebudget‚Äù and move the money around which will lead to more complications. 

Also, why in the world would I want to assign a ‚Äújob‚Äù for my rainy day money? Emergency money should be left alone, untouched, and not assigned to any job or budget.
title: Confusing & complex

review: Easy to use, feeds multiple accounts and worth the fee. My family and I needed an app that streamed bank transactions, created a budget and keeps us accountable with our budget goals. The budget is editable and easy to figure out. I wish I would have bought this in Jan so I would have a years worth of activity to evaluate. My only complaint is that I never heard about this app until a friend suggested it. I have heard other use mint but preferred YNAB over it. There should be better marketing efforts. Whenever I have had a question - like how to assign credit card transactions- I easily find the answers online.
title: Perfect match for what we need

review: I started using YNAB a couple of years ago and although this review was supposed to be about how incredibly ecstatic I am with the functionality and independence of the new app it honestly just speaks to the impressiveness of the company as a whole. You guys are making my journey back to financial health a breeze. When I decided to file bankruptcy last year, I spent the last year or so learning how to budget from you and your software and now, post bankruptcy, I feel like I have the tools and practice necessary to be completely successful... and WEALTHY! So thanks! Pat yourselves on the back, give yourselves a cookie, keep up the most excellent work.
title: Continuously Impressive

developerResponse: {'id': 39855842, 'body': 'Thanks for the review, Bre! I love how you mentioned that YNAB gives you more control and oversight of your finances than you had before. üòä We appreciate you sharing from your experience! \\- Aubrey @ YNAB', 'modified': '2023-10-31T19:56:03Z'}
review: I‚Äôve been using YNAB now for two years and I can‚Äôt sing it‚Äôs praises enough.  For years I‚Äôd spend money and leave my credit cards on autopay without really seeing where my money is going.  I knew I had enough money but never felt proactive in my savings or financial strategy.  Categorizing the different areas I‚Äôm saving for, tracking where my is going, and seeing my net worth grow has been so fulfilling and satisfying.  I feel more confident in my financial future because I have more control and oversight and I really do recommend for the more tactical and detail oriented type of person.
title: Game changer

developerResponse: {'id': 38765429, 'body': "Thanks for your review! It sounds like you and your wife have done a great job of applying the YNAB Method with your own finances, and we're glad to hear that it's been so helpful to you. üòä \\- Aubrey @ YNAB", 'modified': '2023-09-06T19:33:45Z'}
review:
YNAB is amazing. It‚Äôs so much more than just another sleek budgeting app, though it is sleek. It teaches you an entirely new (and better) way of looking at money. Gone are the days when I‚Äôm just tracking where my dollars have been and hoping they‚Äôve been good. Now every dollar gets a job! I‚Äôm anticipating expenses and something as mundane as paying bills actually feels strangely satisfying. I regularly recommend YNAB to every friend of mine who mentions budgeting- it‚Äôs that good.

YNAB has been integral to helping my wife and I get our finances organized and in check and I can‚Äôt imagine budgeting without it.
title: So Much More than a Budget

review: This app is great and user friendly. I had always wanted to try the envelope system of budgeting, but since my money is direct deposited I felt like I wouldn‚Äôt keep it up for long if I had to make trips to the bank. This allows me to utilize that system concept without the extra steps. Easy to setup, access, and check daily. I look forward to pay day and distributing the money into my categories! I have only been using it for a couple of months, but it helped me to stay in budget for my Christmas spending. I am excited to use this app to help me to save money this year.
title: You need YNAB!

review:
I‚Äôve been trying to budget for decades. I‚Äôve read books, listen to David Ramsey‚Äòs course, try different apps, built a spreadsheet‚Ä¶and I‚Äôd get close but never could figure out how to manage my money. It‚Äôs no longer about budgeting for me, it‚Äôs about how am I going to use my money. The subtle shift is huge. 

The app/platform makes budgeting and managing money so so easy! I‚Äôve been able to pay off debt, save over $20k. After paying off the debt, I have consistently put money toward retirement, and all the extra things I didn‚Äôt think I could afford or do. Including renovating our first house!
title: I love to budget now!

review:
I kept putting off the pain of budgeting until we got sick of transferring funds to cover groceries at the checkout.  Then YNAB showed up after listening to a consumer report on the radio from Clark Howard.  Game changer.
We made too much money to live paycheck to paycheck and within 60 days (and a learning curve) we stuck with it and results were real.  We now have nearly 3 months of expenses planned out within just 7 months of using the App.  We‚Äôve also paid off all consumer CC debt and are now working off the car.
This has absolutely changed our financial picture and freedom and all it took was dedication and consistency.
title: Hesitancy led to Freedom!!

review: This app is amazing. Everything you need for a digital cash budget system without the long hours of planning. The only thing that this application lacks is the useful updates and syncing. It hardly ever syncs correctly between my devices, I use it better on laptop. But what is the purpose of that if I am making purchases and need to record them immediately to keep my budget up to date while I am on the go? Sometimes it does not load at all. I haven‚Äôt even used it for a good 2 months. It was working great when I first got it, but it got a little crazy when the app updated in May. I don‚Äôt know what happened, but I‚Äôm debating whether or not I should switch to another system.
title: Impeccable App

review: Your only regret will be that you didn‚Äôt do this sooner. I know that sounds like a shill, but it‚Äôs the truth. We were living in a financial fog until we started budgeting, and this is the best budgeting platform out there. It blows Mint out of the water. We‚Äôve even started using it for our kids so they can budget their allowance and other earnings and start to understand how their money needs to work for them. Our kids will enter adulthood with a sound understanding of personal finance, and YNAB is our vehicles for teaching those lessons. At $7/month this app is a bargain considering the use I get out of it. I‚Äôm down for life with the YNAB budget life.
title: Get YNAB, Change Your Life

review:
My wife started using the ynab app first and raved about how she was better able to save money and payoff debt. She strongly recommended I use the app also.  I was very reluctant to join and never having used a budget it was also confusing for me. 
Prior to using ynab my finances were unorganized and was never able to save money.  I was in credit card debt and didn't think or really have a plan as to how I was spending my money.
Now I'm credit card debt free, I'm able to account for every penny spent, save money for gifts and vacations, pay all my bills on time and am much happier and less stressed about my financial situation.
title: My Wife Made Me and I Couldn't Be Happier

review:
I used YNAB4 for years and years and was very reluctant to upgrade and start paying a subscription. I will say I still have mixed feelings about the change to the SAAS model and having all my data stored in the cloud, but the new features are pretty great. Goals alone have entirely changed the way I budget. 

I also love being able to do the majority of my budgeting on my phone now. The one thing I would really like is the ability to reconcile accounts on my phone. I‚Äôm sure it‚Äôs a hard flow to move to a mobile form-factor from a design perspective, but I really hope it‚Äôs in the pipeline.
title: Awesome Software

review: I love the app and the idea behind YNAB. It is a wonderful tool. I have one complaint about matching transactions. When I write a check, the person/company cashing that check can take weeks. When the check finally hits my account, the transaction does not see the uncleared transaction for the same amount if it is older than a couple of weeks. I have to manually change the date of the original transaction to the date of the new transaction, match the transactions, then set the date back to the date I wrote the check. Not a huge deal, but an annoying one. This is a problem for any ‚Äòdelayed transaction‚Äô, but checks would be the biggest culprit.
title: Matching Older Transactions...

review:
This app has a great layout, intuitive and concise. The app allows me to link to my bank account(s) and will auto-import any transactions I make as they clear my account.

But that is not the point. The app focuses around how a budget should be done: as I am paid I decide which categories to ‚Äúfund‚Äù. Then the app puts front and center the ability to track any expense I have. It took time to change my ways, but I was all in. Their support staff communication (which can be done in app, iMessage-style with a thread about a particular question) are always ready to answer questions like ‚Äúhow should I do X if I am currently trying to do Y‚Äù, or whatever. This tool is so generic you could pre-budget your whole month, or only budget when you get paid. It is actually up to you.

The app makes thinking of credit really easy: because the app shows you all of your accounts as one pool of money you don‚Äôt really fret about ‚Äúis there enough in my checking account to pay off my credit card?‚Äù

I love this app!
title: Keeps me on track

developerResponse: {'id': 35577391, 'body': "Thank you so much for sharing your amazing story with us! Congratulations, what a huge win. ü§© It sounds like you really put in the work, and we're happy to have played a part in your financial success! - Jill@YNAB", 'modified': '2023-03-25T00:05:36Z'}
review:
Before YNAB, we frequently overdrew our checking account, barely got the bills paid, had tens of thousands in credit card debt, and had no way out. We are now debt-free and carry a balance in our checking account that I never would have dreamed of. YNAB is a huge part of that success.

2024 edit: I don‚Äôt know how long ago I left the original review. Like any good habit or exercise program, there have been times that we‚Äôve fallen off the wagon with our finances. However, YNAB has remained instrumental to keeping us from falling too far and getting us back on track. Amazing service.
title: Life changing

review:
Three years ago I was in debt up to my eyeballs, doomed to rent forever. Some solid budgeting and a fortuitous couple of tax refunds later, I have no more credit card debt and I‚Äôm on track to buy a house I can love in September.

Don‚Äôt just use the app! Go to the site and read the method. Watch the videos, take a free webinar. YNAB is not just an app, it‚Äôs a whole program. They teach you how to see money differently. They teach you how to control your debt without it controlling you. You learn to be strategic, practical, and even have a little bit of fun with the money you work so hard to earn. 

YNAB also helped me to save up for this iPhone X (yay for priorities!); I wish their app had full iPhone X support.
title: On financial track, Jesse and YNAB team helped

review: If you‚Äôve ever budgeted based off of putting cash into envelopes and found that it didn‚Äôt work because of how inconvenient cash is then this is for you. It‚Äôs absolutely the BEST budget app I‚Äôve ever used. Everything is easily accessible and visible at a glance. It has seriously saved my finances. I finally feel fully in control of my budget and I‚Äôm not running out of money every week. There‚Äôs a month long free trial which is enough time to decide if it‚Äôs really going to work for you rather than a week that doesn‚Äôt even get you started. I‚Äôll be with YNAB for life!
title: Envelope Method for the 21st century

developerResponse: {'id': 39992566, 'body': "Thanks for leaving a review! It's great that YNAB has helped you so much in a short period of time. We love to make money fun and put you in control! üí™üèª \\- Natalie @ YNAB", 'modified': '2023-11-07T20:04:32Z'}
review: My wife and I started using YNAB three months ago. We immediately signed up for two other free seminars a day after starting our trial, and I have to say we talk about money differently. We plan for it differently, and we manage our expenses so much better than we ever have before because of this app, it‚Äôs intuitive. It‚Äôs easy to learn, and it actually makes money fun to manage as opposed to scary to look at strongly recommend that you sign up for the introductory seminar. It helps you understand budging better and it makes using the application less intimidating.
title: Life changing budget app

developerResponse: {'id': 35815255, 'body': 'Hi there! Thanks so much for taking the time to leave us a review. We are thrilled to hear that YNAB has taken the stress out of budgeting, and made it enjoyable. That is truly something to celebrate. - Jill@YNAB', 'modified': '2023-04-06T17:10:30Z'}
review: I saw this app about a year ago when I was looking to replace my current well known major accounting software.  Did not think much of it then since it was not apple to apple comparison.  But this time I looked further.  At 62 I wanted something that did a much better job of tracking a budget than the other software.  After the 34 day trial I found it.  Why did it take make so long to find this?  Fear I think.  Fear of leaving my other software I was using for 20 years.  Now I‚Äôm at ease.  Budgeting has been a pleasure with this program.  Wish I found it earlier.
title: Wish I found earlier

review:
We started our YNAB journey in January 2020 and now I‚Äôm so grateful we did. Facing all the changes we are, it‚Äôs so good that we have our budget feet under us so we know what to spend on, where to get money for extra groceries and just feel peace of mind even with my severely reduced work hours that I know what to do with our money when it does come in. 

I mostly use the phone app for quick checks and on-the-go entries but to do regular budget maintenance the web app is more fully featured and has an undo button! But this is a great system, supportive company, and for us, a lifesaver. Thanks YNAB team!
title: Total lifesaver

developerResponse: {'id': 35503353, 'body': "Hi there - thanks for leaving this review. Those transactions at the end of the month transactions can be tricky. We'd love to help get this sorted for you! Email us at help@ynab.com and we can go from there! - Natalie @ YNAB", 'modified': '2023-03-21T11:51:42Z'}
review: I‚Äôve been fighting with trusting the numbers YNAB has been providing for several months now, but I figure they were ‚Äúclose enough‚Äù. I finally figured out the major bug that‚Äôs causing me to end my subscription and woefuly step back into the endless search for a proper personal finance app. The issue: once the new month is created, the numbers are apparently set in stone. This means that, if you make a $1000 purchase the end of February so it goes under February‚Äôs budget, then open the app a few days later in March to assign it, it will show the numbers properly in February, but March will act as if the transaction never happened; you‚Äôll simply have $1000 that‚Äôs unaccounted for in March. This is the closest to the perfect app I‚Äôve found (reporting aside), but if you can‚Äôt trust the numbers, it‚Äôs meaningless as a finance app.
title: One fatal flaw

review:
I really, really want to love YNAB. This is my second reluctant subscription renewal on the service but might be my last. The constant connection issues means I spend more time trying to sync my accounts every time I use the app than I do budgeting.

Capital One connections are non-existent. I log in to my Capital One app separately and manually enter my transaction history in YNAB. Wells Fargo isn't supported if you use 2 factor authentication. Chase is now going to need relinking every 2 months. Robinhood rarely links. It‚Äôs just untenable. Somehow every other personal finance app I use has this figured out (Personal Capital, Mint, even Simplifi). I really want to support this developer and this product but they need to find a solution for the constant connection issues plaguing an otherwise fantastic product.
title: Constant connection issues

review:
A utility like this, if utilized properly and diligently, is life changing. It gives you a simplistic understanding of where your money is and where it is going at all times.

My experience has been fantastic. There was an approximately 1 to 1.5 week learning curve. Now, I log every purchase I make and track all of my accounts through the app. It has allowed me to pay down my debt confidently without fear of overreaching. It has increased my awareness of where my money is going, which has improved my spending habits. It‚Äôs given me the ability to plan for large expenses in an easy-to-use format. 

Can‚Äôt speak highly enough about YNAB.
title: Life Changing

review:
For a company that‚Äôs main function is connecting to your bank so that you can budget efficiently, they do a poor job.  There seems to always be a connection issue with one of my banks. Now my main bank account is effected.  I asked when it will be resolved and they expect it to take weeks!!  You would think since they are an Expensive subscription based company that they would at the very least extend coverage or reimburse for the outage time, but they said these outages are to be EXPECTED.  I can understand a day or two, but WEEKS?!? That‚Äôs ridiculous.

I like the concept, hence the 2 stars, but paying an expensive subscription for a company that can‚Äôt deliver its main function and then won‚Äôt back it with customer service is ridiculous.

Try Mint or another competitor.
title: MANY Connection issues

review: I‚Äôve read online reviews and articles saying this is a great app, but I‚Äôm not seeing it. I‚Äôve been trying to connect to my banks, but when I go to the ‚Äòmanage connections‚Äô it‚Äôs not set to adjust to phone screen. Pretty big issue for a phone app! All the info on the left side isn‚Äôt visible as I can only see whatever is in the center. This means I have no idea what they‚Äôre asking for nor can I see what I‚Äôm typing in the fields. I‚Äôve verified I‚Äôm using the most current version, restarted my phone, checked settings, but still can‚Äôt get it to work. There‚Äôs zero customer support, which for an app with a monthly fee is pretty ridiculous IMO. Well, maybe there is customer support and I just couldn‚Äôt find it??? Considering this is supposed to help me manage my budget, methinks I‚Äôll cancel this app as it‚Äôs not a good use of my money. I guess maybe I did learn something after all.
title: Meh.

review: Pretty easy to use overall, and recording transactions is a breeze.  If you overspend on a category it is very easy to move money.  However, if you are trying to move money between budgets that aren‚Äôt overspent it isn‚Äôt as intuitive as the desktop version.  Also, I wish there was a way to budget based on what you want your total available to be and let the software do the calculations for you.  You can only budget what you want to add or remove from total available, which can be a nuisance as you don‚Äôt always work with round numbers.
title: Easy to use overall but wish there were a few changes

review:
As a budgetting system YNAB is superior. The app is great but it's missing some fundamentals that kept me wondering the whole week if the developers really care. 

I can understand that the app doesn't support multiple currencies, there are few workarounds that we can live with but the developers don't care to make our lives either even if we are willing to compromise. At least the transaction entry should support multiplication as the rest of the other applications.

The offline is horrible, you can't use your computer as its a browser based and the iOS app frequently skip syncing some entries made offline
title: Amazing but no one cares!

review: I‚Äôve tried a bunch of different budgeting apps over the years... like all of them.  I was originally turned off because of the price, I wanted it to be free, but sometimes you get what you pay for.  It took me a year before I tried it.  I never should have waited! Try it if the full 34 day free period. Seriously!  It takes a bit to get the hang of because it‚Äôs a little different in theory but within your first pay cycle you‚Äôll understand it.  Give yourself a month and it becomes very intuitive.  I look back at my other apps and they were bulky and difficult.  This is streamlined and simple. I‚Äôm loving this app!
title: Best budgeting app! 5 Stars

developerResponse: {'id': 32262407, 'body': "Hey exYNABfan! I'm sorry to hear you're still having trouble with your connections. We just released a feature to switch single bank connections to the other import provider which has led to much better success. If you're up for it, feel free to reach out to help@ynab.com and see if this new feature can help improve your connections! -Kat @ YNAB", 'modified': '2022-09-27T17:56:34Z'}
review: Would not start down the YNAB path at this juncture. Find an alternative because it is hard to break the dependency once you start. I went all in and set it up nicely. Connected my accounts for automatic syncing - a necessity for me. Connections and syncing are so buggy now that this feature should be labeled beta. Lately, it has taken several days before they fix errors with bank connections. Very frustrating. Customer service attentive but I wish they could fix the problem too. Looking for alternatives. Hoping someone will create a competitor asap.
title: Used to love this app

review: I don‚Äôt usually write reviews, but the customer service that I have received from this company has been probably the best I‚Äôve seen at any company I‚Äôve worked with. Casey was phenomenal and over the course of several months kept on one of my banks issues to make sure that they could help get is resolved. Besides the customer service, the software does exactly what I need it to do and I couldn‚Äôt be happier. The only thing I would like to see is expanded use of reports both on the desktop and on the tablet app, but that‚Äôs not enough to take away from my 5 star review. It‚Äôs GREAT.
title: Great!

review: I have always prided myself on being frugal and budget-conscious. I‚Äôve tried a couple different budget apps and the monthly budget set-it-and-forget it approach just never felt helpful. There‚Äôs probably a way to have recurring expenses with YNAB, but I actually like entering my upcoming expenses each time I get paid - this helps me be careful not to spend more than I currently have in my account. And I really like the function the allows you to set savings goals. It has changed how I budget and think about money. I have recommended it to all my friends and family.
title: Helped me adapt a new budget mindset

review:
I had to leave a review for this app, though I‚Äôm not only giving 5 stars to the iOS app, I‚Äôm giving 5 stars to the whole program. I‚Äôve been using YNAB for 60 days. I started mid-month which was hard for me to do because I budget monthly. YNAB made it easy to start and, better yet, had made it easy to continue. 

The app itself is easy to use, with no bugs that I‚Äôve encountered. I‚Äôm able to customize my budget based on the categories I need for my spending. 

The real gem, though, is the education that accompanies their program. Helping you understand how you can easily use a credit card for things and still count it towards your budget or making sure you know that your budget will fluctuate and that‚Äôs okay. I‚Äôve really appreciated the weekly emails (which I normally unsubscribe from with other companies) and the help section on the site. And I LOVE the testimonials! 

If you‚Äôve been wanting to get serious about your relationship with your money, this is a great app!
title: I never leave reviews but....

review:
I just got renewal email and I thought about whether to continue or cut (we‚Äôre cutting expenses across the board). 

While I haven‚Äôt made use of the budgeting technique, I have made heavy use of this for tracking and categorizing expenses. It helps ground me into ‚Äúhow much does the household cost all in?‚Äù I never really had confidence in past estimates. 

The UI on the app is great for categorizing, and I‚Äôd had to use the website for reporting.  I wish I could figure out the incantation to mark a transfer in the app or see net income for the month. Overall I‚Äôm satisfied and plan to renew. This service is how I know we‚Äôre living within our means.
title: After a year, suited me

review:
Like many others here, I downloaded this app in the hopes it might help me neaten my finances. However, upon downloading and setting up, my bank flagged this app as unsafe, and so I could not pair my bank with this app. Upon learning this, I immediately deleted my account with YNAB and deleted the app. This all happened within a couple of hours.

Fast forward a month, and YNAB has billed me for membership. I reached out to customer service to sort things out, and Katie and Angela from YNAB support was entirely unhelpful and set off my scam alarms even more. She asked me for screenshots of things that have my personal information (bank info and address). I declined, explaining that my entire reason for deleting this app was that it seemed like it might be scammy. She then immediately replied to tell me that she can‚Äôt help at all, and gave my a link to some phony apple website.

Quick google search has revealed that this company is not BBB accredited. They‚Äôve been in business 11 years. Address listed on BBB is 770 West Main Street, Lehi, UT. Here, I could see a Papa Murphy‚Äôs, a UPS, an Allstate, a Batteries and Bulbs, and some store called Western Heat and AC. No YNAB. 

A final quick google search of ‚Äòyou need a budget scam‚Äô reveals that many users have been billed nearly $100 without permission.
title: Scammy

review: YNAB is the only thing you need to change your life for the better 10fold. It has totally changed the way I think about money. I make the same amount of money and income I‚Äôve always had, the only change has been to start budgeting with YNAB and for the first time in my life, I‚Äôm not worried about making the months bills. Every that has to be paid has been, my savings account building. Student loans are gone. I go to the grocery store and I just buy the things I need because I budgeted for this. No surprises, and when there is the occasional surprise, I just roll with the punches no sweat. Get this app,
title: This Method Will Change Your Life

developerResponse: {'id': 37897581, 'body': 'Whoo! So glad YNAB could help you, what a great way to use our file-based importing. Thanks for budgeting with us! - Natalie @ YNAB', 'modified': '2023-07-25T19:23:21Z'}
review:
Just wanted to say thank you for the way you keep transaction data. I‚Äôm having to pull together a balance sheet for my business using another third party app and I‚Äôm trying to use their bank import feature but my bank limits it to pull only 3 months back. I needed a way to get all of my transactions. Luckily YNAB has a clever export feature and I‚Äôve been using YNAB for years so I‚Äôm able to pull all the missing transactions out of my business budget with YNAB to the other app to get things done. ‚úÖ 

If YNAB ever comes out with business accounting software I‚Äôll be the first to buy.
title: Geniuses

review: The app is stellar but YNAB is so much more than an app. It‚Äôs also coaching and education. And you can utilize all of it or none of it. YNAB‚Äôs culture is never shaming for the choices you‚Äôve made (good bad or indifferent) but rather identifying YOUR needs and YOUR goals and helping you get there. I truly love it. The biggest dopamine hit is getting a bill & having no stress bc you‚Äôve already saved the money (& in tiny monthly chunks so it didn‚Äôt hurt as bad as one huge payment). My first yearly goal was a $3500 credit card payoff‚Ä¶I did it in the first quarter. Thanks YNAB, thanks content creators, thanks Devs, thanks Jesse!
title: It‚Äôs so much more than an app!

review: My wife and I have budgeted our entire marriage. Initially I made it work with excel, but as we wanted to get more and more detailed it became very difficult to maintain. I looked around at other apps but so few of them had the features I was looking for. Specifically goals, recurring payments, and splitting a single receipt into multiple categories. YNAB has all of the features I used before, hoped for, and more. And they add more all the time. I LOVE this app. It saves me hours and hours of effort and helps my family meet our financial goals. I can‚Äôt recommend YNAB enough.
title: By far the best budgeting app out there!!

review: I love this app and the YNAB system.  I was never successful at saving money until I got YNAB.  I am a single mother and have come a long way from living a life where I was cash only and building my credit back up after a debt consolidation.  I had overdrawn fees regularly as well.  With YNAB, I have been able to successfully save my money into different categories - I‚Äôve learned to become more strategic about it. I honestly look at YNAB as a strategic game.  After 5+ years, I still get excited on payday to allocate all my dollars into their categories.  I cannot recommend this system enough.
title: Success for 5+ years

review:
