I love YNAB and it‚Äôs been very useful for the last several months. However, it rolls over to 0 budgeted at the beginning of the month, and my income doesn‚Äôt work that way. YNAB offers four Quick Budget ways to deal with that, none of which suit me. I‚Äôd like one more option‚ÄîContinue Last Month‚Äôs Budget‚Äîor Carry Forward‚Äîwhich would carry forward all the amounts from all the categories just as they are. It takes me a few hours to fix the numbers each month, and I hate that because otherwise YNAB is awesome!
BTW, I‚Äôm not finally fed up; that name was leftover from a review of something else and I don‚Äôt know how to change it.
title: Needs one more option on the first of the month

review: I was skeptical about this app, especially with the $80 annual fee but I saw great improvements in my financial handling within 2 weeks! The free trial gives you a little over a month but I was ready to buy in 14 days! I read about all these people who save $600 on average and I was like, ‚Äúyea right.‚Äù But I have definitely seen those results. Looking at money the way the app allows you too has changed my life. I feel as though I have more money and have barely changed my lifestyle. I also no longer get those angry, upsetting feelings when I spend money on something since I planned for such things.
title: This App Honestly Helps Immensly

review:
I used Quicken for decades and was very comfortable using it, never had a problem until Intuit decided to sell it. Quality rapidly declined and it became too buggy, I sought an alternative. Along came YNAB. 

Seriously, after four years it‚Äôs become a life saver. YNAB has become the single most important software product I subscribe to. When I started, I couldn‚Äôt believe all the reviews describing how people got out of debt and were able to build a financial cushion, yet here I am. Another success story!

It takes a little getting use to but it‚Äôs worth the effort. A burden has been lifted off my shoulders and I suspect it will never return.
title: Long term Quicken user

review: This app, what can I say about his app. This is the most fun I have ever had budgeting. I feel so in control of my money. I look and every dollar has a job and I know exactly what my day, week and month look like. This app is well put together and the real gem might not even be in the app. It might be in the blog, the forums, the weekly columns. All that comes with the app! I tried mint for awhile but I like how this app makes you look at your money and account for every dollar you spend. Mint just took a shot at categorizing your transaction but it never really gave you a solid plan. The price is so worth it so go ahead and give it a try!
title: Game Changer

review: This app is fantastic when it works and when it is linked to your accounts. Unfortunately it is CONSTANTLY loosing connection with my banks. Out of the blue YNAB will ask me to re-link my account, so when I re-enter the user ID and password it then tells me the password or something else is incorrect. So then I go directly to my bank webpage and log in with zero issues. This happens on almost a monthly basis with multiple different accounts and financial institutions. It will tell me that the connection is lost between YNAB and my bank for about a week or 2 then it will finally accept the same user name and password it has always been and work flawlessly for about a week or two. Then the cycle starts all over again.
title: Grate.... when it works.

review: This is a huge improvement over the original YNAB ‚Äúclassic‚Äù app. We have used YNAB for over 5 years and it‚Äôs made a big difference in our budgeting. And although the auto transaction import is a huge time saver it still has regular problems syncing with my credit and bank accounts‚Äîand I‚Äôm referring to major names here: my Wells Fargo account loses its connection EVERY DAY.  It‚Äôs getting really annoying having to re-authenticate my account connection every day. For this, and for the other account issues that regularly occur, this is not yet a five star app IMO.
title: Bank connection issues

review:
I‚Äôm not usually one to leave reviews but this Bugeting App has changed my life for the better! 

Before this, I had a slight control over my finances but never could seem to get ahead of my expenses. When bonus checks a tax refund would come, it would usually be spent / lost / forgotten. The difference with this app is it‚Äôs a legitimate budgeting app, not just a financial tracking app like Mint or HelloWallet. 

This app has enabled me to know where every dollar goes, and has me in total control of my finances! The amount of relief this has enabled within my life is far beyond my expectations!
title: Best Budgeting App

review:
The YNAB philosophy/method has made a huge difference for my financial peace of mind. I've been using it off and on since it was an Excel spreadsheet and mostly on since YNAB 4.0.  You really should make the effort to get your head around the method by going through their materials at their site. 
This app (primarily the webapp with this as adjunct) is all about getting a handle on your finances and feeling confident and peaceful about them. This isn't really the app for those who want to obsess over detailed reports and know what their balance will be 327.5 days from now. 
Get it and use it. The effort will pay off and then will cease to be effort.
title: Good app.  Great philosophy.

review: This used to be a great app. I‚Äôve been using it since the early days when you bought the app for the Mac, then there was Dropbox integration, an iOS app and all was well. Then they started a subscription model that was a little frustrating, but somewhat reasonable - I think maybe $45/yr. now that price has doubled and I don‚Äôt see that stopping. There really hasn‚Äôt been the amount of improvements to justify the continued price increase. Is it a good app? Sure. It does everything I needed when I first bought it. But it definitely is not worth the continual price increases. Going to be finding a new app for budgeting since I foresee continual price increases in the future. At $50/yr, it might still be worth it, but definitely not at $80+/year. Very frustrated long time user here.
title: Getting more and more expensive

developerResponse: {'id': 35510855, 'body': "Love that quote and it's so true! I'm glad you have found that in YNAB. We are all about helping people feel in control of their finances! Thanks for leaving a review! - Natalie @ YNAB", 'modified': '2023-03-21T19:06:13Z'}
review: From day one, I have loved the way YNAB has put me in control. If you are just starting out, there are tons of videos and classes you can use to get yourself up and running. However, I would advise anyone getting started for the first time to start out slowly with only a few categories- Keep It Simple‚Ä¶ it takes a good 3 or more months to really get up and running. Over time, you will start to feel the joy of being in control of your money. John Maxwell said that a budget tells your money where to go so you don‚Äôt wonder where it went.
title: I love this app

developerResponse: {'id': 35577516, 'body': "Hi there, thanks for taking the time to leave us a review. We're so glad to hear that you've been enjoying YNAB, and that it's helped you save money! If you haven't already, we'd love for you to share your feature requests here: https://support.ynab.com/en_us/feedback-and-feature-requests-an-overview-rJgD33fAq - Jill@YNAB", 'modified': '2023-03-25T00:37:35Z'}
review: Most budgeting software simply doesn‚Äôt work. This one actually does work and is the best I‚Äôve ever found. I‚Äôve been very pleased with it. It syncs with credit cards, bank accounts (if you want) and between spouses. There is also a ton of great training/educational content. I wish the software allowed for receipt storage for future returns/taxes and ongoing syncing of the ‚Äútracking accounts,‚Äù but those are not critical for the main job of budgeting for immediate and future transactions and tracking spending. We have saved a lot of money by using this.
title: This actually works

review:
I have been struggling with how to make my budget work with me for years. I tried Every Dollar for a couple years, I found it too restrictive and it didn‚Äôt work with my lifestyle.
Ynab is a new way to look at my budget, that actually works with how I live. It seemed strange at first, but now it seems like the most obvious way to budget.
I no longer do complicated math or try to game my budget. I know exactly what I have to spend, how much my spending is impacting my debt, and I am no longer checking my bank account to see if I‚Äôm too close to zero. Beyond grateful!
title: Absolutely transformational

review: If you want to keep good track of your credit spending and properly allocate funds from your checking to pay in full each month, this app is for you. They recently updated the credentials authorization for Citi, Chase, and potentially others, by landing you on a secure page that verifies on the bank‚Äôs end that you give YNAB the authorization to access your data. Simple secure and trustworthy. Once the rhythm of credit clicks you will never want to swipe your debit card again. Say hello to points, perks, deferred payments and more !
title: Incredible User Design and Credit Integrating Features

review:
Occasional bank connectivity issues, but after a couple of days, this is fixed by the partner company.  This app has a very fluid budget process with great mobile apps.  It is not a static budget process.  With other apps, I would have to run a report to see how much money has been spent in each category.  Who likes to run reports all the time?  With YNAB, you ALWAYS know how your spending is going by just quickly opening the app.  At the store you may feel tempted to buy something.  Open the app and QUICKLY know your budget status.
This is the way to budget and follow your expenses and monetary assets!
title: Definitely the BEST Finance App

developerResponse: {'id': 40704177, 'body': "We couldn't have said that any better ourselves! üôå Thanks for this great review, and we're thrilled to hear that YNAB has had an impact on your financial life. And you're spot on, the proactive approach is really what sets YNAB apart and helps our users love the way they spend. üéâ \\- Jill@YNAB", 'modified': '2023-12-15T14:11:54Z'}
review:
YNAB (You Need A Budget) is more than just a budgeting app; it's a transformative tool for managing money. Its key strength is in making every dollar intentional, fostering a proactive approach to finances. The clarity and ease in planning and saving are standout features, making financial goals clear and attainable.

The app simplifies managing debts like loans and credit cards, balancing debt reduction with other financial objectives. Over time, YNAB has been instrumental in my savings, proving its effectiveness beyond just budgeting.

Most importantly, YNAB grants a sense of financial freedom and runway. For anyone seeking control over their finances, YNAB is an invaluable asset.
title: Financial Clarity and Freedom with YNAB

review: I came from a household who never knew what budgeting was and so they never taught me growing up. After I got married, We started seeing how our financial situation was only getting worse. Debt was piling up and we felt like we never had any money. With YNAB, we were able to pay off most of our debt within a year and start putting money towards savings. YNAB has helped me get away from living paycheck to paycheck and now we don‚Äôt stress as much about our monthly expenses. The app is wonderful. I look at it multiple times a day. Very user friendly.
title: Huge financial improvement

review: I have my whole family budgeting on this app! It‚Äôs helping me set goals for my family, monitor my snowball debt payments, and keep track of everything. It‚Äôs sync with banking is perfect too, I rarely have to even check my bank account these days:) I love the app better than the computer version, except I wish it did have the reconcile features. It‚Äôs flexible for the things your forget to plan for too! Moving money from ‚Äúenvelope to envelope‚Äù may not be best money management practices BUT real life happens and YNAB is helping us manage it and stay on top of our goals:) thanks YNAB!
title: Yep - it‚Äôs worth it!

review: I have been with YNAB through many of their upgrades and have lived the changes. Each time improving, until now. This one is horrible!! Not user friendly, less control over your budget and to much access to personal information. Not sure who you are trying to compete with, but I loved the user friendly YNAB 4 and just wish there was still an app to go with it without being like the rest of the fiscal world trying to take my money every year for something I can create in a spreadsheet that is more friendly!!
title: Cost and not better

developerResponse: {'id': 44972903, 'body': "We LOVE hearing how YNAB has brought you peace of mind about your spending - thanks for the review, and here's to many more years of YNABing!!!", 'modified': '2024-07-01T17:59:19Z'}
review:
I have been using YNAB 5+ years. I use the iOS app along side the web version.  There is a bit do learning curve at first as you relearn what it means to budget but it‚Äôs worth the effort.  The price is worth every penny.  I have gone from holding my breath when am charging gas 2 days before mortgage is due to confidently spending as I know exactly what I have saved.  From 3 digits in the bank account to many more then that and kept myself out do debt.

Take the chance.  It‚Äôs worth it to have it all in your pocket where ever you go.
title: Electronic envelope system but way better.

developerResponse: {'id': 39963105, 'body': "Thanks for your review! It's amazing how you were able to pay down your debt so quickly and save up for vacations. That's a big deal. Way to go! \\- Natalie @ YNAB", 'modified': '2023-11-06T16:38:13Z'}
review:
Before ynab, I had $10k in credit card debt and was living beyond my means without visibility into my spending. I spent a year only on debit and using ynab religiously which caused me to not spend money I didn‚Äôt have, save up for vacations, and quickly pay down my cc debt. YNAB aims to reprogram how you think about money which can be very painful and tedious at first, but becomes a fun video game once you get the hang of it.
$100/yr sounds steep but you‚Äôll make that back easy and not get bombarded by ads for credit cards like other budgeting apps
title: There‚Äôs a learning curve, but changed my financial life

review: We make a decent income and could live comfortably but it seemed like our entire paycheck was gone by the end of the month. We couldn‚Äôt figure out what we were spending it all on. Thanks to YNAB, we started tracking our spending and could say no to certain impulse desires when we knew what our bigger picture priorities were. We have so much saved now and feel so relaxed about our spending knowing what the money in our accounts are going to be used for! Our average account balance has at least tripled!
title: Completely changed our lives

review:
Game changer. If you are on the fence about this app, it pays for its self a thousand times over. We have changed our financial trajectory and now have financial peace thanks to YNAB.

I wish I could put everything I have learned in this review because it takes the average person 60 days. Stick in there and you can master your money. Understand where your money is going, create a plan, work the plan, review the data, and fine tune it. You got this!

I hope you choose to use YNAB and I hope it has the same impact on you that it has for our family.
title: You Need a Budget!

review:
I was on top of my budget for a full 4 month period - I was responsible and thoughtful with my spending. And then I thought ‚Äúoh I got this now‚Äù and stopped for a month - my budget and spending went downhill so quickly I couldn‚Äôt even bring myself to open the app to look at how awful I was managing my finances. 

They have a ‚ÄúFresh Start‚Äù option, which I just used today. I‚Äôm resolved to stay on top of my finances this time and commit to using the app consistently. 

This is truly the best budgeting app out there. You just have to STICK TO IT and you‚Äôll be onto a long term healthy relationship with money.
title: Really works, just commit to it

review:
I can't believe YNAB switched to a subscription model?! This is NOT the kind of software that needs a subscription. There better not be a forced upgrade some day. If there is I will surely move on to something else. No way I'm going to pay $50 per year in perpetuity for something like this. In fact, when I purchased YNAB 4 I vaguely remember YNAB saying something like ‚Äúthis will be the last finance app you'll ever buy‚Äù. Well, that's not the case any more if I need a subscription. 

Bad move YNAB. I used to recommend YNAB to all of my friends. Not now!

Update: October 2019

The time has come. YNAB 4 will no longer work if you upgrade your Mac to macOS Catalina. The YNAB subscription now costs a whopping $84 per year. ZERO CHANCE I ever pay a subscription fee for a product like this. Just like Adobe (now use Affinity products for a fraction of the price and actually like them better!), I will move on to something else. YNAB has lost its way, all for the sake of profit.

If they had a YNAB 5 available for $60 like the good old days I would upgrade immediately. Apparently that's a pipe dream now. The value just isn't there for an online, monthly service. There's a sucker born every minute, I'm not one of them. You're a fool to sign up for this.
title: No Thanks

review: This app has changed my life. YNAB isn‚Äôt just a way to keep track of what you spend, it‚Äôs a whole mindset that helps your prioritize the things that YOU find most important, not what someone else thinks should be important. It‚Äôs simple, it‚Äôs flexible, and it completely removes the guilt and tediousness from budgeting. Getting debt free or building savings doesn‚Äôt have to be a chore, YNAB makes sure you are leaving some wiggle room for fun, and that your budget is balanced both financially and according to what makes YOU happy. I‚Äôve been using YNAB for over a year and will never look back!
title: Life changing

review: First of all you guys need to know I‚Äôm a CPA and I have a master‚Äôs degree in accounting. So I‚Äôm very tech savvy when it comes to budgeting. This app is hands down the best one I have ever tried. I am a very cheap person but I will subscribe to this app for sure because of the incredible value it brings me. The ability to budget into the future and move money in between categories is amazing. Also the workshops taught me so much! I thought I‚Äôm good at dealing with my finances because of my credentials (see above) but the workshops has improved my view on so many aspects of budgeting and have a positive financially healthy future! Thank you YNAB !
title: Greatest budgeting app ever

developerResponse: {'id': 35169547, 'body': "Thank you for taking the time to share this! We're so glad to hear that YNAB has been a game changer for you. ü•≥  You're absolutely right, getting out of debt is hard. It sounds like you're making great progress, so huge props for putting in the work! - Jill@YNAB", 'modified': '2023-03-02T17:26:12Z'}
review: YNAB has been life-changing. Getting out of debt is super tough and emotional, but at least I had a bit more of a plan using YNAB. I like that I can do ‚Äúfresh starts‚Äù of my budget if I feel like I‚Äôm too far behind or just lost in purchases and need an easier task to begin again. I find it easier to set up a budget on a desktop or laptop, then track expenses through the app as I swipe my card. If you think the app is dumb and annoying, make sure you‚Äôre not accidentally stuck in the tutorial like I was for a week at first.
title: I recommend this to everyone

developerResponse: {'id': 35025061, 'body': 'Empowered. In control. Wow, we love hearing that! Like all new things, YNAB has a learning curve, and we encourage folks to start from day one without looking back ‚Äî it super-charges your ability to get that "cockpit view" of today\'s priorities and move forward successfully, fast. Thanks for sharing your experience. We\'re celebrating you! - Dela@YNAB', 'modified': '2023-02-23T01:58:25Z'}
review: It took me a while to find out how the numbers work in the app as I started with back-assigning numbers for Q4 of 2022. And then when you get it, you get it. For the first time in a while I feel so empowered by the amount of control I have over my cash flow. Subscription is a bit pricey, but it‚Äôs worth each cent paid. You guys did a great job implementing this platform. Web based app gives you a cockpit-like experience for your finances while the mobile app helps you keep track of your expenses as you go. Well done!
title: Top notch tool to keep the books

developerResponse: {'id': 35581655, 'body': "Hey there G Caldwell, Thanks for sharing your experience with YNAB here in this review and in the wider world! I'm so glad that the app and more importantly the method has been helpful to you on your budgeting journey. We love to hear that it has been life changing! Sasha@YNAB", 'modified': '2023-03-25T13:38:29Z'}
review:
When I recommend YNAB to people who are looking for a system to manage their finances I get one of two reactions: a glazed over look that indicates the listener imagines another software platform that provides the same solutions and suffers the same shortcomings; or true curiosity. 
Those who take the time to investigate YNAB discover it‚Äôs so much more than software, but a system that will change the way you manage your resources and think about your financial goals. 
What I hear from those who discover the power and simplicity of YNAB is, ‚ÄúYNAB changed my life!‚Äù
title: Best Budgeting System I‚Äôve Seen

review: This app has been a game-changer for me feeling in control of my spending and money. I love it so much I gifted a subscription to my young-adult daughter and helped her set it up based on what I‚Äôve learned from the excellent educational tips, videos, and blogs offered by YNAB, plus the 7 months or so that I‚Äôve been using it. If you dive in, spend some time learning how best to make it work for you, and commit to the ‚Äúfour rules‚Äù, you will end up spending less money overall and feeling much better prepared for life as it shows up. Highly recommend.
title: YNAB has changed my whole outlook!

review: I have been using YNAB over five years. Not ounce have I thought about using another. It takes some getting use to. But it feels like when you evolve it evolves with you, never complicating much as you grow. You get back what you put into if for sure. This helped me out of debt and in my marriage. This should be taught in our schools and our kids should graduate high school with this app ready to tackle the future. Lastly, their customer service is hands the best. The key is communication. The person you speak to IS working on the issue and the buck doesn‚Äôt get passed unless it absolutely has to. Thank you YNAB.
title: Financial Counselor

developerResponse: {'id': 31822472, 'body': 'Thanks so much for the five star review, Neil! And thanks so much for sticking with us these past five years! ~Renae@YNAB', 'modified': '2022-09-04T20:53:23Z'}
review: YNAB has set the bar high. It‚Äôs mobile app has many features, it‚Äôs web app has even more, it‚Äôs pretty easy to use once you get the hang of it. I‚Äôve tried a couple others, Tiller is excellent on the desktop using spreadsheets, but the mobile interface is virtually unusable except emergencies. Simplifi has an improved user experience over YNAB but it‚Äôs lack of support for rollover funds and need for several workarounds to accomplish what YNAB does still can‚Äôt make it worth using. I‚Äôm loving YNAB for over five years and can‚Äôt imagine living without it.
title: Continues to be the best

review: I find this app to be incredibly confusing and overwhelming. I can‚Äôt imagine how this would work for someone who doesn‚Äôt make a ton of money. The app tells me my savings account is ‚Äúto be budgeted,‚Äù but I don‚Äôt  want to spend my savings.. they are there for savings. Additionally I can‚Äôt just budget my checking because that wouldn‚Äôt be enough money. My entire first paycheck of my biweekly paycheck goes to rent. Other than rent I put purchases on a credit card and pay it in full at the end of the month. I think a lot of people live like me so I have no idea why the app makes you budget only money you currently have versus money you know you‚Äôll make later in the month. I haven‚Äôt been able to find a useful tutorial on their website. I‚Äôm really disappointed because I heard great things about this app.
title: Incredibly confusing

developerResponse: {'id': 44738676, 'body': "Hi Jose! Thanks for the great review ‚Äî we are SO STOKED to hear that you're enjoying YNAB, and that you've been with us for 2 years! I've passed those feature requests along to our designers, they love hearing from YNABers (and you're definitely not the only one looking for more reporting on the mobile app!). Here's to many more years of happy YNABing!", 'modified': '2024-06-20T23:53:03Z'}
review:
YNAB has changed my relationship with money. Who knew budgeting could be so fun?
I like the budgeting system and all of the help provided by YNAB. Budgeting is explained in a fun and practical way. 
The app is easy to use once you get the basics down and there is a ton of help available if you need it.
I‚Äôve been using the app for almost 2 years now and I have seen lots of improvements to usability over that time.
My only suggestion is to at more reports and the ability to filter transactions in the app like you can in the web version.
title: Can‚Äôt recommend enough

review:
Budgeting and finances has always been a sore subject for me. A lot of apps just shame you into saying your spending all your money here or there and you feel like you just can‚Äôt get a grip. 

YNAB asks you start TODAY. Don‚Äôt review yesterday or the day before. How much money do you have today and what are your plans for it. That mindset has made me accountable for my money but also assures me that I can spend money on these things I want in my life because I planned for it.

If you‚Äôre willing to put your mind to it. YNAB is incredible
title: Great if you‚Äôre willing to put in the work

developerResponse: {'id': 39132739, 'body': "Hi there, thanks for this awesome review! It sounds like you've really put the YBNAB method to work for you. üôå We're very happy to hear that YNAB has made the game of life a little easier\\-\\-that's a huge win! \\- Jill@YNAB", 'modified': '2023-09-25T18:19:38Z'}
review: I‚Äôve used countless spreadsheets and even a simple notepad for my monthly expenses while also keeping a budget and for whatever reason, I would set it and forget it and have a meltdown when I try to pay my bills, and realize that I haven‚Äôt been keeping track  what I purchase, like groceries and ‚Äúfun‚Äù money. YNAB completely changed everything. All my bills get paid on time, I am able to budget $$ for groceries, gas, and fun money. Thus far, this ‚Äúgame of life‚Äù, is much more manageable and realistic compared to the board game üòÇüòÇüòÇüòÇüòÇüòÇ
title: YNAB makes the ‚Äúthe game of life‚Äù much more manageable

developerResponse: {'id': 35024294, 'body': "Thanks for being a long-time YNABer! You're right that robust reporting is on the web. Our mobile designers would love to hear from you about the mobile reports you'd like to see! Please consider sending a feature request at https://support.ynab.com/en_us/feedback-and-feature-requests-an-overview-rJgD33fAq - Dela@YNAB", 'modified': '2023-02-23T01:00:38Z'}
review:
Long time YNABer here.

Fantastic budgeting app but other budgeting apps have pulled well ahead in some areas which are extremely beneficial on mobile. One of those areas is Reporting. There have been ZERO updates to Reporting tab on mobile in years. When will we see additional reports and useful tooling on this tab? Seeing daily spending trends/patterns, avg daily & weekly spending, cash flow breakdowns, category spending breakdowns on daily, weekly, monthly basis, etc. These are so important for understanding spending habits and having this info with you while you budget on mobile is critical. YNAB has fallen way behind here and needs to enhance very quickly.
title: Report Tab Updates for Mobile

developerResponse: {'id': 31448678, 'body': "Hi AlsoRenovator, I appreciate your thoughtful review! Working only with the money you have *right now* is key to the YNAB Method. The budget can be forward-looking (planning for true expenses, for example), but the focus is on the funds your accounts currently have. If YNAB isn't the right fit for you, we understand! You can reach out to help@ynab.com with any questions about your subscription. -Kathryn @ YNAB", 'modified': '2022-08-14T12:04:14Z'}
review: While okay for budgeting, the app does not allow you to see future account balances. So you have to do the math in your head for cash flow, or as YNAB ‚Äúchallenged‚Äù me - just keep everything in one account. Maybe that is fine when starting out, but they don‚Äôt seem to grasp the concept of interest bearing accounts, large purchases, etc. I guess their demographic is those truly living paycheck to paycheck - which is fine. Being able to see my future balance to know how much to transfer and when seems like an easy and obvious function. Instead, their answer is for me to give up income to use their app. I wish I had done monthly vs. the annual subscription. I will cancel when it comes up and go with a competitor.
title: Okay if you only have a single account and a calculator for cash flow

review: I have tried all the ways to budget with spreadsheets, cash envelopes, other apps, separate spending/saving accounts, etc but never could keep up with it. This one is by far the best! It‚Äôs easy to use, no time consuming, as soon as we get paid I assign what each $ is going to and look here not my bank account so I know how much I have budgeted for! The best part is I have a separate budget for my business and personal. I can‚Äôt wait to stop living pay check to pay check and overspending in personal and my business.
title: Best money managing system ever!

review: I have been using YNAB since the middle of January 2021. My friend recommended it a couple years ago, but I was at the start of a divorce with no consistent access to money and no way to budget. Mid-January I started receiving court ordered funds and I immediately signed up. I am now able to budget successfully. It has really helped me stay within my allotted amount (which isn‚Äôt really enough, but I make it work, thanks to YNAB). I reached out to support a few times, with some tricky situations (to me), and they were quick to respond, as well as kind and understanding.
title: So far so great!

review:
Review of YNAB in general‚Äîhaving used similar budgeting methods for years, I can‚Äôt praise the concept that YNAB espouses enough. The YNAB approach gets you on the path of having your money work for you instead of the other way around. And for committed couples, money will become a subject of pleasure instead of conflict, as it promotes a team mentality instead of being about controlling each other. 

The app is fantastic. The main reason we switched is the ease with which my partner and I can both use it, seamlessly, so that we are always on the same page and in the know. Cannot recommend it highly enough.
title: Excellent app

review:
Dang. This app is pretty life changing. It‚Äôs created lots of good money habits, like checking in on your Finances before committing to big purchases or taking the stress out of spending money when you plan for it. For the first time in my adult life, I have much less ‚Äúfinancial stress‚Äù. Not that there is any more money in my account just by using the app, but I am building habits which will undoubtedly lead to that result. 

The phone app could be better, but it works as a mobile version that I can do quick budgeting and categorization. The web app is much better and comprehensive, but this serves its purpose well.
title: Changes your life

review: It‚Äôs been a tiny but crucial (and probably obvious) shift in my thinking, to check my BUDGET (not my checking balances) BEFORE (not later, when paying bills) making a purchase, but oh what a difference it has made. YNAB‚Äôs software and web app is incredible, and the mobile app keeps things flowing between computer check ins. It‚Äôs easy to log transactions, move money, and generally keep an eye on things. I‚Äôve never had any syncing issues or buggy experiences. Using the app and giving every dollar a job has totally transformed my finances and budgeting life. I actually....dare I say...enjoy it now. Thanks so much YNAB!
title: YNAB Stole my heart

review:
I have never made a review for an app. Ever. But YNAB is more than an app. It has saved me! Before YNAB I was constantly worried about my rent check just barely clearing my account. Now I‚Äôm a solid month ahead plus having extra money to put into investment accounts. I now love paying my bills without anxiety. I use credit cards not because I have to but for the cash rewards. My credit card now pays me cash back. 
The YNAB rules are key. ‚ÄúEvery dollar has a job‚Äù really was the main concept that has help me get ahead. I‚Äôm like a freaking financial genius...working YNAB like a boss.
title: Working YNAB like a boss

review:
This app is absolutely infuriating. I want to like and use it because it‚Äôs a great concept however it‚Äôs the single most frustrating thing I‚Äôve ever laid hands on. IKEA assembly instructions aspire to be this unintuitive and maddening. ‚ÄúThere‚Äôs a learning curve‚Äù is a severe understatement.

To make things worse I finally sort of understood it and made a minor error. If anything is slightly off there‚Äôs a bright red bar on the top of the app screaming for attention. It makes sorting out the budgeting problems even more difficult than they already are. 

It has potential but seriously needs an overhaul because it‚Äôs near unusable. The only reason I‚Äôm not deleting it a day after wrestling with the infernal thing is because I really need to get a budget that works for me. A+ concept but the execution makes me think I‚Äôve died and am being punished in purgatory.
title: Frustrating

review: I recently went on the hunt to find a money management app that I could make multiple budgets in. I was trying to find an easy way to help my older parents out in managing their cash flow. YNAB was the only app that allowed me to do this. After getting everything setup and a few tutorials later, I realized this app is life changing in the way I look at and spend money. I wish I had this 20 years ago when I was going through a tough spot financially. I‚Äôm glad I have it now. I can ditch the spreadsheets. So glad I have YNAB now.
title: Wish I had this 20 years ago.

developerResponse: {'id': 41177424, 'body': 'Thanks for your review! Spending without guilt, having clarity around your saving, and becoming comfortable with unexpected expenses are some huge wins. \\- Aubrey @ YNAB', 'modified': '2024-01-09T12:58:40Z'}
review: It took me some time to figure this app out, but once I did, it was a game changer. I feel more in control of my finances and no longer feel guilty about spending money on things I want because I have plans for them and set the money aside. I have been able to save more than usual and have been comfortable with some unexpected expenses. As someone who always wanted to be fiscally responsible and live below my means but struggled with several different budget techniques, I HIGHLY recommend this app. I think budgeting is fun now. 100% worth the money.
title: Control

developerResponse: {'id': 34846741, 'body': 'Wow ms_erupt! I love that you are taking great advantage of the free year for college students. YNAB is all about empowering you to love the way you spend your money. It sounds like you are there! Thanks for budgeting with us! - Natalie @ YNAB', 'modified': '2023-02-13T20:52:40Z'}
review: So, this app essentially functions as a digital ‚Äúenvelope method‚Äù of budgeting for me. It‚Äôs intuitive and just makes sense for how I look at and spend money. I‚Äôm not even a month in, and I already feel like I have a much clearer picture of my finances presently and into the future. It has allowed me to start anticipating all of those expenses that seem like surprise expenses (but really aren‚Äôt) and put away some cash toward those. As a college student, I am able to take advantage of their free year for students, and am super excited for what the year will bring.
title: Intuitive

developerResponse: {'id': 38786553, 'body': "Thanks for your review. I'm sorry you found YNAB to be too rigid for your financial situation. We are always happy to answer questions to see if YNAB can fit your situation. I wish you the best as you find the right budget for you! \\- Natalie @ YNAB", 'modified': '2023-09-07T19:25:00Z'}
review:
I had high hope for this app, but I had problems with the App the moment that I started to use it. What good is an app that is so rigid that it will not allow you to tailor the app to reflect your life. I refuse to use an app that is going to force some predetermined budget down my throat without allowing me the flexibility to adapt the app to my unique financial situations. Maybe, when your app is much more fluid, I will try it again. Right now, it‚Äôs user interface is so rigid that I canceled my subscription 5 minutes into starting to use the app.

I need an app that I can tailor to fit my unique financial situations. I will not pay money for an app that will require enormous amounts of my time to get it to work than it will ever benefit me.
title: Too Rigid and Lacks Fluidity

review:
No other budget methodologies worked for me before I tried YNAB. But something about the YNAB paradigm, and their brief (1 minute reads) tutorials really clicked for me. I‚Äôve been using it for a year and it‚Äôs helped me pay off a credit card and actually pad some savings. I still have some long-term goals to achieve but just knowing I‚Äôm spending my money responsibly is a whole weight off my shoulders. 

Recently I ran into a bug with the app and contacted support. They were courteous and prompt and solved the issue the same day.

All in all feels like a great product with a great team behind it.
title: Great Support and Life-Changing Paradigm

review:
Been doing YNAB since the new year.  Restarted the budget in Feb and have been reconciled since!  I found the book first and definitely recommend reading that first or in conjunction with starting the app.  
In the midst of the whole quarantine stuff, our family‚Äôs money is at least 30 days old and we were able to deal with buying a new washer and dryer (which we were saving to get in Sept)  With cash.  
If you have not looked at it, HIGHLY recommend it!  Not only do you get the app, but a whole support and education structure.
Love this app and mindset.
title: Peace of Mind

review:
YNAB is an essential tool in my life - using their method of budgeting has completely changed the way I understand budgets and use my money. I recommend YNAB to anyone that asks for money management tips.

Instead of budgeting with what you will make this month you just give every dollar you have to a line item in the budget. Some categories are for long term items that you save for multiple months like a car replacement or renewing hour tabs. Stuff like that seems like much less of a hit on your budget when you set aside $10 a month rather than $120 when tabs are due.
title: Essential

review:
The first time I tried this system, I became very frustrated and quit before my free month was up. The second time I tried it, it clicked. When the tutorial said ‚Äúour most successful users open them app multiple times a day to enter expenses,‚Äù I thought I would never do that. I thought that if budgeting was that much work, it wasn‚Äôt worth making myself miserable. Turns out, I now enter all my expenses on the same day I make them and it is a huge stress reliever.

I think the phone app is better than the web page- though it would be nice to have the ‚Äòundo‚Äô button in the app.
title: It works

review: When looking at total financial control using this system, it seems counterproductive not being able to link and automatically track transactions with loans, but I can see interest and contributions being made in my investment accounts. There is no benefit in having to switch between multiple websites or apps to view current balances of loans just to come back to YNAB and set up a working budget. Should be a one-stop shop for you current financial assessment (balances and net worth). Would be a fully functioning threat if it could automatically track loans. But still better than Mint when it comes to budgeting.
title: Great...but no automatic loan tracking

review: I am not one to write reviews, but YNAB is a powerful tool to get your finances under control and headed in the direction you want. The app itself is great now that you can see, and adjust, your whole budget from your phone. The customer support has always been top notch. There are only a few missing features (that you can only get from the desktop version) that I am sure will get addressed with time.  This app lets multiple users (your spouse!) update and see the budget real time. No question as to what can be spent at the store! Join the YNAB movement- take charge of your money!
title: YNAB gave us confidence to RV full time!

review: I have been using this app for about a year and a half now. This app has helped my wife and I stay on track with our finances and not have quarrels about what we are spending our money on. At first, YNAB takes time to get used to, and you have to be consistent with it in order to make it useful. Linking your bank accounts is a MUST if you get lazy with inputting your transactions. If you are serious about getting your finances in order and to track and stay on target with a budget, take the time to use this app and you won‚Äôt be sorry!
title: BEST BUDGET APP

review: My husband and I read this book at the beginning of medical school residency, and over the course of three years have paid off credit card debt, built up savings, and paid off a 20,000 loan. We will have this app for the rest of our lives. I love that it is on both of our phones so we can both see exactly where we are at all times, I love that it is always up to date. Being in line at the grocery store and inputting the expense at the same time as I‚Äôm purchasing, and getting paid and allocating money are two of my most favorite things ‚ô•Ô∏è
title: Can‚Äôt live without

review: I miskeyed my savings information when setting up the initial expenses and I wasn‚Äôt able to change it. I tried deleting the category and every option in the settings. There was no option to return to a previous step or even start over. I tried logging out and logging back in but nothing worked. Since I was just giving the app a try, I figured I would try deleting my account and creating a new one but after trying each method (Google, Apple, different email, even the recently deleted account information) I was unable to create a new account or login. Grateful I was able to cancel the free trial through Apple, would be pretty hilarious to pay for a subscription to a budget app that I can‚Äôt even use.
title: Unable to edit bank information

review: I loved the idea of this app and I thought it would make things easier. Unfortunately it has made budgeting much more difficult. It has taken 2 months to figure out there system and it is still not functioning how they promised. The biggest setback is that to get any help you have to wait a day or two for an email response. It has been several weeks now going back and forth mainly because when I finally have the time to dedicate a few hrs ( which is what this is requiring) I then have to wait several days to get my questions answered.
title: Help desk takes too long

review: I love this app!  Previously I was budgeting in excel, had several checking/savings accounts and was transferring money all around, running reports in Quicken to see my spending per category.  It was NOT efficient and very confusing.  I stumbled on YNAB and love it!  It‚Äôs so easy to use.  It‚Äôs like digital envelopes. I‚Äôve reduced my spending and am prepared when things come up because I have money in that ‚Äúenvelope‚Äù when needed.  I tell everyone I know about this app.   I never write reviews but am happy to be writing this one!! Get the app, follow the program and you‚Äôll have total control over your $!!
title: Obsessed is an understatement

review: When I first started using the app I‚Äôd be punching in the wrong numbers because the number keypad is flipped from what a calculator, or dialing on a phone would be. I realize it is in the same configuration as a number pad on a keyboard, but I believe it is not ones natural inclination on a phone. Would love to see having an option to change this. Otherwise, great app. Love the features. In the budget tab it does seem that everything is mushed together. There isn‚Äôt a whole lot of differentiation between columns and groupings to make things feel more separate and distinguishable.
title: Love the app, but the numbers keypad

developerResponse: {'id': 44009032, 'body': 'We are just SO GLAD that you found us! ¬´3', 'modified': '2024-05-19T18:32:55Z'}
review: I was the person who lived with constant anxiety about money. The balancing of a checkbook was worse than going to the dentist! I was the one who would wait for checks to clear and when I couldn‚Äôt make sense of my account I would close the account and start a new one with a different bank. YNAB has changed everything for me! I actually look forward to using my budget and am able to see where my money goes. Saving is exciting and being free of credit card debt is the greatest gift. I recommend YNAB to everyone!!
title: YNAB changed my life!

review: I overall like this app but don‚Äôt think they should raise the prices. I have issues all the time with my American Express, it takes multiple days for it to sync in the app. This can make it really hard to actually budget because you don‚Äôt know how much you‚Äôve spent when it takes five days for the transactions to hit. Paying $100 a year is not anything crazy but if you‚Äôre going to raise the prices in my opinion you should make the service better.
title: Prices are going up but service is staying the same

review: Conflict over money issues dials way down when YNAB helps create a common strategy and purpose to our goals. Removing complication and making daily tracking easy but tied to a purpose gets us to talk about bigger things like car purchases, vacation plans, and our goals around Christmas celebrations. Our rainy days are few now that we have a plan for the unexpected. We move together in greater confidence than our rarly married years when money battles put us on opposing teams. YNAB keeps us on the same team where $$$ can‚Äôt squeeze between us. Thanks YNAB.
title: YNAB makes money conversations easier

review:
Between the web app and this mobile app, YNAB has transformed the way I view and spend my money. Before, I‚Äôd just kind of wing it, and somehow I thought I was doing ok. With YNAB I plan ahead and I‚Äôm building a sizable savings. I feel simultaneously rich and poor... Rich because I never worry about paying bills or unexpected expenses. Poor, because I know that if I haven‚Äôt got money budgeted, I‚Äôm not buying that sudden impulse I didn‚Äôt know I wanted 5 minutes ago...
 Thanks to YNAB, I carry no debt and pay everything in cash. I know what my expenses are and I have a hefty emergency fund. I‚Äôm secure and that feels GREAT!
title: Transformed the way I view money

developerResponse: {'id': 40783674, 'body': 'Thanks for your review, Trey! I love how you said, "I\'m never guessing if I have enough to pay for that." That definitely shows your peace of mind around money now. üòä \\- Aubrey @ YNAB', 'modified': '2023-12-19T19:27:27Z'}
review:
I‚Äôve gone on a long journey trying every budget app under the sun. I‚Äôve found that despite the cost YNAB is by far the best to get my finances under control and very manageable. After the initial set up a quick review nightly and I‚Äôm never guessing if I have enough to pay for that. 

Personal finance isn‚Äôt rocket science and the key is spending less than you earn which YNAB helps me do to a T. I‚Äôve seriously tried them all (Simplifi, Pocketguard, Mvelopes, Monarch) and found the most banks/credit cards sync with YNAB. It also has the features that put it above the rest with Reconcile and the pre-planning of transactions ahead of time. 

There are a couple banks that don‚Äôt sync which is a disappointment but I found that‚Äôs not a YNAB problem but that banks problems and any that doesn‚Äôt has lost my business. 

The subscription cost is the only con but I feel it is offset with peace of mind YNAB provides.
title: Tried Them All This is the Best

If you run into any trouble with that, or would like to chat more, send our team a message at help@ynab.com‚Äîwe'd love to dig in with you. - Caity @ YNAB", 'modified': '2024-09-13T21:54:51Z'}
review: Don‚Äôt get me wrong, I‚Äôve loved YNAB for years after I finically figured it out the first time. There‚Äôs been some really weird changes in the app updates as of late that I haven‚Äôt cared for but this new money move screen is just awful!! I no longer have the ability to just straight type in what I want to move from ready to assign to the category without going through that awful new screen. Don‚Äôt like the slider, don‚Äôt like that spinny selector thing for the second category to move to/from. This is not a good change.
