title: New money move screen üëéüèª

developerResponse: {'id': 29449281, 'body': 'Congratulations on achieving those financial goals and thanks so much for the 5-star review and for sharing the word about YNAB! üòÑ - Renae@YNAB -- RENAE | YNAB Support help@youneedabudget.com _April showers bring May flowers...and also changes in your budget! Learn what happens\xa0__When the Month Rolls Over__._ How would you rate my reply?', 'modified': '2022-04-28T11:26:12Z'}
review: I have been a YNABer for 2 years now! Ever since my husband and I got married we have depended on YNAB to help us set and achieve financial goals. I tell everyone I know to get this app! Budgeting has never been a strong suit for me. But YNAB makes it easy and fun! They have very helpful tools to teach you to budget well. They also have highly responsive support staff who are kind, informative, and so so patient. Everyone needs this app! It is a paid program, but it is worth every penny! And they will help you create a budget line for the minimal cost! :)
title: Everyone needs this app!

review:
First off, the app is great and I have no complaints. 
The real story though, is that because of YNAB I am financially healthy and secure. 
As a college student working full time I had 10k in credit card debt from normal life expenses. 
YNAB enabled me to pay it off in one year with my meager 25k/year job. Using YNAB gave me the visibility necessary to figure out where and how my money was being spent. It made me realize that rent was too expensive, so I got roommates. It helped me figure out exactly how much I could spend on groceries; to the penny. 
I am stable and self sufficient and YNAB is the tool that got me here.
title: YNAB is an Essential service in my family

review: I‚Äôve tried to use this app for a couple of years now and in the end, I always need to reset my budget because it becomes entangled with too many non participating 3rd party entities. If you have and use the Apple Card regularly, forget this app. They don‚Äôt play together at all. Yes, you can import your transactions by way of some arcane method that‚Äôs harder than it really needs to be, but then you have to fiddle with the Apple Card money you get for using it. And then if you return something, it‚Äôs gets even more convoluted.  I gave this app a fair shot. More than fair, I think. If I have to delete everything every couple of months for the budget to balance out, then it‚Äôs not working. For me, at least. Your results may vary.
title: Too complicated. Find yourself another option.

review: YNAB has completely changed my financial life‚Äîhow I feel about money and my ability to save, how I track my money, how I talk about money with my fianc√©, etc. I now am always really excited to have new transactions come in for me to categorize, and I love payday not because I get more money (though I do enjoy that), but because I get to budget it! I convinced my friend to try it and now she‚Äôs as obsessed as I am and now she uses is it for her personal accounts and for her business, and she got her husband to start using it. I‚Äôm spreading the YNAB gospel!
title: Changed my financial life!

review: I have been using this app/website since 2017 and it has changed my life. Of course you still need to do the work for yourself, but this app is designed to help you see where you need to be more mindful. I love the goals aspect- it allows you to set a goal and it tracks it for you and even tells you how much you need to stay on track along with the percentage of the way to your goal you are. I LOVE IT and I can‚Äôt recommend it enough!! I finally feel like I will be able to conquer my financial goals because this program helps me create the plan to get there!
title: 4 Year User

review: I have been using YNAB since 2012 and there is no other software out there that can compare. I had Mvelopes for awhile but although you have to account for every penny and stick to a spending plan, there was absolutely no flexibility if priorities had to change. YNAB online and app is the most powerful and user friendly software I could have ever hoped for, and I have tried many. Budgeting still takes discipline but it lets you prioritize your decisions. Will probably always use it. Can‚Äôt live without it because I always know where I stand and what needs attention.
title: Like no other

review:
I‚Äôve had this app for years and used to genuinely love it. It really helps you only spend money you actually have, encourages paying credit cards used in full, and is a great way to track accounts from all over in one place. 

BUT.

Lately it seems to never want to connect to my banks. I know some of this is bank security changing but when I even try to work on my Chase connection it fails. When you add an account under an existing login it gets cranky. I so want to love it but why am I paying for something that hardly works anymore? Every single account I have has a connection error and between me and my husband, that‚Äôs a lot of accounts. :(  (BofA, Chase, AmEx, USAA, and Wintrust)
title: Getting buggy...

review:
I loved this system when I started. I don‚Äôt have the time or energy to input every expense by hand, so the sync feature where it would automatically pull my spending and I could just categorize it was perfect for me.

YNAB was seamless for my first six months. Then suddenly Venmo stopped connecting automatically and I had to log in every time. It was annoying, but I hoped the bug would be fixed. Six months later Venmo stopped connecting at all, so I had to input everything by hand. I contacted YNAB several times and they always said they were working on it, but eventually they just announced it was incompatible. 

I kept going since it was only one account that was incompatible, but over the last couple months two more of my accounts (Goldman Sachs and Capital One) also stopped connecting. So now I have to input those by hand too.

Since the whole purpose of this app (for me) was that they pulled spending and I didn‚Äôt have to parse through each receipt/charge one by one, it is now futile for me. I‚Äôm going to ride out my subscription, and then cancel. I‚Äôm disappointed because I loved it so much at first.
title: Cancelling after years

review: YNAB has legitimately changed my life! Not long ago the father of my fianc√© sat me down and told me he was concerned about my financial situation, and he was right - I had $1000 in the bank and it wasn‚Äôt improving. I started using YNAB, following their tips and tricks from their plethora of YNAB content, and now only 2 years later I‚Äôm married, own a house, have a baby on the way, have a dog, bought a car with cash, and have a comfortable budget that will help protect me with unexpected emergencies happen. I seriously can‚Äôt thank YNAB enough for helping me get my financials into shape!
title: YNAB is a Game Changer!

developerResponse: {'id': 35002979, 'body': "We'd love to get these things addressed! Will you please reach out at help@ynab.com? We'll investigate and help you move forward confidently. - Dela@YNAB", 'modified': '2023-02-22T03:00:57Z'}
review:
My Ynab has been having really terrible bugs for months, they never fix the issues. I‚Äôm leaving then a 1 star review until they address my concerns because this is completely unacceptable for a paid subscription:

1.) Getting multiple Ynab pending transactions placed into the incorrect accounts.

2.) Ynab is also creating duplicate transactions and sometime even marking the incorrect ones as cleared. Ynab is not removing pending transactions when bank notes them as no longer pending, multiple days after that occurs in the bank. Meaning, auto import of transactions is working extremely poorly.

3.) If I delete an incorrect pending transaction sometimes that action will also delete a correct, cleared, and already budgeted/addressed transaction out of no where. This creates absolutely havoc in the budget.

4.) I‚Äôm getting random transactions that are searchable, but they don‚Äôt show on the account list or all accounts list. What the heck is going on with Ynab?

These bugs are ridiculous and I‚Äôm considering jumping ship for good. We will see how Ynab addresses these major issues.
title: Bug ridden experience for a paid subscription, unacceptable

review: While there is a learning curve that comes with the YNAB method, it has nothing to do with the app itself. The YNAB method combined with the amazing app has been absolutely transformative for my family‚Äôs finances. While we were frugal and decent at managing money before, this enabled us to take control in a way we had never been able to without feeling trapped by budgets that never take into account the fact that (especially with kids) some budget categories are always in flux. I recommend YNAB to all of my friends.
title: The budget app that beats them all

review: I cannot say enough amazing things about this app! It has seriously changed the way I think about money and handle my finances. It has seriously helped me manage my budget through a job change & COVID unemployment. I‚Äôve been telling everyone I know to try this app. If I had designed a budget app myself, this is what I would‚Äôve wanted it to do. The ONLY small suggestion I have is that it allow you to add a photo of the receipt to each transaction. Seems kinda old school but for business owners and 1099 workers it would be super helpful come tax time.
title: LOVE this app! 1 small recommendation...

review:
I‚Äôve been running into issue where I have to reconcile my budget/accounts. I assumed that this was due to me entering an item wrong or missing something. All the while, there were continued sync issues with credit card banks where the balances would completely reset and only show recent payments. This out negative balances over. 

It took me a while to notice this and make the connection- but this was why I‚Äôve been needing to reset my entire budget. If the credit cards aren‚Äôt able to sync, fine, but the balances changing and throwing off the entire budget is very inconvenient.
title: Credit Card Sync Issues Throw Everything Off

review:
I have found YNAB exceptionally helpful. I have ADD, and easily lose when and what I‚Äôve budgeted. YNAB‚Äôs mobile app means I can budget when I think of it, so it actually gets done.
It also encourages me to think ahead and set up annual and emergency categories, not just my monthly needs. It is easily worth the subscription.
The credit card function of a little confusing, so I would recommend looking online for their tutorials and explanation videos if you use your credit card regularly. The in-app explanation wasn‚Äôt helpful for me.
 I definitely recommend YNAB for personal finances.
title: Very helpful

review: The setup and interface and method behind YNAB are SO much more straightforward and easy to get started than Mint or other similar options. The concept of just starting with what you have‚Äînot worrying about projecting into the future or estimating much of anything‚Äîand giving every dollar a job makes it so much less stressful to get going. It‚Äôs simple and understandable, the explanations and tutorials are actually really helpful, it‚Äôs pragmatic, it‚Äôs not condescending, they‚Äôre not selling your data to give you credit offers... TOTALLY worth the subscription cost. Give it a shot.
title: Only budgeting app that‚Äôs worth it

review: YNAB has been such a help to my wife and I. It allows us to easily assign ‚Äúevery dollar a home‚Äù and helps us each month stay on top of our budget. It lets you know what transactions come in, whether it‚Äôs a purchase or a direct deposit. Plus, you can record transactions right on the spot, so that way your budget is updated throughout the day. We used to just use old fashion paper and pen for our budget, but YNAB has given us a way to consistently budget and steward our money, and is a tool that has given us financial peace. It‚Äôs cheap, and I definitely recommend it!
title: Great product, must get

developerResponse: {'id': 1461158, 'body': "Hey There ~ That connection issue is not related to the new version, so rest assured there. But we do know it is tedious to reauthorize every time. ;) We're working on it! Thanks for using YNAB and sharing some feedback.", 'modified': '2017-10-10T09:34:21Z'}
review:
This app is truly amazing and has radically changed how I budget. I‚Äôve been with YNAB for over 4 years and STILL love it. 

Their customer service also seems really responsive which is comforting. 

My only beef is one that I had commented on before but YNAB has a hard time updating my accounts automatically. I also will see a triangle with an exclamation point next to my accounts all the time and I‚Äôm confused why it keeps happening. It seems to be a back end issue. Hopefully they will resolve this issue soon and I will give them a 5 star rating.
title: Life changing but with a recent glitch

developerResponse: {'id': 39707674, 'body': "Thanks for this awesome review\\-\\-we're glad to hear you enjoy using YNAB! It sounds like you've really put the YNAB method to work for you. üéâ \\- Jill@YNAB", 'modified': '2023-10-24T12:24:19Z'}
review: It admittedly took me a couple tries to really ‚Äúget‚Äù why YNAB works, but once it clicked I never went back. Their system is similar to a digital version of envelope budgeting, and it works really well. The app is pretty nicely designed for a relatively complex system, and they‚Äôre good with updates and release notes. I appreciate that they do their best to support many of iOS‚Äôs annual feature releases. While I can‚Äôt think of a good reason to use Live Activities with budgeting, but if there is one I bet YNAB would figure it out.
title: An excellent budgeting app and system

review:
Im totally addicted to this app! I love it so much and it‚Äôs so functional. They‚Äôve really thought of everything when it comes to budgeting. I use it for personal and small business and it‚Äôs just magic. 

I used to use EveryDollar for several years but when it stopped importing my transactions, I had to find something else. At the time I was upset I had to change systems, but now I‚Äôm so happy that happened so that I could move over to YNAB! 

Thanks YNAB for the entertaining videos (Hannah especially), the great email support, and the best budgeting app ever!
title: Im addicted üòÇ

developerResponse: {'id': 37897573, 'body': "Thanks for your feedback here. I'm sorry you feel like YNAB has made missteps. I wish you all the best in finding the right budgeting solution for you! - Natalie @ YNAB", 'modified': '2023-07-25T19:22:40Z'}
review: I‚Äôve been a YNAB user since before there was a mobile app. It used to be great and it helped me get out of debt and build wealth. However, over recent years it seems like every design decision they‚Äôve made has been a misstep, sacrificing the actual practicality and usefulness of the app for superficial shine and what I can only assume is an effort to dumb down the system in order to attract lazy people who won‚Äôt commit to actual budgeting. The company doesn‚Äôt seem interested in feature requests or feedback from its longtime users about their bad design choices. On top of all that, MX is a terrible aggregator that adds yet another layer of constant frustration to using the app. The system I learned and loved is now a shadow of what it used to be and, sadly, I‚Äôm moving on.
title: Used To Be Great, Not Anymore

review: This app and system is great- it allowed me to get control of my money, pay off a bunch of debt, and maintain some sense of sanity, especially during COVID 19. However, the iPad app is still missing one crucial feature- it can‚Äôt reconcile accounts. If your bank is not supported for auto import, then you have to revert to the web app. On the phone, this is fine, but if you‚Äôre working on an iPad, this app is useless. You‚Äôre far better off using the web app. Please add the reconcile feature to the app!!!
title: Great- but iPad needs the RECONCILE feature!

review:
I decided to give YNAB a three month trial, after my thousandth frustration with Quicken. That was two years ago and i've never looked back. Originally I was concerned about the "budgeting" philosophy, and i've come to love it. 

I'm specifically posting a good review today to give a shout out to the customer service. Every time I have had a problem their team has been amazingly responsive and helpful. And they always seem to get it. I have never had to reply to an email saying, "No, you misunderstood my first email." They got the extra mile with detailed steps to correct the problem. Of course, 99% of the time, the problem has been user error!

I have a few small nitpicks about things you can't do on the app, only via the web, but if you get to this same level of detail, it only means you too are loving the program. 

I would strongly encourage trying the YNAB system. It's been great for me.
title: Great system and GREAT customer service

review: I cannot say enough good things about YNAB. They do an incredible job with their app and online software. I love how easy it is to organize transactions and be extremely cognizant of where my money is going. As any ‚Äúnew year financial resolution‚Äù blog will tell you, this is the first and most essential step. You absolutely need to know where your money is going in order to manage it well and help you to overcome yourself and your ‚Äúin the moment‚Äù bad spending habits. Knowing I‚Äôm keeping track of it helps me to make smarter choices, and YNAB is a beautiful app that helps me accomplish just that.
title: Perfect App, perfect program

developerResponse: {'id': 34992185, 'body': "Thank you so much for your review here, Rich! It's great that YNAB is just what you were looking for. Thanks for budgeting with us! - Natalie @ YNAB", 'modified': '2023-02-21T13:11:11Z'}
review: It was with gratitude that I paid the fee after the 34-day trial. it‚Äôs great software, it‚Äôs a great community, and it‚Äôs a great philosophy of managing your money well. I looked for great financial software like this for years. I don‚Äôt think any other software helps you understand the finite nature of your income as well as YNAB. Plus, you can create additional budgets for your side hustle, or to experiment with different ways of budgeting your money. And now, with YNAB Together, you can share YNAB with family members at no additional cost. I really feel like the team at YNAB is for me.
title: 10 Stars

review: This app has completely changed my life financially. Before I started using it last summer (2020), I was basically living the way I always have; paycheck to paycheck. I make pretty decent money but was just never able to save anything or curb my poor spending habits. I now 32 years old and have more money in savings than I have ever had in my entire life. I know how much money I will need every month no matter what for rent, utilities, etc, and I no longer worry about money for extra things I enjoy doing. YNAB is INCREDIBLE.
title: More than worth it

review: I have used YNAB for close to 10 years. YNAB 4 was fantastic. I recommended it to all my friends. Then they changed to a subscription basis, which I could have lived with if they left it as it was in YNAB 4. When I transitioned over I lost close to 6 or 7 years of records because the new rules were retroactive and went back and messed up years of work. I have been considering leaving YNAB already because of the changes they have made. It used to be great. Now if you overspend a category it automatically takes it out of somewhere else. Not always making it clear. So credit card spending gets completely out of whack. I should never have to budget for a credit card. This last price increase is the last straw. They are not worth it.
title: YNAB has lost it‚Äôs Touch

review:
Does not sync with any bank to find your bills or your balance. Does not sync with any utility to find you bills or balance. It entirely depends on you to fill out, track, and manage every single part of creating and maintaining a budget, with zero helpful input or instructions. Save 100$/year, grab a piece of paper and you now have an alternative to YNAB with the same features.

Edit: okay, it can sync your balances from your banks. But it does not let you create new bill categories after the first screen. So unless you already know how much you spend on every bill and when you spend it, this app is useless. And, if you already know how much you spend and where to the point where you can properly set this up, you don't need this app.
title: Garbage.

review:
I‚Äôve been an annual subscriber for a few years now and have had a great experience with it. I just looked at the new prices for the subscriptions coming soon (December 2021) and found the monthly subscription rate ($15/month) to border on predatory. That‚Äôs $180 a year for this app.

That‚Äôs almost double the annual rate. 

I hope most people using this app long term are on the annual subscription because while its convenience is still worth it at the annual price ($100 a year), I don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs worth the monthly price. I worry people who can‚Äôt afford the annual price start in on a monthly subscription and end up paying out the ears for this app.
title: Love this app but‚Ä¶

developerResponse: {'id': 41799228, 'body': "Thank you for sharing your story, and congratulations on the huge strides you've made financially! We appreciate you speaking from your experience. \\- Aubrey @ YNAB", 'modified': '2024-02-06T19:30:13Z'}
review: I know I risk sounding histrionic but I am a YNAB evangelist.  When I started using YNAB in 2016, I had just been served papers for delinquent debt and had a court ordered payment plan, and a credit score in the high 400s.  My money was a mess and it stressed me out.  Two years later I had fixed my credit, paid off most debt, and qualified for a first time home buyers loan.  I learned to manage my money and feel secure because I had a plan.  And now I don‚Äôt shut up about it and YNAB has helped a lot of my friends get control of their finances, too.
title: YNAB changed my life

developerResponse: {'id': 41799237, 'body': 'Thanks for leaving a review! We are happy to answer any questions you have about getting YNAB set up. You can email us at help@ynab.com. We can also help with the upcoming charge. üëç \\- Natalie @ YNAB', 'modified': '2024-02-06T19:31:17Z'}
review:
I‚Äôm bad at budgeting. I went all in on YNAB to get a handle on my finances and I just have to be honest with myself, this is too much. I‚Äôm not dumb but this app makes me feel like it. I had my brother in law coach me on setting it up but still can‚Äôt wrap my head around it. Finally throwing in the towel. 

Probably a great app for people who are analytical and good with spreadsheets. However I feel as though the type of person who thrives with YNAB is probably capable making quality spreadsheets on their own. 

Also, I paid for the yearly subscription in fall 2023 and I found out YNAB was going to charge me another $98 in March. Idk what that‚Äôs about.
title: Great if you‚Äôre already good at budgeting

developerResponse: {'id': 30201829, 'body': "Thank you so much for the five-star rating and helpful review, Spectre61! I'm really glad to hear that YNAB has made it easier for you to budget with your spouse. I totally understand wanting to find YNAB sooner, but we're glad you're here now! ‚ù§Ô∏è - Kat @ YNAB", 'modified': '2022-06-07T00:24:57Z'}
review: Heard about YNAB a few years ago, loved the philosophy of zero based budgeting and YNAB‚Äôs 4 rules. Thought it was crazy to spend $ on an app when I could use excel for free. Budgeted with excel on and off for 3 years. If life happened and I didn‚Äôt keep the budget up for a few weeks it was such a pain to catch up. Also the spreadsheet wasn‚Äôt easy for my spouse to access or understand due to my convoluted system and abbreviations. Using the YNAB app has made all the difference. Wish I started using it earlier!!!!
title: Best thing ever for my finances & my marriage!!!!

review:
I‚Äôll keep it short and sweet...this app is by far the best budgeting app. I have tried many and this one just makes sense. 1 thing would make it perfect....

The big issue I have is the lack of reporting built in. I am a huge nerd and like to have reports and statistics that I can have easily populate. I understand YNAB philosophy, but to me age of money and net worth is not all that useful when glancing in the app. 
PLEASE ADD MORE REPORTS!! Better yet, allow for some custom reporting. (I will note that I am aware of 3rd party options that YNAB supports that has extra reporting but I would rather trust built in YNAB versus unknown 3rd party)
title: Reporting

review: I love this app. I have more money in my account than ever between paychecks thanks to this. But I have two main complaints. The first is that it‚Äôs supposed to sync from your accounts every day, but it doesn‚Äôt. It syncs for me maybe once a week. So I find that sometimes there is a difference from what I have and what is in YNAB. I do add manually as well but somethings like recurring charges I don‚Äôt and would like it to sync faster. Secondly, I don‚Äôt like that your savings accounts are accounted for in the budget. I feel it makes it HARDER to see how much I saved that month, not easier. Not sure how to fix that
title: I like it A LOT but some complaints

review: I have used this software for a number of years and it has helped me get a handle on my spending. At first I was really annoyed when the app was updated to show I overspent in a category by showing the number of overspent categories on the app icon. But you know what, that visual reminder has done wonders to make me address the overspending problem. I just wish one of my banks would fix their export process so I don‚Äôt have to swap fields when importing into YNAB because It causes problems when I use the direct connection option (I.e. I cannot use that option).
title: It works for me

review:
A little tricky to get the hang of at first, but totally worth figuring out. They have videos to help teach you. 

Would like to see a ‚Äúnotes‚Äù feature & options added to swipe in the budget categories module. Rather than just swipe to ‚Äúmove money‚Äù, also have other options like ‚Äúdetails‚Äù (where the goals info is at). And maybe swipe left to ‚Äúhide‚Äù a category.

It would also be really cool & helpful to have a module where we can pre-budget a check, so that once it hits the account we‚Äôve already planned how it will be spent. There‚Äôs no way to do that now without it messing with your actual working budget.
title: Super helpful app

developerResponse: {'id': 36936833, 'body': 'Thanks so much for this review! I love that the YNAB Method and app have helped you so much. No more money stress is a big deal! üéâ \\- Natalie @ YNAB', 'modified': '2023-06-05T15:24:56Z'}
review:
There was a time in my life when I was skating paycheck to paycheck. I would make spending decisions based on the balance of my checking account, not realizing that that money was already spoken for later in the month! It was stressful and I wasn‚Äôt saving. 

Enter YNAB. It‚Äôs just the best ‚Äúenvelope method‚Äù app out there. You give your money a job, and then spend based on those jobs. It makes it easier to save, easier to plan, and takes the stress out of money for me. 

And the automatic reconciliation is great too. I never miss an unexpected charge because it imports automatically from my various accounts. I never accidentally pay for a subscription I‚Äôm not using as a result. 

It‚Äôs not cheap, which is the hardest part about selling it to other people. But it‚Äôs worth every penny. It would be worth it at twice the price. And they have a great refund policy, so there‚Äôs no risk. Just try it!
title: YNAB changed my life

developerResponse: {'id': 35815187, 'body': 'Thank you for this fabulous review! We are so happy you found us. ü§© If you need any help getting your new budget up and running, please reach out to us at help@ynab.com. -Jill@YNAB', 'modified': '2023-04-06T17:05:09Z'}
review:
We decided to get serious about money and started the Dave Ramsey plan using EveryDollar in March. EveryDollar was ok-ish. We need more though. So then we tried another app. Found one for $50 a year but it was just to much and hard to use. So then this morning at 6:30 am I was perusing the interwebs in Safari and found this app. 

My three musts were work on all my devices with either a web app or downloadable app. 

Be easy to use and have great self help support that explains things with a metaphorical crayon and construction paper approach because I am not big on waiting around and finance isn‚Äôt my strongest area. 

Be affordable

Even though we only met little over 12 hours ago YNAB I think I am in love. This is exactly what we needed for our budgeting. I am a fan of zero based budgeting. So I will be budgeting in a yearly as soon as Apple refunds the money from the trash I was trying to use.
title: Just Get the App

review:
Love, love, love this app! I tried many different apps, spreadsheets, etc. to find something that would actually work for managing my husband‚Äôs and my finances - and this one finally did the trick! 

It truly is helping us make better spending decisions and save more than we ever thought we would. Date nights are stress-free when we know the money is there because we already allocated it! 

The web browser app is a little clunky, but 5 stars all the way for this app. Love their personable customer service and tip articles as well. Thanks YNAB!
title: A budgeting system that finally works

review: I‚Äôve been using YNAB since I was a college student ten years ago, and I love it. Seriously, these guys should pay me to be an ambassador since I talk about them so much! Haha! It‚Äôs helped me stay on track with my spending and got me through a rough time when I was living paycheck-to-paycheck, paying crazy health bills, and was afraid of not having money for rent. It helped me put my dollars in the right places. Now I‚Äôm trying to save up for a new car and it‚Äôs keeping me focused. They‚Äôre also a bunch of nerds, which comes out in the software and their educational videos, and I love that. I seriously adore YNAB.
title: YNAB is BAE

review: Finally, a tool that helps align how we spend our money everyday with what we actually want to accomplish in the short, medium, and long-term. This app is powerful because it is flexible and you can make it do almost anything. Pick your priorities, then give every dollar you have a job to help accomplish those priorities. I have used the software and app for several years now and I cannot believe how this has helped my wife and I align ourselves and make amazing progress toward our goals. I cannot recommend this app more highly!
title: Tool to Empower You to Accomplish whatever you want!!

developerResponse: {'id': 39133128, 'body': "Hi there, thanks for this great review. We're so glad to hear you've enjoyed using YNAB, and that you've had excellent experiences with our support staff! Thanks for including some feedback as well. We'll keep it in mind as we continue to improve YNAB. \\- Jill@YNAB\r\n\u200b\r\n\u200b", 'modified': '2023-09-25T18:49:43Z'}
review:
I‚Äôve used a lot of different budgeting services (Mint, YNAB, Quicken, etc) and YNAB is by far the best. I appreciate the fact that they encourage entries to be created manually so that people are familiar with their account. The overall philosophy is the best and actually encourages real budgeting. It has a bit of a learning curve, but after a few months it‚Äôs pretty natural. The app is designed well, it‚Äôs stable, and the customer support is excellent. Their development pace is also excellent.

My only complaint is the intrusive and disruptive requests for feedback.
title: Best in Class

developerResponse: {'id': 37593676, 'body': "Hey elayners\\_7! I'm so glad to hear that YNAB was the right fit for you and helps you plan for the unexpected! Great work customizing your budget to the exact level of granularity that's right for you! \\- Kat @ YNAB", 'modified': '2023-07-10T20:53:49Z'}
review: I‚Äôve tried a variety of budgeting tools and I‚Äôve landed on YNAB because of how it works the way people actually behave and not just on wishful thinking and an empty promise to yourself. YNAB is extremely granular and perfect for detail oriented and organized people. It does have a learning curve so if you want it to work, you‚Äôll need to carve out some time to understand it. Once you know the general sense, it will make everything easier, more realistic, and help you plan for unexpected purchases.
title: Such a unique and useful way to budget my money

developerResponse: {'id': 29577360, 'body': "Thanks for taking the time to update your review, Gena! It sounds like you've paid down another large chunk of debt since your last review -- congratulations on doing that while still spending on things you enjoy. Keep up the great work! -Kat@YNAB -- KAT | YNAB Support help@youneedabudget.com _Plan your PTO! How to use YNAB to\xa0__budget your days off__._ How would you rate my reply?", 'modified': '2022-05-05T15:06:29Z'}
review:
I have never budgeted prior to YNAB and I‚Äôm extremely happy I started! YNAB allowed me to take control over my finances and stop living paycheck to paycheck.

In about 2 years, I‚Äôve paid off about $20  25,000 in debt and student loans without compromising or really restricting the fun things in life like dining out or travel. It takes time to get used to and you will make mistakes but it is well worth every penny. I have and will continue to recommend ynab to anyone who wants to take control of their finances and have piece of mind.
title: Best financial decision I‚Äôve made!

review: This is by far the best software I‚Äôve ever used for budgeting and money tracking. The sync between the computer and my phone is instant. I love that I can enter transactions as I spend and see what‚Äôs left in category balances in real time. I love that I can use it on any computer with Internet access. It‚Äôs well worth the yearly fee they charge. This software turned my life around financially. Overdrafts are a thing of the past and my bank accounts keeping climbing as I build up category balances for the future! Best financial software ever!!
title: Look no further for budgeting software...

review: YNAB has changed my life! And I don‚Äôt say that lightly. The way you budget on YNAB makes so much sense and it has helped my husband and I to reach all of our financial goals for the year and more! Knowing where every penny is and having money put away for different categories like auto and home maintenance make sit so that when things go wrong and we need to fix the car or buy a new door for the house, the money is already set aside for it and it doesn‚Äôt feel like a burden. I think that‚Äôs the best benefit of YNAB: if you use it well and consistently, it really relieves financial burdens.
title: I LOVE YNAB

review:
Bank sync used to be a little suboptimal, it‚Äôs now completely broken (unless you classify ‚Äúworking‚Äù as resyncing multiple times each day, buggy reauthorizations, delayed transactions, some institutions still not working at all, etc).

This degrades YNAB to the point of not being worth the price of an ongoing subscription.

When bank sync is working this is the absolute best budgeting tool available. Hopefully they get their act together before they lose their subscriber base.
title: Do not subscribe until they fix bank sync!

review:
Super frustrated with YNAB.  I hate their system and way of screwing you over on the first of each month. 

The good: nice layout, great job pulling regular updates from the bank (this is the reason I use them).

The bad: defaults to the wrong month constantly, can‚Äôt rename things on the app, have to go to the web, MOVES MONEY WITHOUT ASKING.

Yes, that is right, the biggest issue I have is that on the turn of the month, it just moves your money without asking to cover negative envelopes....DO NOT MOVE MY MONEY! I want those negative as I am expecting reimbursements.  What does some generic, end of the month, have anything to do with when you do this anyway??? Most people get paid every 2 weeks, so ‚Äúend of month‚Äù is some relative bogus selection anyway.  Most importantly, your philosophy is great...philosophically.  Not in the real world.  Work reimbursements need to go negative, allowance envelopes, heck pretty much ANY envelope I choose to go negative should be left alone.  DO NOT MOVE MY MONEY!
This creates a MASSIVE amount of time and effort to go back and forth to put the money back where it belonged.  
This is ridiculous.
title: NIce looking program, great job on pulls, but it MOVES YOUR MONEY WITHOUT ASKING!!!

review: If you don‚Äôt have a budget you only find out what happened to your $.   There is a slim chance you will be financially successful without a budget.  Get started with You Need A Budget and realize this can be fun and it makes financial decisions so much easier when you have a budget.  If you do budget you need YNAB because it makes it so much easier to tell your money what to do.  Give every dollar a job and start telling your money what to do, feel peaceful with your financial future use YNAB!
title: Wonderful way to manage home finances

review: Long time YNAB user. I just switched from the old desktop version to the new web based and love it. Wish I made the switch months ago. Their tech support was awesome helping me with the transition. The automatic importing is a game changer helping us to stay up to date. We‚Äôve been on a budget since we first got married (> 20 years) and this has been the easiest method yet (I‚Äôm the detailed money guy and she is not). My wife even likes working with the new app and web based software. Well done YNAB!
title: Great app, even better customer support!

review: I have been through, paid for, tried, failed just about every single other kind of budget, budgeting app, book, system, etc out there!!! YNAB WORKS!!! It‚Äôs actually exciting to check my budget now and seeing the age of my money rise. This is the first time I‚Äôve actually had money accumulate in my accounts and it feels great!!!! Highly HIGHLY recommend trying to anyone that can‚Äôt figure out or is scared or ready to give up on budgeting. I was, and I‚Äôm so happy I gave YNAB a shot!! I feel like my life (and money) will change for the better for good now!!
title: Only thing I‚Äôve had work!!!

review: We never had a problem paying our bills and apart from our mortgage, don‚Äôt have any debt. YNAB really helps us track our money and has given us additional confidence to invest/save in larger amounts. We aren‚Äôt struggling kids trying to get a handle on our finances, we‚Äôre Generation X‚Äôers in our peak earning years. The app is okay, but I‚Äôd really like additional reports, like those available on the desktop version or better. Let‚Äôs see reports on monthly spend, etc.. This would be useful when calculating what a person would need for retirement. I know this program is geared toward younger users, but you could do so much more with the app. What do you think?
title: Not enough reports available

developerResponse: {'id': 41057063, 'body': 'Thanks for leaving a review! I love that YNAB has helped you reached your financial goals and take the stress out of unexpected purchases. So happy to have you YNABing with us! \\- Natalie @ YNAB', 'modified': '2024-01-03T15:09:16Z'}
review: I used to have a lot of anxiety around money because I never knew whether I was spending ‚Äútoo much‚Äù or not. Once I created a budget with YNAB, I had established clear financial goals and could easily determine whether I was meeting them or not. Furthermore, it took the stress out of making unexpected purchases in the moment. After an unexpected purchase, I always know that I can sit down with my budget and strategize about where I can cut spending in other categories to stay on track for the month.
title: YNAB changed my life

developerResponse: {'id': 2145054, 'body': "Hi LilRedheadedGirl7 -- We can definitely help you with your category and matching issues -- just send a message to help@youneedabudget.com and let us know what's happening!  \n\nOur Direct Import connection with your banks will only import transactions that are cleared by your bank - usually within 12 hours of clearing.  We can also help you with any issues you're seeing there!", 'modified': '2017-12-27T15:07:05Z'}
review:
Update:  the developer finally responded to my concerns. But the answers provided do not answer anything. 

Despite waiting 24 hours, many transactions still do not sync. And the categories issues persist. Matching is maddening. I still HATE this app. 

Original Review:
I wanted to love this app. On the surface, it looks to have everything I wanted, such as integration with my accounts so transactions could be loaded automatically, the ability to add my own categories, and use of both desktop and app. 

But I hate it. The integration rarely works. The categories are not as flexible as I‚Äôd like because I can‚Äôt use some of the fields sometimes, several of my banks are not accessible via the automatic feed, they introduced some functionality that is stupid ‚Äî it‚Äôs not helpful and it junks up the screen. I can‚Äôt always ‚Äúmatch‚Äù something I‚Äôve entered manually with the transaction that comes in automatically, but in order to actually use it for budgeting, I need to know in real time what money is in my accounts. The feed is supposed to show the next day. It often doesn‚Äôt.

I‚Äôve just found this tool maddening. Don‚Äôt waste your time.
title: It‚Äôs not a budget; it‚Äôs a waste of time

developerResponse: {'id': 43199881, 'body': "Hi EZB808‚ÄîI‚Äôm sorry it's taken so long to get your questions resolved! If you email us at [help@ynab.com](mailto:help@ynab.com) responses will come to your email instead of through the app. While there are times it can take 48 hours to get a first reply, our goal is for ongoing conversations to get responses much faster. \\- Angela @ YNAB", 'modified': '2024-04-11T10:56:05Z'}
review: I started using YNAB in December. I love many of the features, especially how credit cards are treated like debits. However, I have made mistakes and had questions, and if I want support, there is a two day turn-around and the communication doesn‚Äôt come to my text or email but to my app. There have been several time where I almost ditched the app because there was no ready customer support. I recommended the app to others with the caveat that you have to figure stuff out and if you have questions, you maybe get answers in 48 hours and if you have follow up questions, it takes another 48 hours.
title: Need timely help

developerResponse: {'id': 31298300, 'body': "Thank you so much! We really believe that budgeting is an active and engaged process (and the YNAB method is a big part of that!) and I'm so glad that is resonating with you. We absolutely love hearing you're finding budgeting not only rewarding - but also fun! Thanks so much for being a YNABer and sharing your experience! -Becca @ YNAB", 'modified': '2022-08-05T11:54:48Z'}
review: There are innumerable budgeting apps out there. YNAB is different. It doesn‚Äôt pretend to budget for you. Rather, it provides a framework to make budgeting for yourself an efficient, rewarding and (depending on how you get your kicks) fun process. Like most valuable things, there is a learning curve. Expect it and work at it and you will be happier for it. YNAB offers great support along the way and there‚Äôs a deeply committed community of users as well. If you‚Äôre serious about managing your personal finances, give YNAB a thorough try.
title: If you‚Äôre serious about budgeting, this is THE app

developerResponse: {'id': 35577178, 'body': "Hi there! We're so happy to hear that you're enjoying YNAB so far. Thank you much for this thoughtful review. You were spot on when you you said YNAB isn't intended to be passive. It's definitely designed to help you make proactive choices with your money! -Jill@YNAB", 'modified': '2023-03-24T23:10:57Z'}
review:
Understanding the philosophy and thinking behind YNAB was the hardest part. What made it easier for me was to think of categories as physical buckets to put cash in. I‚Äôm oversimplifying it for sure but things started to click a lot more after I understood. 

The app itself works great, the user experience is very smooth and the ease of use makes it easier to be more active in maintaining your budget goals (as YNAB isn‚Äôt a passive budgeting method, it‚Äôs very active). Overall I‚Äôm happy with the app and the service.
title: Great once you understand the YNAB philosophy

review: There‚Äôs nothing quite like YNAB and it‚Äôs not even close when it comes to other budgeting strategies, apps and software programs out there. YNAB gives you complete control over every penny to your name and that‚Äôs something invaluable. I find the mobile app to be sufficient for quickly checking in on my balances and budgeted categories, but the desktop version will give you the complete YNAB experience. Highly recommend pairing the app and desktop together so you can achieve your financial freedom!
title: YNAB Changes Everything

review: YNAB is the center of my personal financial management. It is truly a phenomenal tool and I can‚Äôt imagine managing my finances without it. The only reason I don‚Äôt give it five stars is that there have been persistent, long term problems direct importing transactions from one of my financial institutions that their direct import partners have been unable to resolve. I track my finances closely enough that entering transactions for this one account manually is no big deal, but the point is they offer direct import as a capability - and I pay for it - and for this one account, they do not deliver.
title: Indispensable!

review: My husband and I have been using this app for 5+ years but can no longer justify the cost. We were told our rate was grandfathered in several years ago and now our cost has over doubled ‚Äî complete disregard for our grandfathered rate. Thankfully our renewal date isn‚Äôt for another 8 months, but in the meantime we‚Äôll be looking for another budgeting app. We no longer can recommend this app to friends; not for this price. In a time when we‚Äôre trying to save a little extra for some bigger purchases down the road, this app no longer can take priority; which is pretty unfortunate since it has changed our mindset on budgeting and really helped us learn how to manage our money.
title: Great software; don‚Äôt recommend due to price.

review:
I‚Äôve been using ynab since October. The last six months I have been able to watch my account go from pennies between paychecks, to having a completely untouched paycheck in my account on payday. 

This app works. It‚Äôs like a check register. Debit cards changed how we kept track of money. Budgeting all of my money each month hasn‚Äôt been difficult or stressful at all. It‚Äôs given me control over my finances again and I‚Äôm in charge of where money is spent. 

This app is worth the yearly fee. It‚Äôs saved me so much already, it‚Äôs more hand paid for itself.
title: Best Budgeting App

review: I love this app! Heard about it from a friend and never looked back! My wife and I are both able to see the family budget (instead of the budget only being on my laptop) and it has helped us stay informed about our spending. We now feel empowered by our budget and no longer wonder where our money goes. We‚Äôve used three other budgeting software apps and YNAB is by far the easiest to use and most pleasant to look at. Can‚Äôt recommend it enough!
title: Helpful, Easy to Use, and Empowering!

review: I have been using YNAB for more than 6 years. And not a day go by without appreciating this wonderfully designed budgeting tool. I have been debt free for a long time but with YNAB‚Äôs help, I am even more effective and honest with my hard earned cash. When you have learned to be honest with the money you earned, you will become more honest with other areas in your life. In that sense, YNAB go beyond just a budgeting tool. I absolutely recommend this to everyone and anyone. Especially to those who wanted to live a debt free, peaceful and calm life.
title: The best budgeting tool EVER

developerResponse: {'id': 47423961, 'body': "Hi there, fellow multi-card user here‚ÄîI know the complexity it adds to your cash flow and to YNAB, and understand your frustration that we couldn't connect with you the way you preferred! It's true our Support team works via text chat and email; we can also dig in with custom visuals and videos if needed. If you're open to giving that a try, we'd love to hear from you at [help@ynab.com](mailto:help@ynab.com) or right in the app. ~ Lauren @ YNAB", 'modified': '2024-10-14T04:51:15Z'}
review:
I tried using this app for a year, and never got it to work right. It constantly over or undercounts payments, and the credit card tracking is terrible. If you have any issues and need support, forget about it - I was told repeatedly that they do not offer live troubleshooting, despite numerous attempts. Customer service is not a priority for this company.

If you have a single bank account and no credit cards, this might work well. But it cannot handle the complexity of transfers and multiple credit cards. I spent many hours of work on this app, and never got to actual budgeting, as I was always trying to get it to accurately track purchases.

Just an infuriating process all around. Avoid this app
title: Baffling App, Terrible Support

review: YNAB as a concept has really revolutionised my finances and for that I am grateful. Now to why I had to cancel my subscription. Paying $15 a month when you already are in financial stress is rough but doing so for website/app with such poor software development is even worse. I never used the app because it was not user friendly and eventually gave up on the desktop version because it too became way too frustrating to use. And yes I watched hour long videos trying to get the software down. I hope they can make something that works better to justify the steep price.
title: Love The Ideology Hate The Application

review: This is the first time I‚Äôve written a review. I felt like if my review could help someone else make the decision to build and follow a budget, then it‚Äôs totally worth it. YNAB is a great tool to help you be aware of your money and reduce financial stress. This is the first budgeting app that has held me accountable to a budget mostly because of how it sends me the notification of a transaction and then makes me categorize it. This helps me then see how much money I have left in that category. Seeing the age of my money increase has been very rewarding. I truly recommend this to everybody.
title: I recommend this to everybody!

review: Want to know exactly where your money goes? Want to be able to know exactly how much you can spend on movies this month? Want to stop stressing about spending or fighting with your SO about every purchase? Then you've come to the right place. YNAB is a brilliant program combined with a budgeting philosophy. Get this app (and use the web platform, too). It will change your life. I used Mint religiously for 2+ years, but never felt I could budget effectively. I'm now a full-fledged drank-the-kool-aid convert to YNAB and I'll never look back. You need a budget!!!
title: The perfect tool for precise budgeting.

review: I have spent years trying to figure out how to take advantage of Credit Card rewards without racking up debt. Thanks to YNAB I am paying better attention to what money I have, and also using my credit cards with peace of mind that I will be able to pay off the balance each month. Every time I use my card the money is automatically moved from my budget line to the card payment line. It is my absolute favorite feature!!! I am not racking up rewards instead of debt!! This app is a game changer for managing your money!!
title: Credit Card Control

review: I have absolutely loved YNAB. It was a little involved getting started and used to everything but now it is SO EASY TO MAINTAIN!!! I feel like I have a much greater awareness of where our money goes and I feel completely empowered in managing our finances. I love that all of my accounts are linked and My Budget is created from money we actually have or spend‚Äînot just arbitrary amounts that we later have to reconcile with our actual spending. YNAB has been a game changer in how I think about, feel about and use money. I would highly recommend it to everyone!
title: Game changer!

developerResponse: {'id': 38002908, 'body': "I love this so much! It's great that you are feeling in control of your finances \\- that's the goal. üéâ \\- Natalie @ YNAB", 'modified': '2023-07-31T12:56:08Z'}
review: I‚Äôve used the app and website for over a year now. It has been the best thing that has happened to my finances in a long time. I know how I‚Äôve spent every penny that has passed through my hands and I‚Äôm prepared for upcoming expenses. The phone app doesn‚Äôt have reporting but it allows me to see money available, assign, and add transactions on the fly. I‚Äôm a YNAB convert and my finances are vastly different today than they were 15 months ago. I looked forward to when all my debt is paid off.
title: Can‚Äôt Live Without

developerResponse: {'id': 1641205, 'body': "Hi there! I think we can help you out with that credit card issue! Send a quick message to help@ynab.com that describes what's happening there and we'll see what we can do to resolve the issue (and the annoyance)!", 'modified': '2017-11-01T14:51:27Z'}
review: This app really helped me get my checking account in order, then credit cards, and is now a daily routine. Every purchase is already pre-approved based on the categories I‚Äôve set up so money management is easier than ever. The only thing driving me NUTS with this app is every month, the credit card account I have starts over at $0 on the first of the month. Even if I have a balance, it goes back to $0. It doesn‚Äôt erase my purchases, but I have to change the purchase dates to the current month to reflect my correct balance. Other than that, great stuff here.
title: Overall great. One annoying thing...

developerResponse: {'id': 37560167, 'body': "Hey MsMonet05! What a great review! I'm so glad that YNAB has helped you communicate better about money and to save and spend with intention. I love that you're YNABing with your kids \\- way to set them up for future success! \\- Kat @ YNAB", 'modified': '2023-07-09T12:29:45Z'}
review: Learned of YNAB in 2019. At the time, my husband and I were beating our heads against the walls, trying to figure out how to work together on our finances. We were in our 6th year of marriage, we had growing debt and in the midst of an endless cycle it seemed. We couldn‚Äôt talk about money without someone being offended or negative feelings showing up. Fast forward.. no debt, living within our means, healthy channel of communication on ALL things, living/saving/investing with intention. AND all of our children are YNAB‚Äôing with us!
title: Changed our life

developerResponse: {'id': 36001031, 'body': "Paid for your graduate certificate in cash?! What a great accomplishment! I'm so glad YNAB has helped you feel in control of your finances. That is a big deal. Thank you so much for leaving a review! - Natalie @ YNAB", 'modified': '2023-04-17T11:47:12Z'}
review: I have been using this app for 5 years and it has helped me so much! I got the app when I decided to go back to school for a graduate certificate and I didn't want to pull out any more loans. Two years later I got my graduate certificate, I paid it all in cash, I paid down some of my debt, I saved for future expenses, and I have never felt so in control when it comes to money and finances. I recommended it to my mom and now she's been able to pay down consumer debt. I highly recommend this app.
title: Best Budget App

developerResponse: {'id': 30306877, 'body': "Thanks so much for the review, Ryan! I'm so glad to hear that you're feeling reduced stress around your finances and you're able to make that paycheck go further! üôå You're doing great!! ~Renae@ynab", 'modified': '2022-06-12T12:30:04Z'}
review: I don‚Äôt write reviews for apps very often. In fact, I hardly ever do it. I really feel like this app needs more attention, however. It has the potential to completely change someone‚Äôs life by helping them realign their finances. YNAB helped me understand what was actually happening to my money. I was able to see what I was wasting money on and where I could use it better. After a month of using it, it felt like I got a raise on my paycheck and completely helped alleviate my stress.
title: Potentially life changing

developerResponse: {'id': 31723201, 'body': "Hi Stevie, rhanks for letting us know the app wasn't intuitive for you! Did you have a chance to reach out to Support (help@YNAB.com)? We'd love the chance to help you understand the credit card payment category‚Äîit sounds like there might be a misunderstanding of how to use it. And we might be able to help with your bank connections! ~Renae@YNAB", 'modified': '2022-08-29T14:45:43Z'}
review:
I did the free trial and at first thought it seemed great. However, once using it, it‚Äôs really not a user-friendly UI, especially for the hefty price tag.

Connections between your banks tend to break every few days. It‚Äôs very annoying to have to reconnect them so frequently. Connecting credit cards seems like a good idea so you can see all your debt at a glance, but in practice, recording payments is kind of nonsensical - you have to create separate budget categories and hide the actual connected accounts in order to track them. 

Definitely not worth $100/year. At most, I‚Äôd pay $20 for this. Especially when I can effectively budget much better through Excel‚Ä¶
title: Good‚Ä¶in theory

review: I recently noticed that one of my main spending accounts is no longer linking to YNAB (even though my other accounts from the same institution are working correctly). When I contacted customer service they explained they weren‚Äôt sure how long it would take to resolve and that I should consider manually reconciling the account indefinitely. Obviously I‚Äôm not paying YNAB $15/month to do the heavy lifting on my own and asked for a temporary refund/reduction until the problem is resolved. They did not accommodate. The YNAB product is great but when it fails the user should rely on customer service to make it right. They chose not to, which makes me reconsider whether I should choose to give them my business in return.
title: Account Linking Issues

review:
YNAB has changed my life. I have taught the YNAB way to my teenagers and my 40 yr old brother just recently. I saw immediate results and financial stress melted. I read the book and watch the whiteboard Wednesday‚Äôs and listen to the podcasts. I‚Äôm all in! I‚Äôve been using it since April and I‚Äôve aged my money to 25 days and have been in the black ever since.
______________________________
After iPad OS update in July 2021 I can no longer swipe left and right to easily switch between months. Why eliminate one of my favorite features on that platform!?!?!
title: Sounds Overblown but...

review: I typically don‚Äôt write reviews but i had to take time to write this one. Ynab has changed my life. I used to keep telling myself next month I‚Äôll save or next month i wont spend as much, but I never changed. I never really knew where my money was going. Ynab has made me in control of my money. And i am less stressed and definitely more confident in my money habits. I only wish i had Ynab earlier. I found ynab through Jessie‚Äôs podcasts and those have helped me so much. If u want to be in control of ur money and stop living paycheck to paycheck. Get this app.
title: Incredible

review: I mostly use the iPad app and it does its job but there are a few missing features and oddities I come across. The most annoying is when adding a transaction the input for the dollar amount will not accept content from the clipboard. The app does do a good job in slide over mode which makes the lack of clipboard support tolerable. There is also no shortcuts support which would be fantastic. I would love to have a shortcut for quickly adding a transaction. You can mostly get this working using scripting blocks but having official support would make it a lot more accessible.
title: Works great with a few quirks

review: I don‚Äôt often write reviews, but this app has been life changing. I read the YNAB book first and then decided to get the app and online software. It took a few minutes to learn the ins and outs of it, but now it feels like second nature. I‚Äôve never budgeted before and have always been bad at dealing with money ending up with credit card debt and unpaid loans even when I was making more money. Now I finally understand why. Absolutely love YNAB. If you‚Äôve never learned how to handle money, I‚Äôd highly recommend reading the book as well, so worth it!
title: Absolutely amazing

review: I love YNAB itself but I‚Äôm very disappointed that the iPad app doesn‚Äôt function like the desktop function. One important thing missing is the undo button! Also the indicators for credit spending budget are missing so they just show up as over budget which is only half true. In the desktop version you get a refined view where you can tell whether budgeting money to that thing will result in a cc payment which is central to the overall YNAB way of thinking. This has changed how I manage my money but i still prefer to be on desktop which means the iPad app hasn‚Äôt changed anything. It really functions to keep things the same. :-/
title: Love it, but ......

developerResponse: {'id': 40624693, 'body': "Hi there! Thanks for this great review. We're thrilled to hear that you enjoy using YNAB, and that it's had an impact on your financial life. üôå It sounds like you've really put the four rules to work for you, and you're absolutely right, the YNAB method is all about being proactive with your spending decisions! \\- Jill@YNAB", 'modified': '2023-12-11T19:18:12Z'}
review: I was a Qicken user for eons! Couldn‚Äôt break away. But after more and more connection issues with my banks, I had to find something new. Budgeting our money is a super high priority to me.  I find Ynab so helpful. I have realized these past six m months of using it that it really is a tool for budgeting where Quicken was more of a tracking tool for me. I never thought I‚Äôd find another software besides Quicken that would satisfy my quest for tracking and budgeting our money. But I have been totally converted!! YNAB is the best!
title: Soooooo Awesome!!!

developerResponse: {'id': 39550320, 'body': "You did it!! That's amazing!! üëèüèª I love that YNAB could help you with this huge accomplishment. Thanks for leaving a review! \\- Natalie @ YNAB", 'modified': '2023-10-16T19:59:05Z'}
review: My husband and I (we have separate finances) started YNAB in April 2023, we were $22,000 in debt. As of yesterday, (Oct 12, 2023) we are debt free. This program is AMAZING! We had tried other budgeting apps but they didn‚Äôt require us to DO anything or work with it, so it never worked for us. There is a bit of a learning curve and we were definitely a bit frustrated for the first few weeks, but then it all clicked and now it is so easy and smooth and a part of our daily routine. So thankful to be out of debt and saving money!
title: Debt Free!!!

developerResponse: {'id': 36311691, 'body': "Wow! It's great that YNAB has helped you so much. We love hearing that. Thanks for budgeting with us! - Natalie @ YNAB", 'modified': '2023-05-03T17:29:40Z'}
review: YNAB is simply the way personal and family money management should be. Huge fan, it has changed our life and our marriage because everything in life is in some way tied into money and where you choose to spend it. It is a real time budget based on Ramsey-esque and zero based budgeting / envelope principles but for the modern world. Couldn‚Äôt be easier to use. App is great for real time entering purchases out and about, but all real management I do on the website/laptop.
title: Best personal money behavior modification tool ever

developerResponse: {'id': 38484497, 'body': "Hi Ethan! We're honored that you took the time to share a review from your experience with YNAB. Thank you also for the feedback on reporting. I'll be sure to pass that along. üòä \\- Aubrey @ YNAB", 'modified': '2023-08-23T17:38:27Z'}
review:
I never leave reviews, and I never typically trust reviews that glow about an app. However, this is an exception. YNAB itself is a 5 star program. The app is a great extension/tool of the program. It works amazing for its primary function- logging transactions on the go. However, it would truly be a 5-star app if they offered better reporting. Right now, it‚Äôs extremely basic, only showing net worth and age of money. In this regard, it can be so much better. 

Everything else, though? üëå

I look forward to seeing where the programmers/developers can take this!
title: Amazing app

review: My mom bought be a subscription 8 years ago when I was in high school and I immediately loved it. I used it on & off throughout college, but really took it on 5 months ago and there is NO looking back. I genuinely look forward to budgeting every week and can‚Äôt wait to get paid so I can assign itüòÇ my friends are probably over hearing about it, but I won‚Äôt stop talking about how life changing this app/software is. The company itself is also amazing - following them on ALL of the socials! HIGHLY recommend‚ò∫Ô∏è
title: SO. GOOD.

review: 3 years ago, I barely lived paycheck to paycheck things were a mess. I kinda sorta knew where the money went each month but wasn‚Äôt real sure.  I now have a savings account my money is aged nicely to 47 days with a goal of 60 days. I‚Äôll be paying off my car note in 4 months‚Ä¶.one year early. If you want to get on top of things and think your bad with money and you‚Äôll never figure it out‚Ä¶..get this app. USE IT (I got it and ignored it a rock solid year and a half) You‚Äôll be amazed. Thanks YNAB!  It has been a game changer.
title: YNAB

review: I managed our finances with Quicken for at least 20 years. YNAB has made the whole tedious process so easy, I left Quicken behind for good. My spouse and I both have the app on our phones and use it regularly. It‚Äôs now a team effort instead of a burden that I was trying to carry alone.  Feel so much more in control of our budget... but spend so much less time on it. Using YNAB helped us save a significant amount of money in just the 12 months we‚Äôve been using it.  If I could give it 6 stars I would.
title: Awesome app

review:
I understand the cost of the app might seem high, but I can assure you, without any doubt, that this app will save you the cost of the app and plenty more. 

Let‚Äôs face it, most people don‚Äôt really enjoy budgeting or managing their money. This app -  and the approach to money management that it employs - allows you to manage your money in an easy and efficient manner. 

Giving every dollar a purpose is the foundation for taking control of your money. This app has truly changed my life for the better and given me the confidence I needed - thank you for this.
title: Priceless

review: I found the methodology different from traditional budgets. My transition from an excel budget to the app/website took some time, but ultimately it has helped me save money. YNAB really focuses on what you have right now and allows you to set goals for saving and paying off debt. Once I took the time to understand how the app works and how to manage transactions it has saved me a ton of time. The auto import feature from major banks is great. The chat support has always been fast with thoroughly explained answers. Thanks for doing such a great job on this app!
title: Fantastic App

review:
Terrific app that has the potential to change the way you think and radically adjust your habits. Well worth the investment to learn it and do it right. My wife and I used it to retire all our debt and completely rebuild the way we think and talk about our budget, what we are spending, and what our future goals are. A great complement to the Dave Ramsey approach if you are a fan.

The developers have been very thoughtful and responsive with changes over time (I‚Äôve had it for several years). This is a very robust and secure platform in my experience.
title: Exceptional Value

review: It allows automatic sync with all my different bank accounts, and helps you to track the ones you don‚Äôt want to sync. This is very useful because every two weeks I receive my payment and wasn‚Äôt sure how much of it was available or if I need to save a little bit for Christmas gifts or the insurance of the car. Now, I know what I have available and I‚Äôm on top of my expenses. It makes you feel that you are in control of your finances.
title: Best budget system I have found

developerResponse: {'id': 31132525, 'body': "Hi zvoge, I appreciate you taking the time to leave a review! I'm so glad the past few months using YNAB has been such a positive, impactful experience for you. üôÇ - Kathryn @ YNAB", 'modified': '2022-07-27T21:26:52Z'}
review: YNAB is just a great app. The more you watch the YNAB videos and understand it the better you get at budgeting and prioritizing your money for what matters in your life. I‚Äôve only been using it for 3 months but I‚Äôve been using other budgeting apps for about 10 years. I‚Äôve never run across anything else that helps you reconcile your budget easily while using a credit card daily for expenses. It‚Äôs made a huge impact and I would 100% recommend everyone use YNAB.

developerResponse: {'id': 42442915, 'body': "Thanks for your review. I'm glad YNAB has helped you so much. \\- Natalie @ YNAB", 'modified': '2024-03-07T16:22:13Z'}
review:
This app has helped me change the way I plan my finances. I‚Äôm not good at it at all on my own, and the app has altered the way in which I budget helping me see what I need and when. It‚Äôs changed my life! 

There are some things the app does that I have not been able to figure out. When I have contacted support, I have felt the need to defend my intelligence. Customer support has come off as patronizing and dismissive. So, any further learning that I might need isn‚Äôt going to happen when I‚Äôm hesitant to contact support. 

Overall, I highly recommend the app. It‚Äôs worth the subscription cost for me.
title: Almost exactly what I need

review: If you want to try this, don‚Äôt subscribe through Apple because you‚Äôll be unable to get a refund if it does not work for you. I paid the year in full‚Ä¶and 4 months in realized this app does not work for what I need it to do. Initially I liked it but then nearly every month, I had to reset everything because money got directed to the wrong place and accounts didn‚Äôt reconcile. There‚Äôs no ‚Äúundo‚Äù button on the app is you accidentally send money to the wrong budget item. I ended up changing to another budgeting software that works better for my needs‚Ä¶but sadly YNAB said bc I subscribed through Apple‚Ä¶I was out of luck for a refund. Buyer beware.
title: Don‚Äôt subscribe through Apple

review:
I tried every freaking program out there and none of them were customizable enough to fit what I needed. I was literally considering building an app myself I was so frustrated. I LOVE YNAB. It‚Äôs not at all tedious to use and I actually get excited when a transaction comes through. It couldn‚Äôt be easier to customize, AND customize AT ANY POINT IN THE MONTH. You can always change anything and it doesn‚Äôt screw up your whole month. 

Thank you YNAB for this perfect program, please please PLEASE don‚Äôt change anything major!!!!
title: FINALLY. A budget that works!!!!!!!!

review:
This is a good methodology for budgeting money.  Be warned, however, that the company recently leveraged its customers loyalty by doubling the annual price.

This is despite the fact that you may not be using many of the features such as financial account syncing or customer support.  

After years of using this app, there have been very few new features added that make a meaningful difference.  Most of the features added have been directed at gaining new users (onboarding experiences or app redesigns).  Gaining new customers and growing their business is exactly the kind of thing you would expect would keep costs low for everyone.

Customers invest a tremendous amount of time, money, and trust in a platform like YNAB.  Doubling the cost, without warning, just before Christmas was a poorly executed move.

At some point, even if we can afford it, people like me begin to wonder what if an alternative would provide more peace of mind about how that investment of time, money, and trust will be treated in the future.
title: Sudden price increase.

review:
I have recommended this to anyone and everyone who will listen. This concept is amazing and the app is simple to use. It does take awhile the first time you set it up, but once you do, it‚Äôs 5 minutes a day to never need to stress about money again.

I joke that this has preemptively saved my marriage, but we don‚Äôt fight about money anymore, and that‚Äôs absolutely worth what we spend on this.

The app isn‚Äôt perfect, sometimes things get out of sync or we‚Äôre somehow off by $20 that we can‚Äôt figure out, but overall we love it.
title: Incredible

review: Really frustrated with this app. Worked well for me for a couple months but now it‚Äôs been a nightmare for half a year. I constantly deal with it unlinking from my bank account (PNC) and I sometimes have major trouble getting it re-linked. Transactions come through 2 sometimes even 3 times so I have to constantly go in and ‚Äúreject‚Äù transactions. If I put a transaction in manually and then it comes through later for the exact same amount from the same payee, it almost never allows me to use the ‚Äúmatch‚Äù feature so I have to again ‚Äúreject‚Äù those transactions. Don‚Äôt know why I‚Äôm paying for this any more, it‚Äôs more of a struggle to manage than it is worth
title: Duplicate transactions, features not working

developerResponse: {'id': 40916362, 'body': "Thanks for your review! It sounds like the way YNAB handles credit cards has been just what you were looking for, and I'm glad to hear it. üòä \\- Aubrey @ YNAB", 'modified': '2023-12-26T20:29:23Z'}
review: Great budgeting tool once you learn how to use it effectively as they want you to and as it will be useful for your everyday purchases. Warning though, the free trial is not nearly enough time to learn the app so if you choose to try it, plan on paying for a year subscription to get the full feel of it. It does mimic everyday life though and keep you from overspending on credit cards which means the credit card companies won‚Äôt be making money off you.
title: Very steep learning curve

review:
I stopped using YNAB because:

1. My bank supports creation of saving goals.
2. Mint is better at account importation and categorization
3. Mint allows for decent budgeting
4. Mint is free

The idea is definitely great, but the execution is lacking. Account importation is a joke in comparison to that of Mint‚Äôs. Mint automatically adjusts for credit card payments far better than YNAB could, and can automatically categorize transactions. YNAB does not show pending transactions, so your budgeting barely operates in real time since transactions usually take days to go through. It also fails to connect to my credit cards half of the time saying the credit card is experiencing ‚Äòdelays‚Äô while Mint is able to update just fine. 

YNAB‚Äôs one advantage is the ability to ‚Äògive every dollar a job‚Äô through your manual allocation of money. But this is hardly an advantage over Mint‚Äôs automatic categorization of your spending which is done pretty much in real time. YNAB does have the better UI, but unless they can fix the capabilities of their platform I won‚Äôt be switching back any time soon.
title: Waste of money, Mint is more useful

review:
I‚Äôve been using YNAB since it was an Excel spreadsheet back in 2008, and I love it. The mobile app features are awesome, and for the most part, it just keeps getting better. 

HOWEVER, I have one major gripe. The mobile app is sloooow. It takes 5-10 seconds just to pull up the new transaction screen sometimes. My situation may be unusual, because I‚Äôm using it on a slightly older phone (iPhone SE), and my budget is big (25-30 accounts, with all that history going back to 2008). Nonetheless, YNAB should test these kinds of scenarios and optimize for customers with large budget files too.
title: Please improve performance!

developerResponse: {'id': 47975684, 'body': "Thanks for that feedback, Melina! That's so valuable - I've shared it with our design team, and they'll take it under review. We're always looking for ways to make YNAB better, and we love hearing how we can do that from our customers. Thanks for being a YNABer!!!", 'modified': '2024-11-05T17:30:07Z'}
review:
Absolutely LOVE YNAB and have gifted it to multiple people as I know it could help them greatly!
However, the exported income/expense reports don‚Äôt split up income vs expenses or categories with bolding or spaces so it‚Äôs tough to read & takes time to format to read. 
Additionally, we could really really use a column for our budget (or target, whatever you want to call it) so that we could view in the app or at least through excel export compare how we are doing.  
Thanks!
title: Would give 5/5 if there were better report exports and a way to view budget against spending

title: Life Changing App

title: Hands down the best personal finance app

developerResponse: {'id': 32490544, 'body': 'Oh wow! Thanks so much for being such a long-time user of YNAB! We appreciate your support so much! ~ Renae @ YNAB.com', 'modified': '2022-10-10T17:05:20Z'}
review: The only (well-developed) system that truly gives you an accurate way to track your money. Free services like Mint are fine but don‚Äôt actually let you track the money in your account. It‚Äôs all backwards looking. YNAB looks to the future and sets you up for success. It‚Äôs paid for itself hundreds (if not thousands) of times over. It‚Äôs a system, not just a tool. So you really need to buy-in to it. But if you do, it‚Äôs literally a life changer (I‚Äôve been a user since 2014)
title: Can‚Äôt rave enough!

Learn what happens\xa0__When the Month Rolls Over__._ How would you rate my reply?", 'modified': '2022-04-29T03:53:25Z'}
review: I‚Äôm 32, a single mom of two very young children, living on one income.  Because of YNAB, I‚Äôm no longer living paycheck to paycheck.
