I‚Äôm confident that if you‚Äôre willing to do the work, YNAB could change your life.
title: Why didn‚Äôt I start this sooner?

review: My cousin is a newly retired financial advisor. She recommended this app to help me understand money and budgeting. I can‚Äôt say enough about how this app has changed how I think of money!  This should be taught in all high schools! I am retired now but if I had had this knowledge throughout my life - oh how different it would be! Sadly, I wasn‚Äôt able to use the app as our bank doesn‚Äôt allow links to apps. However, they have a budgeting widget that I now understand thanks to this app. If you are a parent,  consider giving this app to your teenager!
title: Recommended by financial advisor

review:
This app is so worth its price! Makes budgeting with a partner so easy! We always know what we have left to spend on dining out or groceries or anything we want to share the cost of. We can also save toward goals together, and see our work pay off! 

It takes some time to figure out exactly how to set it up for your life but I love how customizable it is. I love that everything is changeable, I‚Äôd so rather have it be fine tuned to our scenario that pre-built for an ‚Äúaverage‚Äù setup. 

Love love love!
title: Great for Couples

developerResponse: {'id': 36778700, 'body': "Awh, I'm tearing up over here! üß° Thanks for sharing your experience‚Äîwe are thrilled you and you spouse can so easily find financial clarity and alignment together wherever you are and whenever you want. Peace between partners is priceless! Appreciate you sharing your experience here. \\- Dela @ YNAB", 'modified': '2023-05-28T22:15:33Z'}
review: We used Quicken for 20+ years, then I tested out YNAB. It was SO much easier to keep a zero dollar budget and keep my wife and I on the same page. Then I added my kids to the family plan and they have liked it it as well. After using YNAB for the last year we all love it and appreciate being able to review our spending on the computer, our phones or iPads. Now our budget meetings can happen anywhere, even in the car on a roadtrip.
title: We used Quicken for 20+ years

review:
Surprisingly effective at changing my financial behaviors, mindset and peace of mind.  Something I kept hoping for years that Mint would do.  

Don‚Äôt try to make it budget ‚Äúyour‚Äù way, but spend the time to buy into their four rules...even with your savings.  Your way isn‚Äôt working else you wouldn‚Äôt be reading reviews would you?  And budgeting your money isn‚Äôt spending your money, so you‚Äôre not out anything.  

Significantly underestimated the hidden toll my finances took on me until I became a YNABer.
title: Financial Peace of Mind

review: I‚Äôve been using the classic version for years and until it will no longer supports the new Mac OS, I begrudgingly switched over to this online version. I found that I‚Äôm saving time in not having to manually enter each transaction and instead just sync my bank account and approve the budget category. What I do miss is the ability to see a running total. YNAB- please consider adding a running account balance with each transaction, including the future reoccurring transactions. Keep up the great work!
title: Glad I switched over

review:
Don‚Äôt hesitate. Get the app, and you can get control of your finances. Like so many others who have success stories, my wife and I got out of debt and started saving in only one year. The amount was a shocking financial turn around. 

Like anything worth doing, you have to commit. It does take effort to learn and get started although I‚Äôm sure there are even better resources available now than when we started 5 years ago. Also, you will need to figure out how to live within your income. YNAB helps guide you to how to do that, but if you have too high of a standard of living like I did, you will have to reconcile the gap between income and expenses somehow. 

It is worth every penny! And when you‚Äôre in debt and stressed out about spending money like I was, I still say it is worth every penny. 

Best wishes to you and your soon to be improved financial situation.
title: Get YNAB and your money will no longer disappear

review: I‚Äôve tried several apps and various excel spreadsheets, this is the best I‚Äôve found.  This app doesn‚Äôt require up-front budgeting but instead pushes the idea of assigning purposes to each dollar when it is earned.  It feels like taking your paycheck and stuffing those dollars into envelopes marked Gas, Groceries, and Dining Out.  One Reddit quote I read was from a guy invited to go out for drinks with his friends whom declined because his app told him he was all out of Fun Money, yet he still had money in his bank account for other categories.
title: The one you‚Äôve been looking for

review:
YNAB is an excellent platform for budgeting. The one thing I wish the app had, though, was an extra layer of authentication (i.e passcode, password and/or Touch ID to open app)

If I happen to leave my phone sitting around unlocked ‚Äî an unlikely scenario, but still possible ‚Äî I don‚Äôt want someone to be able to just open YNAB and look through my transactions and other financial info. 

Every other financially-related app I have has this feature. I don‚Äôt understand why YNAB doesn‚Äôt. Seems like a pretty easy thing to integrate.
title: Love this app, but one thing missing

developerResponse: {'id': 46081422, 'body': "Hey there, I'm so glad to hear that YNAB's had your back in tough times and provided clarity and freedom these 7 years! As a long-time YNABer, I can totally relate (though my cat might argue about what's more fundamental). Here's to the next 7. ü•Ç ~ Lauren @ YNAB", 'modified': '2024-08-19T05:00:01Z'}
review: I‚Äôve been running my life and businesses on YNAB for over 7 years. It‚Äôs a tool that I can‚Äôt live without. I have been through some tough moments with money scares, but never without 100% clarity of how I can make it work, thanks to this app! I consider it as fundamental as brushing my teeth or feeding my dog. I forget not everyone has it! The world would be a different place. Bye bye stress, hello eternal freedom in knowing EXACTLY where I stand how to get to where I need to go. Thank you, YNAB!
title: 7 years and counting. Can‚Äôt live without it!

review:
Budgeting according to what you have in your pockets right now is a great idea, but it was hard to do with the app‚Äôs system.

I had it connected to my bank but it took days to load transactions. And for some odd reason, it took even longer for income to be reflected in the app. So I had to either enter it manually and allocate the money only to do that again later or wait, postponing assignment of my money for better spending habits.

Due to the extended income delay, it would put everything in the red when I was actually fine and it was really confusing to have to separate dollars I hadn‚Äôt received to work with in the app yet. 

Yes, I could have just done it all manually but what is the point of connecting it to the bank then? And as much as I want to save money with this app, it gave me so much extra work that quite frankly I could just figure out how to do this on my own and save more money and time since you pay a subscription for this.

I‚Äôm not paying them regularly for me to do all of this extra work by myself.
title: Hard to execute system in app

review:
Seems like a good approach for someone just beginning to budget, and who needs to better control their debt. That probably fits most Americans today. However, for those of us who have no debt, know how to control our expenses, and want to budget beyond a month in advance, it doesn‚Äôt work very well. 

I‚Äôve used Mint for years.  It also has limitations in the budget area. However, I followed advice in a Wirecutter review (which rated YNAB as their top choice) and customized my own budget using Mint to gather the data as it already was, and downloading that data to an Excel spreadsheet to report against the budget I setup in Excel. Now I have what I wanted, and the flexibility to change it as I gain experience with me new system.
title: Not for everyone

developerResponse: {'id': 46797057, 'body': "Thanks for this review and for your feedback on our recent updates to the money moves interface! We're always eager to hear how changes are impacting YNABers. If we can help at all with getting adjusted or you want to share anything else, please get in touch with our support team at help@ynab.com‚Äîwe'd love to chat more. - Caity @ YNAB", 'modified': '2024-09-17T21:39:06Z'}
review:
Simple processes that were very easy and quick before are now cumbersome and require extra steps and waiting through pauses between steps due to unnecessary animations. This app was great before and now frustrating to use.

Week later: This update remains aggravating, as most of the reviews are indicating. Frustrating to see the developer feedback about how transitions can be hard and reach out to let you know what features are causing trouble. Hope YNAB reads all the reviews together and realize the recent UI changes - particularly for assigning money and moving between categories - are a huge fail. Everything takes longer. More steps. Nothing is intuitive.
title: New update is a downgrade

developerResponse: {'id': 35491205, 'body': "Wow!! That is a huge savings and I love that YNAB helped you find that. It's great that your finances are clear now with YNAB's help. Thanks for leaving this great review! - Natalie @ YNAB", 'modified': '2023-03-20T20:35:41Z'}
review: This app is amazing. Makes your financial story crystal clear. I added in my mortgage and found out I could save $26,000 in interest by paying an extra $200/month toward the principal. I know exactly what I have planned to do with every dollar I have, and where I have wiggle room if things come up. I found it to be very intuitive to use and user-friendly, but there are also TONS of videos to help with set up. Use the app. Watch the videos. Change your financial life.
title: Best budgeting app ever

developerResponse: {'id': 44065299, 'body': "HI Ranaea, Thanks for sharing your experience! YNAB is definitely different from Mint and other apps! It is designed to help you look forward rather than just record what already happened! If you'd like to chat more about the change going from Mint to YNAB, we'd love to help out! Email us at help@ynab.com ~Phil@YNAB", 'modified': '2024-05-21T19:38:39Z'}
review:
Mint was easier to use in my opinion. YNB has great potential and linking accounts is relatively easy if available. However, there‚Äôs not a notification that says your account is unlinked. I had to click on it the account. 

I don‚Äôt like the idea of adding money to a target when it comes too my bills. I set the amount I need to pay money and when the money leaves my account that‚Äôs link, and categorized I expected it to update that target but that was not the case. Then when I would add the money it would sometimes double the targeted amount. Overall did not give me a great view of my expenses. My numbers in the budget portion do not change unless I physically go into every transaction and set a category each time. It does not remember those that have been previously set. 

The app could also use some updating to show better visuals similar to mint. 

This app just didn‚Äôt work for me. May be easy enough for others.
title: Not a fan of it

review: Finding YNAB has been the best bit of luck I had since I made the decision to be better with money. I‚Äôve read financial advice books, tried other apps, and learned systems... all super overwhelming and reactive rather than proactive. Learning YNAB has an admittedly steep learning curve, but it is absolutely worth it! This app helps me feel in control of my money‚Äîin a proactive way‚Äîand makes tracking my purchases on the go so much easier. If you‚Äôre thinking about it‚Äîdo it!
title: Finally in control of my finances

review: I was astounded at the difference I experienced in my life when I started with YNAB. Once I could see exactly what my expenses were, I could confidently avoid overspending. In fact, it freed me to spend MORE because I knew the basics were covered. I could set up my budget in the way that made the most sense to me. I get great support when needed. When I do choose to ‚Äúoverspend‚Äù, I know exactly what else I have to forgo. YNAB gives me self confidence and peace of mind about my finances. No more fear I‚Äôll mess up.
title: Game changing money management

review: I have subscribed to YNAB for several years. However, in the last year they have had many problems importing transactions from my credit union. This issue lasts for weeks at a time. YNAB‚Äôs suggested work around is that I manually enter all of my transactions. For this reason, I will no longer pay for YNAB when my subscription expires. There is no reason for me to pay for a service when it doesn‚Äôt work. I will go back to using an excel spreadsheet for my budget because this software does nothing for me. It is just an expensive spreadsheet now. Find a different budgeting software to pay for if you want a service that automatically imports your transactions.
title: Might as well use a basic spreadsheet

review: I‚Äôve been using YNAB on and off for a few years but have recently gotten rigorous with using it.   I am so impressed with the app on the web as well as mobile and iPad.  But I really, really find most amazing your help/tutorials.  Wow.   They are funny yet spot-on with what I need to know right now.   And because of the great tool and super wonderful training/help I feel that YNAB is my very-much-trusted financial advisor.  And all this for less than $10/month.  I am so grateful that YNAB is there for me.   Thank you Jesse and your amazing team. üå†
title: YNAB - a great tool? yeah, but also a ‚Äòtrusted advisor‚Äô

review:
Ive gone from being paycheck to paycheck and barely having enough $ to do anything. My net worth is now $1700 after less than 2 months and my financial stress is completely wiped out. I never ever thought I could or even would budget until I recently started to really stress about my money and where it was going. After trying multiple apps, lessons, and even the old MS Money Sunset, YNAB is the ONLY one that is absolutely  effective and stress-free requiring minimal work or thinking on your part. Thank
You YNAB for potentially changing the rest of my life
title: Woah.

review: Budgeting can be stressful, but YNAB makes it easy to assign every dollar and track how it‚Äôs spent. I was an Excel budgeter, but I finally got sick of losing hours to my spreadsheets and thought there must be another way. There is. It‚Äôs this app. I just hop on for a couple minutes a day and my budget is up to date. No more wondering if I have enough money for something I want; I just look and know! Big fan. I do recommend using the web browser for making your monthly budget, it‚Äôs just easier that way.
title: Found Love In A Hopeless Place

review:
I love a budget that tells my money where to go instead of telling me where it went. Because of this app, I don‚Äôt look at my bank account and think ‚Äúwow, I have so much money, I can go spend some of it on crap‚Äù...instead, I know exactly how much of it is a sinking fund for that dentist appt I have coming up, or the windows we are paying cash for, or savings for a holiday that‚Äôs around the corner. 

This app is great because it allows me to customize every category to my liking. 

 One of my favorite things is having a little savings catergory that I use to stockpile a set amount for the upcoming month‚Äôs expenses. By the end of each month, I know that I have enough money heading into the next month, and know exactly how much is left over that I can save.

Get YNAB and start saving more money than you thought possible. You can stop living paycheck to paycheck üòÑ
title: This app changed the way we live

review:
We were long time Mvelopes users and couldn‚Äôt take it anymore. YNAB delivers everything Mvelopes hoped too and more. Additionally, YNAB does not suffer all of the lag times and connectivity issues Mvelopes did. 

YNAB has some great features that help you b disciplined about your budget. My favorite is that I cannot carry negative balances in any category from month to month. This prevents me from making ‚Äúloans‚Äù to myself - something that we used to do which prevented us from ever really being able to take advantage of bonuses or increased income.
title: Great software

review: The program is great and let‚Äôs us know exactly where our money goes. The app doesn‚Äôt do everything the web based software does, but it‚Äôs great for tracking money as soon as the money is spent or received so I won‚Äôt forget to do it later. I can also check my account to see if I have the money to buy something before I buy it. Really helps to keep me on track. I gave it 4 instead of 5 stars because you also need to use the website. But together, it‚Äôs absolutely 5 stars!
title: Great program, software, and app

review: I could never budget any other way again!! My fianc√© and I are a month ahead on our monthly expenses and it makes things a whole lot less stressful!! Now we are working on paying off our credit card debt. It is so nice being able to see how much we spend and where we spend it instead of spending aimlessly and not hitting our goals. I look forward to ever payday just to budget everything into categories, I have been using YNAB for over a year and recommend it to everyone I know.
title: Best budgeting ever

review:
I've tried to use YNAB a number of times and it's like a bad girlfriend. You keep going back to it although you know that it won't work out. The #1 reason I leave is that you can't rollover negative balances to the next month. This used to be an option but was eliminated because this violates one of the pillars of YNAB. Makes life very difficult if you have work reimbursements that get paid the following month. 

I realize that this gets to the heart of the YNAB philosophy but life is not always so simple. I feel that users should have a little more ability to control how they implement YNAB's golden rules. 

Otherwise, a great app.
title: Please Allow Rollover of Negative Balances

review: I used to worry about money all the time. I tried other budgeting apps, but I had no idea how to manage my money. I invested the time learning the YNAB system - there's loads of help available! - and it absolutely changed my life. I went from living paycheck-to-paycheck with $20,000 in credit card debt to paying my cards in full every month and thousands of budgeted dollars in the bank. I can't recommend YNAB enough - I hope it changes your life too!! ‚ù§Ô∏è
title: Life-changer with a huge learning curve

developerResponse: {'id': 35503269, 'body': "Great to hear you are enjoying the credit card feature in YNAB! It's such a great tool. I recommend checking out Auto-Assign https://support.ynab.com/en_us/auto-assign-a-guide-r1gBNbBJo It makes assigning your paycheck really quick! - Natalie @ YNAB", 'modified': '2023-03-21T11:47:31Z'}
review: I was in the market for a new budgeting app since mvelopes was discontinued. I tried Every Dollar and I didn‚Äôt like how I couldn‚Äôt link a credit card. YNAB is very similar to mvelopes and allows me to use the credit card like a debit card and deduct from my budgeted amounts. They have good articles and video tutorials too. It‚Äôs a little clunky to manually assign paychecks. I wish there was a way to save how you wanted each paycheck distributed each month. But I‚Äôm learning how to do it and am a happy user.
title: Great app

review: Before we had YNAB, we really had terrible money management skills.  We‚Äôd look at the accounts and decide if we could afford something and find out later that we really over did it again.  Now we plan ahead  knowing each step towards our goals that our day-to-day spending needs are protected.  This has saved us thousands, made several amazing family vacations possible, and probably kept a marriage intact too!
title: This app has saved us thousands!

review:
I‚Äôm attempting to begin using this app, and I can‚Äôt make it work. Watch the tutorial? Sure, but my screen looks nothing like the tutorial‚ÄîI have literally no menu options besides choosing where to put the dollar sign. Link my accounts? Ok! Why am I being prompted to link my accounts over and over? Contact the help desk? Oh, no one is available. Is there a way to sign into the website (not app)? Who knows???  All I get are prompts to start my free trial which I already did! Maybe I should try restarting my phone? Doesn‚Äôt help. This may be an amazing tool but if I literally cannot start using it what is the point? 

This is the worst online experience I have had‚ÄîAND I‚ÄôM INCLUDING IKEA IN THAT ASSESSMENT. So you know it‚Äôs bad.
title: Maddening

review:
This app is very good, but the real magic of YNAB is the philosophy. You don‚Äôt really set up your budget with this app‚Äîthe desktop site is where you want to do the heavy lifting, but once you do YNAB is incredible. Just do it. You‚Äôll thank yourself later.

Suggestion for the devs: When you have a category with a target balance, under the quick budget options, I want to be able to see the ‚ÄúTo Go‚Äù amount. I don‚Äôt really care about ‚ÄúBudgeted Last Month‚Äù or anything. I would use this allllll the time.
title: Can‚Äôt recommend highly enough.

review: How is it this made it to production? This completely half-baked application has no feature parity with the original, costs money, and requires full-time internet access. How often are you entering bills while you don't have Internet? How often are you managing a budget without having internet? For me, that's all the time. Why would they wait years and years for a major update, and then take features out? I guess Jesse and the team have finally sold out. The writing was on the wall with the lacklustre and few updates, but now it's clear what they really want -- to throw a half-baked product in your face and expect you to pay forever. Cool. Edit: prices just went up to $85 a year lol
title: A grim future

review: This app is incredible. I seriously tell all of my coworkers and friends about it, and how much it has helped me save. Not only to save, but how to develop good habits with my money. And it‚Äôs so easy and convenient to look at on my phone on my commute to work. I never thought I‚Äôd be the kind of person to pay money for a budgeting app, but this one is worth it. I am so proud of how far I have come with my savings, and how much this app improved my quality of life. No longer living paycheck to paycheck, and it feels amazing. Thank you!!
title: Taught me amazing habits

review: I can‚Äôt overemphasize how much I‚Äôve enjoyed using YNAB for almost three years now. I am particularly grateful for how it allows you to manage credit card expenses and how you can create different beudgets in multiple currencies. The videos and articles about how yo ise YNAB and best budgeting practices are excellent. Finally, I will add that the customer service is fast and reliable. I‚Äôve had great chats with technical support about resolving issues and ideas for how to improve my budget. Thank you Team YNAB!
title: Phenomenal App - Service

review: This really is amazing. We love watching our age of money increase and it makes us naturally question each expense. I feel like it‚Äôs truly remarkable and behavior changing without making me feel like a child getting told I can‚Äôt have something.  The feeling every pay period of knowing things are being paid for, and knowing that the credit cards have enough fund to cover fully the bill is such a relief to me. This Christmas was the first time I wasn‚Äôt worried about expenses. It‚Äôs taken such a load of stress off of me.
title: Amazing

review: This user-friendly program, which I have used for 7 years, has been key in my getting out of debt and saving money for my true expenses and goals.  The iPad version notifies me when transactions are posted, so I can categorize and approve them and always stay up to date.  YNAB gives access to valuable tutorials and a weekly podcast, which have taught me strategies for effective use of its  four guiding rules for budgeting.  In addition, the YNAB staff is quick to answer specific questions I have had about the program.  I rate YNAB a 5++++!
title: YNAB is a 5++++

review:
I was skeptical at first, another budgeting app.  They literally think of everything. Best budgeting app I‚Äôve used.  Yes, it‚Äôs $7, but if you really want to stop going through the motions, you‚Äôll figure out $7. 

It is a little difficult at first to get a hang of things, but you have the resources to get things set up. If I were to set this up again, I‚Äôd have a list of all my thing (bank accounts, credit cards, etc). I already have seen things I can eliminate. 

Keep working on the guides, your support and docs are amazing already.
title: Amazing | MUST FOLLOW GUIDE

review: This app costs money. And it takes a little time to figure out. But it will change your relationship with money for the rest of your life. The customer support is really incredible. Like people are available to help answer my questions within hours. There is a huge network of financial educators including podcasts and video tutorials. This company is friendly and really wants to improve the quality of your life.
title: Worth the expense and time investment

review:
So‚Ä¶ why YNAB? Because YNAB. You Need a Budget. You really do. 

This application is amazing with how it works. I‚Äôm a 50+ year old with ADHD, and impulse spending has been my life. While YNAB hasn‚Äôt cured it, using if for years *has* helped me understand where my money goes, and how I can take control of it. 

I‚Äôve used ALL of the applications out there for money. MINT only allows you to look backwards at your spending. Quicken? Hah. It‚Äôs a joke, compared to this system that allows YOU to fully grasp money as the tool that it is.
title: Why YNAB?

If you have any delays longer than a couple days, we'd love to help. You can email us at help@ynab.com! \\- Natalie @ YNAB", 'modified': '2023-06-19T12:57:54Z'}
review:
I ‚ù§Ô∏è YNAB. The system has revolutionized my budgeting, saving & investing. I no longer freak out every time my kid‚Äôs tuition is due, in fact I often have money assigned to that category 1-2 months in advance! Thank you YNAB!
 The only reason I don‚Äôt give it 5 stars is because there are often significant delays (like multiple days, sometimes more than a week) in downloading transactions from my primary bank. So, I can‚Äôt use the app to actually track things contemporaneously. If this weren‚Äôt an issue I would give it a solid 5 stars.
title: Fabulous system!

developerResponse: {'id': 34888383, 'body': "Hi luna! I'll let the team know you'd like to see more reports on the mobile app. It's great that YNAB has helped you know what you can save for the future. That's amazing! - Natalie @ YNAB", 'modified': '2023-02-15T15:34:23Z'}
review:
I love YNAB. It gives me a clear view of my spending, helps me know exactly what money I have available for what, and ensures that I can figure out exactly what I can responsibly save for the future. 

There is one inconvenient downside to the app: none of the reports that break down your spending on the desktop version are available on the app. I‚Äôm dying to have those, because I use the app 99% of the time and have to go out of my way to log in on desktop to check those spending reports.
title: 5 stars for program, 4 stars for app

review: Like many my last year has been rough. I seriously think if it wasn‚Äôt for YNAB I wouldn‚Äôt have handled things so well. It‚Äôs constantly keeping me honest and forcing me to look at my spending in a real concrete way, despite using credit cards (many apps just don‚Äôt account for this correctly). I‚Äôve been using this for going on three years now, but I REALLY used it this last year. And I‚Äôm very grateful so I figured I should finally write a review.
title: Gets you through the tough times

review:
In the first month of using YNAB we recovered 10% of our income that had been more or less wasted on ‚Äúlife‚Äù the month before.  That money recovery and planning continues a year later.  

The App is a big part of that and functions beautifully and fast and is nearly feature identical to the website.   Could it be improved?  Of course!  But week by week it receives updates and they address issues.  No issue at all rating this 5 stars, for the app, the dev team and for the service.
title: Worth every penny

review:
I had been using the original version for a few years and kept putting off the conversion to the subscription service version. I was already a fan of YNAB. It has been the only budget that my wife and I were successful in using together, and the results were great. 

This new version is even simpler to use. I also linked my bank accounts when I converted. I was hesitant to do that, too, but I‚Äôm very glad that I did. Maintaining my budget takes a couple of minutes per day, if that.
title: Was hesitant to convert

review:
It is one thing to have a budget, but it is another thing to actually follow it. YNAB has changed the way we spend and save and we could not be more grateful for that. Only thing missing from the app is showing the title of the budget you have open and it would be great if all of he reports available in the desktop version were available on the mobile app. 

Overall the app is really easy to navigate and is set up so that we can use the app almost exclusively.
title: Actually Following Our Budget

review: This is not just a budgeting app, but a life-changing budgeting philosophy that will allow you to take ownership of your money and your life. We went from living paycheck to paycheck to being able to pay off all our debt, save for a house and cash flow MANY projects and purchases. I just can‚Äôt say enough good things about this system. My car license plate literally says YNAB. üòÇ Anyways, take the leap and try it out. We did and have never turned back! Good luck!
title: Best Budgeting App‚Ä¶life changing

review: I love YNAB, it‚Äôs a great system to manage finances. However I‚Äôm torn because they currently offer no way to secure the application. I have this installed on my iPhone and iPad, and I have to be careful allowing others to use my devices for concern someone can easily open the YNAB app and see my private financial information. I contacted YNAB and they said they have no immediate plans to add security to the app. I can‚Äôt imagine this would be difficult to do. Until then I can‚Äôt recommend this app to anyone.
title: Great App/Poor Security

review: I‚Äôll preface this by saying I use YNAB daily and am a big fan of the app itself.  That being said, they‚Äôve recently announced a price hike (understandable) but are going back on a promise they made to original adopters of the app that our flat, yearly fee would be $45.  With the price hike, you‚Äôre looking at close to double the price with zero new additions and the same buggyness we have all come to expect with syncing with bank accounts.  It might be time to start looking at alternatives and if you are trying to decide if this app is right for you as a new user, I‚Äôd suggest looking elsewhere before settling on an app run by a company that clearly is tone-deaf and doesn‚Äôt care about their legacy users.
title: Great App, Untrustworthy Company.

review: I honestly don‚Äôt know how I functioned before ynab, always wondering and worrying if I‚Äôd have enough money in the bank so checks wouldn‚Äôt bounce. Living oh check to pay check. Now, we have a great savings, rainy day funds and my age of money is over 160! It‚Äôs almost like by using ynab I‚Äôm earning money ü§ë, I‚Äôm giving every dollar a job and it‚Äôs making all the difference. I‚Äôve been a user since the beginning and I love all their updates to the system. It‚Äôs user friendly (after learning the basics). Thank you thank you!
title: YNAB gave me control

review:
While it may not be the most straightforward or hands-off cash flow management solution, YNAB is unmatched when it comes to implementing the YNAB method. If you have no idea what that (or ‚Äúenvelope budgeting‚Äù) is, you‚Äôve never budgeted like this before. Requires regular maintenance to realize its full benefits, but this maintenance is pretty easy.

Still has some room to grow in regards to reporting and handling net worth tracking to become *the* one-stop shop for financial tracking, but the niche the app aims to fill is filled very well.
title: The Best App for Active Budgeting ‚Äî Requires Your Attention

review:
I absolutely LOVE LOVE LOVE this budgeting program. It allows me to go be every single dollar a home and save money more intentionally. 

At first there‚Äôs a slight learning curve but once you get it you‚Äôll never want to budget any other way. I rush to budget when money comes in and I no longer dread it. 

It‚Äôs the best digital envelope system. You have unlimited categories you can put money in. You get to see where every dollar is going and you can even pay off debt and credit card payments using their credit card feature.

I watched videos online of other people budgeting using this program and it motivated me to try it. I appreciate the 30 day trial as it helped us get the hang of it. My husband and I was hooked. We also teach our kids how to budget using this.

It‚Äôs a total game changer.
title: Game changer and worth the price!

review: Import delays and connection errors make this app useless. The budgeting tool is great and I loved the tracking but for the last few months nothing is importing. This app is supposed to making budgeting easy but since the imports haven‚Äôt been working, it‚Äôs like a glorified excel spreadsheet. I have to import the transactions manually. If the import issues were resolved I would definitely be satisfied but it‚Äôs useless right now.
title: Import delays and connection errors useless right now.

review: YNAB is among the best budgeting apps hands-down. I initially thought that budgeting was a limiting and restrictive endeavor, but after using ynab for more that two years now I have come to realize the freedom and control that it has brought to my finances and the peace that emanates from that. I often times wonder why it took me this long to start budgeting in general. Not living paycheck to paycheck is an attainable goal using ynab and a realization we should all have. I will be budgeting for all the time henceforth.
title: Taking charge

review: The YNAB approach is everything. The app is absolutely fantastic on all devices (I it on my iPad). The website is also very similar to the app, so if you have to switch between the two it won‚Äôt feel like two different worlds (this is the case with many other budgeting apps). The price of entry is absolutely worth it if you commit to the approach. You will really see your finances change and feel infinitely less stressed about organizing and spending money. I will be a lifetime subscriber without a doubt.
title: The ONLY Way to Budget

review: YNAB has actually changed my life. I‚Äôm a young professional making a good salary and I‚Äôm not afraid of spreadsheets, but I didn‚Äôt feel in control of my financial life until I got YNAB. Completely eradicated my financial stress and I‚Äôve made so much progress in saving and paying my debts. Subscribe online so you can share with people you love in exchange for a free month. Also join the subreddit for inspiration. Also, realize that it takes time to learn how to use YNAB, but once you do it‚Äôs a game changer.
title: Love it!! But subscribe through web app not iTunes

review:
I love this app!  It is easy to use and helps me keep track of my money and reach goals.  I also like that it is stable and convenient for spouses in a joint account to both see and log transactions.  

Connects to my bank so we have checking, savings and credit card for daily transactions. I actually quickly caught someone fraudulently spending our money by seeing the out of state transactions the next day and kept the damage to minor inconvenience instead of financial crisis.

Highly recommend!
title: Daily helper!

review: A true life saver for our family!! While suffering from postpartum depression after the birth of our first kid, I couldn‚Äôt get my mind wrapped around our finances the way I‚Äôd done for years and years prior. YNAB got what was in my brain on ‚Äúpaper‚Äù in a super easy to understand method my mom brain could utilize. We bought a house, have all our true expenses and insurance deductibles covered, 2.5 months of living expenses stashed away for a rainy day and are saving for the fun stuff now!! YNAB has been the catalyst for it all and I will be forever grateful!!
title: Life/marriage/sanity saver

review:
I've been using (new) You Need a Budget for a year. In that time, my net worth went up 12% and I've been able to figure out where my budgeting needs are. Prior to YNAB, I was worried about money and income all the time. I do not worry about money nearly as much.

This new version of the app does everything the web app does. It's quick, responsive, and syncs with my budget. I use it to stay on task and keep my budgetary priorities straight.

Update: I don‚Äôt notice any app-side bugs and the YNAB team‚Äôs support is second to none.
title: I can sleep at night

review: The apps works great but they do struggle to keep up with smaller banks changing their data models. For the last year I‚Äôve had the app work on and off but I can at least import transactions easily from my bank‚Äôs csv download. Basically when my bank says they will take down their website for maintenance I assume I will have to do it manually for 3 months or so. I‚Äôve notified support but they usually can‚Äôt help and have to wait for development to take a look. They don‚Äôt seem to have a way of creating a ticket to resolve this.
title: Works but struggles to keep up with changes

developerResponse: {'id': 46472105, 'body': "So glad you're here now!!!", 'modified': '2024-09-04T01:21:11Z'}
review: I was introduced to YNAB years ago but put off trying it out until recently. It has been great already!! I appreciate that they give you over a month to try it for free so you get through an entire cycle. It has already increased the conversations I am having with my spouse around money and he is entering his transactions because it is so easy. Hindsight is 20/20 and I still wish I hadn‚Äôt waited. If you are on the fence I encourage you to jump in.
title: Waited too long!

review:
YNAB has help my partner and I communicate about money in concrete terms. It takes out ‚Äúgrey-area‚Äù and decision fatigue. My priorities are clearly listed out for me to review and hold every dollar accountable. The app and web interface itself are excellent, and customer support with real humans actually will answer any question you have, both about technical questions or some of the ‚ÄúYNAB philosophy‚Äù of managing money. 

Worth every penny just for having an app that is so stable and responsive.
title: It‚Äôs worth it

developerResponse: {'id': 41906999, 'body': 'I really appreciate you leaving a review! The YNAB Method is a game changer and giving a every dollar a job is the best. So glad to have you YNABing with us! \\- Natalie @ YNAB', 'modified': '2024-02-12T19:38:21Z'}
review: I have tried budgeting for years and always felt like a failure because I could never stick to it. When I first discovered YNAB I was really interested in how different it was from any other budgeting technique. It‚Äôs all about budgeting the money you have right now! It‚Äôs so nice to be able to just up the app and see how money I can actually spend. I preach it to everyone I know. If you have always struggled to budget I encourage you to try this technique out.
title: Best way to budget!

developerResponse: {'id': 41800982, 'body': 'Hi there! Thanks for sharing how valuable YNAB has been in your marriage. I love how you shared that YNAB helps you to be on the same page as you make spending decisions. \\- Aubrey @ YNAB', 'modified': '2024-02-06T22:14:32Z'}
review:
YNAB has been one of the best things to happen to our marriage! Despite our
very different levels of comfort with uncertainty around money, YNAB allows us to be on the same page about our budget speaking the same language at the same time! For the first time ever, we are making decisions about how to use our money to support the life we want based on reality, rather than based on our often divergent feelings/guesses/intuitions about reality. Thank you, YNAB!
title: Why didn‚Äôt we YNAB sooner?

review: A friend recommended YNAB to me years ago as a way to track expenses. Little did I know the data I added to my budget would give me the details I needed to achieve a goal I set for myself of paying off the last of my (then) 10 year old student loans. Once I‚Äôd been using YNAB for a year, I had a solid overview of what my income and expenses were and where I could shift dollars to allocate towards paying off that balance. I reached my goal inside a year!
title: A staple app - worth the subscription

review: For years I tried all kinds of ways of keeping track of our spending in budget. I tried paper spreadsheets and other online tools. I just wasn‚Äôt disciplined enough to stick with it. YNAB has really changed all that. It‚Äôs easy to use, they make it intuitive and easy to fill out transactions. Customer support is great and they have good training available, all at a very reasonable price. I highly recommend this app.
title: I finally have a handle on our money

review:
I‚Äôve been a long time YNAB user and have kept my subscription through iTunes because of a legacy pricing structure. Recently I was informed that my subscription was going to double with no new features added nor anything groundbreaking on the road map. I do not see the value in paying $100 for a budgeting app while there are other cheaper options out there. 

The app itself is fine with no major issues. The philosophy or budgeting every dollar is an excellent practice but honestly is not something that needs to be tracked every month once you get in the habit of doing it. 

I hope they reconsider their pricing structure or offer more features in the future.
title: Not worth the subscription

review: I've used YNAB on and off for about 3 years, and whenever I use it for a couple of months in a row, my money situation improves. I tend to go for an overview, or for "can I pay that bill today?", but YNAB does what it says: no more bounced payments, no more trips to the bank to deposit cash into a check account or a credit card. There's always a bit of money left over when my next paycheck comes in. It's a little nit-picky for my style, but I find that altering my style a bit is maybe a good thing.
title: Got me started

review: I work with so many IT support teams trying to get the help I need and I‚Äôm still very often just met with generic and scripted responses to my problem, even in this day and age. YNAB support is none of that - there‚Äôs actually someone on the other end paying actual attention to your actual problem and giving you guidance that‚Äôs actually tailored to it. It‚Äôs refreshing. YNAB must treat their support team very well. They‚Äôre happy to be at their jobs.
title: Support team is top notch

review: The amount of stress this app has removed from our lives is astounding. We now know exactly what job every dollar needs to do, and given us the confidence to reassign those dollars when needed. YNAB has helped us eliminate debt, plan and execute bigger expenditures, and - best of all - use YNAB Together to teach our teenagers how to budget their money. Giving them the tools and knowledge to control their money and avoid the debt traps is an invaluable gift to launch them into adulthood!
title: Truly life-changing

review: I‚Äôve been using YNAB for a few years now through the web interface on my computer, but have been lately been using it more and more on my iPad Air. It works super well for nearly everything, but all of the really good info I used to get on the web interface through the reports isn‚Äôt available on the the iOS app (age of money and net worth aren‚Äôt as helpful to me). It would be great if you could add these reports!
title: Great App - more reports on iOS?

developerResponse: {'id': 39713483, 'body': "Hi there! Thanks for taking the time to share your feedback with us.
