review:
I‚Äôm so sorry, the new color scheme is really not working well for me. It is much more difficult to quickly scan through information than it was with the old scheme. Please allow users to switch back if they want to.

Also, overspent categories no longer display as red?? They display as the same yellow as underfunded categories do? That doesn‚Äôt make any sense and it‚Äôs much harder now to see which categories are overspent vs underfunded. 

I love this app and I‚Äôd hate to see these simple issues get in the way of my renewing the service
title: New color scheme is painful to look at

review: I have tried all the budget softwares out there.  None fit me until I found YNAB.  I‚Äôve been a YNAB Budgeter for nearly 2 years.  Now that I have historical data (that I will never ever lose because it is a web-based service), I can easily look back and see where and when I have overspent, what areas I can cut back on, and watch my money work.  Before YNAB I looked back and scratched my head wondering where it went.  Now I control my money....it no longer controls me!
title: This is a ‚Äúmust have‚Äù for budgeters everywhere!

review: I downloaded this app this morning and easily linked all my known accounts.  And on my lunch break I started typing in my monthly expenses... and for some reason there was this big category at the top called ‚ÄòTo be budgeted‚Äô that was a dollar amount I couldnt even imagine where it came from.  So after spending 40 mins figuring that out and not allowing them to count a savings account against money I need to spend, now I have a giant red -800$.  And I am ‚Äòspending money I dont have‚Äô.  Um, what?  Since I dont keep my total monthly bills in my checking account ALWAYS, it will always be a giant negative red.  Thats totally demoralizing and makes no sense.  This app makes no sense to me.  I deleted it and cancelled my ‚Äòfree trial‚Äô.
title: No thanks

review: We love YNAB! We have been using it for more than a year and it has helped us pay off all of our debt, take control of our finances, prepare for the future, and truly understand what our money is doing each month. The app interface is great, there is a bit of a learning curve, but their support is great and there are tons of FAQ and tutorials about how to budget with YNAB. Using YNAB allows me to stop thinking and worrying about finances so much and focus my time, energy, and passion elsewhere. Highly recommend!
title: Control over our finances!

review: YNAB has done so much in improving my personal accounting experience.  I find that I am keeping better control of my budgets, spending, and income.  At first I only used YNAB from a web browser because the App just wasn‚Äôt there yet.  YNAB developers have done an outstanding job getting the App functioning.  In fact some of the smart functions they have added to the App makes it preferable to the web browser version.  I‚Äôm extremely pleased with the product and will continue to use it!
title: Made good even better

review:
This app directly aligns with my zero based budgeting system. I also enjoy how you‚Äôre forced to budget within your means. The approach of only assigning money that you have specifically is helpful to someone like me with a variable income.

I also enjoy how the app promotes responsible credit card spending by automatically moving money spent on a credit card for a category to "Credit Card Payments"

I enjoy the feature of being able to make a budget item a ‚Äúfund" as well and it is simple to track activity for a fund. The concept of saving up monthly for an annual fee that YNAB promotes is wonderful too. 

Lastly, I like how the user is able to list a target amount to assign and the "auto assign" feature. This is helpful when funds actually come in to assign to those categories.
title: An amazing budgeting app!

developerResponse: {'id': 30620382, 'body': "Hey pJamma, thank you for this amazing 5-star review! ü§© We're so glad that YNAB is helping your family stay heroic and headed toward the future with financial confidence. But still - watch out for current day tigers. A budget can help you with a lot of things, but probably not fending off wild animals. - Kathryn @YNAB", 'modified': '2022-06-29T11:38:42Z'}
review:
You can use other programs to keep track of money‚Ä¶ but you might as well write on the wall with charcoal, count on your fingers and fend off sabertooth tigers with a pointy stick. 
YNAB is the only fabulous, futuristic financial app that turns you from zero to hero in a snap. 
Our family got rid of credit card debt, increased our savings and brought peace to the stressful task of tracking a budget. I dare you to walk away from this life-changing program. You‚Äôll be poorer if you do.
title: YNAB? Why not?!?

review: YNAB is one of the most important things I‚Äôve ever incorporated into my life. More than software‚Äîand it‚Äôs elegant, joyful software to use‚Äîit‚Äôs a distilled philosophy and method for living within your means and building wealth over time. The emotional reward for taking control over spending like this is enormous, empowering, and anxiety-relieving. Don‚Äôt hesitate, dive in now, with self-permission to learn slowly and create new habits over time. The you a couple years from now will thank you.
title: Invest in this, invest in yourself.

review:
We have been using YNAB for many years and it has helped us immensely! Within about a year and a half, we zeroed out our credit cards (and now carry no balance), paid off our car and finished paying off our house. We would highly recommend this app to everyone! It keeps you focused.
Update 2021 - reduced stars from 5 to 3; as all the above still applies, but I‚Äôm not sure that the large annual price increase is worth it?!
title: Fantastic Budgeting App

review: The best financial platform out there for wrangling personal finances. The app is great too. Every point of contact i‚Äôve had with YNAB shows how intentional they are about what they do and how focused they are about delivering a great product. They earn my money every year and not just phone it in and collect a check (Intuit) by constant polishing of the software and interface. If only the direct import partners and connected financial institutions would get on board it would be perfect.
title: No regrets

review: The app is great as a general tracker, but it‚Äôs horrendous in managing links with all manner of financial institutions. Constantly having to go in and authorize and reauthorize, and even when it‚Äôs working the importing of transactions is hit or miss. Transfers from one to the other are bad. Managing retirement accounts like 401ks or outstanding loans like Car Payments are worse. Takes a lot of maintenance. Reporting is limited. I haven‚Äôt really tried any others, so it might be the best out there, but it does the job if you‚Äôre already on top of things and just need a way to make sure you aren‚Äôt spending money you don‚Äôt have.
title: Great idea, so-so execution

review: It was great until syncing stopped working and YNAB showed their true colors. Support moderators deleted any questions about problems and always put the blame on banks, never took responsibility. I switched to Simplifi after The NY Times recommended it and it had been fantastic. Customer support is immediately responsive and follows up in hours, not weeks. Less expensive but most importantly it has worked 99% of the time vs months at a time troubleshooting with ynab with no great results. YNAB was good enough but now they have better competition. I am so happy to not give more money to YNAB after how they treated customers whose bank downloads stopped working. Deleted support posts = we don‚Äôt respect our clients.
title: Deleted after 1 yr and never regretted

review: We absolutely love this product! The app is laid out well and easily to use. It has really helped us stay on budget and had made, dare I say, budgeting fun. You do need to watch some of their how to videos as this is a completely different way to budget. If you don‚Äôt take the time to learn it you will hate it and be very disappointed. Their how to videos are quick and very informative and you can pick and choose which topics apply to you based on your budgeting needs once you learn the basics.
title: Awesome!

review:
And I will never be without it. YNAB completely transformed the way I think and interact with money. While most think budgets are restrictive - YNAB is empowering and freeing because you know you‚Äôre covered. 

Yes, there‚Äôs a cost. But that is warranted by the outstanding customer service, the free classes and webinars, and the peace you‚Äôll feel by knowing you‚Äôre in control of your money. 

YNAB helped me pay off my credit card debt, student loans and cash flow a wedding + honey money and two kids since then. Like I said, seven years with YNAB and it is now a part of our lives. If you‚Äôre on the fence SAY YES. Do the trial! Take a class. Give it your all. 

Additionally - the app is intuitive and getting smarter every day. We can do everything we need to on the go. Having the habit of spend money > enter transaction keeps us in control of our money each and every day.
title: YNAB user for 7 years

review:
YNAB has helped me take control of my money and use it to further my dreams.  The subscription costs about $8 a month, but I‚Äôve saved hundreds with this tool. 

The app is great for logging my transactions, but I got started using the web client.  It looks like most of the functionality I‚Äôm used to is here, but there‚Äôs some things best done on the computer. 

Give it a shot, and watch some help videos to get started.  I didn‚Äôt realize how much better with money I could be.
title: Vitally useful part of a financial plan

review: Wonderful app, great service. But I'm really missing the ability to see the history of transactions in a particular budget category on my iPhone app. In the new app version all I can see is transactions from the current month. Not very informative on Day 1 of the month. Makes it so difficult to know what expenses have been logged already or what's been going on in that category. My husband and I share a budget and this is our way of coordinating expenses. The loss of this feature is really hampering our communication. Please fix!
title: Missing YNAB 4 feature

review:
This app and the supporting website offers a simple life changing approach to proactively budgeting and not just tracking income and expenses.  You simply give ever dollar a job when it comes in and put money aside for what‚Äôs coming up both expected and unexpected.  

Easy to learn and tons of get started videos and live-streaming events.  Search the term YNAB Broke just for fun!  It‚Äôs when your cash accounts have lots of dollar but they‚Äôre all accounted for...so its beans and rice and Netflix for fun tonight!
title: Life Changing Budget App and so much more

review: I‚Äôm in the free trial period looking forward to pay day so I can open the new category for the totally worth it annual fee for this genius app. I‚Äôm so in love with it that I dream that I reconcile my accounts and I pay off debt. I have been a long time Mint and a cash envelope method user. However, YNAB gives me the power to take the bull by the horns and roll with the punches with precision and accuracy. No more loose change or surprises. I know where every single penny goes and I LOVE THE FEELING!
title: The assistant you always wanted

developerResponse: {'id': 38122325, 'body': "Hey Jess! I'm so glad to hear that YNAB has helped you increase your savings and your awareness of your money! YNAB does make managing your money more fun, doesn't it? Thanks for sharing the YNAB love with the people around you! \\- Kat @ YNAB", 'modified': '2023-08-06T13:34:17Z'}
review: Honestly, I feel like this has the power to change peoples lives. We‚Äôve been doing it for about a year now and we have a much better grasp of our money plus have increased our savings a lot. It definitely takes time and patience to figure it all out  (I‚Äôm probably still figuring it out) but it is worth the effort. Most of the time it feels like playing a fun game ha. The app/software itself is pretty remarkable. We tell everyone about YNAB!
title: Wonderful App

developerResponse: {'id': 41302855, 'body': "Hi Tommi! Thanks for leaving us a review. We're glad to hear that YNAB has worked well for you! And you're so right, giving every dollar a job can be a real game\\-changer. Regarding notifications, If YNAB is running in the background, you should see notifications, but if it's closed completely they won't come through until you open the app.", 'modified': '2024-01-15T17:28:02Z'}
review:
The YNAB concept of assigning money encourages you to take a whole different approach to budgeting. Being able to link accounts and cards to make sure there is enough funds to cover everything is very reassuring. Also just seeing and categorizing all the transactions makes you be much more ‚Äúin the know‚Äù about what you‚Äôre spending money on. 

Only issue is the transactions from linked accounts won‚Äôt show up in the app and give a notification unless the app is open.
title: Great budget tracker

developerResponse: {'id': 32357609, 'body': "Thanks so much for taking the time to type out this review; I'm so glad that you've found it life-changing! ~Renae@YNAB.com", 'modified': '2022-10-03T11:19:56Z'}
review: I very rarely take time out to type a review, even a small one like this. YNAB has been life changing for me. The UI is incredible (take a an hour or two to watch some YT videos when you start), and I feel like for the first time in my life I‚Äôm being efficient with my money. If you‚Äôre a student like myself then take advantage of the 1st year free. I‚Äôm going to be paying the full subscription cost when my renewal notice comes up no question.
title: Life changing

developerResponse: {'id': 35491232, 'body': 'Hi Jake - thanks for this review! There is a setting on iOS that might help, to enable it (if you haven‚Äôt already), you‚Äôll go to Settings > Accessibility > Display & Text Size, and then toggle the Differentiate Without Color option. I hope that helps! - Natalie @ YNAB', 'modified': '2023-03-20T20:37:55Z'}
review: Starting off, I love YNAB. It has really helped me keep my money in order over the last two years. I have one significant issue with the program though. I am colorblind, and the colors used to indicate whether I‚Äôm meeting my monthly goals are orange and green, which are very hard for me and many other colorblind folk to discern from one another. If an accessibility option were added to change the color of these indicators, this would easily be a 5-star review. Happy budgeting!
title: Perfect app for budgeting, with a single flaw

review: I‚Äôve started multiple times over the years to track my budget closely and always dropped the ball after a few weeks. This app makes it so easy, whether you are checking on it every day or even once a week! We‚Äôve had this for 5 months now and successfully stayed on top of our budget and can see where every cent of our money is going! I will continue to recommend YNAB to anyone who asks, it‚Äôs well worth it.
title: Love it!

review:
For the first time in all my fifty-seventeen years I KNOW EXACTLY WHERE MY MONEY IS! And no, I don‚Äôt mean which financial institution, I mean not only how much I‚Äôm spending on each part of my life, but beforehand, like actually thought out! It‚Äôs amazing. 

Take the workshops, watch the videos, and every time you have a question look it up in help. This is the best support you‚Äôll ever get to learn how to MANAGE your money rather than simply watching it go bye-bye.
title: I‚Äôve never been this excited about numbers!

review: Another financial app that says they link with my bank- but don‚Äôt. This is my third time trying to use one of these apps for budgeting and every time there third-party company PLAID has an issue connecting even though they list my bank as participating. Frustrated. I‚Äôm not able to give it an accurate then he‚Äôll without the ability to automatically link my information in. The whole point of using an app as to avoid having to manually make entries. When you click to check the status of the conflict it was a bunch of outstanding tickets and none of them are with my bank. There‚Äôs no option to report it either.
title: Not able to link my accounts.

review:
YNAB is an excellent budgeting tool that can help anyone get their finances under control.

There's a strong focus on money literacy, and helping users form a plan. The assistance and lessons that come with the membership are helpful and easy to digest. I also find it impressive that the mobile app can do anything that the full web app can do.

It can be difficult to edit many transactions at once. I sometimes find myself changing the same attribute of many different transactions one at a time. If you're already a budgeting and spreadsheet guru, you'll find you have more power and control in a full spreadsheet program, but it's hard to beat the convenience of having a synced app. 

I would recommend this app to anyone who is a beginner or adequate with their financial literacy.
title: An Excellent, if Simple, Budgeting Tool

review: The methodology behind YNAB - giving every dollar a job - may sound incredibly restrictive at first, but it‚Äôs actually so freeing. I‚Äôve found that I can spend money on the things I want with zero guilt, knowing that all of my needs are already fully covered. The direct import integration also helps keep everything completely up to date and accurate. If you‚Äôre looking for a very active but lightweight way to take control of your finances, look no further. It‚Äôs worth every penny.
title: My sanity, in an app

review:
Great app, made by a developer focused on their customers. Easy to use yet still deep. The company puts their philosophy to budgeting and saving in action through the app. 

My only complaint is I‚Äôd love to see their super helpful and detailed Reports feature that exists on their website also be recreated in full on iOS (or, at the very least, in the iPadOS version of YNAB). 

I think not having a more fleshed out version of their insanely useful Reports feature on iOS/iPadOS is a huge missed opportunity and is the reason I‚Äôm giving YNAB four stars instead of five.
title: Love the App, but...

review:
I‚Äôve adored YNAB for a couple years now and I think it‚Äôs worth every single penny. I base a lot of my life choices on how I use this app. It has greatly increased my quality of life. 

I only give 3 stars due to the apps current state of bugginess. Frequently my To Be budgeted category will change from moment to moment upon opening and closing the application. It has caused headaches while trying to keep money straight. 

Keep up the good work. I will watch mindfully and update this score as necessary.
title: My life revolves around this app

review:
I recently started using this app and I will say I love how easy the user interface is. I‚Äôve used other apps like this and I find most of them to busy for me and I loose focus trying to understand the app and end up not using them at all. 

Something I miss about using other apps are the payment reminders. I have most my bills set up as paperless, like most of us do, and would really like a reminder to help me remember those bills in the busy day to day lives we all live. 

Other than that. Works great!
title: Great app, would love a payment reminder to be built in...

review: I had the classic version. And loved it. Sure it took an hour (or more)of my time every week to manually put in transactions, but it was familiar. The classic app kept crashing. I pouted. But Being without YNAB was worse than new YNAB. I reluctantly switched and now I love it even more. Linked bank account = no more paper receipts piling up in my wallet/bags. On the go budget changes make the process smooth and always up to date. I got a better product and that hour (or more) back. So glad I upgraded!
title: Reluctantly loving it

review: THANK YOU for the updated mobile app. You turned a monthly dreaded chore into a simple task I do on the bus every day or 2. One feature request - allow quick switching between months with a swipe to the top bar. I keep doing the gesture and expecting it to work, then having to click through to get to the next month and back.  :) but anyway tell your engineering team they are a bunch of beautiful angels (pms and designers too, I guess)
title: I'm finally able to manage my budget on the regular :)

review: ‚ÄúYou need to spend money to make (save) money‚Äù applies to this app. I‚Äôve been using a budget (paper and then Excel) for 30+ years. YNAB makes it so easy and fun to track where every cent of my money goes. No more surprise annual expenses (car registration, Costco membership, property taxes, etc.) Emergency expenses - no problem. Needed a new washer and drier - had money saved for it. House flooded and needed to pay the insurance deductible - had money saved for it. This app is Worth. Every. Penny.
title: Best Budget App!

developerResponse: {'id': 35577527, 'body': "Hi Christine! We're thrilled to hear that YNAB has made a difference in your financial life, and that our videos and help guides have been useful as well. Thanks for taking the time to share your feedback, we appreciate it! - Jill@YNAB", 'modified': '2023-03-25T00:43:47Z'}
review: This budgeting system has helped me manage my finances better than anything else I have ever tried. The app is intuitive and well-designed and syncs with my accounts easily. There is a learning curve but it is more mental (learning the budgeting method) than about the software itself. The website has a ton of educational information that is helpful for anyone getting started with different financial goals. I‚Äôd definitely recommend YNAB!
title: Great budgeting system

review: Functionality for Storing calculations that are tied to a goal amount? Say for instance I had a long term category called furniture and I have a goal set that seems arbitrary, I would like to see a table have columns for (I.e) item (bed couch), next expected replacement date, expected price, source, expected durability at this price point. Like a simple, little, built-in, beginner-friendly, finance calculator that saves your work so you can check it and get better.
title: Is there‚Ä¶?

developerResponse: {'id': 36984924, 'body': "Thanks for leaving a review. I'm sorry you found YNAB to be confusing. We'd love to answer any questions and clear up what might be going on. You can email us at help@ynab.com and we can go from there! \\- Natalie @ YNAB", 'modified': '2023-06-07T14:52:22Z'}
review: Thought it was great the first month. Now it‚Äôs telling me I have over spent by $5000. Its two days into the month, I havent even spent $5, let alone $5000, what is it talking about? I tried to just clear it all out this month, but it‚Äôs requiring me to reassign stuff from previous months and preventing me from doing anything. It has all the previously adjusted assignments instead of the baseline that I originally set. I have tried YNAB and everydollar, both are honestly so obnoxious with their quirks and the transactions failing to sync or duplicating. I‚Äôm probably just going to go back to the 1800s and write a paper budget.
title: You need a confusing budget

developerResponse: {'id': 32214147, 'body': "Thanks for being such a long-time YNABer, Evan! I'm glad to hear that you're still finding YNAB to be the best out there! üí™ That said, we are constantly working on new features‚Äîincluding some mobile transactions entry updates that I think you'll like! Take a look at our Up Next page for more: https://www.youneedabudget.com/up-next/ ~Renae@YNAB.com", 'modified': '2022-09-25T11:30:08Z'}
review:
Still the best personal budgeting app (I‚Äôve been using it for at least 8 years).

However, my main ‚Äúcomputer‚Äù is the iPad Pro and the app is lacking keyboard navigation support. I almost never use the iPad app, but instead just login to the website. This isn‚Äôt too big of an issue, but it feels like a waste to have the iPad Pro using only the website.

For example, on the website I can enter in a new transaction, choosing the date, payee, category, memo, and outflow/inflow using nothing but the keyboard. However on the app, hitting TAB moves me from the outflow amount to the memo, without allowing me to choose the other options. I know we iPad Pro users are a small minority right now, but many of us who use iPad Pro‚Äôs are more ‚Äúprosumer‚Äù in our use‚Ä¶ and this includes keyboard navigation.

Regardless, still the best! Great job YNAB.
title: GREAT, but iPad app needs keyboard support

review:
It took us a few months to adjust our life‚Äôs to budgeting but thanks to YNAB it was as painless as could be. Now one year into using YNAB our life is so different. By planning for expenses every month life can‚Äôt surprise us. Works great with credit cards and every dollar is accounted for. Well worth every penny!

The only frustrating part is that it doesn‚Äôt work great with AMEX. It splits out account into users for charges but does not split them for payments. If this could be fixed that would be great!
title: Life changing!

review: Back in the good old days, when I did the budget on paper, I only budgeted the money that I had. Nowadays, online budgets are a projection of the month, no matter whether you have received the money yet or not. I love this budget for the simple fact that I fill categories only if I have the money to do so. It keeps me on track in a healthy way, minus the anxiety caused by funding categories without money on hand. Plus the peace and joy when funding retirement means the world to me. Thank you a million times over, YNAB!
title: Love My Budget

review:
I have been using YNAB for over 5 years‚Äîwell before a mobile app existed. It is truly the best budgeting system available. Don‚Äôt hesitate to support this amazing company while getting yourself on track. 

I love that the YNAB philosophy is make a fresh start by looking at what you have, budgeting it by giving every dollar a job, and adjusting as you go.

It‚Äôs a different thought system than other software options, but it‚Äôs so simple when you understand it. (Their training videos are stellar.)
title: 5+ Year User

review:
If you choose to use this app, watch these people *very* carefully. It‚Äôs probably not a good idea to ask them for help, either. They did *nothing* that I asked for and EVERYTHING I asked them not to ‚Ä¶ and the only person who didn‚Äôt follow this pattern is likely being kept from helping me because the boundary-violating bullies are having too much fun.

Update: The only person who actually tried to help eventually returned and I attempted to work with her, but she couldn‚Äôt help defending (and even *praising*) the bullying tactics of her co-workers. That tells me they put their personal issues ahead of actually helping customers ‚Ä¶ that‚Äôs all I needed to know.

‚ÄúWhen someone shows you who they really are, pay attention.‚Äù - Maya Angelou
title: Don‚Äôt ask for help

review:
I‚Äôve been using this software for at least three years. I love it. It has changed my family‚Äòs financial life. This iOS app is a great accompaniment to the desktop app on my Mac. I highly recommend it.

My only complaint is that this iOS app, in all of it‚Äôs iterations, has never had any type of security feature. Meaning, that anyone who has access to your phone has access to your financial data within this app. How can we have gone so many years with this app and not have it password-protected or protected by face ID?
title: Great Accompaniment to the Desktop App

review: I am a newer YNAB convert. I began using it at the end of January, 2018. I took a big pay-cut and went back to school. I am obsessed. I‚Äôve listened to every single podcast, I‚Äôve read the book, I‚Äôve taken a number of the workshops on the website. I have recruited three dear friends to YNAB with me. The app is wonderful, the company is wonderful. My husband and I have already paid off two of our smaller balance credit cards and are working on our third. YNAB is the answer to all of my budgeting needs.
title: Simply amazing

review: Ugh I freaking LOVE YNAB. I currently have a funded emergency fund, new car fund, and am on track to pay for Christmas gifts, and a vacation next year! And money to get my car detailed, drs appts, bday gifts, etc. It feels SO good to actually plan where my money goes. YNAB makes me set the budget but then also cover the overspending when it happens. It‚Äôs not just, oops I‚Äôll do better next month. No, you actually have to choose what category loses money if you overspend. Genius.
title: YNAB changed my life

review: YNAB‚Äôs one of the best tools and routines in my partner and my life. It has completely transformed our relationship with money, and provided a great sense of financial relief by making the intangible tangible. Knowing and feeling you are secure can be 2 different things, and YNAB has really helped us with the latter. While YNAB‚Äôs philosophy and app is not the only way to budget, it certainly is for us and all the friends we‚Äôve recommended it too!
title: Life and Game Changing Even for those Already Deep Into Budgeting

developerResponse: {'id': 45823793, 'body': "Hi there, Lauren @ YNAB here. I know that with prices rising for most things these days, any hike can be hard to swallow! We're incredibly thankful that many YNABers stick with us for years, and that means we don't make price changes lightly: there were many factors that went into this decision, including that the cost of supporting each individual user (in terms of servers, security, and support) has gone up. If there are any sticking points in the app we can help with, I hope you'll reach out to help@ynab.com‚Äîwe want every YNABer to feel like it's 100% worth it!", 'modified': '2024-08-07T14:39:42Z'}
review: So I like the app (some issues), but as many companies now a days do they totally let down me as a customer down. There is this thing called loyalty to already subscribed customers. Many other apps keep the price the same for customers who have been with them and only add price increases to new customers or even returning customers once they cancel but it gives an incentive to stay subscribed. Not impressed. So they took over after Mint ended and now upping prices as there is now more of a monopoly. $10 here, $10 there really adds up. Disappointing as people are struggling out here.
title: Zero loyalty

developerResponse: {'id': 44973378, 'body': "We LOVE hearing stories like this, Jeremy! Thanks for sharing how YNAB works for your family - here's to many more years of not fighting about money, and raising the next generation of smart spenders!!!", 'modified': '2024-07-01T18:41:02Z'}
review:
YNAB has changed money from a source of conflict to an aspirational conversation within my marriage. 

My wife and I set the budget goals together, then we just run the plan. When kids want to go out to dinner we all open YNAB and discuss, do you want to go to dinner tonight? Or save it for when Grammy and Grandpy come Saturday? 

Money has become an easy, fun conversation where we talk about what we want to do together instead of what we cannot do.
title: Never fight with your spouse

review:
One of the biggest perks of using YNAB for me was the complete elimination of anxiety. No matter how my life turns out, using YNAB gave me the peace of mind that I‚Äôd have my basic necessities budgeted for even during tough times . That freed up a lot of my thinking towards other goals. I‚Äôve been using it for 4 years now and it‚Äôs one of the best software I‚Äôve paid for - the peace of mind and ability to easily plan is well worth what I pay for it.

Also Hannah rocks!
title: Financial game changer

developerResponse: {'id': 35581621, 'body': "Thanks for sharing your fantastic results with YNAB, Big_Apple_J! I'm thrilled to hear it is working for your personal and business finances, and we appreciate the kind words about the app and our learning resources. Keep up the great work! Sasha@YNAB", 'modified': '2023-03-25T13:30:58Z'}
review: I have gained tremendous control over my financial health using this app.  The interface is clean and straight-forward and the features are powerful yet easy to use.  I replaced QuickBooks and run my business with this app as well.  There is no question that if you download this app and implement the best practices they provide in the incredible amount of training that you will gain absolute control and visibility into your finances.
title: This app has truly changed my life

developerResponse: {'id': 37616370, 'body': 'Sorry to hear that! Many YNABers use credit cards like you and find it works well for them. We are happy to help get your credit cards working smoothly, you can email us at help@ynab.com! \\- Natalie @ YNAB', 'modified': '2023-07-11T18:09:01Z'}
review: I have two issues: First, I put pretty much everything on credit cards, including all bills and even my rent. I pay them off every month, using it like a debit card (and earn tons of miles/points doing this and basically travel for free). The interface isn‚Äôt really set up for this and it requires a lot of extra steps and makes it look like money has been spent twice until you manually fix it. Second, I exclusively use AmEx credit cards and the connectivity with YNAB is awful. These two issues make the service basically unusable for me. Nice idea though.
title: Just doesn‚Äôt work for me

review: YNAB is the best!! If you‚Äôre familiar with the envelopes system Dave Ramsey teaches, this is basically a digital version of that. So much more convenient. It‚Äôs a super high-quality software and the YNAB team has put together amazing educational materials to not only teach you how to use the software, but the 4-rule philosophy that really helps you be successful in your budgeting endeavors. I always had a paper budget but never really stuck to it until I got YNAB. It is worth every single penny.
title: So helpful!

review: YNAB has been a lifesaver!  I used to make complicated spreadsheets and attempt to keep things updated in it...but this failed every time. What used to take me 2-3 hrs per week, now takes about 15 minutes per week. We know where every penny goes, and can see trends for spending in various categories, so can then tweak those if needed. A family member told me about this app....nothing could be more user friendly and helpful.....and timesaving!  Thanks YNAB!
title: Lifesaver!!

review: I love this app.  This is the first time in my life that I‚Äôve been able to take control of my finances.  It takes time to see the changes and now 2 yrs later it‚Äôs gratifying to finally see the age of my money staying past 45 days.  In the beginning getting out of debt and staying there was the challenge. Living month to month was no fun at all.  Now that I‚Äôm seeing my savings slowly grow every month is not only enjoyable, but has taken away a lot of worry, stress and anxiety.  Thank you YNAB
title: Amazing app

review: I am a TERRIBLE money manager. As soon as I get money, I spend it. I‚Äôve needed to rethink the way I look at money for a long time. This app was recommended to me by several people in my life. Unless I‚Äôm using it wrong, it‚Äôs not helpful for people that aren‚Äôt making more than minimum wage. I live paycheck to paycheck at the moment and it was constantly saying I was over budget because the funds in my acct were always so low. It never let me budget with my monthly income‚Äî just whatever I had in my account. I searched and read and asked about how this could be different for me and I found nothing helpful. If you‚Äôre working poor, this app is not good.
title: Not as helpful as I thought.

review: We were doing a decent job budgeting before finding YNAB, but it was always a chore. I love that my hubby and I can really be on the exact same page and see exactly how much we have in each category. We paid off over $10,000 of loan within 5 months of using YNAB because we could see exactly how much ‚Äúextra‚Äù money we had to put into loans. üôåüôå if you‚Äôre on the fence... DO IT! Paying a little bit for the app is  1000% worth it!
title: Wouldn‚Äôt go back

review: It took a while to adjust but i feel sooo much less stress. Even though i have no debt i still scrambled every month to make sure i had enough to pay off credit cards.  I was a big ‚Äúfloater‚Äù of credit.  Now i set aside and plan for everything.  This app FORCES you to do the right thing, which we all need!  Financial peace and freedom!  Plus you watch everything so i have caught billing errors i might have missed!  Been a user for 6 months.  Worth it and addicting!
title: Get on track!

review:
This is by far the best budgeting application out there!  The ability to budget proactively, using an electronic envelope system, is what makes the difference!  Others let you look at what happened, or set goals and planning.  But YNAB allows you so much more!

For planning, use a spreadsheet program. That is great for ‚Äútheoretical‚Äù budgeting. But when you want to work with what is in the real world, use YNAB!  I have used it for years, and the new iPhone app and web app are excellent!

If you subscribe to Dave Ramsey‚Äôs plan, this app will work!  It is better than Dave‚Äôs budget program (sorry, Dave) because YNAB allows you to reconcile your accounts with the bank. The budget has no use if it does not agree with what is in the bank. I never could find a way to do that with Every Dollar.  

Just use this.  I have for years. You won‚Äôt regret it!
title: The best

review: I‚Äôve never been great with money! Budgeting is something that has just never clicked with me. I was putting all my money into paying off credit cards and slowly racking up debt. It was such a frustrating cycle.  And one YNAB has helped me break.  It‚Äôs smart enough to show me where I should spend my money and flexible enough to help me adjust when I fall out of line.  It‚Äôs really a lifesaver if you are struggling with your bank accounts.  Can‚Äôt recommend it enough!
title: FINALLY something that works for me!!

review: The functionality of the app is fantastic.  I like the philosophy behind YNAB, but the one problem I have is the time it takes for transactions to sync from my accounts to the app.  The app is always 2 days minimum behind my actual online accounts.  Then by the time I get around to categorizing my transactions it‚Äôs been longer (5 days or so).  This makes using the app to check on remaining balances almost useless.  Other budgeting apps are way ahead with some that even show pending transactions.  If YNAB could fix this, then it would easily be a 5 star service.
title: Too Long to Sync Transactions

developerResponse: {'id': 45729656, 'body': 'We LOVE hearing things like this, Nikkia! Good luck on your move, thanks for using YNAB!!!', 'modified': '2024-08-03T20:07:00Z'}
review: I always knew I needed a budget but never knew where to begin. The free trial brought me in and I was very intimidated at first. The app wasn‚Äôt user friendly and it took several videos but I was determined to budget and SAVE money! It‚Äôs been nearly 3 months. Consistently! I‚Äôve made 28k in 3 months and I was able to save 15k of that money! In 7 days I‚Äôm moving my family 500 miles and 2 states away with my savings. I have a testimony thanks to YNAB ‚ù§Ô∏èüôèüèæ
title: This app is soooo UNDERrated‚ÄºÔ∏è

review: I seldom ever write reviews but this app is life changing. I‚Äôve been using YNAB diligently for over a year and I am more fiscally responsible than I have ever been, all thanks to to this app. The app is intuitive to use and does everything you need without extra bloat. Linking your accounts is incredibly easy and adding transactions on the fly is a breeze. You really do need a budget and you should be using this app to track it
title: The best budgeting app I have ever used

developerResponse: {'id': 36036387, 'body': "Wow, what a great review! Paying off that much debt and staying out of debt afterwards is a big deal and I'm so glad YNAB had a small part in that. Way to go! Thanks for being such a longtime YNABer. - Natalie @ YNAB", 'modified': '2023-04-18T20:26:50Z'}
review: I used mint, quicken, and others before finding YNAB. This one takes the cake. Been a member four almost 5 years and it has been life changing. YNAB helped me pay down $40,000 in credit card debt and I am proud to say that besides my cars and home, I am debt free. It works very well and any hiccups I have had have been handled by their support team very quickly. They are friendly and helpful people. Can‚Äôt say enough how much I love this company.
title: Best Budgeting App Out There

developerResponse: {'id': 37521729, 'body': "Hi there, thanks for leaving us a review. If you'd ever like to give YNAB another try, reach out to us at help@ynab.com! The credit card functionality is fully compatible with paying them off monthly, and we'd love to help get those running smoothly for you. We can provide some guidance in regards to your other two road blocks as well! \\-Jill@YNAB", 'modified': '2023-07-06T20:28:09Z'}
review:
I really wanted to like this app. 3 things made it such a pain for me to manage.
1) I use credit cards for my daily spending but always pay them off at the end of the month. This causes a double spending problem where the money is spent once when the buy something and again when I transfer money to pay the bill. I watched a handful of videos and there was no easy way to either a) ignore the transfers to my credit card b) easily fund the different budget categories

2) 70% of my transactions are uncategorized. Manually categorizing everything isn‚Äôt ideal

3) no easy way to carry over a budget between periods. Some categories are flexible (eg $100 / month for entertainment). Some months higher, some lower. It would be nice to carry over a budget and overfund for the following month. Then, ‚Äúround up to savings‚Äù if I find I don‚Äôt need that money.

Unfortunately, I‚Äôm canceling my subscription and deleting.
title: Does not work well with credit cards

review: My husband and I have been using this software since before it was a web based app-that‚Äôs 8+ years! üò≥ It has allowed us to plan and prepare for many adventures, medical expenses and unknowns along the way. This truly is an amazing budget software! Their help team is incredible and they are constantly improving bugs. I think for price it gives you so much more than most of the other budgeting softwares out there!
title: Best True Budgeting Software!

developerResponse: {'id': 34846717, 'body': 'Hi Jay, I really appreciate your thoughts around the overspending when you cover money from a category. I can totally see why it would be helpful to not show as overspent. Thanks for leaving this review and budgeting with us! - Natalie @ YNAB', 'modified': '2023-02-13T20:50:36Z'}
review: All in all YNAB is a fantastic budget app/software. And honestly the only thing that I don‚Äôt like about it is that when you transfer (YNAB calls it ‚ÄúMove‚Äù) money around from one budget category to another it marks the one you moved money out of as underfunded for the month. People overspend in categories and cover from others, that should not make the ones that covered marked as underfunded. If YNAB changed this, it would be 5 stars all the way. It‚Äôs still the best budget app/software out there.
title: Best budget app around

review: The iOS app for YNAB is well written and fully functional. YNAB itself is the best consumer budgeting app on the market bar none. It took me some time to understand some of the core assumptions/concepts, but the library of text and video education made that easier. It integrates with most of our financial institutions seamlessly. The process of entering and categorizing purchases is intuitive. It makes the trade-offs inherent to savings/spending your money easy to see and reason about.
title: This application has made my life better.

review: I have been enjoying YNAB style budgeting for a couple years and up until now the updates have been good. Unfortunately the updated UI in version 3 is worse than what we had before. I liked the previous UI and colors. The newer theme is much less appealing or user friendly. I don‚Äôt understand: Why do companies insist on ‚Äúfixing‚Äù what isn‚Äôt broken. I would much rather you work on adding features or fixing bugs than changing the UI every year or so.
title: Latest update ruined the UI

review:
The new update looks great and it seems much of its function has been retained. That being said, two small but important things have been changed/removed. 

On the accounts page at the top, it used to show your total net worth at well as your total debt. That‚Äôs gone now and it just says net worth. Along with that, negative balances were red, positive green and 0.00 was black. Now the negative and 0.00 are both black, positive has remained green. 

I have dyscalculia, number dyslexia, and I typically don‚Äôt carry balances on all my credit lines, so this change has made it incredibly difficult to just glance at my account balances to see what they are. Along with the total debit over all accounts being removed, it‚Äôs made this update very bad for me. 

It‚Äôs such a minor change but it‚Äôs fundamentally ruined my ability to use the app. I wish it was a setting I could choose at least. Please consider fixing this.
title: Small changes, big problems

review: We have used Mvelopes for more than 15 years and unfortunately Mvelopes has slowly sunk into awfulness.  We started our search and after several months we landed on YNAB.  Once we made the decision it took us all of ten minutes to link our bank and credit card accounts.  The experience was enjoyable.  This is an excellent budgeting tool.  We, without reservation, recommend it to anyone looking for a powerful yet simple way to budget yourself into positive cash flow.
title: Excellence made Easy

review: This program took me from paycheck to paycheck always worried I wouldn‚Äôt have enough to thousands it the bank. Over time and taking their live classes and learning what they teach has been a true life changer. If you are tired of the paycheck to paycheck cycle and are willing to learn, this is the program for you. Success is a thousand little choices made differently with YNAB showing you, step by step, how to save and spend money on things you value. I highly recommend it.
title: Best budgeting software Ever

review: At what point are you going to expand the functions of YNAB to the tablet platforms? Not everyone uses a computer or laptop everyday! I use the phone app for my everyday YNAB entries and then I prefer to use my iPad Pro when I need to do my weekly reconciliation of my accounts. I work on a computer all day long Monday-Friday....the last thing I want to do on a Saturday morning is sit in front of my computer at home! ALLOW US TO RECONCILE FROM THE IPAD APP!!! And I am tracking literally reconcile not just clear the transactions! I am considering looking at other budgeting tools because of the lack of freedom this causes. Why pay for a subscription if it can‚Äôt be top notch!?
title: Limited functions w/o a computer

review: I absolutely love this app, the videos are worth watching! I was frustrated as I couldn‚Äôt get everything to balance at first until I watched a video, and it‚Äôs sooooo simple!! I‚Äôve been using this app for years now, worth every cent! It is amazing what I‚Äôve been able to achieve by being in control of my money. I also love the ease that it pulls transactions directly from my bank, I am able to stay on top of my budget.
title: Love this budget app!

review: I love the concept of YNAB, but I‚Äôm not impressed so far.  We had a lot of trouble getting our Schwab bank accounts to sync and had to go back and forth with customer service quite a bit to get it sorted out.  Also, it appears that if my husband and I both want to have the YNAB app on our phone, we *each* have to pay the $90 subscription fee.  At $180, I‚Äôd rather find another software option (or just use my own spreadsheet).
title: Pricey

review: I‚Äôm 34 and lived paycheck-to-paycheck my entire adult life. That ended when I downloaded the app 6 months ago, a time when I was between jobs and had zero savings and then the pandemic hit. There are so many YNAB resources available, I listened to the audiobook (free from the library!) and actually read the email newsletters because they‚Äôre insightful and useful! Being financially literate and solvent has removed a ton of stress from my life and I owe it all to this app and the friend who recommended it.
title: This method changed my life

review: I absolutely love YNAB. I graduated college in May 2018 and began using YNAB in February 2019. I clicked with the philosophy instantly and I've used the app every single day since then. With YNAB, I payed off $26k of consumer debt (student loans, credit cards and a car loan) in short amount of time because I was intentional with my money. YNAB has become such an integral part of my personal finances. Now that I'm debt free, I cannot wait to use the app to reach my retirement and savings goals!
title: I can't recommend this app enough!

review: I have spent the last few years with this app and the classic version it is hands down the best budgeting software out there. I volunteer my time helping people put their finances in order and have tried to work with other apps. The people that have had the most success use YNAB. It has made the difference for me and my family being able to stay with the program. Take it and run with it. You will be so happy you did!
title: I can‚Äôt stress enough how wonderful this is.

review: I‚Äôve been using YNAB for I‚Äôd say 5 years maybe? It is a great tool for sure. But I‚Äôm getting to the point where I‚Äôm going to start looking at other options because it is really annoying trying to figure out how much money you‚Äôll have left after upcoming payments. They used to have a running balance but now to see that for scheduled payments you have to check mark every payment and then subtract. It‚Äôs annoying. We aren‚Äôt all rich and have unlimited cash flow. Lol please help get the running balance back!!!
title: Need a running balance!!

review:
Simple idea executed extremely well. I love this tool. Using YNAB, I went from paycheck to paycheck to having almost 4k saved. Granted, I had the money to work with to begin with - it won‚Äôt make you rich; however, it WILL help you put your money to good use. 

I used to worry about each check and which bills it would pay. Now, I‚Äôve got this month‚Äôs and next month‚Äôs bills set aside, and I don‚Äôt worry when I spend money, because it‚Äôs set aside for that purpose. 

It‚Äôs the envelope idea updated for a digital world, and the bank integration - while sometimes spotty - is a great way to keep track of spending. 

It does require that you USE it. It won‚Äôt automatically help you, you have to want it a bit. I check my bank against YNAB daily. Overkill, sure, but it helps me stay on track with my debts and savings.
title: Awesome tool, simple principle.

review: I would love to be able to use this on my iPad in either landscape or portrait. I like the concept and it makes more sense than most of the other budget apps out there, but for some reason pending transactions do not sync from banking institutions so money may be spent but it doesn‚Äôt appear spent in the app for a day or two. I suppose that wouldn't matter if you use it only to forecast the next month, but if you need to make adjustments or want to see how you are sticking to you budget daily, it can be a bit inconvenient.
title: Love it but . .

review: YNAB is amazing. It showed me how to handle my money better. I knew I needed to save but I didn‚Äôt necessarily know what I was saving for . It also made me feel better when paying bills because I already knew what to expect and that way it was never stressful. They also have classes every day that you can join in listen to l. The teachers are very professional and personal. It has changed my life and I will be using this app for a very long time . Money well spent.
title: Definitely changed my life

review:
I have been desperately searching for an app to get my finances under control. This one isn‚Äôt it. Again, this is way too complicated and confusing. I feel like I need either a degree in economics or programming to use it. 

First, it keeps wanting me to budget my savings for expenses. This the exact opposite of what I want to do. When my bank shows a payment to a credit card or loan it doesn‚Äôt seem to do anything to the balance of the corresponding account. 

I don‚Äôt understand why someone can‚Äôt make a simple budgeting app. Maybe it‚Äôs time to go back to pencil and paper. At least the cost of those isn‚Äôt a budget buster like the cost of these apps.
title: Too complicated

review: YNAB isn‚Äôt only an app. It‚Äôs a framework and a methodology at the same time. It‚Äôs based on the envelope method with so much more cool things incorporated in it. It serves type A folks like me and the fire-and-forget kinds too! I‚Äôve been using this app for 4 years and so this feedback runs deep üòÑ my experience on their awesome support has been great because follow up happens and issues actually get resolved. Kudos to this team. I wish I could work at YNAB actually üòÑ üëç
title: Worth it

review:
As someone who metaphorically wrote the book on value-selling, this was already a tough sell at $84 per year given other options at half the price that offer twice the intelligence, such as investment tracking (REAL, actual investment tracking and live asset tracking). Even with connecting your accounts, most of the work is manual. As a 3-year user I have YNAB-PTSD. 

To be clear, all these features I just mentioned are available at half the price from a big name competitor who‚Äôs been around for longer and does accounting (that‚Äôs what budgeting is, at the end of the day) much better than YNAB. The value was not all there at $84, and it‚Äôs non-existent at $100.
title: Price hike for ‚Äúvalue delivered‚Äù

review: Am I the only one that is frustrated with change earlier this year that removed the ability to see what my planned budget was?  This was huge for me to help see how far off I was from what next months bills would be (based on goal setting) and comparing that to what would be coming in. That allowed me to make adjustments before assigning $s.  I have been trying to work with this, but may have to look elsewhere if YNAB can't bring this back soon.
title: Cant see what a planned budget is

review: Once you commit to using this app, you will begin treating your earnings with respect. Once you give every dollar a job, you begin to realize every unbudgeted dollar you spend means the money has to come from somewhere you‚Äôve already allocated. Watch your relationship with money change for the better. Watch your mindset change about impulse purchases. Watch your ability to make decisions about your financial future vastly improve.
title: Outstanding Budgeting App! Life Changing.

review: Had a few friends recommend YNAB to me a year ago. Tried the free 1 month trial, and have stuck with it ever since! I‚Äôm still relatively young in working world and so was a bit hesitant and unsure of how to save and manage my money well. YNAB won‚Äôt do the work for you, but that‚Äôs the point. It‚Äôs awesome being able to feel confident evey single day, knowing exactly where each of my dollars is going and where I need to re-evaluate my budget or my spending! Will probably use for life!
title: Totally worth the price!

developerResponse: {'id': 35168223, 'body': 'Thanks so much for taking the time to share this feedback with us, and for being a long time YNAB user! You\'re so right that the YNAB method isn\'t quite budgeting in the traditional sense of the word. I like to call it "complete financial control." üòÅ We love hearing that you\'ve been able to save the cost of YNAB many times over! - Jill@YNAB', 'modified': '2023-03-02T15:52:02Z'}
review: This is the best budgeting software on the market. Quicken, mint, and all the others are after the fact ‚Äúbudgeting ‚Äú. Hint-That isn‚Äôt budgeting. Assign your money to categories first and stay on budget! Works with the Dave Ramsey system as well. Even better than the program that they sell. I have used this program for over 10 years and have saved many, many times it‚Äôs cost. Totally worth it!
title: If you want to save money

developerResponse: {'id': 44580265, 'body': 'Alina, thank you for letting us know where we can improve on accessibility features, that is something that is important to us and I have confirmed our developers are aware of this issue! YNAB is available on desktop via the web as well if that is an option for you! If you have any other questions write us at help@ynab.com. ~Phil@YNAB', 'modified': '2024-06-13T12:55:44Z'}
review: You cannot change the font size, which is accessibility feature #1. The designers assumed users either are color blind, legally blind or have perfect vision. The font is incredibly small, and there is a lot of text crammed into small spaces. I unfortunately have a binocular vision disfunction and photophobia that can make focus on fine details very difficult and attempting to do so on a screen will trigger migraines. Apps that use high contrast are even harder to use. The dark mode is painful, but I can add filters via IOS to change that. However there to do about the font size. I will have to switch apps since this app is inaccessible.
title: Lacks Accessibility Features

developerResponse: {'id': 38735023, 'body': 'Thanks for leaving a review! I am so glad you have found YNAB to be great and thank you for sharing it with your friends and family. Sorry to hear you ran into a bug while trying to contact us. You are always welcome to email us at help@ynab.com! \\- Natalie @ YNAB', 'modified': '2023-09-05T12:14:27Z'}
review: I had a problem assigning a credit card payment (I ended up figuring out how it works) and I tried reaching out to support in the app. It gives me premade options and a text bar at the bottom but when I try to enter my own text it minimizes the keyboard and only shows the premade options. Also when I swipe up when I reach the bottom of the text string the whole menu moves down. Other than the issue with the app, YNAB is great and I will be recommending it to friends and family.
title: Love the app but the support ui does not work

developerResponse: {'id': 35537105, 'body': "Thanks for leaving this review! It's so great that YNAB has helped you pay off your debt and increase your savings so much. üéâ - Natalie @ YNAB", 'modified': '2023-03-23T01:56:26Z'}
review: I do really like this app for budgeting money. Before I was using YNAB we lived paycheck to paycheck with not much extra spending money. We started using YNAB in 2016, after about 6 months we actually had some savings and being able to pay off some debt. Right now we have about 10,000 in savings, which is unheard of for us. This app contributed to these savings. The only thing I don‚Äôt appreciate is how much money YNAB USE increased since we started at $50 a year and we are now paying $106.
title: Good Budget Tool

review: YNAB makes it so easy to keep on top of your money.  Any transaction we didn‚Äôt plan for shows up during import and can be dealt with daily.  We know what we do have money for and what we don‚Äôt have money for.  I check for transactions to approve multiple times a day out of habit.  And I know when an expected expense hasn‚Äôt been charged yet.  I  makes you aware of your money situation and helps you bend it to your will.
title: Money Mindset

developerResponse: {'id': 30896642, 'body': "Thank you so much for the 5-star review, krisx22! I love that YNAB is working well for you both on web and mobile. I agree that your phone is much easier to check when you're stopping by Target! The app has the same functionality for managing the budget as the website imo and I love using it to check and make sure I‚Äôm on track (because I‚Äôm terrible at budgeting and knowing if I‚Äôm close to going over, especially if I‚Äôm walking through a Target or in k-town).

Thanks for taking the time to leave this review! \\- Kat @ YNAB", 'modified': '2023-05-09T12:11:10Z'}
review:
This app is easy to use, has all the features one could want in a budgeting tool. This has been an absolute game changer for our families finances. There are no more surprises throughout the year, and if there are we have the freedom to shuffle things around without stress. 
There are also many useful tutorials and articles on how to tailor the app to your needs. I highly recommend this application for everyone.
title: Excellent Budgeting Tool

review: I do not care for this budgeting app. It‚Äôs very confusing, and also very shortsighted. It‚Äôs difficult to see my long term goals, and even my monthly goals. I get the concept, but it isn‚Äôt very user friendly. And the fact that I can‚Äôt unsubscribe on the app or even my phone‚Äôs web browser, but have to login on a desktop, huge downer. If I can sign up without a desktop, I should be able to unsubscribe without a desktop. If you want an easy to use budgeting app, try EveryDollar from Dave Ramsey. I know people will love this app, so maybe it just doesn‚Äôt work with how my brain does.üòè
title: Very confusing

review: If you have YNAB Classic and you have not yet switched to YNAB 4, don‚Äôt do it. We‚Äôve been struggling with this web-based version for almost two years. I‚Äôve contacted customer support many times to ask questions and make suggestions. Nothing has helped. If you are at the point in your budget where you are spending last month‚Äôs income on this month‚Äôs expenses, this version will absolutely cause you to spend that buffer without even knowing it. Stick with the YNAB Classic as long as you can. If you have to switch, look for something else. Our subscription ends next month. We will be going with some other program, or back to paper - anything would be better than this.
title: Keep your YNAB Classic

review:
Recent updates have made using the mobile app so much better. The app is invaluable on the go. YNAB has helped us avoid dipping below into our line of credit since the month we started in June 2017. A bi-weekly miracle. Each month we are shocked at how far from a $0 checking balance and are aging our money farther. 

Jump into YNAB‚Äôs philosophy and especially the software! It‚Äôs been life changing, reliving so much financial and marital stress! Highly recommend to anyone who wonders where there money goes or is tired of not feeling in control.
title: So much better!

developerResponse: {'id': 46665138, 'body': "Thanks for sharing that feedback on the subscription price, LaMaChris! The decision to raise the price on YNAB is never taken lightly, and is in direct relation to our desire to create an excellent product for our loyal users. Our goal is to help you love the way you spend your money, even if that's not with us - let us know if we can help you cancel, or if you have other questions we can help with by reaching out to help@ynab.com.", 'modified': '2024-09-11T15:13:10Z'}
review:
I have used this app regularly since 2020 as it is a good app. I thought the price increase of $15 in 2022 was overkill and now 2 years late you raise it another $10 in 2024??? A $25 price increase over 2 years (for your loyal customers) when it is already so expensive is how you loose loyal customers. 

I will be taking the next several months to try out alternative apps and find a replacement. I use this app to budget bc I need to save money everywhere I can. $84 for a budget app barely fit into my budget. $99 was a stretch. $109 is so ridiculous.  My Financial Peace University counselor thought this was a ridiculous expense at $84. 
What a shame
title: Ridiculous price increaes

review: YNAB has been the best budgeting tool! They give you so much flexibility, and make everything very clear. I‚Äôm not sure why it‚Äôs so expensive, but I do plan to continue using them. They are still my favorite between all the other options I‚Äôve tried.
title: Great App!

developerResponse: {'id': 35914995, 'body': "Hey Acowens1260! Nine years -- that's awesome! Thanks for being such an awesome advocate for YNAB! You're in good company with the other YNAB budget nerds. Keep up the great work growing that Age of Money and matching your money to your priorities! -Kat @ YNAB", 'modified': '2023-04-12T13:13:06Z'}
review:
I have been using YNAB for almost 9 years, and I still love it to this very day.  I have gotten so many people turned on to YNAB, and one person actually works for them now creating Podcasts/videos.

I never thought I would ever be a nerd about budgeting but I love it.  I still enjoy giving my money ‚Äújobs‚Äù and it makes me extremely to see my Age of Money get older and older.

If you are on the fence of YNAB give it a try!
title: Best software around!

review: YNAB is one of the best budgeting programs that uses the envelope budget system. I am still new to the program, but YNAB has a learning curve to it but they offer plenty of online resources to help with that learning curve. The iOS app works pretty good. I have not had any issue with it so far other than figuring out how to do certain things. I myself have learned YNAB on their website so the app was a little bit different to use
title: One of the best budgeting programs

developerResponse: {'id': 31298462, 'body': "Hi Cody! Thanks so much for taking the time to share your experience. We always love hearing from YNABers about what is - and isn't - working for you. Reach out to us at help@youneedabudget.com so we can make sure we get the full scope of your feedback (and your Apple Watch idea!) to our design team. -Becca @ YNAB", 'modified': '2022-08-05T12:05:42Z'}
review:
I‚Äôve been using this for a while now and it‚Äôs the best method and app to get control of your money. 

The worst part is the custom numeric keypad and entry. It doesn‚Äôt work like anything else on iOS and I mistype at least 75% of the time, and have no problems elsewhere. The amount entry also by default replaces everything instead of being a standard entry field. It‚Äôs just miserable to use, which stinks given it‚Äôs the most used part of the app for me. 

Oh, it‚Äôd be amazing to be able to enter transactions, even stubs, from Apple Watch.
title: Great Method with One Big Flaw

review: This app makes me feel like I actually have control over my life and my finances. Every transaction is categorized and that helps me feel like I‚Äôm on top of it. I link my cards to this app so it makes things so much easier and prevents me from forgetting about any small transaction. It‚Äôs helped me save a lot more money because I know where that money is going. It‚Äôs very user friendly and has a nice interface. I highly recommend!
title: Ease of mind when it comes to budgeting

review: If you are at all like me, it helps to have someone show you how to use this program. I found that friend at a wedding in MN and have been hooked ever since. It is hands-down the best budgeting program that I have ever used! I have been told the first year is the hardest, as all the forgotten yearly expenses are brought to light. I am loving getting to see it all clearly and looking forward to this year and beyond! PS The podcast is also a great addition to using the program.
title: Find a friend

review: I have tried pretty much every budgeting software there is (including Mint) and have discovered that this is the best software out there, hands down. This app has saved me HOURS of work every month, and is the key to getting out of debt and feeling in control of your finances. I love knowing how much money I actually have at any given moment. It‚Äôs a truly freeing and useful app, and the yearly membership is worth every penny.
title: Best budgeting software on the market.

review: The real power of YNAB is in the philosophy behind the app: Approaching budgeting through the lens of assigning all income a job. It takes financial discipline. If you‚Äôve been broke to the point of begging the power company to keep your power on, you will benefit from the YNAB method. It‚Äôs complimentary to many of the popular debt reduction and financial stability strategies that work. There is a community of users who are supportive. The technical support team at YNAB is very responsive. It‚Äôs worth every penny and more for a subscription.
title: Financial Game Changer

review:
Love YBAB so much. I tell all my friends about it. My 14 year old daughter (who is training for the Olympics btw) uses the app and is gaining a huge appreciation of the value of a budget (good thing since it costs a ton of money to seems a kid to the Olympics!) 
This app is a marriage saver as well. Talking money can be hard but when you both have a current snapshot of your money it makes decisions on how or if you can spend money a no brainer. 

When or if you have a technical issue the team at YNAB is right on it. I recently had a connection issue with my bank. A few emails back and forth and it was fixed. I get why they don‚Äôt have a phone help line but my only gripe is having to wait a day to get a reply. That said they always do respond and then stick with you till the problem is solved. 

Thank you for being AWESOME!
title: BIG FAN!

review: After trying out 4 different budget apps and finding them all to be lacking, this one blows the rest away. If you‚Äôre looking to actively control you money, save, and make it work for you, this is the app. The app is intuitive, yet very powerful. Combine it with the YNAB method and you have the complete package. Their customer service has been phenomenal. Jen was super helpful in the included coaching session. Tons of resources available. YNAB is the way to go. Take control.
title: By far the best

review:
I have been addicted to budgeting software and apps for the last 15 years, and by far this is the best. I think the app is lacking when it comes to the Reports, but with the web top version you can pretty much do whatever you need. 

The process is very simple and when you set up the goals you can really make sure that every dollar is working for you. 

If I can just figure out how to get my wife to actually use the app and look at the remaining balances in each category we would really be rolling. 

Nonetheless, if you enjoy keeping track of your income and expenses and want to make sure that you stay on target for your savings goals Then you should really try this app out. But don‚Äôt try and do it just on your iPhone you really need to use the web top version to get the full effect.
title: SIMPLY THE BEST

review: I‚Äôve tried many of the budgeting apps - Mint (RIP), EveryDollar, Rocketmoney‚Ä¶I always come back to YNAB. It‚Äôs flexible and intuitive and I love using this app to meet all my budgeting needs. I love tracking every account - checking, savings, debt, investments, cash - and seeing everything all in one place. The app gets better with each update and I can‚Äôt imagine changing budgeting systems any time in the near future. Great job, YNAB team!
title: I‚Äôve tried other budgeting apps, YNAB is IT!

developerResponse: {'id': 41177336, 'body': "Thanks for your review!! I love how you mentioned the peace that comes from knowing you have planned ahead for your spending, whether that's a monthly payment or something less frequent. \\- Aubrey @ YNAB", 'modified': '2024-01-09T12:55:22Z'}
review: I‚Äôve been using YNAB for a couple years now and I absolutely love it! I‚Äôd consider it absolutely essential for anyone who deals with money. It gave me peace when I stopped worrying about if I could pay my monthly credit card balance or when I started saving for irregular payment like car insurance or gift... I also enjoy that I can pay for it because there are no commercials, no selling of my personal data!
title: Essential!

developerResponse: {'id': 43941586, 'body': "Hey Chris, thanks for the feedback \\- it's super valuable, and we appreciate you taking the time to share some specific features you're looking for. I've passed it along to our product team!", 'modified': '2024-05-16T00:44:03Z'}
review:
At $100/yr, this app should at least have the ability to store receipts. The latest new features which include sharing my YNAB subscription with others feels pointless for me. I‚Äôm a dinkwad! I‚Äôm not going to share my subscription with my dogs! 

In all seriousness the only other powerful feature that has been added was the loan payoff feature. That‚Äôs nice but very limited on mobile. I really do want to keep YNAB but at this price point and it‚Äôs becoming difficult to justify the cost.
title: Keeps raising the price without any new functionality
