review: I do not have much free time and I struggle to track my transactions regularly. I hoped this app would make that process simpler and more intuitive. Instead, this app gave me even more work to do.  After a fairly convoluted setup process I ended up not being able to actually import any of my transactions automatically and having to work manually. I went to the help section multiple times and tried to get the best answers I could find through video and written guides. Still confusing‚Ä¶ still so many steps. I am now even more frustrated and stressed about my finances.
title: This app is terrible for anyone who needs support with balancing a budget

developerResponse: {'id': 30172007, 'body': "Thank you so much for the wonderful review, erin laine! We're so honored to have had an impact on your life. Sending that love right back at you! ‚ù§Ô∏è - Kathryn @ YNAB", 'modified': '2022-06-05T17:17:12Z'}
review: I am not a money person. Or a numbers person. I would never have guessed I would one day be in love with my budget app, but I am. YNAB is life altering. I‚Äôm not sure if I would have any money in savings right now or be in the financial position I‚Äôm in without having this beautiful way to track and plan my money. And the company and customer service are like no other business I‚Äôve ever interacted with. It‚Äôs mind blowing how helpful they are. ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è
title: In love üòç

review: YNAB is so helpful and flexible and the app is really great at showing you your budget and letting you tweak it as needed anytime. (I saved more than 5 times the annual subscription price my first month. Worth it!!) I love budgeting for next month as soon as I get paid. So helpful! And the team deserves a shout-out, because they‚Äôre incredibly helpful and personable if there‚Äôs a question or a problem. The in-app help system is really neat. ü•∞
title: Amazing control of finances

review: I almost deleted this app after the free trial, but, a friend told me to stick with it for a bit longer and I am so glad I did! It is not like a traditional budget and there is a learning curve to using it. However, it has totally changed how my family thinks about money! It‚Äôs literally been game changing for our spending. I cannot recommend the app and platform enough!! It is definitely worth your purchase!
title: The BEST budgeting app

review: My coworkers introduced me to YNAB and it has really changed my life. I know to the penny how much I‚Äôve saved and how much I have left in all my categories, and it doesn‚Äôt make mistakes constantly like Mint. There are some things that are also much easier on the app than desktop. YNAB has made it that I look forward to opening my budget every day. The newest updates are great ‚Äî very glad I can reconcile from my phone now.
title: YNAB is the best

review: Maybe it‚Äôs a little confusing to catch onto YNAB‚Äôs method at first, but once you get the hang of it, it‚Äôs a whole new world of money. YNAB is almost single-handedly responsible for me getting out of tens of thousands of dollars in credit cards debt, building an emergency fund, saving for a down payment on our first condo, and basically everything else good in my life. I am a YNAB evangelist, and think everyone would be more financially empowered if they hopped on board.
title: I basically owe YNAB my life

review: I have been using YNAB for about 10 years.  Functionality has improved a lot during that time.  My husband was laid off last year and this has been a wonderful tool for staying on track with our new budget constraints. My only gripe is that there are no itemized category reports.  You have to export your info to a csv file and format into reports from there.  Obviously it is not a deal breaker, but I wish it were easier.
title: Wonderful household budget tool

review: Can‚Äôt say enough good things about this app! I‚Äôve looked and tried various apps over the years trying to find what this one offers... real time updates on what we have spent in categories, able to share with a spouse on a different device, real time input from credit card expenses to be able to make sure the money is there to cover them.  It has given me total confidence in my ability to stay on budget!
title: Total life changer!

review: I just can‚Äôt find a better budgeting app and I‚Äôve tried A LOT. YNAB just makes sense to me and I love all the workshops and videos that make it all so simple to stay on top of my budget without feeling overwhelmed and defeated. I‚Äôve saved so much money this year and paid off my 5 year car loan in less than 2 years all because with YNAB I knew what every dollar was supposed to do the second I earned it. Budgeting is the new freedom!
title: Best Budgeting App

review:
Have been using the on-line version of You Need A Budget for approximately 6 months.  This is a very comprehensive and easy to use budgeting program.  It makes it very easy to track expenses.

Several years ago I purchased the YNAB software for use on a PC, I found it too difficult to keep the program up to date.   Have experienced none of these problems with the on-line version.
title: You Need a Budget Online

review: YNAB has been absolutely integral in me becoming aware of my money, and especially learning how to spend on stuff I really do want and save on the rest. The app is great, and on the few occasions I‚Äôve needed to contact Support (mainly because I was trying to do tricky things and couldn‚Äôt figure out how), they were awesome! This system definitely has a bit of a learning curve because the style of budgeting is not the same as some others. That said, it‚Äôs absolutely worth it.
title: Life changing

review: Great customer service. Solid concepts. However, implementing the concepts with this app or website is not intuitive. The complexity in getting going is frustrating. Be prepared to spend a time getting setup with budgets, goals, and initial reconciliation and for trial and error and contacting support, which is excellent. My recommendation: don‚Äôt even attempt to use the mobile app or the desktop website until you‚Äôve read the help docs or watched the short videos or you‚Äôre in for frustration. I ended up throwing away hours of work and just starting over.
title: Complex and time consuming

review: I was hoping this would be better than another app i tried but i found it difficult to customize to my needs and set recurring expenses. Overall it seemed very confusing even after consulting the help section. It must be helpful for some who have no budgeting ability or ability to use spreadsheets but for me it wasnt worth paying for. I was hoping to be better able to track daily expenses and tag them for categories. Alot of times you may have groceries and entertainment on the same receipt and you need to break that up or whatever and this didnt seem to let me do that either.
title: Not great, my spreadsheet is better

review: YNAB is more about the method and philosophy than it is the app alone. So take time to read through their site and learn the method first. But good news, the app is fantastic anyway. With YNAB, I went from frantically looking at a spreadsheet of upcoming bills every day wondering if we‚Äôd be able to cover them, to having the next 2 months of expenses covered and another few months worth in savings. I barely think about money anymore, and that is the greatest thing YNAB has provided.
title: Changed My Life

review: This is by far the best tool I have used to track my spending habits. It empowers you to adjust your budget to life as it happens. You set goals, and instead of feeling foolish and undisciplined when things don‚Äôt add up, you can easily see where you made you mistakes and then adjust. I actually ENJOY budgeting now. And that is saying a lot.  This is an excellent system that I believe anyone can use and benefit tremendously over whatever they are doing right now.
title: Best Budgeting App Hands Down

review: Downloaded this app because I saw it recommended on a finance forum. Deleted immediately, but I just received an email that my account is about to automatically switch to a paid subscription tomorrow. I followed the link to unsubscribe, and it didn‚Äôt work. I can not figure out how to remove my personal info, and it feels like a scam that they will automatically charge my iTunes account for an app I never actually used. The email I received did not have a title that accurately explained what was happening, and it felt as though they were hoping people would not open the email to see that their account is going to be charged.
title: Difficult to unsubscribe before being automatically charged

review: I‚Äôve tried almost all of them (free & paid) and YNAB is hands down, no question, the best option available. Think of it as an ‚Äúelegant, electronic envelope cashflow management system.‚Äù If you‚Äôre concerned about the cost‚Ä¶ don‚Äôt be. Use YNAB consistently and you‚Äôll easily save many multiples of the cost‚Ä¶ every year‚Ä¶ and be in ultimate control of your money and financial life. (5 year user now after 25 years with Quicken)
title: Best cashflow & debt management app!

review:
I‚Äôve used YNAB for 5 or 6 years now. It has been such a life changer!! 
When it comes to managing my money, seeing where it went, planning ahead and budgeting, saving, working with a significant other and even kids, it‚Äôs hands down the best budgeting app. I especially appreciated the support and videos to guide me along when I first began. Now I also frequent the Reddit forum to keep me motivated and hear other peoples stories.
title: The best budgeting app!!!!

review: I am so happy with the app! I started using it on a holiday vacation I took to see my parents in 2017 and I‚Äôve never looked back. Being able to ‚ÄúBudget on the Go‚Äù has helped me more times than I can count and there is no way I could budget or live without this app now. It is a necessity if you want to know how much money you have in all your categories at any time. Highly recommend!
title: Without This App I Would Be Lost

review: Great app! I do the majority of my transactions on my credit card and I manage my Schwab debit account manually. This works for me. I was having an issue with Schwab connectivity, but due to the low number of transactions I can manually manage this. So far, is helping me keep track of my money with just one debit account. I no longer split my money between my 2 debit accounts and my savings account.
title: One of my most used apps

review:
I've been a YNAB customer for many years now and it's very frustrating that basic features like reconciling accounts are still not present in the mobile app. Even more frustrating is the fact that some mobile features like the "age of money" report aren't in the web app. At least one of the apps should be full-featured. And development seems to have slowed to a crawl. I hope YNAB can get it together.

Update: I just canceled. After being a customer for over five years, they emailed me that they will be doubling the price of the subscription fee. And with only 30 days notice. Awful.
title: Slow development. Missing features.

review: I‚Äôm the worst at being organized and have been historically dreadful with monitoring cash flow (‚Äúliquidity‚Äù as they say in the big leagues, I think) but YNAB has turned me into a slightly obsessive but overall better moneybag-man. I feel confident in my ability to froth money around like the dreamy end of a pumpkin spice latte with warm cinnamon raisin bread fresh from the ... wait what was I saying?  Oh right YNAB makes budgeting a snap. I recommend it highly and would encourage anyone to try it; ‚ÄúY‚Äôall need a budget‚Äù.
title: YNAB saves orphan kittens

review: This app is worth every penny! In less than 60 days, we‚Äôve managed to save $250 towards an emergency fund - one of the steps towards eventually getting out of debt!! I‚Äôve used many budgeting systems through the years. None of the others made it so easy to see exactly what is happening with our money. On the day before we get paid, I snatch up any money left in our budget and get it into savings ‚Äî we‚Äôre on our way to freedom!
title: Saved $250 in less than 60 days

review: I had YNAB Classic for years and resisted switching. Once I switched to the web based YNAB it was even better. My net worth has grown substantially and what YNAB has shown me was that although I was making good money I still overspent. Eventually it gets to the point where it doesn‚Äôt make any sense to keep spending your money away instead of building freedom. Just do it, get the app and you won‚Äôt regret it. Plus the new videos YNAB has been creating are awesome. Keep up the great work.
title: Best Money App Ever

review: Yes, there are other budgeting programs out there, and it‚Äôs not the cheapest deal in town. But the ease with which YNAB syncs between the app and site, the live webinars on how to use the program and manage money, the fantastic customer service, and the many features and money-tracking options make the program the best investment I‚Äôve ever made. What‚Äôs $84/year when it helps you eliminate over $20,000 in debt and change your financial life? A darn good deal, that‚Äôs what!
title: YNAB is the reason we‚Äôre debt free.

review: In 2015 I fell in love with Marie Kondo‚Äôs ‚ÄúThe Life-changing Magic of Tidying Up‚Äù (I promise this will relates back to YNAB soon). The ‚Äújoy spark‚Äù practice she teaches helped me get much of my life in order, but it wasn‚Äôt until I committed to YNAB that I felt in control of my finances and truly found joy in giving every dollar a job. I am a huge fan of YNAB! I attempted to use YNAB in 2011 and it was a fail on my part, but I started back up almost a year ago and I LOVE it. They have refined the user experience exponentially and I 100% recommend!
title: YNAB CHANGED MY LIFE!

review: This app is definitely worth the money spent on it! It makes it easy to set categories and designate where you want your money to go. It also does an excellent job of keeping track of how you spend your money so you can change your budget for the next month according to how you have been spending your money. Also let‚Äôs you move money from one category to another in case you do end up overspending in an area!
title: Great help to managing money!

review:
I have been using YNAB for over 3 years and the app for the same amount of time. This newer version of the app is very good. 

If there could be one improvement is if it could update the transaction faster. Sometimes it takes 2-3 days after a purchase is made to be available to update in to ynab (app and desktop).

Overall I am very happy with YNAB and would recommend it to anyone who wants to get their budget in order.
title: Great even after 3 + years of using!

review: This mindset has bled into how I divide my time and energy resources, not only my money (though I have much more success with my money)! I would like to see, in a future update, the completely unnecessary but customizable ability to change the app icon on home screens and a dark mode for my late-night budgeting. For a wonderful example of these options, Streaks app and Carrot Weather have done this successfully. Thank you for consistently adding useful features!
title: Love this app

review: There are other budgeting methods and apps out there, but there‚Äôs only one YNAB. Some people struggle slightly at first with the method, and if that‚Äôs you, read the YNAB book or a few blog articles; you‚Äôll get it quickly. Once you‚Äôre in it and flowing, you‚Äôll starting saving big money and meeting goals through conscious spending/giving. I‚Äôm 3 years in and it‚Äôs brought our family new ease and success. 5 stars!
title: Don‚Äôt hesitate!

developerResponse: {'id': 39821668, 'body': 'Thank you so much for this review! Our Support Team is fantastic and they love helping YNABers with any questions they have. So glad they were able to help you! \\- Natalie @ YNAB', 'modified': '2023-10-30T12:16:51Z'}
review: I‚Äôve been using YNAB for about 4 years now, and had to finally leave a review commending their customer support. I ran into some confusion about how my balances were showing up, and two separate customer service agents both provided great help to get me on track within one day of my support request. Would wholeheartedly recommend YNAB for the budgeting tools alone, but the service really goes above and beyond.
title: Great Support

developerResponse: {'id': 36440994, 'body': "Whoo! I'm so glad we can be there with you on your financial journey. ü§ù It's so great that YNAB has helped you feel so on top of your finances! Thanks for leaving a review! \\- Natalie @ YNAB", 'modified': '2023-05-10T13:01:28Z'}
review: I had been using a spreadsheet to track my spending, but things were (1) starting to get too complicated to easily manage, and (2) at the end of the month, things were starting to not add up. YNAB has turned both of these things around. I‚Äôve never felt more on top of my finances, and until we abolish our current money-based order, it will be a trusted friend in my day to day journey.
title: Game changer

review: It‚Äôs incredible how much you can save when you actively track your money. I have been using the app for a month and I‚Äôm happy to say I love everything about it. The app is incredibly functional and offers a simple design for easy use. I would highly recommend at least trying it out and seeing if it works for you. I can say this was the best thing I‚Äôve done for my financials.
title: Great opportunity

developerResponse: {'id': 36001920, 'body': 'Thanks for the review. It sounds like you are definitely getting the hang of it, nice work! Feel free to reach out if you have any questions as you go, okay? You can email us at help@ynab.com. - Natalie @ YNAB', 'modified': '2023-04-17T12:24:41Z'}
review: Coming from Mint, I wish I would‚Äôve tried this app years ago! I love the concept of only budgeting the money you currently have and being able to create categories for future bills so it can tell you how much to set aside now so you‚Äôll have the money when the time comes. The only downside is the learning curve, but I know I‚Äôll get the hang of it soon. YNAB will be my forever budgeting app and I look forward to getting out of debt and seeing my money grow!
title: Excellent App

review: Finally! An app that does it all. Now I am 100% certain I have the money in my accounts to pay my credit card in full. I can plan for and have money for expenses that only come up every few months. Every dollar has a job! Saving is so easy! I can adjust my ‚Äúbudget‚Äù immediately to adjust for life‚Äôs normal fluctuations. This app is so flexible and it‚Äôs easy to import and track. I can‚Äôt say enough about it! So worth the money!
title: The Last Financial App I will ever need!!

review: I‚Äôve been a customer for 7 years and enjoyed the budget customization and YNAB best practices. But over the past year I‚Äôve had to open several support cases for direct import not working. YNAB always points the finger at their import partner and never takes accountability. Yet they continue to do business with them. Currently my direct import has been down for over a month and there is no urgency to fix it. This once great company (I actually wanted to work there at one point) has really gone downhill. Trust me, look elsewhere - there are so many other services in this industry that offer the same product for free!
title: Direct import always broken

review: YNAB is a method first and app second. We started using it back in July but never really adopted it until November. Once we took the time to learn, embrace, and practice the 4 rules regularly our stress went down and quality of life improved. This app strongly supports their method and while I do love shiny new updates (and their hilarious release notes) this app does exactly what it needs to do as is. Keep up the great work, YNAB team! Can‚Äôt thank you enough.
title: Your future self will thank you...

review: They are always adding more features and fixing the app all the time. Even though it works just fine the way it is. And the customer service is on point. Three times I‚Äôve had an issue and a quick message to them had it solved within the day, and they always follow up with you. Both customer service and a well designed app make it worth the subscription and five stars.
title: App is great service is better

review:
YNAB gave me my freedom and my life.

I wish it was a hyperbole but I was in deep financial debt. Student loans, low paying job, and living with my parents was my life before YNAB. Now I‚Äôm debt free, working a job I love, and living my best life yet.

I started with YNAB 4 and started to get my financial picture in focus. It was ugly. My net worth was deeply negative and I didn‚Äôt have any freedom to live the life I wanted. Following the 4 rules along with many financial blogs, vlogs, and talking heads, I start reining in my spending, saving more money, and laser focused on killing my debt.

It worked. It was hard work giving up some of the things I loved (but not all) and missing new experience I could‚Äôve had (but not all). Now I‚Äôm focused on building my wealth and preparing for the next stage of my life. I hope you‚Äôll find the same.
title: Long time user, for a long time to come

review: YNAB in general is a life changing program! It‚Äôs changed our financial picture tremendously. I highly recommend to YNAB to everyone. This app helps us stay on budget and budget on the go. I love inputting transactions in real time and having the most up to date look at our money. I don‚Äôt have any negatives at all to this app and nothing I think should be approved upon. It gets  5 gold stars from me and my husband (and kids they‚Äôre little YNABers, too! 6&9 years old! ) thanks YNAB!
title: YNAB is life changing

review:
I would like to see two things added. 

1. An easy way to either have a budget goal per paycheck (I get paid every two weeks) or a handy quick button that lets me put 1/2 my monthly goal into a category so I‚Äôm not doing awkward math every other paycheck to hit half my goal. 

2. I would like to see a calculator in the screen where I enter split transactions. That way I can add up all the amounts for different categories right it this app and don‚Äôt have to switch back and forth to a calculator.
title: Great! Some requests.

review: There‚Äôs a learning curve to this app in terms of how you think of organizing and planning your money, but it‚Äôs been such a pivotal tool for me to manage my personal (and family and business) finances. I plan for every dime, and it all has a place. It‚Äôs made for proactive savings and tax reporting is so quick now. Love the updates and support is always super quick and specific. Highly recommend!
title: Learning curve so worth the squeeze!

developerResponse: {'id': 2964329, 'body': "Hi Mishieme - thanks for your feedback - it's valuable.  There is a way to import up to 30 days of previous transactions - you just need to change the date of that starting balance transaction. Send a message to help@ynab.com if you have other questions!", 'modified': '2018-03-28T21:19:17Z'}
review: I wanted to create a budget based on the spending habits I already have. I‚Äôm lucky to not be in debt, and saving every month. This product starts out at zero, meaning there‚Äôs no way for me to figure out how much I‚Äôve historically spent to use as a baseline for my budget. It expects me to know that or estimate it. Some things I know, like rent, and others I expected to find out by transaction importing. It doesn‚Äôt work that way. Transactions before you sign up are not imported. There‚Äôs also no way to create a ‚Äúsave as much money as possible‚Äù goal ‚Äî  everything has to be strict dollar amounts. That works well if money is tight, but for my use case it was utterly useless.
title: Cannot give insights on spending based on pre-ynab signup

developerResponse: {'id': 39152909, 'body': "Hi there! Thanks for sharing your feedback on the web and mobile apps. I'm glad to hear that YNAB has been such a great fit for you. üòä \\- Aubrey @ YNAB", 'modified': '2023-09-26T13:28:15Z'}
review: I have loved using the web version way more than than the iOS app. But say no more they have improved the ios and I just say thank you. I started budgeting with Dave Ramsey course and this web app and the iOS app is so easy to use. Really makes what I learned in that course then elevates to a whole new level. If your looking for one of the best budgeting app this is it. I have tried a lots of them.
title: 3.0 Finally

developerResponse: {'id': 36818357, 'body': "Hi there! Thanks so much for taking the time to leave us this great review. We're very happy to hear that YNAB has been a useful tool in your financial life. \\- Jill@YNAB", 'modified': '2023-05-30T12:59:51Z'}
review: We‚Äôve been using YNAB for about four months now and it‚Äôs such a helpful tool for tracking finances. I tried another, well-known app and the monthly planning idea was too confusing. With YNAB, I can quickly check and see exactly how much I have left to spend each week, after each paycheck is deposited. YNAB is simple to use and they provide a lot of videos to help you get started.
title: Love the app!

review: Yes, it costs more money but boy is it worth it.  We tried other apps but they are not very user friendly or do not allow more than one user easily.  If you‚Äôre serious about budgeting, this app does EVERYTHING and makes it SO EASY to see all your credit cards, checking account, etc all at once.  This really helped us take control of our spending and see where our money is going.
title: Yes it‚Äôs worth it

review: I‚Äôve been using YNAP for two years and what I tell everyone who will listen is that I use it not to set limits on my spending but to plan my spending. I actually feel more free to spend on things I used to feel a little guilty about since using YNAP because I can see so easily that the goals I am planning long term for are on track so it‚Äôs ok to spend in other areas!  I‚Äôm killing my student loans but also planning for a new car soon.
title: Not a limit setting budget

review:
Glad to have a mobile option for receipt entry, quick checks of budgeted amounts, and approving imported transactions. Doesn‚Äôt replace the full browser view, which lets me see more lines at once foe a better view of how the categories & accounts relate to each other.

The reporting tools seem like they‚Äôll really shine with multiple years of data.
title: Good on the go, supplements browser interface

review: This app teaches how to budget money and makes it easy to achieve my financial goals. I‚Äôve never had to worry about a credit card payment since I began using YNAB and for that alone it‚Äôs worth every penny! Would give five stars but the app has occasional connectivity issues with banks and credit card companies. It‚Äôs a minor frustration but it‚Äôs core to the app so hoping they eliminate those issues altogether someday.
title: Super Helpful Budgeting app

review: I don‚Äôt even know where to begin. I knew I needed help. I googled. YNAB came up with a one month free trial and the rest is history. My eyes are open now. It literally changed my life. I feel in control of my finances. I make better decisions. I know where my money is going. My stress levels are almost non existent. Wish I found this app years ago, I‚Äôd be tens of thousands richer. Highly, highly recommend it. Give it to your kids, your relatives, your coworkers. It really is that good.
title: Life changing

review: I‚Äôve been using YNAB about six years now and love having total financial clarity. It was easy to learn, easy to customize my spending and savings categories, and easy to record purchases while I am making them because it remembers locations. I also love their instruction videos because they‚Äôre about more than learning to use an app. They‚Äôre about learning to master your money.
title: Financial Game Changer

developerResponse: {'id': 41034780, 'body': 'You are so welcome! I love that YNAB has helped you so much. We are all about creating positive and impactful habits around your finances. So happy to have you YNABing with us! \\- Natalie @ YNAB', 'modified': '2024-01-02T16:09:24Z'}
review: YNAB helped me change my financial life for the better. With their approach, education, and app itself, I have a consistent and capable management of my finances like I‚Äôve never had before. It will take a few weeks or months to get used to: don‚Äôt worry! That is you ditching old, bad finance habits from other apps and approaches, and learning new, better finance habits from YNAB. Thank you YNAB for helping me, my friends, and my family!
title: YNAB changed my life!

review: I love this app. It‚Äôs too expensive for me but I loved the trial period. The only major annoyance I had was with the credit card. It for some reason could not understand how a credit card works and such. It was constantly saying I was overspending on my credit card when the fees would come out even though my budget included the fees. I tried talking to two different people about it and what they were saying was not helpful at all.
title: Love this app

review: YNAB is s the best budgeting app out there! I have had problems on occasion with transactions not importing from my bank but the team at YNAB is great at responding to my emails and they have been able to fix the issue both times it has happened. I have tried other budgeting systems and I love YNAB the best. It is easy to use, practical, and I love being able to keep track of where my money is going.
title: Favorite Budgeting system!

review:
My sister hounded me for over a year to get YNAB and I am so glad I finally did! The way YNAB budgets is exactly how I already budgeted but now I‚Äôm not spending hours updating my bills on those little paper bank ledgers.  

I really enjoy the credit card feature. You can immediate pull from any account and put it toward your credit card payment for later. I use a credit card for groceries(cash back!) and it makes it so easy to keep track of how much I still have in my grocery budget. 

Another great thing is that since it‚Äôs digital, my husband and I can both see it at anytime of day. It‚Äôs really helped us to stay on budget with our spending money since there is no guesswork when we‚Äôre out and about.

I would strongly recommend YNAB!
title: Love YNAB!

review: I‚Äôve used several other forms of budgeting (apps, spreadsheet templates, etc). But this is by far the best method I‚Äôve used. I‚Äôve been using YNAB for over a year and it has given me a way to see my inflow and how I am able to budget exactly what I need and when. I used to live month to month and now I have my bills set and ready for the following month. I would highly recommend trying the free trial and the $70-something a year is well worth it!
title: Best budgeting app ever!

review:
YNAB is by far the best budget system I‚Äôve ever used.  The organization has a solid logic and simply makes sense.  

üëÄ The iOS app looks great, runs smoothly and just works!  

üîÑ The account sync works flawlessly (usually next day transactions are ready to link).  

üí™ We still enter everything manually in real time, so the bank is always catching up to us üòâ.  

‚ú® The annual fee to use this app will pay for itself within 3 months (or less) if you‚Äôve never kept a budget before‚Äîjust from sheer awareness of your money and where you‚Äôre telling it where to go.  

üß† The emails and tutorials are not a nag and are truly helpful if you need some advice on how to make your money behave in an effective manner using the YNAB system.  

üôè Thanks YNAB for such a beautiful and effective design!
title: Best Budget System Ever!

review: I was doing Dave Ramsey‚Äôs baby steps and tried YNAB to implement my budget. For me it has allowed me to easily track my budget on the go and even cover overspending in the moment. But it also downloads transactions from my banks and matches them to what I manually enter. This is the key to trusting your budget. Up to the moment information that is double checked when available online. I much prefer it to every dollar, although it has a steeper learning curve.
title: YNAB is a godsend

review: I have been using YNAB since ynab4 was new and it completely changed the way I think about money. I am now debt free, paid cash for some high ticket items, and I‚Äôm building my savings. You will feel so much more free when using ynab‚Äôs 4 rules. Honestly I don‚Äôt even know when I get paid because my account never gets so low that I need to worry. Ynab might be tricky for some to wrap their mind around, but stick with it and use the free resources until it makes sense.
title: The BEST!!

review:
This has been the best tool we‚Äôve used. Much better than Mint (which is just reporting and always trying to sell you stuff), and before that Quicken. Much, much better than the app with our bank. 
We‚Äôve been successful at building our savings month after month. 
Set up is easy. 
Took me a bit to figure out credit cards, but YNAB support is the best of any app out there: quick, personal, very helpful.
title: Great tracking, smart and motivational.

review: I‚Äôve tried different budgeting apps like Mint and even EveryDollar but nothing can compare to YNAB. I was using the app for a few months before I read You Need a Budget book. Once I read the book everything clicked! It was a true ‚ÄúA-ha!‚Äù moment. Now I only budget the money I have and my husband and I fight over who gets to input the next paycheck. It‚Äôs been great to get our true expenses nailed down and to have a plan for our money moving forward.
title: Who knew budgeting was so fun!?!

review:
It seems there are some people who are lamenting lost "features" when ynab updated. This is not my experience. Having an automatic update feature for my bank and card are a game changer. 

Ynab is so much more than great software, it is an education in financial freedom and a way to go about it that doesn't involve putting money in envelops. The videos and articles are extremely helpful. 

I have recommended ynab to 10+ friends and more than half have found it to be incredibly helpful. The others decided they wanted to stick with free programs like Mint because they weren't a fan of the increased level of control ynab gave them. 

I highly recommend giving this system a try. It has changed my financial outlook and set me up to live a more balanced life. Five stars
title: Exactly what I am looking for

review:
Now into the 6th week of YNAB and I‚Äôve learned to navigate but still confused. Does the budget carry from month to month? What‚Äôs the big picture? Do I really have enough income to provide for my family ? I LOVED Microsoft Money because I could see a cash flow graph that used all the recurring transactions and it either sank or soared depending on what I allocated to non-recurring transactions. 

I have not been able to take one of the classes but I‚Äôve looked at a lot of the videos. I GET the four rules. How old my money is just isn‚Äôt as meaningful to me as seeing the curve forecasting cash flow.
title: Still confused

If you'd like, you're always welcome to submit feature requests or feedback here: https://youneedabudget.typeform.com/to/Pt6cek \\- Kat @ YNAB", 'modified': '2023-08-06T13:30:08Z'}
review: YNAB is very well designed. I‚Äôve been using it for just about a year now, and essentially it forces you to budget in a smart way. The iOS app in particular is missing some of the reporting functionality from the web app, and there are sometimes some quirks that are somewhat confusing, but if you‚Äôre using a spreadsheet to finance then scrap that garbage and pay for YNAB‚Äîit‚Äôs worth it.
title: First and ONLY budgeting app I‚Äôll ever use.

review:
YNAB and other financial smarty pants people out there will tell you - you build wealth by really understanding how your money is working for you and whether or not you‚Äôre making good decisions with it. I‚Äôve been using YNAB for years and I‚Äôve gone from a negative net worth to a climbing positive one. 

It is very user friendly and the brand‚Äôs accessibility and lightness are just what I need from a financial app (many others really stress me out).
title: YNAB for life

developerResponse: {'id': 35024939, 'body': "Yes!! A life free of nagging and irritation around money is very cool ‚Äî and it's even cooler that you're teaching your kids how to have healthy relationships with money early on. Kudos! We're glad YNAB gives you the support you're looking for. - Dela@YNAB", 'modified': '2023-02-23T01:45:59Z'}
review:
I enjoy how easy this app make it to stay on too of the household budget.  Sharing the app with the kids is helping them develop good budgeting skills, as well. 

A previous budgeting app would drop connections with amex without warning.  YNAB is great about indicating the dropped connection, makes it easy to fix, and notified me that it was a situation they were aware of and were working on.  I can‚Äôt tell you how happy I am about that level of awareness.
title: Great reminders without nagging

review: I‚Äôve been using YNAB for over a year now and the progress I‚Äôve made financially in the last year is way more than I made in the previous 5. Glad I stumbled on the book and then decided to do the trial. I introduced my wife to it. She was reluctant at first but now she wonders how she ever lived without it. We‚Äôve paid off debts, boosted our savings, and took control of our money because we see everything transparently through YNAB‚ù§Ô∏è
title: Take Control of Your Money

review: When I was young about 50 years ago, my dad used to budget using a pen and paper and a small notebook.i still have the books :-).  I think I inherited this and I started using spreadsheets to budget. But then about 6 years ago, I moved to this application after trying many other applications and this is by far the best. trust me I‚Äôm an expert at this stuff without sounding arrogant. It‚Äôs in my blood.  :-).
title: Perfect

review:
I‚Äôve been using YANB since 2020 and my finances are now in a totally different and better place. 

One suggestion: Please add a calculator to the ‚Äúsplit‚Äù section of a transaction entry. There‚Äôs no food tax where I live and I like to make sure the tax I pay is attached to those non-food items I shop for at the same time. It would be great to do all of these calculations in one place. Thank you!
title: YNAB has Changed Everything For Me

review: I‚Äôve been using this app for around 6 years as my personal budget and I have really enjoyed the features and growth YNAB has had. However, the recent major update has changed the load times considerably to the point it makes me want to stop using it. I cannot give this app even 3 stars because the load times are so bad. Please fix this.
title: Was Great, But Too Slow After Update

review: This program is very easy to create budget categories, connect to your bank to import/match transactions.  My husband and I are able to use it at the store to make sure we aren‚Äôt running over our budgets.  Also is easy to plan vacation, big ticket auto maintenance, and even let‚Äôs us track how much our kid‚Äôs allowance amount are without giving the cash to lose!  I love it!!
title: Easy to Use!

review:
I have two things to say about YNAB. First, it‚Äôs methodology of being proactive just works. And the interface is set up well to easily be proactive in making a budget. Second, YNAB customer support is top notch. They send fun and helpful tips, are always on call, and have responded within 24 hours to two of my issues.

I have been using YNAB for five months, and I intend to keep using it fair years to come.
title: I Needed A Budget!

review: This is paired with an online service, that comes with a yearly fee, BUT! Before that turns you off, this program has EASILY saved me 10x what I pay for it just in one month alone. If you‚Äôre not feeling sure about it, they have a 1 month free trial. It is worth it. It‚Äôs simple and as intuitive as money can get (I‚Äôm someone who doesn‚Äôt totally get money). So if you‚Äôre trying to budget and manage your money, this is a really amazing program.
title: Best money saver ever

review: I am such a visual person and for years have struggled with saving money / figuring out where it's going and "seeing it". I can finally SEE it! I'm like giddy this morning with excitement after putting in my first income (just started) and get to tell my money what to do (realizing realistically I can spend a lot more at decreasing debt and less on wine) . Thank you Jesse ! And thanks for the podcast. Been listening for the past week and I'm almost done- what's that say?!
title: Obsessed

review:
The app is absolutely fantastic. Super happy with it, it‚Äôs very easy to organize transactions and categorize them. Budgeting is made simple, and once you‚Äôve done it for a while, it‚Äôs even easier to budget for regular transactions!

However, after recently having looked at other budgeting apps, I wish the reporting tools were better.

I would love to have a quick overview over how much I‚Äôve spent at a certain vendor or in a certain category over time!
title: Love it but wish the reporting tool was better

review:
YNAB is easily, hands down, the best budgeting system around. And the mobile app is as excellent as the rest of the software.

I have used many systems before, a paper cash book, spreadsheet, Quicken, Money, and I reviewed about a dozen packages before I stumbled upon YNAB about 5 years ago. I was at the point of writing my own, with the UI essentially complete, and YNAB did everything I wanted. In the years since it‚Äôs only gotten better.

No reservations, YNAB is an unqualified recommend.
title: Simply The Best

review: Not exaggerating. We paid our credit card and turned us into savers so we can roll with the punches and not be caught unprepared for Christmas. It‚Äôs not a reductive grit your teeth and sell all your things that the kids think they‚Äôre  next type solution. It‚Äôs real and it works and took tons of stress out of our lives and let us use our credit card like a debit card. Love YNAB üíñ
title: Changed my Life

developerResponse: {'id': 47103187, 'body': 'HI there!\n\nThanks for giving us clear feedback regarding the latest update! If you want to chat more about that, send us a note to help@ynab.com. ~Phil@YNAB', 'modified': '2024-09-30T12:26:59Z'}
review:
The latest update regressed the behavior of the ‚Äúcover overspending‚Äù and ‚Äúmove money‚Äù It feels slower to walk through overspending using this feature which feels worse the more overspent budgets you have. Every item you want to modify now has to go to an entirely new window which is confusing and takes a long time to load and pop up. Sure it looks fancier but it behaves worse visually and functionally. 

Previously, I liked the app. Please roll back asap because it‚Äôs so much less usable now which isn‚Äôt what I‚Äôd expect from an app I have to pay to use.
title: Latest update regression in ‚ÄúCover Overspending‚Äù

review: I love the budget process and the way YNAB has everything set up. It‚Äôs user friendly and has helped my husband and I save money. I‚Äôve contacted support multiple times but the issues have not been permanently fixed.

review: Using YNAB on the PC and the app is the best browser/app combination I believe I have ever worked with regardless of the type of app. All the functionality that is available in the browser seems to be in the app along with much of the functionality being very intuitive within the app. There certainly are some parts that I‚Äôm still learning, but overall if is a great phone app.
title: YNAB App Functions Great!!

developerResponse: {'id': 34846809, 'body': "Hi pierredenoyon! YNAB is amazing for variable income and I'm so glad it's helped you. Thanks for being a longtime YNABer! - Natalie @ YNAB", 'modified': '2023-02-13T20:56:39Z'}
review: I have used YNAB for many years. The concept of budgeting ahead, replacing the bad habit of covering spending after the fact has been revolutionary in my life. I am an artist and my income fluctuates a good deal. YNAB has truly helped me find ways to bridge the gaps. It has been indispensable, especially when my funds were low and I had to make the hard choices. This app has seen me through thick and thin!

review: So this is a nice budgeting app and is great to when it linked to my accounts‚Ä¶when the latter works. I‚Äôve had multiple issues with links to my accounts. When I use the support feature it takes several days for an actual person to respond. For almost $100 a subscription you would think they would have better customer service. So I give the app 3 stars with 2 stars taken mainly because the price and slow response customer service.
title: Where‚Äôs the support

review: I have tried Mint, Quicken, etc. with no long term success in tracking expenses or sticking to budget.   I‚Äôm not a detail person.  More of a creative type.  It took me a while to get it but now I love YNAB.  The zero based budgeting concept is simple but effective for me. Like the 4 rules (my money is now 60 days old) and classifying expenses takes about 2 minutes everyday on my mobile.
title: Finally something that works

review:
At minimum, the iPad app should have the same features as the web app, especially in the reporting (expenses vs income view) which is extremely helpful. 

It‚Äôs kind of a bummer to have a powerful iPad Pro but have to go through the tedious process of trying to trick the browser to show me the desktop site to see my cash flow.
title: Love the app, please make it have feature parity with web

review: I found out about YNAB from a financial literacy podcast and let me convince you: this app has saved my life. I was a former spreadsheet user and found it was too difficult to keep up with spending on one app and waiting until I was on my computer to enter it into my budget. I love that I can have YNAB on my phone and my computer. My spending has drastically improved and I have piece of mind.
title: Never Knew How I Needed This App

review:
At first I balked at the price. I thought spending the money for the app was counterproductive. I went back & downloaded it to for the free trial to see what I thought.

I made & remade several budgets because it was a bit confusing. As I browsed I saw that they had a lot information & help. I signed up for the 1st 2 live classes They‚Äôre only 20 minutes long, & so helpful.

Dave was my instructor for those classes & he was awesome! By the 2nd class it made perfect sense & I have my budget set. 

It‚Äôs already proving to be invaluable to me. It‚Äôs helped me see where I need to make changes & set goals I never thought I‚Äôd get to. YNAB is in my budget now.

There‚Äôs a LOT of help & lessons. It‚Äôs very feature rich. Try it out & take the 1st 2 classes. It‚Äôs worth it
title: You really need YNAB

review:
I had no clue where my money was going, how much I was spending on pointless purchases.  YNAB helped me set a budget and I was shocked at how much money I was wasting.  YNAB is one of my most used apps.  HIGHLY recommend!!! Take advantage of all the live webinars and start budgeting.

I know where every dollar is at anytime day or night.  Creating goals and budgeting around those goals ensures Christmas, birthdays, mothers/fathers days, oil changes, car registrations , etc... don‚Äôt sneak up on you!!!
title: Great App!!!

developerResponse: {'id': 35816196, 'body': "Hi there. We're so glad to hear that you've been loving YNAB so far. It sounds like you're really making rule 4, age your money, work for you! - Jill@YNAB", 'modified': '2023-04-06T18:21:28Z'}
review: I love this budgeting app! We have been using YNAB for only about two months, but in that short time, I‚Äôve gotten a much better handle on where our money goes and when. I have been able to assess our various subscriptions and spending habits and have started to allocate money toward future purchases and general savings all thanks to YNAB. Well worth the subscription price.
title: Makes Budgeting Easy

developerResponse: {'id': 2238629, 'body': "Hi Packfan77 -- thanks for the feedback - we appreciate it!  I've send this along to our design team.  I can appreciate that you wouldn't want your friends accidentally seeing your budget when you were just trying to show them the 100 Happiest Dog Pictures of All Time! Or something like that. :)", 'modified': '2018-01-08T14:45:24Z'}
review:
I like YNAB for its functionality, but very disappointed that the app is not secured by a pin or TouchID.  This is a very clear and serious oversight.  Banking apps and Credit Card apps have this. Yet an app that connects them all and has your personal financial details doesn‚Äôt?  People hand friends phones to watch videos or look at pictures and parents often allow kids to use their devices.  Not having your financial apps with a level of security at use is a dealbreaker.

The App Store has security for purchases/downloads.  Even my fitness apps offer this as an option.  How did YNAB miss this?
title: Missing Critical Security Feature

developerResponse: {'id': 37064902, 'body': "Hey Naugatuc! Thanks for being such a long\\-time YNABer! I'm so glad to hear that YNAB is helping you feel on top of your finances! Keep up the awesome work! \\- Kat @ YNAB", 'modified': '2023-06-12T09:20:09Z'}
review: The budgeting system and the apps, especially mobile, deliver the results I need: meaningful awareness and control of my finances and cash flow. The app makes it easy to bulk preview, categorize and organize transactions. I always feel like I‚Äôm on top of things. Sync with financial institutions has improved in the past year plus. I don‚Äôt love the yearly subscription expense, but I could not be as successful without the app and it‚Äôs conveniences.
title: Since version 4.0 and going strong

review:
I could go into all the details, but I‚Äôll keep it simple. There have been a few pivotal moments in my life...

One was when I took control of my health with a few key body metrics which I could track progress against, enabling me to see how my workouts and dietary changes were physically changing my body.

Another was when I fully adopted YNAB 2.5 months ago. I know have a complete and real-time picture of my finances. I‚Äôm controlling my money, and my money is no longer controlling me.

A YNAB subscription is an absolute no-brainer, in my opinion. I just hope the ongoing subscription fees will contribute to future updates and feature releases.

It would be amazing to see a product roadmap, be able to vote on upcoming features, etc. I already have a list of my own üòé
title: Life Changing

review:
I got to the point last week where none of my accounts were syncing automatically which put me at a total stop. I‚Äôve realized over the last couple of months that this lack of sync made me unable to stay on top of my budget. 

In the reddit community and on the forums there is a big push to go All-In on the YNAB concept of envelope budgeting. This includes entering transactions as you make them and only allocating money when you receive it. If you follow this process, the lack of sync is not a big deal, but if you are using the app for convienence, not being able to sync and the rigidity of some of the rules are a pain to work around.

To sum everything up, if you want to follow the YNAB budgeting philosophy to the letter, including entering transactions as they happen, this is a great app that does everything that you need very well. If you want a convenient envelope budgeting app, this is not it.

I am in my 3rd year of using YNAB.
title: Account Sync Horrendous

review: It is actually a fairly simple app other than the concept of giving every dollar a job before spending it instead of focusing on analyzing your budget afterwards. I like that it is fairly easy to use both on the mobile app and the web.   I see myself using even when away from home.  I have been using another very well known app for decades but I have NEVER had a good experience with their mobile solution! YNAB is simple and just works!
title: Different than others

review: I‚Äôve always struggled to manage money and budget but with YNAB I have actually gained control and can see where my money is going. I love literally everything about it and recommend it to all my friends and family! I also love how they have classes and live tutorials for using the app and website because you just don‚Äôt see that with other companies. You won‚Äôt regret this! Do it now and see how much more you can do with your money.
title: BEST. DECISION. EVER

title: Great program!

review:
YNAB is an excellent budgeting tool and reduces the friction enough for me to keep things current.

while i miss the classic desktop version and the ability to take a birds-eye view of my budgeted amounts and spending over several months at a time AND i don‚Äôt like not being able to work on my budget offline, YNAB is an excellent budgeting tool and reduces the friction enough for me to keep things current, the ability to import recent transactions from my banks mostly make up for it.
title: best budgeting tool i‚Äôve found

review:
Being able to instantly know how much money is available for each budget item has allowed me to open up to spending freely when I know our bills are covered. This app really helps. It takes a bit of time to get figured out but once you start using it, things just click. It‚Äôs also a good resource to know how much over spending we have done in a specific area. I have recommended this app to almost three people, 2 are using it and 1 is getting ready to try it out. 

Seriously this is a fantastic tool!

title: Was great

review:
I love YNAB and it really helps me organize and save money, but the web version is easier to use than the app. If you get frustrated with the app, please keep that in mind. I find some organization functions and basic features are counter intuitive or hard to locate on the app.
On a positive note , I have some friends who have major financial peace because of YNAB. Oh and I love that YNAB customer service people reply quickly to any email I send and are very helpful.
title: 5 star website, 4 star app

review: This app has saved me incalculable amount of money. I‚Äôm a huge impulse purchaser. Specifically for the latest and greatest technology. As you can imagine that is an expensive goal to chase and by having everything budgeted into money buckets, it can become quite clear to users that what they want is not in their best interest based on other expenditures and goals coming up! They have amazing support and free classes every day!
title: You want this app.

review: YNAB has given us a real time method for tracking all our expenses and to give every job a dollar. Within the first month, we had already showed up excess, frivolous spending and became wiser about where we did and did not want our money to go. The free tutorials, articles, great customer service, and webinars are excellent for getting started and for going deeper in taking charge of your finances. I recommend this app to everyone!
title: Must have!

review: I‚Äôve tried budget apps so many times and this is the first one to ever make it really easy to make a budget and stick to it.  When you are allocating ACTUAL dollars instead of arbitrarily selected numbers, you can actually visualize how each purchase affects your bottom line.  I don‚Äôt love the spreadsheet look of it, but it works great.  Also imports all my investment accounts and lets me budget allocations to my retirement.
title: A budget that actually works

review:
YNAB is more than just an app. It‚Äôs a way of thinking about your money. I discovered it years ago, and it has changed my life. I‚Äôm so thankful for the team that has been improving this app and service and company for so long. It was already great and it just keeps getting better and better. 

It‚Äôs obvious that the people behind it really care about what they‚Äôre doing. There‚Äôs nothing else quite like it!
title: One of the best apps I‚Äôve ever used

review: YNAB itself is awesome. Having just migrated from YNAB 4, I must say that the new mobile experience is cluttered and busy. Buttons are smaller and harder to hit accurately, the budget is crammed with details, and the app is always generating events that require action (approve this, fix that). Tapping on a budget category pulls up a complicated menu as opposed to a list of recent purchases. Perhaps I'm just getting used to it, but I really preferred the former streamlined mobile experience that was tailored to entering purchases on the go and viewing the current state of the budget.
title: Cluttered phone experience

review: I‚Äôve used almost every budget software / website out there over the years and YBAB is by far the best.  It has the best concept of allocating money from income, forcing you to deal with your budget when categories go negative, and allows you to pull together all your financial institutions into one place. I realize many other companies have the same features, YNAB simply does it better and things just work.
title: Best budgeting software!!!

review: This is a budgeting app. It‚Äôs not about investments or forecasting. It‚Äôs about answering a simple but important question : ‚ÄúCan I afford this?‚Äù  Your bank account can‚Äôt answer that question because it doesn‚Äôt know about upcoming bills.  If you budget with YNAB and give every dollar a job it will help reduce your financial stress.  It‚Äôs flexible in its approach. It‚Äôs effective and I highly recommend it.
title: Best budgeting/financial tool available

review:

title: Great app but missing key reporting features

review: YNAB has changed my life! This app provides an easy, organized, and often ‚Äúfun‚Äù way to budget. I realized how much $ I was spending each month on items like ‚Äúdining out‚Äù and ‚Äúcoffee‚Äù that I didn‚Äôt really need. title: Life Changing

review:
amazing app. great UX, clearly built to handle the realities of a flexible and changing budget. very please with the mental model created for credit cards as well. it all just works so seamless!

Knocked off a star because I primarily use the IOS apps (instead of a computer) and the apps are seriously lacking meaningful reports‚Ä¶ and YNAB hasn‚Äôt changed that in my 5 years which is disappointing
title: Overall Great Tool, want more in-app reports

review: I love this app because of how versatile it is. I used mint for one month but just wasn‚Äôt compatible with the way I was tracking on excel. YNAB allowed me to set up my budget just like I had on excel. Had to watch a couple videos and read articles on a couple topics to ensure I set it up correctly. Definitely worth the $100 a year because it saves me 4-5 hours a month.
title: Better than Mint

review: I‚Äôll admit it took a few tries to figure this app out, but it‚Äôs ultimately the only budget tool that‚Äôs worked for me. The learning curve is worth it. I was tired of being stuck in the same cycle of ignoring my bank account completely to panic-checking my balance every time I had an ‚Äúunexpected‚Äù expense. Can‚Äôt recommend enough.
title: Completely changed the way I viewed my money.

review: YNAB takes some effort, but it works. Two years ago I was broke and in debt, living worse than paycheck to paycheck. Today, I‚Äôm out of debt and am several months ahead, with money saved for trips, a car, and a move. All in just two years. It‚Äôs incredible, and incredibly effective, if you‚Äôre willing to trust in and follow YNAB‚Äôs four budgeting rules. Do it - you won‚Äôt regret it!!
title: Revolutionized my finances!

review: YNAB has provided me a much needed visual for keeping track of and understanding my spending and knowing here I‚Äôm at financially. My finances have never looked better! I‚Äôve been able to pay off thousands in debt and have a savings and am now able to adequately plan what to do with my money without hurting myself financially. Thank you for this amazing app! I‚Äôve been using it for years now.
title: Thank you YNAB

review: I have been using YNAB for many years. As someone with an accounting degree, this is the first budget program that actually BUDGETS and works the way a money management system should. However, I just got the email saying the price is going up, way up, even for legacy customers who locked in a discount way back. It just got too rich for my blood, so I will be cancelling. I can't justify my cost almost doubling. But I love the app.
title: Great until the price hike.

review: This is app is just as functional as the desktop version now which is great! We can finally reconcile accounts!! I also love the tweaked UI and status bar showing how much money is left to spend under each spend category. I wish there was a feature to tackle debt like a built in snowball calculator based on our current accounts.
title: New and Improved

review: Most importantly, YNAB has been great for me and my finances.  This new update is so-so, though.  While I like the progress bars, I find it takes longer to budget now unless I let everything auto-assign.   There‚Äôs a lag any time I click something like Average Assigned. I‚Äôd also love to be able to pull historical reports on the app to see how my spending trends month to month.
title: Not sold on the update yet

review: This plus treating my credit card as cash and paying it off by transaction as opposed to by payments is changing my life! I wish it showed all the category spending like it used to on the desktop version, but really, the mobile app does everything I need and syncs well when another person enters info too. Really great. Please get on board with YNAB and save your finances.
title: Life Saving

review: My wife and I started using YNAB at the end of 2018. We still have a lot of stress in our lives and our financial margins aren‚Äôt great, but money is rarely a stress in our lives. YNAB enables us to work together to set goals, and with the app we‚Äôre never more than a moment away from knowing how much we are able to spend on things. This is an absolute treasure of a business and the app has worked very well for us as well.
title: Game Changer

review:
YNAB helped my wife and I control our finances and enabled us to confidently take on a mortgage and purchase our first home together. Two years later and we still use YNAB to maintain that control and keep ourselves honest with our spending. 

I do wish the app supported some of the scenarios that the YNAB website handles more gracefully, but the app is perfect 99.9% of the time. Also, there is a learning curve when you first start using YNAB. I found the documentation a little unhelpful.
title: A learning curve, but great

review: I started using YNAB 2 years ago exactly. In those two years, I have gotten out of debt completely and saved money. As a single parent of two children on a single income, it isn‚Äôt easy. YNAB helped me so much, I stopped renting homes and leasing cars and I bought a nice new car last year and a new house this year with still plenty saved for emergencies and rainy days. I‚Äôve never had that. Thai has changed the game for me. Life changing!
title: Game Changer!

developerResponse: {'id': 34865555, 'body': "I'm so glad YNAB has helped you pay off debt and reach your savings goals, that's amazing! The mobile app is perfect for checking your categories on-the-go. Thanks for leaving a review! - Natalie @ YNAB", 'modified': '2023-02-14T15:51:05Z'}
review: I love YNAB and how it‚Äôs changed my finances forever. I can finally budget and manage my money to a T. I‚Äôve paid off debt and hit savings goals more effectively than ever before. I prefer the desktop app but it‚Äôs nice to have something on the go to check my budgets. The app has some UX issues that could be better, but overall it gets the job done.
title: Good app, desktop is still the best.

review:
iPad version needs significant work.  Given this is a budgeting app, the iPad is the perfect device to manage your budget.  However, this app doesn‚Äôt make use of the excellent features of the iPad.  To start, there‚Äôs no portrait view.  The app only supports landscape view, which is a shocker to see on the iPad.  There‚Äôs no split view support, so I can‚Äôt have a bank app open in one view and YNAB in the other. Keyboard support in the app is terrible. 

The iPad version of the app needs to be treated as a first class citizen to allow YNAB users to effectively manage their budgets.  For now, I‚Äôm sticking with the YNAB site on Safari (which works relatively well in iOS 13).
title: Poor iPad Experience

review:
I used the YNAB classic for many years and loved it. My wife and I used it very simply as a method to track only our discretionary spending for each os us and also things like entertainment and vacation. Was ‚Äúupgraded‚Äù by accident to this new version when the old one stopped working. 
I really dislike the new version. There is no way to simply create a handful of budgets for real-time tracking. Also very difficult to also review historical transactions by budget to check for double entries.  For folks looking for complex solutions to easy problems this may be right for you. I will be searching for a simpler and FAR cheaper solution.
title: Too complicated and yet restricting

review: YNAB is a total game changer. Its philosophy and easy to use app helped my finances go from paycheck to paycheck to paying off credit cards in full every month and a healthy savings account. Since I know what every one of my dollars is working on I can answer the question ‚Äúdo I have the $$ for that?‚Äù the right way every time. Finally have adult finances to go with my adult age.
title: Adulting for the first time

review: For years I struggled with quicken and quickbooks. When I found YNAB through the podcast, I was excited.  It took 2 times to get the hang of this tool and now- life changed.  Was able to see my money and where it was going.  Able to quit my job, able to see all the way through the pandemic.  Simply the finest budgeting software around.
title: The BEST budgeting tool to know your money

review:
It is great for what it is, I've used it for 4 years. In that time there haven‚Äôt been very many new features and several long standing bugs. Even so I considered it worth the $45/year.

But the price increase today to $100/year is simply too much.

I‚Äôm sad to depart, I earnestly enjoyed the tool. I even bought some of their swag from their annual merch sale last week (which I‚Äôll be returning).
title: Good but stagnated and not worth the price increase

review: I made the switch from another budgeting app to this one and it is a game changer! Zero balance budgeting is the way to go and this app makes it so easy! The other app I used to use would always have problems with syncing and providing proper tech support... but YNAB support and chat features make adjusting to the interface SO easy. I highly recommend this app.
title: Make the switch

review: I ABSOLUTELY LOVE YNAB!!! It is different from any other app I have tried. It is a zero base budget BUT it keeps track of long term goals not just the goals for the month. I have been able to save for so many things effortlessly because YNAB tracks my goals for me. I loved the free training they offer. Seriously it was the best $85 I have EVER spent. I can‚Äôt recommend this highly enough.
title: Finally a budget that carries over months!

review: YNAB helped me rewrite the way I was thinking about money. I‚Äôm saving more than I ever had using Mint or Digit. I had to get rid of some bad habits and it took about two months to really figure it out how it all makes sense. The app works great too, an essential part of the experience. If you‚Äôre struggling with budgeting, invest the free trial time and rewrite your own way of thinking about money.
title: Helps you stay on track

review:
The app stopped connecting to my bank and YNAB isn‚Äôt in any hurry to fix it.  It‚Äôs been down over two weeks.  They said it will take time.  

I wish I hadn‚Äôt wasted my money on this.  It‚Äôs not good at handling credit cards if you always pay them off anyway, but at least I could track the money in my account.  Now I‚Äôve lost that.

Edit:  When I stopped using the app and cancelled, I was contacted by support and they reimbursed me for the remaining time.  I was impressed that they went to that trouble.  I didn‚Äôt ask for reimbursement so I do feel considerably better about the company.
title: Unreliable, not good if you pay off CCs

review:
This app is a wonderful tool to "organize" your money the best way that works for you!

Worth every penny for the yearly subscription! I can easily update my budget just a few times a month and the other days I don't even think about money. Just waiting on a little more interactive app for the watch. It would be great to add transactions via talk text!
title: This app is a game changer!!

review: I‚Äôve used YNAB since wrapping up college and being financially independent - one of the best decisions of my life. It helps me see my financial situation clearly and bring mindfulness to decisions about money. YNAB has helped me achieve goals a dreams - buy my own home, travel the world, share household expenses with my partner, and so much more. I can easily take it everywhere with the phone app and computer access. Summed up, I love it!!
title: Look, see, tell the truth, take authentic action

review: I've been a Ynaber for 8 years and it is an incredible budgeting tool. In this time we have paid off more debt, saved more $, and most importantly don't stress where our $ is coming or going. It also makes using credit cards "healthy". Meaning you can't spend $ you don't have. So getting all those credit card bonuses are possible in a functional sort of way:-)
title: Couldn't function without

review: I absolutely LOVE this app. I will admit, when I first started using YNAB it took me a little bit to get the hang of it, primarily the desktop version and then the app, but once I did, it was so worth it. YNAB is the most efficient and comprehensive budgeting software I‚Äôve used and I absolutely love it. The app is super easy to use and when there are minor issues, they make sure to roll out updates promptly. Improve your budgeting today and get YNAB!
title: Life changing

review: It‚Äôs an entire philosophy. If you are living paycheck to paycheck, trying to pay off debt, always feeling behind that last bill that came, or simply getting your finances in order, check them out online, sign up, and start changing your life. Been using it for over three years now and I cannot overstate how important it has been for us.
title: More than an app

review: This app is so much better than the classic app. I love how it directly connects to my banking accounts, so that I don‚Äôt have to haul out the laptop, log in, and upload account information before I can do our budgeting. The only reason I didn‚Äôt give it five stars is because there is at least one day delay between a transaction posting in my banking account and the transaction uploading into the YNAB app. Still, it is SO much better than the old app. Thank you, YNAB, and great job!!!!
title: So much better

Happy budgeting! - Dela@YNAB", 'modified': '2023-02-23T01:17:10Z'}
review: Hate to say it but it really did change my life. Eased my anxiety, allowed me to reach my goals, gives me a feeling of control and security‚Ä¶can‚Äôt recommend it enough. There‚Äôs a learning curve for sure, and also you gotta be dedicated for it to work, but honestly it‚Äôs worth it. App itself is nice and easy to use/has the features I want plus lots of forums and support.
title: Changed my life

developerResponse: {'id': 39821842, 'body': 'Thank you so much for leaving a review! I love that YNAB has helped you so much over the years. ‚ô•Ô∏è \\- Natalie @ YNAB', 'modified': '2023-10-30T12:23:42Z'}

title: Best Budget Software (and Philosophy) Out There

But this time it still didn‚Äôt work. It kinda defeats one of the main features & points of the app.. to know you‚Äôre setting aside enough money each month. I‚Äôm trying to set my gift giving goal so I can start saving for 2024 Christmas but the app refuses to register anything which is extremely frustrating. Maybe I will have better luck on the website.
title: Bugged

review:
Went to re subscribe and the price has gone way up. For 15 dollars a month I should not have to spend as much time as I do getting accounts synced. Regretting not jumping ship and going to the competitor. At least there I have access to the University library and several books. 
With YNAB I feel like I spend as much time waiting on customer service to get back to me to fix a problem (several days), as I do budgeting. Well quickly re subscribing to update my budget has now been a valuable learning experience.
‚ÄúExperience is what you get when you don‚Äôt get what you want.‚Äù
title: Poor investment

review: As a whole, YNAB is the best budgeting software I‚Äôve found. The strong community and social media presence are like no other. That being said, this app is not enough on its own; the undo button and reconciling are currently only available on the desktop website. But this app is perfect for entering transactions, checking budget amounts, and other general daily upkeep tasks
title: Great supplement to desktop

review:
I used the old YNAB for years, then fell of the wagon for a while. I don‚Äôt know why, because it worked wonders then, I guess I just got complacent.

I‚Äôm back again and while I must say the newest version is not a one time purchase... and there is a little bit of a learning curve... it‚Äôs worth every penny.

This my friends is a game changer and a wake up call all rolled into one.
title: YNAB will change your life

review:
After many years on old version of YNAB, I went to a competitor for a year, and it was the longest year of my life. I easily went back to YNAB despite the price (well worth every penny).

The new app is great, but it is missing one VERY IMPORTANT feature which is easy to build.

There needs to be a backup for FaceID. If your face cannot be scanned for whatever reason, there should be a way to enter a PIN number or password of some sort. For example, when wearing my sun glasses, FaceID doesn‚Äôt work. At the lock screen it goes to the PIN number, I enter that and I‚Äôm in. With YNAB that is not an option so I HAVE to take my glasses off to access it which is very annoying and inconvenient. 

What will it take to build this feature in?
title: Would like one feature

review:
This app has a great layout and has helped me to manage my money in a tangible way. However- after using it for about 6 months, I‚Äôve noticed that the delayed imports severely impact my ability to stay on top of my budget day-to-day. I have a limited income and work paycheck to paycheck, and make at least two transactions per day. 

Because of the delayed imports I assume I have more money than I do, and often go over budget days before my next paycheck will go through. 

The whole reason why I purchased this app (I went for the yearly option) was to get better at tracking my purchases. It has not helped me with that. 

This would be a great app for someone who has a more flexible income and wants to meet some new financial goals. It is absolutely not for the individual who relies on an accurate display of their account(s).
title: Fun at first, not a game changer.

review: Before YNAB, we weren‚Äôt drowning in debt, but we could be doing better. We made a decent income, but it felt like money was just getting away from us. I‚Äôve been using this app for almost 2 years, and we‚Äôre going to pay off a car, I‚Äôve paid off one student loan, and I‚Äôve got a plan for student loan debt. I wish we had gotten started years ago.
title: The only thing I‚Äôve been able to stick to for any amount of time

review: I‚Äôve been using YNAB a year now and, even though it might sound dramatic, it truly is life changing. It takes a little bit of learning but once you get into it, it seriously changes your relationship with money. I‚Äôve saved more and felt less financial stress in the last year than ever in my life before. Do the trial, watch some of the tutorial videos and you‚Äôll see it‚Äôs worth it. Seriously love YNAB.
title: Amazing and worth it

review:
In the past I‚Äôve always done finances once a month.  I dreaded it because it would take hours!  With YNAB I can quickly look at my transactions each morning and take care of budgeting in just 5 min.  I love that I can do all of this while in my jammies before my day really begins.
I also adore YNAB‚Äôs mission to help families take control of their money.  I‚Äôve attended live trainings and they‚Äôre top notch!  Thanks team!!
title: YNAB makes it simple to build a budget habit

review: Budgeting always used to make me feel guilty, but with YNAB I‚Äôm comfortable spending money on ‚Äúunnecessary‚Äù things (though can ice cream really be counted as unnecessary?), because that money is BUDGETED for spending! The importing feature is a lifesaver‚Ä¶now it doesn‚Äôt matter if I forget to record a purchase because YNAB reminds me when the bank transaction comes through! 10/10 would recommend.
title: Budgeting is fun??

review: This app is a life changer. I wish I had this app when I was in my early 20s. I can‚Äôt imagine what I could‚Äôve done & the amount of financial stress I could‚Äôve avoided if I had this tool then. Oh, well, no sense crying over spilled milk. I‚Äôm just happy I started. About 1.5 years using YNAB @ 41 years old and I‚Äôm able to make significant progress in my short term and long term financial goals. Thankful!
title: Wish I had YNAB in my 20s

review: Once my husband and I figured out how to use it (watch their videos and read the docs!), YNAB became a critical tool in our daily evaluation of where our money is going. We have been able to save for vacations, investments, and pay down debt by using the budget and goals functionality. Thank you YNAB for making our lives a little better!
title: Keeps me on track

review: I don‚Äôt usually write reviews, so the fact I‚Äôm writing this speaks volumes about YNAB. I‚Äôm a young professional fresh out of grad school who never budgeted before this, and my bank account showed it. If you need something to help keep you on track financially, YNAB is for you!!
title: Best financial decision I‚Äôve ever made

review: So it turns out the man that made this app is OUR NEIGHBOR!!!! it‚Äôs been amazing to talk to him personally about the app and money.  Not only has this app changed me and my husbands life but how we are able to save $$ on trips, shopping and even spending on a few fun nice things for our selfs. title: Best budgeting app

review: I love this app. I started budgeting with YNAB in late 2019 and am addicted. This has really helped me gain insight into my spending and get ahead to include more money in my buckets. review:

LOVE LOVE LOVE
title: Well well worth the money

This app provides all the necessities of YNAB, a great tool to use when you‚Äôre feeling too lazy to visit the desktop version. I like that it doesn‚Äôt have all the functionality of the desktop version, and focuses on a sensible layout for achieving the most from the core daily actions/functions.
