Thank you YNAB team!
title: User-friendly App, for on the go

review: This app and software has changed my life. Been a user for 6 years now, and it had helped be intentional with my money. review: I found YNAB when I was finding myself stressed because I didn‚Äôt know how much money I was spending on stuff? title: The Center of My Financial Life

review:
Years ago I tried this app and found it extremely difficult to use. I‚Äôm glad to say their UI has improved significantly in that time, but unfortunately so have my finances. No Apple Card support is a giant deal breaker coming from Mint, so I figured why not try a manual import like Rocket Money? Except you can‚Äôt even do that. The shortcut ability is a nice touch, but only works for tap to pay.

All these companies that rested on their laurels by relying on Plaid are going to get a rude awakening when someone else does it better.
title: Still awful

developerResponse: {'id': 34642448, 'body': "Hey Krpone! Thanks for the review. Changing behavior around money is a challenge and it sounds like you've risen to the occasion! We're thrilled to hear that you're seeing a difference in your spending and saving habits. Nice job! - Nicole @ YNAB", 'modified': '2023-02-02T17:23:22Z'}
review: It‚Äôs a bit of a learning curve but once you get past some of that it becomes much easier and more helpful. Definitely changing my behavior around money for the better. I feel like I‚Äôm finally getting in control of my spending and Saving. Highly recommend.
title: Took a while to get used to but gets better and better

developerResponse: {'id': 35581704, 'body': "Hi sedblake, We are so thrilled to hear that YNAB has helped you to get out of the paycheck to paycheck cycle! Thanks for sharing your review and feedback. We'd love to hear more about what you want to see in future debt tools and you can submit that here: https://support.ynab.com/en_us/feedback-and-feature-requests-an-overview-rJgD33fAq Sasha@YNAB", 'modified': '2023-03-25T13:50:43Z'}
review: I love this app. It has been a game changer. I actually have money now. I‚Äôm not living pay check to paycheck. I do wish they would incorporate a debt payoff system. They do have one but I wish it was like the snowball or avalanche system. I have to use two separate apps. It would be nice if YNAB had it built in. Other than that I use this app solely for my accounts.
title: This app saved me

review: This app is the first 0-based budgeting system I‚Äôve used and I love it! It allows you to link accounts or track them manually and you only can budget money you already have earned - vs planning future earnings. This has helped me get a handle on my discretionary spending. I primarily use ynab on my phone but the desktop version has even more features too.
title: Love YNAB

review: My wife and I have been using YNAB for ~3 years now, we started just after getting married and it helped us immensely in our relationship with money and understanding our needs, in 3 years we paid off all of our student loan debts, bought and paid down a large chunk of our home, have saved a sizable emergency fund, and have prioritized saving for retirement. We couldn‚Äôt have done half of it without YNAB.
title: Get YNAB!

review:
I‚Äôve been a user since YNAB4. I‚Äôd like to rate this app higher but as always, you have to take the totality of the app into consideration when doing so. At $100/year there is simply no way to justify using the app anymore since at it‚Äôs core its a glorified spreadsheet. You‚Äôre better off using a free alternative and creating your own simple spreadsheet you can apply the bucket method to. 

Unless there are some real ‚ÄúGhee Whiz‚Äù improvements coming down the pipeline, YNAB has simply priced itself out of my (and many others) budget.
title: Priced out of my budget.

review:
For an app that asks for $89 a year acting as a premium budgeting service, you would think they would have their account API protocols sorted out.

If the idea is to budget down to the dollar yet they cannot handle importing major accounts like Capital One, Bank of America, Navy Federal, and American Express, then if you have one of those accounts, it renders this app useless as it is an all or none scenario.

Stick with Mint or some other free service that knows how to handle these accounts.  Check YNAB‚Äôs forums...this stuff has been going on for years with no resolve.
title: Bugs and Compatibility Issues

review: YNAB is life changing and I can‚Äôt say enough about what it‚Äôs done for my finances and how it‚Äôs helped me pay off student loans. The app allows for easy budgeting on the go and it‚Äôs improved greatly since I first started using YNAB 3 years ago. If only I could reconcile my bank accounts I wouldn‚Äôt need to login on my computer to use the desktop version. I find it irritating that it won‚Äôt perform this function, hence the 4 stars.
title: Love for YNAB

review: This app and it's online software is overly confusing at first - I almost threw in the towel. After watching an hour or two of videos and getting a grasp on what giant I was dealing with, I realized how happy I was to stick with it. This system has given me such a peace of mind and control over my money! Knowing where every dollar goes is comforting rather than scratching my head on how I blew thru my paycheck so fast!

review:
*still like the app, my only wish is that they bring all the reports from the web app to the iOS app, at least for the iPad. The current reports are pretty useless for me and still have to long into web to find the relevant reports I need. Once reports improve for the iPad it will be a 5 star app. 

Exactly what I was looking for, great job on the new app. Makes a great budgeting system and adds a great full feature app. Look forward to any future updates.
title: Love it

developerResponse: {'id': 40523406, 'body': "Thanks for your review! I love that you've got your holiday and vacation categories ready to go when the time comes. Talk about knowing your priorities and making a plan to see them happen! \\- Aubrey @ YNAB", 'modified': '2023-12-05T21:27:13Z'}
review: This has been a great tool to keep us to our budget! It‚Äôs so easy to see how much you have allotted for what and adjust amounts based on what‚Äôs important to me! Plus, we save half the year for Christian‚Äôs half the year for vacation, that way, the $ is always there when it‚Äôs time! Makes  for no stress holidays and vacations. The money is always there BEFORE we spend it!!
title: Love it!

title: I really did need a budget!

developerResponse: {'id': 38170388, 'body': "Hey there! Thanks for letting us know YNAB is helping you know exactly where your money goes and that you're a month ahead \\-\\- great work! I'm glad the tutorials and podcast have helped you! \\- Kat @ YNAB", 'modified': '2023-08-08T12:57:42Z'}

title: Helped me much

title: Over priced and no support

review:
Before this tool and it‚Äôs accompanying methodology I was like so many, living paycheck to paycheck. After a year of using YNAB I lost my job, and due to this tool not only was I able to have savings for an event like this I can also survive it  and not use ANY credit cards or other borrowing.

title: Life Changing

review: I cannot recommend any app more than this one. I can literally start funding some of my biggest dreams because of how this program causes me to lock in on my intentions. It‚Äôs life changing.
title: Changing my life

review:
Fun & Easy Budgeting Software 

Too many great things to say about YNAB in a review. Highlights include: the pressure-free 34 day trial (they won‚Äôt automatically subscribe you); the ease of using it every day (seriously. You‚Äôll get it. Stick through the learning curve); free classes & lessons online; the robust global community of YNABers. 

Worth every penny and then some. I certainly have been able to save for that $85ish subscription now, anyway!!
title: Worth Every Penny + Then Some

review: One of the best finance apps out there. Have been using for over two years now and it keeps getting better. I love how to age my money and try other ways to make it climb. The only issue at this time is the new Face ID. It keeps closing the app when I try to go back and forth to my bank account and YNAB. I already know your team will fix the problem so I‚Äôm not worrying about it. Thanks YNAB for an awesome finance tool.

I did a training and chatted with a rep and they were great....except that it was still too complicated. It could just be me, but I wasn‚Äôt getting the concept and my budget was always off (in the app) even though it wasn‚Äôt in real life.  So I was paying for it and not using it, so I had to stop. Maybe I‚Äôll give it a go another time to see if anything had changed.
title: Wanted to love it

review: After years of trying and failing, I‚Äôve been able to keep my budget for 2 years now. YNAB makes is super easy. I was a little leary of handing over my cc info but since I check it all the time, I know exactly when something doesn‚Äôt look right. I‚Äôve been able to counter-act charges like subscriptions I didn‚Äôt sign up for. It‚Äôs been well worth the $ spent.
title: Finally, I can keep a budget!

review: While it‚Äôs not the most intuitive to start using, once you get the hang of it it is extremely powerful. There are many training classes and articles and read understand how to use i if you need it. I have been using it for years and wouldn‚Äôt know what to do without it.  If you care about your finances then you can take the time to use this app.

review: I‚Äôve been looking at and comparing budget apps for a couple of weeks now.  It came down to two apps, one that is free and rated very highly, and this one. (I‚Äôm guilty of that.  It never works out well.).   Worth paying for.
title: Awesome

review: YNAB has changed my life like no other app has done! I finally feel like I have control over my money and me and my partner have a plan that is flexible and at the same time gives us peace of mind by ensuring that we can cover all of our fixed expenses. title: Life Changer!

review: I really really love this app. It‚Äôs the best I‚Äôve ever tried. review: I make mistakes, YNAB helps me find them. If I fail to record, error in my recording or get behind in checking transactions reconciling the account quickly points it out. When I have questions YNAB staff responds quickly and without making me feel foolish if it‚Äôs obvious fit. Thanks.
title: Confidence

review:
I downloaded the app, watched the videos and clearly I am not smart enough to use this app. I was hoping this would be a legitimate way to manage my finances but I‚Äôm disappointed. 

When I link my bank, it doesn‚Äôt reconcile payments that are listed in my budget and then I have to assign money. It‚Äôs more complicated than it needs to be for a budget. 

It says it‚Äôs principle is to put your money into envelopes but I feel I‚Äôd come out better if I literally has the envelopes in my possession cause this is not easy. I‚Äôve deleted and moving on to another app - hopefully it‚Äôs not as complicated.
title: This is dumb

review: This app, and its desktop counterpart, changed my life. My spending was out of control, and it seemed like I was just getting farther and farther behind. The YNAB system has kind of a steep learning curve, so you really have to give it a few weeks while you learn how it works. But once you learn it, it becomes second nature, and my financial life is totally stable now.
title: Changed my life

review: I‚Äôve been looking for a user friendly app that allows my husband to see what our money status was without having to constantly ask me about it. title: Worth every penny

review:
It has some deep functionality which can be great, but riddled with frustrating errors including substantial lag times for updating various accounts. 

The biggest issue I had was when it came time to renew after the first year. I paid the full amount for my second year and was double changed and had literally a dozen emails and kept getting moved to different departments. 

They were super unorganized and actually sent me another customers information in one of the emails. They ultimately requested some pretty sensitive bank documents because I used Apple Pay and that was when I decided to just eat it. 

The fluffy marketing and cutesy phrases gets annoying when they inappropriately charge you for a product that frequently under delivers. 

I‚Äôll use it for another year because I double paid for it but after that I‚Äôll certainly switch.
title: 2 years of use

review: My husband and I have been using YNAB for a year and a half now and have watched our net worth rise from virtually nothing to a comfortable amount, helped us prepare financially for a baby, and afford a home remodel. review: More money, more problems. I couldn‚Äôt understand how I made good money, but was living paycheck to paycheck. I started with YNAB over 3 years ago, and I have gotten my financies in order. review: I‚Äôve tried many budgeting apps and tools. This is the only one that has stuck! With this tool we have paid off debt early and  accomplished saving goals! title: Best Budgeting Tool

review: It really isn‚Äôt overstating it to say that YNAB has been life changing‚ÄîI love it so much I‚Äôm writing my first review! I had tried almost every other budget program but couldn‚Äôt make it stick. YNAB (the app and the principles) finally were what I needed. I‚Äôve used it for four years and I now have the confidence I can work with whatever comes financially as well as there‚Äôs a solid plan for all regular expenses.
title: Life changing!

review: YNAB is an incredibly helpful tool to manage and control your finances. It has helped my family get and stay out of debt. It also provided a way to facilitate good conversations in our family around money and how it is handled. I highly recommend the free training sessions, especially at the beginning of use. review: Absolutely love using YNAB! This platform was able to change my perspective on budgeting and how to handle my money! title: Budgeting is enjoyable

title: It works. Use it.

title: Life changing

I would really like to see all of the reporting functionality available in the app (the reports currently available are extremely basic) and have the ability to make adjustments.

review: Just recently started using, and I‚Äôm really excited. I‚Äôve been pretty confused, both about how to use the app and how to pick a subscription for myself. review:

Truly only docking one star because of the learning curve (it took QUITE a while to learn) and the lack of charts for looking at retroactive spending, but other than that it‚Äôs simply perfect and helpful
title: Integral part of my life

review: I‚Äôve just started using YNAB & I am beyond happy I did.  Since, I‚Äôve went from 10 Checking accounts, several budgeting spreadsheets, 3 apps to 1 Checking Account and 2 Savings, NO spreadsheets, and 2 apps (YNAB being one) and lastly NO MORE darn headaches keeping track of it all!! 1 month in and so far so goos. No complaints. And I‚Äôm already feeling a lot less stressed about finances. üôåüèΩ
title: Best Budgeting App Ever!

review: YNAB is a great innovative way of budgeting what you have on hand. Think of it as a virtual ‚Äújar system‚Äù. This is exactly what my family needed. For the first time in seven years, we‚Äôve added zero debt to credit cards for the past three months thanks to YNAB. If you‚Äôre serious about getting out of debt, this budgeting software WILL help.
title: If you‚Äôve always struggled with forecasting, YNAB is the answer.

review:
LOVE this software. Budgeting this way has changed our finances. 
I wish the app had an undo button. As well as a way to see ‚Äúactivity.‚Äù For example, if my husband logs in and does the budget, it would be great if there were recent changes made in the app. As of now, if one of us changes something small, we have to ask/tell the other person to be able to tell what happened.
title: Obsessed but have some suggestions

review: This app has really helped us control where our money goes in the future, not just report on where it went in the past. The ‚Äúvirtual account‚Äù budget categories (aka envelopes) are what makes this app so special. Their tech support is also very responsive and top notch. YNAB lines up perfectly with Dave Ramsey‚Äôs philosophy and is so much more sophisticated than his own app. I highly recommend it.
title: Fantastic budget app

review:
The app is very straightforward and easy to use. You can‚Äôt see all the reports on the app (the income vs expense report isn‚Äôt available), but all the important stuff is there. 

One really good feature is that when you log a transaction it remembers the account, category, and payee, so logging transactions becomes super easy if you do it right away.

Great app, great budgeting mentality (if it works for you).
title: Great Functionality

review:
I have been using YNAB since 2015, when it was still a desktop version. It has helped me manage my finances and take charge of my life. The only thing that I would say negatively about YNAB is their syncing capabilities with certain banks. Other than that. They are an amazing service and I highly recommend them to everyone that wants to talk finances! 

Thanks so much for all that you have done for me over the last few years!
title: Great Customer Service!

review: I think this app is great and it helps me keep a total account of how much money I have all in one spot. However, I like to plan each paycheck (mine come Biweekly, and my husbands weekly) out as it comes, so it is frustrating keeping the calculator close to me as I plan the weeks out, since the app is based around monthly planning. I am using the free trial right now, and do not think I will continue on to pay for the app unless they fix this little issue.
title: NEEDS (BI)WEEKLY BUDGET

review: 2 main issues with this app. First, there is no security on it. No touch-is, no PIN, no asking to login. Yes, I lock my phone, but still. This app has a lot of financial data. It‚Äôs the only financial app I have that doesn‚Äôt lock. Second, the app give an alert badge when I‚Äôve overspent with credit. The web app doesn‚Äôt do this, but this one does. Since this causes the app to show an alert, it‚Äôs kind of annoying.
title: Solid replacement for the web app, but...

review: Been a member since Nov 2017. This helps me track all my financials. Once you figure out how to tell your money where to go, it‚Äôs very intuitive. The features that have been rolled out over the last year, while adding options and thus a little bulk have been helpful and necessary for a more robust program. I love this software and recommend it to anyone.
title: Keeps getting better

developerResponse: {'id': 42719602, 'body': "Thanks for letting us know that you'd like to see better reports on the mobile app! It's always helpful to know what YNABers are looking for. \\- Natalie @ YNAB", 'modified': '2024-03-20T21:50:28Z'}
review: The reports seem neglected on mobile. I wish they wouldn‚Äôt keep working on features that only work under perfect conditions (loans are great for mortgages, but break down on car loans that accrue interest daily). Instead, I wish I could do more analysis on the mobile app using the reports. The web version has some great analytics that I‚Äôm not able to do here on the app.
title: Great budgeting, lacking in reports

review: I‚Äôve been a budget Nerd since Dave Ramsey came out with his Total Money Makeover so I‚Äôm not slouch when it comes to making a budget and sticking to it. I constantly manage my budgets but what keeps throwing me off with YNAB is the tracking of transactions between accounts. All I can read is Transfer To Account Xxxxxxx and can‚Äôt actually see what accounts each transaction has gone to. It threw my budget completely off. Now thoroughly confused I‚Äôm going back to Mint and an Excel Document for my budgets. YNAB seems to be a good app and a work in progress. It just isn‚Äôt working for me
title: Wasn‚Äôt Happy with It

YNAB takes your money upfront so that you can‚Äôt churn in year 1.

title: Amazing life changer

review: After a disastrous use of the physical ‚Äúenvelope method‚Äù while staring down 6-figure debt, I nearly given up on ever being out of debt. YNAB changed all of that! title: Life changer

review:

title: YNAB is amazing

review: I like the new features in the update, especially the progress bars along with amount spent and amount remaining. I use the reconcile feature regularly from previous updates. title: New budget update

review:
I think setting up your budget is easier on the web version (just bigger and easier to use for that), but day-to-day management and even creating next month‚Äôs budget is super easy in the app. 10/10. 

Also, for anyone not using YNAB, it‚Äôs just an all around fantastic app and company. They have tons of articles and help videos. Definitely worth the price.
title: Works great

review:
Overall great product and great app.

The only reason that I didn‚Äôt give it 5 stars is that there is still some functionality that is delegated to the website (analysis of expenses over time, undo functionality).  For everyday use the app is great but to clean up mistakes or do any sort of analysis you have to jump to web which isn‚Äôt always convenient, especially because mobile web is blocked and rerouted to the app.
title: Great app!

review:
I have always been a bit of a worrier when it comes to finances.  YNAB really reduces the stress because you always know exactly where you stand.  It also gives you permission to spend because it is in the budget and you are not worried that you are spending money that is designated for other things like the mortgage or utilities
.  I love this App.  It has made my life so much better.
title: No worries

review: I‚Äôve tried budgeting in the past but they never worked because the budget was too controlling.  I‚Äôve used the desktop YNAB for years and I‚Äôm enjoying the internet one also. title: Only budget that works for me

review:
Love this app. Great companion to the website. And I find myself using the app more and more everyday, which keeps my finances up to date - with minimal overall effort.

The only missing killer feature: transaction search! When can we get that in that app? Seems like it‚Äôs doable since the data is in the cloud and should be a part of the same backend API used by the website.

title: The best

review: I‚Äôve never had a good relationship with money in the past. I had tried different apps like Mint, but nothing quite stuck until I tried YNAB. Now I feel like I can prepare for the future and have a much better grasp on where my money is going. I recommend it to my friends and family often!
title: Life changing program

review: I have never used a budgeting app and have tried to ‚Äúbudget‚Äô for years. This app is so helpful! I will never go without it!! title: So helpful

I was constantly referring back to other finance apps or spreadsheet to get an accurate snapshot.
title: Wanted to love it

review: I‚Äôm trying so hard to like YNAB.  Unfortunately the tutorials and videos are geared towards beginners so my choices are either 1. I‚Äôm not giving up, but I wish it was easier to navigate transactions between accounts.
title: Please just advise with the technicals of the online platform

review:
For the most part this works well. I don‚Äôt love the reallocating dollars to credit cards feature though ‚Äî that‚Äôs where most glitches seem to happen.

review: My wife and I started using YNAB a couple of months ago. It has completely changed how we approach our finances. title: Game Changing

title: Love it

developerResponse: {'id': 31700323, 'body': 'Oh, wow! Thanks so much for your review! It means a lot that you see how much we really do care about each and every YNABer! ~Renae@YNAB.com', 'modified': '2022-08-28T13:27:49Z'}
review:
A little less than 2 years ago I asked people who their favorite budgeting app was‚Ä¶ 

I was bombarded with YNAB, YNAB, YNAB, YNAB‚Ä¶ I‚Äôm like, what the heck is a YNAB. 

But really, the rest his history. Not only is this a great budgeting app that reframes the way you think about money, it‚Äôs also a company that CARES A LOT about its users. 

Struggling to use it? They have webinars. 
Have questions? They have plenty of people willing to help (and not JUST the employees) 
Have an idea or want to complain? They care about your feedback and keep people updated on changes. 

I love the app, I love the company and I love the community they‚Äôve built around them. There is literally no other budgeting software like them.
title: I love YNAB!

review: This app singlehandedly changed the way my wife and I budget our income! I recommend it to all my friends and family looking to change and improve spending as well as budgeting habits. The app is simple to use, the instructional videos and chats are super helpful as well! I even use YNAB for my business accounts! Download it today!!
title: Life Changing!

review: I was a long-time Mint user, but got tired of various technical issues including sync errors. YNAB has consistently worked well for the last 18 months and is well worth the subscription price...it‚Äôs even better than EveryDollar. It works well with local and national banks and even investment accounts. YNAB helped us get out of debt, stay out of debt, and even build up an emergency fund.
title: Best Budgeting App To Date

review:
The app is not user friendly and customer service is terrible they don‚Äôt answer question and aren‚Äôt helpful.

The whole point of the app is to create a monthly budget but it not not roll over seamless. They seem to still have a lot of kinks to work out. 

When you email customer service they say there is a chat available, but only when someone is there to answer. This feature never works. They‚Äôre a multiple people responding to your email thread so you have to repeat yourself each time. I‚Äôve emailed server all times and my issue still isn‚Äôt sorted out.
title: Not user friendly

review: Concept was difficult to understand at first but through their support and training was able to pick it up quickly. This app has changed my life!! Have used it for almost two years now and for the first time in my life actually have a balance in my savings account (in addition to staying on top of my expenses). Thank you YNAB!
title: Changed my life!

review: I‚Äôve been very please with the app and updates that come along (like goals), but I really think this app could be made complete with the addition of an event/activity log. I‚Äôve spent too much time trying to figure out where I went wrong when I accidentally moved money I didn‚Äôt mean to. There‚Äôs no record of these transactions unless you go through every category one by one, and even then it‚Äôs limited.
title: Needs an event log

review: YNAB is easy to use and is a great way to allocate where you would like to spend your money rather than just seeing where it went. It‚Äôs like the envelope method made easy. I‚Äôve been using it for over a year and I think this is the first year that my wife actually looks at the budget and knows where we‚Äôre at financially. I love it!
title: Love it!

review: The functionality of the app is fine. But the lack of portrait mode kills its usability. The iPad is so much easier to use in portrait mode than landscape. It‚Äôs too bad because I use my iPad for so many things except the one thing I really would like to use it for. In which case I always end up back at the computer because it‚Äôs so clunky to use ynab in landscape on the iPad.
title: YNAB great. iPad app lame.

review:
Ynab takes a great deal of classes and studying but it's worth it! The best budget app I have used by far. At least try the three months and learn the program. It far superior to other programs out there. 

The transactions are easy to enter, easy to add your banks and credit cards but again you have to take classes for education. Follow the budget and you Will save.
title: Worth the work

review:
Let‚Äôs take a moment to recognize the amazing updates to the app. I no longer have to switch between the calculator app & the budget app cause BOOM you can just add the amount allotted for the week now. Game changer. I‚Äôm the happiest budgeter right now! 

This app is great - I was never taught to budget, sucked at it when I tried starting and then I met YNAB & one year later I don‚Äôt know how I ever lived without you.
title: Kiss the App Developers!

review: I‚Äôve been using this app for over 3 years. It helped me understand how much mortgage I could afford and it helps me take control over where my money goes. If you have the right banks with automatic import, it works quite well. I got an Apple Card just to take advantage of the real time transaction sync.
title: Huge Financial Advantages

review: This app comes with a significant learning curve, but once you understand how it works it makes managing spending incredibly easy. It takes all the guesswork out of spending and it only takes a moment to make informed decisions that are in line with my values and financial goals

review: I love YNAB been using it for years. title: Great App

The mental health benefit of having a *flexible* spending plan that changes as you do and helps you move toward your targets guilt-free is no joke! review: Yes you will need time to learn and make this software your own, but they provide training every step of the way.  It feels sooooo good to control my money and not have it control me. title: Gain control, reduce anxiety

review: After years of feeling like I was always running along behind my money, I finally feel in control of what I‚Äôm doing with it. And it has been remarkably easy. Not without challenges ‚Äì it took a while to figure out how to use it. But it‚Äôs not hard, and the system makes sense.
title: Finally in control

review: This is the best budget app I‚Äôve used so far. However, my only problem with it is that it doesn‚Äôt automatically import your transactions often enough. title: So complicated

title: Best of All

developerResponse: {'id': 30948519, 'body': "Hi HamMar, appreciate the review! I'm honored to hear that you (and your bank account!) have great things to say about YNAB. Thanks for being here. üôÇ - Kathryn @ YNAB", 'modified': '2022-07-18T11:37:52Z'}
review: The ‚Äúonly assign the dollars you have‚Äù philosophy has changed the way I‚Äôve budgeted. After using Everydollar, my own spreadsheet other apps, I can definitely say YNAB is worth the subscription. Every person I know who has given it a full shot has never looked back. Your bank account will thank you!
title: Only budgeting app you‚Äôll need

review: Started YNAB-ing in 2013 (maybe even before) and it has changed my life. I was so hesitant to quit YNAB4 and start over with the newest web-based release but again, it‚Äôs changed my life. The updates always make sense. The logic is there. The methods are easy to use, making goals easy to see and reach. Everyone needs a budget!
title: Changed my life

review: It‚Äôll change yours too. Helped me control my finances and understand them much more deeply. Beautiful, user friendly interface. Helped me get out of thousands of dollars of debt, and shows you reports as well, which makes you want to keep going and going. Leaves you making better financial decisions. The best!!
title: Changed my life

review: YNAB has literally revolutionized my financial life and literacy, and made me feel confident that I know my financial situation and am in control of where it is headed. Not only is the app experience amazing, but in my two (2) interactions with support, they have been the kindest, most polite, most knowledgeable, and most helpful support staff I‚Äôve ever talked to. Honestly, blown away by this app ecosystem.
title: YNAB is a game changer

review: I credit my financial freedom (no debt except a mortgage, which is rapidly shrinking) to my decision to sign up for YNAB back when money was tight. Spending money on a budget seems oxymoronic at first, but this particular budgeting software and methodology will change your financial life for the better if you give it a chance. YNAB requires discipline, but discipline = freedom.
title: You really do (need a budget)

review: I have been a YNABer for just over a week, and it‚Äôs fantastic! The hands-on approach to budgeting works really well for me, and I highly recommend YNAB for anyone else who enjoys being active and involved with their money. The desktop app is a must for all the features YNAB offers, but the mobile app is great for transactions and budget checks on-the-go.
title: Great budgeting app

review: I used to look forward to payday because it meant I could pay rent and eat this month. But with YNAB, payday is now just another day. Two years ago, I started my first job out of college with less than $100 to my name. Now, this month‚Äôs expenses were paid for two months ago. I never thought I would get to financial security this quickly, and it feels good!
title: Game Changer

review:
I was a YNAB 4 hold out, but had to upgrade a year ago. In my opinion there should be ZERO behind the scenes math in budget software but YNAB 5 forces so much on you. Every time I look at it, I have to relearn what it‚Äôs doing with my money.  We need to have negative balances role over, but that‚Äôs no longer allowed so we have clunky work arounds.  It‚Äôs unfortunate they decided not to market to people who can already pay their credit card bills on time. 

If they could make those forced updates optional, they would be 5 stars for sure. But they treat you like a child.
title: YNAB 5 Updates force the user into useless features

review:
I probably should be reviewing the app, rather than the service itself, but I‚Äôm obsessed with ynab. In 12 years of marriage, this is the first thing that has ever really gotten my husband and I on the same page. The support team is also amazing. 

As for the App, I love that too! Great to be able to have all my financial information at my fingertips at every moment!
title: Love everything about ynab

review:
This company will tell you to buy this version and you will be set. Just pay the subscription, however, as soon as they have squeezed all the money they can get and start longing to richer they will announce a new version. There won‚Äôt be any substantial changes mind you...just cosmetic. They won‚Äôt support your version and they will make it impossible for you to use your version forcing you to upgrade to a more expensive version. Just watch and see. 
I loved YNAB but as a senior citizen they have bypassed all the loyal original purchasers for money. I can not afford YNAB. So it is rather less than helpful. Thanks YNAB.
title: It‚Äôs great UNTIL...

review: This app is very confusing to me and seems like a lot of work.  Having to re-enter our income and individual expenses every month is very cumbersome. The help tab did not clarify things for us.  We use out credit card to pay for everything then pay it off in full every month; perhaps the app doesn‚Äôt have a way of accounting for this as a budgeting method. In any case after 3 months I still have no idea what the app is trying to tell me.  Also, pretty sure I wanted the monthly subscription, but was charged for the full year.
title: Confused

review:
Ive been using YNAB for almost a year, and it has absolutely changed my financial life. 

My one request for the mobile app is that we be able to ‚Äúadd‚Äù money to categories like we can online: that is, after the amount that‚Äôs already in that category, add to it using ‚Äú+‚Äù and whatever amount we want to add to it.

Thanks so much!
title: Amazing concept and UI - Just one request

review:
No other app facilitates aligning one‚Äôs money with their values, while shifting beliefs and behaviors (what budgeting is REALLY about), while reducing or eliminating impulse spending, while reducing or eliminating debt.

Americans spend $120 billion annually on credit card interest fees. What if that money were in our hands, and we were investing in public education (including financial literacy and skills), ecological restoration, corporate and political accountability, and more?

YNAB is not only a great personal money management app, but a tool for the citizenry to reclaim our financial power and craft the society we want (if we choose to be citizens rather than ‚Äúconsumers‚Äù).

‚ÄúLater‚Äù doesn‚Äôt exist. Begin now.
title: The best budgeting app!

title: Life Changing

Yes, it helps me budget and manage spending, but more important, it gives me a high-level view of my financial situation. Thanks to YNAB, my annual car insurance doesn‚Äôt surprise me, I can plan for a new winter coat, and I can make intelligent trade-offs that serve my long-term interests. Yes, I‚Äôm a fan.
title: Peace of mind from a budgeting app

review:
YNAB is excellent in every way.  I wouldn‚Äôt touch another financial tool with a ten foot pole.  I have been using it for 5+years.
The app is easy to understand , easy on the eyes, intuitive, and doesn‚Äôt have any unnecessary buttons or features.  
I have stayed out of debt, gone on 2 vacations without overspending, and feel confident about my financial future. üíùüíùüíù
title: So thankful for YNAB!

review: When the app works it‚Äôs great. When it doesn‚Äôt it is useless. There are significant delays in importing data from financial institutions, for example data from my discover account was unable to be downloaded for MONTHS. I also have to routinely reauthenticate my accounts to get data to download into the budget. The delay means you don‚Äôt get an accurate picture of your financials. It definitely doesn‚Äôt feel like an automated budget. Gave this app a year try and just too hard to make it work.

review:
I made an account today with the free trial, added my bank account info, and figured out my monthly expenditures. Was loving it. Not so much right now. I then logged out to refresh my account due to an added deposit not going through. Tried to log back in and it said my account doesn‚Äôt exist. 

Cannot get in, cannot restart through email login or Apple ID options. Says I don‚Äôt have an account but definitely is showing up in my subscription options. Cancelled the subscription but supposedly still have access (I don‚Äôt) for the next month. Please help.
title: Free subscription isn‚Äôt working

review: I love this app because it‚Äôs the most intuitive one I have found and doesn‚Äôt require you to do any fancy shifting of money for unusual spending, that is if all your accounts including credit cards are linked. For beginners, make sure you understand that you should only budget money you actually have!
title: Best budgeting tool

review:
YNAB‚Äôs easy-to-use budgeting app has helped me create the most powerful budget I‚Äôve ever had. By staying on top of my cash flow, I‚Äôm able to align my spending with my priorities. My wife is even having budget conversations with me now (sometimes). 

Bottom line: I feel more in charge with my budgeting than ever and the cost of YNAB is totally worth it for me.
title: More than Mint

review: Have been using YNAB for over 5 years and don‚Äôt know how we ever got along without it. Actually, I do know how... we were living beyond our means and racking up credit card debt. We are out of debt now and make much smarter spending decisions. It is comforting to have a budget plan that works month-to-month and year-to-year. Thanks YNAB!
title: Can‚Äôt live without it

review: I love this budgeting app. It took about 2 months to really understand the thinking behind it, and how numbers changed based on certain actions, but now I love it! I look forward to a new month starting to see the progress I‚Äôve made on my goals. It forces me to really think about how I‚Äôm spending money, and what my priorities are, which is great!
title: Can‚Äôt wait for the next month!

review: As a 25 year old, I had never been in control of my finances and it was a major source of stress. I feel so much more confident with this app, because even though I‚Äôm a broke law student I know where my money is going as soon as I get it. I also like that if I go over in one category, I haven‚Äôt ruined the whole budget. It really took the fear and uncertainty out of finances for me!
title: Life-saving

review: Other tools that I have used in the past allow little cheats, but not YNAB. This software forces you to give every dollar a job ahead of time. You always know where you stand and it is super easy to reallocate funds without doing a ton of math. The reporting is great and tells you where you are going and where you have been. Nothing else comes close.
title: YNAB Keeps you honest!

review: We have made back the money we spent on YNAB and then probably hundreds/thousands more. Honestly, it has kept us on the same page financially in our marriage, enabled us to know where every dollar goes, and has made budgeting super convenient. We talk all the time about how grateful we are for it. The new app interface is even better than before and we love it.
title: Best budgeting app

review: I thought I knew all I needed to know about budgeting so when I got the app and just dove in. This app has a lot of depth and can be tailored to your situation.
title: Powerful tool. Watch videos

review: Using YNAB has given me the confidence to set all my bills and credit cards to auto-pay the full amount because I know I‚Äôm not spending money I don‚Äôt have. title: Money Confidence

review: Truly, this app is so simple and has literally changed the way I budget. I was always a pen and paper budgeter and this brought my budget to a new level. By earmarking money for future expenses I have been able to really gain control of my money. i‚Äôm saving more money than ever and I‚Äôm prepared for future expenses. I highly recommend YNAB!
title: Life Changing

review: YNAB takes a little getting used to in the beginning. However, the videos and education on their website are very well done and helpful. Once you get going you will love using the app in your day to day life. I use it to record my spending as it happens and to check my budget routinely.
title: Helpful budgeting app

review:
This app has been great for a number of years, but it just gets better and better with more features and flexibility. 

It can take some time to get used to the overall approach, but once you do, you‚Äôll realize a mind-shift in how you plan, save and spend money!
title: Absolute best financial budgeting tool anywhere!

developerResponse: {'id': 30952493, 'body': "Hi piazzara88, I'm excited to hear that YNAB is working well for you! Thanks for the review. üôÇ Flexibility in budgeting ‚Äî I agree, it's a game changer! - Kathryn @ YNAB", 'modified': '2022-07-18T14:09:22Z'}

review: This is the only budget program that I‚Äôve used that works with credit cards. It‚Äôs very user friendly. I‚Äôve used it almost a year now and I love it. This makes bill paying not the scary proposition it used to be for me. Now I know the credit card money is right there waiting for me to pay it off. No worries!
title: Love YNAB

review: I‚Äôve been using YNAB for over a year now, and it‚Äôs been life changing. Having a clear picture of where my money is going, what I want it to do for me, and knowing I can move things around when priorities shift allows for budgeting to be a flexible, fun part of financial health. I tell everyone who will listen to try YNAB!!
title: Hands down best budgeting software

review: I‚Äôve been using YNAB for almost 10 years now. It‚Äôs life changing. When I started YNAB I was living paycheck to paycheck. Fast forward to now I‚Äôm completely debt free. Paid off 75k of student loans in just over 4 years thanks to budgeting with YNAB. I‚Äôve been able to let go of so much financial stress because I know where my money goes
title: Changed my finances

review: For years, I resisted moving over from the old YNAB, which I lived. I grumbled when it would no longer work with the latest OS. I was dumb. This is the best designed, most effortless, and most reliably flawless app (and browser-based app) I‚Äôve used in a long, long time. Knowing exactly where I stand now takes minutes each week - literally. Kudos to the YNAB team.
title: Should have come earlier.

review: I have used YNAB before and decided to try it again. The new UI is clunky and I couldn‚Äôt find the settings or how to make another budget for my business. It just had me on the same page. I liked the older version much better. Plus it has issues connecting to my bank and customer service tried to help but after many days they still couldn‚Äôt get it to sync. The amount of money asked to spend is high especially with all the issues. I‚Äôm using Mint now and it‚Äôs free and connects to my bank.
title: Connection issues and new UI

review:
I pay everything with my credit card and then pay it off twice a month, but YNAB won‚Äôt stop telling me that I need to keep $400 in my account for the credit card purchases and then another $400 for when I pay off my card. 

There are so many things going on and when someone tries to give you help, it ends up being a ten paragraph email with all these workarounds. 

Way too convoluted. I‚Äôm going to try something else.
title: insanely convoluted and impossible to navigate

review:
We‚Äôve been using ynab for 2 years now and it‚Äôs definitely our favorite budgeting program. 

The app is generally great, but is missing 2 key features: undo button and reports. You have to go to the web app for the latter, which we never do so we‚Äôre missing a lot of the ynab features. 

Seriously ynab, how is it that you still don‚Äôt offer spending reports on the app?? 

There also used to be a lot of sync issues where our accounts would disconnect from our bank. I‚Äôve gone to support maybe a half dozen times for that. It hasn‚Äôt happened lately though so maybe they figured it out. 

But to end where I started, this is still the best budgeting software that we‚Äôve tried and we will likely stick with it.
title: Love the program, generally love the app, but key features missing

review: We really didn‚Äôt like the YNAB set up in the app nor in the browser. Nothing bad, just didn‚Äôt compute well with our brains. BUT we so greatly respect & appreciate their customer service in that when your trial period ends they close your account rather than automatically charging you for a month or year like so many other apps/companies. Seriously, that is how all should set things up. Because of that alone YNAB will stay on our radar for future needs.
title: Not for us, but...

review:
I‚Äôm terribly conflicted over how to feel about this app because it‚Äôs so good at what it does but the developer is like extremely anti-forecasting with the way it is designed so if you need to do forecasting because you know like most folks you wanna have some resemblance of planning then you‚Äôre gonna have to do that bit on a different platform. 

The budget template goal thing is not a substitute for old fashioned forecasting, no I don‚Äôt want a separate budget to use for forecasting.
title: Good at what it does/anti-forecasting

review:
I need a budget. God, do I need a budget! But I can‚Äôt figure out the app for the life of me. I‚Äôve tried it so many times - I‚Äôve tried it sober and otherwise - and I just don‚Äôt understand the interface. 

Also, when you link your accounts, shouldn‚Äôt the app know what your income is? Budgeting ahead for the next month is difficult because it only lets you see what‚Äôs in the bank today. But maybe I‚Äôve missed something?
title: App isn‚Äôt very intuitive - haven‚Äôt tried on laptop yet

review: Never have I felt more empowered with my money in my 40 years. The only regret I have with this apps that it wasn‚Äôt around 20 years ago. I have tried them all folks... finally this brilliance comes along. I set my son up on this as well. As a mom I finally feel like I have a teaching my tool that is resetting his future course of financial security. You need a budget!!!
title: This. Is. It.

review: The web app is perfect. However on the mobile app, there‚Äôs no option to quick budget individual groups of budget items, and there‚Äôs no undo button, and there‚Äôs no ‚Äúage of money‚Äù. The last isn‚Äôt that important, but I do like to use the quick budget to see how much certain categories need at any given moment to be budgeted for the month.
title: Almost perfect, missing a few things

review: I have tried everything to budget. From using cash only, to other popular apps, and nothing was helping. I went through Dave Ramsey‚Äôs Financial Peace program and it was helpful. But having this app connect to my bank account and track my spending has helped me to become smarter with my money and I‚Äôm so impressed!!!! I would soooo recommend this to others with budgeting struggles like me.
title: LOVE LOVE LOVE THIS APP!!!

developerResponse: {'id': 46972135, 'body': "Wow, what an update! Thanks so much for taking the time to share your experience. It can definitely take a while to get up and running with YNAB. That's something that we think about a lot as a team and we're working to improve. We're just so glad that you stuck with it and that the Support team was able to have your back when you needed us. Thanks again for the review and happy YNABing! -Blair@YNAB", 'modified': '2024-09-24T22:34:45Z'}
review:
I was a long-time Mint user who came across several YNAB ads as Mint announced its shutdown. I spent quite a while setting things up in YNAB, linking accounts, watching videos, reading info on their website, etc. 

I won‚Äôt lie to you: getting this set up and figuring out how it YNAB works was tough. It took me well over a month to figure things out. I hated it. 

But I kept reaching out to support and they kept answering. They extended my free trial so I could get the hang on YNAB.

Now, six months later, I‚Äôm obsessed. I don‚Äôt know that I‚Äôve got it all figured out, but it works for me. YNAB has totally changed how I think about money, and I wish I‚Äôd joined sooner.
title: I‚Äôm a convert!

developerResponse: {'id': 47162994, 'body': "Thanks for being a long-time YNABer and writing a review! It's true that we raised our price in 2021 and again in 2024. We want every YNABer to feel the cost is worth it to them, and if you have questions or ideas you'd like to share, I hope you'll reach out to us at help@ynab.com. Michele @ YNAB", 'modified': '2024-10-02T17:57:36Z'}
review: I‚Äôve been a YNAB member before it became an app when you had to download it on your computer. I‚Äôve noticed that the price keeps going up every year. If it‚Äôs supposed to be a budgeting app, aren‚Äôt you supposed to keep it affordable so that it attracts more members. Especially people who have been members from the beginning.
title: I love the app, but why does the price keep going up?

developerResponse: {'id': 43336736, 'body': 'Thanks for the feedback and updated review, Charliemander! We hear this a lot, so rest assured that it is already on our radar! Caitlin at YNAB', 'modified': '2024-04-17T22:49:43Z'}
review:
The YNAB methodology has changed my family‚Äôs entire financial story. I highly recommend it to anyone looking to take control of their financial situation.

I do wish that the mobile app had more reports available, such as the income v expense report of the spending report. It seems like the mobile app is falling behind there.
title: Great Methodology & Ecosystem

developerResponse: {'id': 41529771, 'body': "Hi there, and thanks for this awesome review! We're happy to hear you've found YNAB easy to use, and impactful over the last 8 years. üéâ \\- Jill@YNAB", 'modified': '2024-01-25T15:13:05Z'}
review:
I‚Äôm a Certified Financial Planner, and I‚Äôve been using YNAB for my personal finances for close to 8 years now. It has consistently outperformed other apps, and the YNAB team is constantly updating features to make it more usable. If I run into an issue, I‚Äôve found customer support easy to contact. They‚Äôre very relatable too. 

Great job, guys and gals!
title: By Far the Best Budgeting App

review: From the time I started using this app to today, my financial freedom and stress level has fallen precipitously. My income has barely budged but from living paycheck to paycheck, I now have enough to save monthly with a small emergency fund. I don‚Äôt live so frivolously but I have control over where my dollar is going.
title: Quite literally changed my life

developerResponse: {'id': 35503394, 'body': "Thanks for leaving this review. I totally understand wanting the connection with the Apple Card. The Apple Card has definitely limited which data aggregators they'll work with and they aren't working with our import providers currently. Hopefully that changes soon! - Natalie @ YNAB", 'modified': '2023-03-21T11:54:08Z'}
review: My transactions primarily flow through Apple Card, and the lack of integration is disappointing. Not sure if it‚Äôs YNAB issue or Apple Card issue, but I can‚Äôt justify spending >$10/month if I have to manually track everything. So I‚Äôve cancelled the free trial. Otherwise the app is good. If one day they are able to integrate Apple Card transactions, I‚Äôll gladly use YNAB.
title: Good app, but doesn‚Äôt work well with Apple Card

review: The app used to be really great, but for the last couple of months imports from all of our bank and credit card accounts have been delayed. If you are going to charge users $85 a year, you need to make it worth their while. All my husband heard back from customer service regarding the issue was, ‚Äúyou can always manually enter them.‚Äù If we wanted to do that, we‚Äôd use an excel spreadsheet, which is FREE. Really hoping they can get their act together in a couple of months, otherwise we won‚Äôt renew.
title: Used to be awesome, not lately

review: Absolutely love YNAB !This app will help you out so much with managing your money. App is easy to use and they are constantly making it better.  First money tracking/budget app that incorporates credit cards which is extremely helpful. Customer service is excellent and will work with you to problem solve any issues. Highly recommend this app!
title: Great Budget Tool

review:
I can‚Äôt understand why a supreme budgeting app that we pay for has the same exact unhelpful reports section on mobile and iPad for years and years now. 

Shouldn‚Äôt a full suite budgeting app help you understand how you‚Äôve spent your money? Even just a little bit? We‚Äôre starving out here. The only real way to digest spending patterns is a 3rd party toolkit on Google Chrome. 

Just being blunt here because it‚Äôs so frustrating when you really think about it. Come on YNAB, let‚Äôs come full circle here.
title: Reports section pretty much useless

review:
Been using YNAB since January 2015. I‚Äôve been using the new version since December 2017. I love the app, but I make adjustments to the way i do it to accommodate my YNAB4 workflow, such as ring-fencing months. 

The App is great. But I wish there were ways they could streamline access to certain types of information. 

Keep up the great work!
title: Life changing App and service

review: It‚Äôs funny to want to start budgeting and tracking your spending habits and to use an app to do so that has a monthly subscription. The idea is to save money not spend more than you have or are willing to spend. The app gets five stars because it‚Äôs a well designed and useful tool. My review is four stars simply because the monthly subscription model contradicts having a budget.
title: A subscription just isn‚Äôt in the budget

review:
I have searched for budget tool all of my life. I have used this app for 3 years and it has saved my financial life. I always have the right amount of money in my accounts to pay big expenses like vacations, car repairs and car insurance( in full so I don‚Äôt have to pay extra to make monthly payments‚Äù
I love YNAB and don‚Äôt foresee a time when I will cancel my subscription.
title: Life saver

review: YNAB is basically the system I was already doing with spreadsheets. The difference is where it used to take me hours two or three times a month to keep things current, now I spend one hour refreshing the budget each month. The rest is seamlessly done in my everyday life. I have to admit that I‚Äôm addicted to importing and allocating expenses. That‚Äôs what I do for ‚Äúfun‚Äù on my phone! Thanks, YNAB!
title: Love it!

review:
Was a long time Mint user, but it didn‚Äôt seem to paint the whole picture. Expenses don‚Äôt necessarily start and stop at the beginning and end of each month. YNAB does a fantastic job of understanding rollover expenses, budgeting with credit cards, and cash flow analysis. The theory of assigning a dollar a job has really changed the way I look at my finances.

The only thing missing is PIN protection and Face ID!
title: Fantastic

review: LOVE YNAB! The app works well for keeping the budget while on the go. I have been a subscriber since day one. This most recent update however is disappointing. While the calculators are welcome, the new number pad is WAY too small. What was a quick easy way to enter transactions, has become very prone to error. Here‚Äôs to hoping the YNAB team will update the UI soon!!!!
title: Not a fan of the new keyboard

review: I‚Äôve been using YNAB for a while, but without a really good app, it was dragging me down. Now the app does everything the desktop version does, and in some cases, does it more efficiently. I love YNAB, their service is second to none, and the app now rounds out everything. You might find a bit of a learning curve with their method, but this is such an efficient and useful service.
title: The app now rocks!

developerResponse: {'id': 44057756, 'body': "Hey there! We can help you out with this! The assigned column only shows how money has been added to the category based on assigning or moving money\\- transactions categorized to the category don't affect that column! Write us at help@ynab.com for more detailed help on how to get things where you want them in your YNAB! Phil@YNAB", 'modified': '2024-05-21T13:02:48Z'}
review: I think the YNAB methodology is an excellent way to budget. I have learned a lot from this app and their educational resources. The app can be hard to learn. There a lot going on. I have had it a few months and am finally starting to get the hang of it. Stick with it and use the guides on their website.
title: There is a learning curve

review: This is a fantastic transition from Mvelopes. It‚Äôs a very efficient and accurate way to assign my money IN ADVANCE and to know EXACTLY where I am spending money FROM ‚Äúbefore‚Äù a purchase is made. There is one nagging question which has to be answered before any purchase is complete‚Ä¶ ‚ÄúWhere is that purchase coming from?‚Äù YNAB answers that question.
title: My Annual Bookkeeper for $1.73 p/w

developerResponse: {'id': 42442770, 'body': 'You ARE a financial genius! I am so happy you are loving YNAB and that you have found it to be so valuable. We are pleased as punch to have you YNABing with us! \\- Natalie @ YNAB', 'modified': '2024-03-07T16:11:31Z'}
review:
YNAB is simply life changing.

I was skeptical of paying for a budgeting app, but 2 days into my free trial I would have happily signed up for an even higher price than what they ask for.

You have to use it to truly understand its power, but after a couple months I have already saved so much money from better financial habits and tracking of my spending.

This software is so comprehensive that I can customize it to my exact needs and now I look like a financial genius when showing off our budget and cool reports to my wife!

If you are reading this, please download! You will not regret it!!!!
title: Best Budgeting App Hands Down

developerResponse: {'id': 34888342, 'body': 'Thank you so much for taking the time, Urmurgursh! I love that YNAB has helped you so much. Feeling in charge of your finances is the best feeling! - Natalie @ YNAB', 'modified': '2023-02-15T15:33:01Z'}
review: I rarely take the time to write reviews. YNAB has helped me so much with getting in charge of my finances. Definitely watch some how to videos as there‚Äôs a small learning curve but it‚Äôs so worth it. Their customer service goes above and beyond to help you. If you‚Äôre reading this thinking about downloading absolutely do it!
title: YNAB is a game changer

review:
Combines cash and budget tracking in a single app.  Don‚Äôt think that‚Äôs a big deal?  I‚Äôve used two other tools and both created a scenario where my bank account would have gone negative. Not YNAB!  Best of the breed,  by far!  
Great development team and company. Their products are reliable and always up to date.
title: Best App By Far

review: After years of trying to budget and get my finances under control. YNAB has allowed me to do just that. Took a bit to get a hang of all the features of the app but now that I have that down, it‚Äôs been really fun and empowering to finally get ahold of my finance. It‚Äôs very informative planning and seeing where my money goes.
title: Game Changer

review: This app has helped me get my finances on track. As a college student money is tight and it can feel like you have no control. YNAB helped me to set goals and keep track of my spending, and that helped me to gain control of my money. If you‚Äôre worried that you won‚Äôt make rent like I was, that‚Äôs why you need a budget.
title: Perfect for college students

review: YNAB is the best!  I have been using YNAB for ten months now, it has been the only budgeting system that has worked for my wife and I.  I get excited to create the budget each month and every time a transaction comes in, it's all so quick and effortless.  I don't think I will live without it for the rest of my life.
title: Outstanding

review:
Have been a YNAB 4 user for a few years.  Used to recommend the program the young people in my office as a great tool to learn budgeting mindset.   
Had to switch to the online current version. 
Awful.  
What used to take a few minutes here and there now takes 30 minutes.  
Information and monthly spending hard to follow.  
Advise to view multiple months was open the program in multiple screens....
Took away a lot of functionality.  
Used to feel in control of my budget and finances and now it causes me concern because I don‚Äôt feel like I have a full understanding.  
It‚Äôs unfortunate because the program used to be so good.  When I asked about loss of certain features support just told me it‚Äôs hard to make the switch but it‚Äôs better.  Well it‚Äôs not.  Changes lack common sense.  Unfortunately I didn‚Äôt realize this till after I paid for a years subscription.
title: New isn‚Äôt better

review: I just accepted the fact that I would always live paycheck to paycheck until this app. Follow the four rules and with a little patience you can succeed too! I love that there is no judgement and no telling you what you can‚Äôt spend money on. Just budget for it! 2018 is the first Christmas I can remember that I didn‚Äôt put it all on credit!
title: This app will change your life!

review:
Is made to be flexible in how you use it, helps me customize and ‚Äúroll with the punches.‚Äù I love the direct import feature, the reports, and again how it is built to be flexible so that I can adjust my budget on the go. 

Great support. It took me a little while to get used to a budgeting app, and their customer support and classes help me understand how to use it. It‚Äôs easy for me now.
title: Excellent Budgeting App

review: Can‚Äôt say there‚Äôs much to complain about here. YNAB had changed my life. In the 4 years I‚Äôve been using it, I‚Äôve paid off all CC debt (and learned to use cards correctly - biggest benefit is all my free flights from points), purchased a car and a home. I have an understanding of where my finances are and how I can continue to save. Thanks guys!
title: Now that we‚Äôve got iPhone X support...

review: I really like using this app, it seems to sync very well with the webapp. Two issues though: it is not optimized for the iPhone X, and often when I try and select multiple transactions and categorize them nothing happens after clicking the desired category. If these things are fixed, the app would be perfect
title: Great app, please update for iPhone X!!!

review: I loved the old app because it was designed to do one thing‚Äîlet you enter your expenses as you incurred them. You can still do that, but in an attempt to basically make the app a standalone version of the web site, they have added so many bells and whistles that the interface is now much more of a kludge. Still a great way to stay on budget but I will miss the old, cleaner interface.
title: New app tries to do too much

review: I love YNAB, from its witty recommendations to the layout and ease of budgeting. I was reluctant to use the app at first but now find it remarkably convenient. I never used the older version and it sounds like this one is a step above. It does everything you can do with the web version, it‚Äôs just as easy and just as clean. Really good budgeting app - these folks got it right!
title: Seamless integration with website

developerResponse: {'id': 44373957, 'body': "HI there! Negative cash doesn't exist so negative balances in your categories cause your budget to be inaccurate. In order to make your budget accurate those balances are automatically covered at the start of the month. If you want to chat more about this, write us! help@ynab.com ~Phil @ YNAB", 'modified': '2024-06-04T18:22:24Z'}
review:
Not sure why a negative balance doesn‚Äôt carry over to the next month. Wish there was more data analytics to view. iPad app isn‚Äôt special, just a bigger version of the iPhone app. Integration with my bank (First Bank Colorado) is delayed quite often.

Still 5 stars.
title: Learning curve but worth it

developerResponse: {'id': 44376422, 'body': "Thanks for continuing to give YNAB a try and for leaving us this insightful review! I've passed all of your feedback along to our design team‚Äîthey love hearing from users. If you're still up for it, you can write into our support team at help@ynab.com, as they'll have some advice on how to manage YNAB with a bi-weekly paycheck (we all get bi-weekly paychecks too, so we get it!).", 'modified': '2024-06-04T20:44:19Z'}
review:
YNAB is great if you get paid twice a month or monthly but for me getting paid biweekly causes my pay periods to overlap months and it makes it more difficult to see where my money needs to go. Please give us an update with the ability to choose pay period lengths. 

I‚Äôd also like the ability to plan ahead. If I don‚Äôt plan where my money needs to go, I overspend. I‚Äôve tried YNAB several different times.
title: Want to love

developerResponse: {'id': 42719548, 'body': "Thanks for being a longtime YNABer! I love that YNAB has helped you so much over the years. Here's to many more! üôåüèª \\- Natalie @ YNAB", 'modified': '2024-03-20T21:43:38Z'}
review: I‚Äôve been using YNAB for many years! Even before they had this app! We used it on our desktop before. I love it. It has helped us to stay on budget, live within our means/stay out of debt, and save for things. It is a habit to stick with a budget, but it is worth it! And YNAB makes it so easy to do.
title: Long Time User

developerResponse: {'id': 36932020, 'body': 'What a great way to put it. We totally agree that following the plan you make for your money will help you succeed when it comes to your finances! üôåüèª \\- Natalie @ YNAB', 'modified': '2023-06-05T12:40:24Z'}
review: YNAB is a personal trainer. Be ready to learn and work hard. It‚Äôs worth it though because you develop the financial organization and self control snd intentionality to make realistic goals, keep track of them, and succeed. It feels good to actually adhere to your budget like 9 or 10 months out of the year.
title: It‚Äôs dope but you gotta put in the work

developerResponse: {'id': 40520348, 'body': "Hi there! I'm glad to hear that YNAB's budgeting style is a good fit for you, and appreciate your feedback about mobile reporting. I'll be sure to pass that along. üòä \\- Aubrey @ YNAB", 'modified': '2023-12-05T16:18:39Z'}
review:
Why a mixed bag? Well for me accounting for every dollar is the only way. Give it a little and you will see their way and that this budgeting style helps you get control. 

On the flip side while the mobile app is great for logging it is SEVERELY lacking for mobile reporting. They really need to at least somewhat catchup with other programs and add additional mobile reporting. As someone who only uses a phone the lack of reporting stinks.
title: Mixed Bag

developerResponse: {'id': 35914863, 'body': "Hey Megan! Thanks for taking the time to submit this review! We have so many great resources to help you get the hang of YNAB! Otherwise check out the Learn tab at www.ynab.com for other resources.\n\nI'm glad you're already starting to see the magic! Keep up the great work! -Kat @ YNAB", 'modified': '2023-04-12T13:06:04Z'}
review:
This is a spectacular app, but it still seems quite technology-advanced and fickle as well and I somehow might need to get trained on how to work with that since I‚Äôm not very tech-savvy. But I‚Äôm definitely still seeing some magic happening and hope to continue to see some more! üòçü•∞ 
Sent from my iPhone
title: My Review

review: I started using YNAB when I first moved out on my own and it‚Äôs the only thing that has managed to keep both my spending and my saving on track for the past 4 years of adulthood. The app is simple to use with both mobile and desktop versions that are intuitive.
title: Life Changing

developerResponse: {'id': 34865529, 'body': "Thanks for your review! If you have an overspent category in your budget in cash, that amount will be deducted from what's available in the new month ‚Äî and your category is reset so you can move on with your life *while* trusting the new month's budget. Check this out for more: https://support.youneedabudget.com/en_us/when-the-month-rolls-over-a-guide-rkyyd6qC9#\n\nWe're at help@ynab.com and glad to work through any Qs you have about the app! - Natalie @ YNAB", 'modified': '2023-02-14T15:49:32Z'}
review:
For an app that costs $100, it should at least carry your negative balances from month to month. That spending doesn‚Äôt just disappear when the month changes and the money needs to be accounted for eventually. 

Other than the negative balances issue, this is a handy app that helps with budgeting and spending. There‚Äôs a steep learning curve, but once you figure it out, it‚Äôs easy to use.
title: Not worth the cost

review: I‚Äôve used a few budgeting apps, and this is by far the best if you are willing to play by its rules. You must be willing to be disciplined and repetitive to make this work, but that‚Äôs the whole point of budgeting! Take your time, learn the app, learn the YNAB philosophy, and you will get control of your money, without a doubt.
title: Best budgeting app by far

review: The best budgeting app... by FAR. Not only do you control everything but they have real live people doing the trainings that sign up for as part of the annual fee... which is far less than most! I have taken some of the classes multiple times... they are so helpful and want you to be successful budgeting!! Love this app!!
title: Great Value

review:
Latest update introduced (and forces) a new color palette. Credit card balances were previously red, but they no longer stand out because they are now the same white text as the zero balance text.

Additionally, if Night Shift turned on, the app has a very ugly, saturated look because the green color is now more neutral than it was previously.

I can't think of a reason why YNAB designers went with this decision. If this was a user research based decision, please share the findings. I have not used YNAB mobile ever since the palette was updated/forced.
title: PLEASE ALLOW RED COLOR AGAIN

review: This app, accompanied by the YNAB method, has changed our lives. I was originally reluctant to pay the annual fee (small though it be) for software that competitors offer for free, but it has paid for itself many times over. I particularly like how it is so easy to use along with a partner. Our finances have gone from confusingly murky to crystal clear. Thank you, Jesse Mecham and team.
title: Game changer

review: This app has totally transformed my financial life! I was able to pay off a ton of debt and now have enough in savings to cover two months of living expenses for my family. I would HIGHLY recommend this app to everyone who‚Äôs been procrastinating on starting to budget. Start the free trial today and watch how easy it is to get your finances in order!
title: Game Changer!!

review: I only wish I had started using YNAB sooner. I had hit a wall with how we were budgeting, because it wasn‚Äôt working. Now instead of months feeling too long and paychecks too short, we make it through the month with ease and money leftover. Win-win. The app is so easy to use and I actually look forward to budgeting each month!
title: Game-changer

review: I love YNAB, but I find myself annoyed by the app‚Äôs limitations. It gets the job done, but I can‚Äôt collapse categories (scrolling for eternity through more info than I need) or reconcile accounts in-app. Those features would be super handy to have! The following limitation applies to the app and web, but it would be amazing to be able to see balances in hidden categories without having to unhide them.
title: Feature Enhancements Please!

review: I have been using YNAB for 10+ years now, and love it. It is great for creating a budget and giving every dollar a job. I have tested out many other budgeting apps over the years ( Mint, Personal Capital, Every Dollar) and, while they have their strengths, YNAB has the best combination of expense tracking with regular, zero-based budgeting.
title: Great app and system

review: I tried a few of the free budgeting apps, but none worked well for me.  YNAB is definitely a cut above.  It does take a little getting used to, and you have to accept and adopt the YNAB approach.  But once you get over the initial learning curve, you‚Äôll find it works extremely well.  The best thing about it is the responsive on-line help.  Get stuck?  Someone will fix you up pronto!
title: Drink the kool aid!

developerResponse: {'id': 46523109, 'body': "Yay! We're so glad that you're loving YNAB and that it's made such a big difference for you. When you love the way you spend, it changes everything. We're here if you ever need anything, Sarah. Happy YNABing! -Blair@YNAB", 'modified': '2024-09-05T17:58:58Z'}
review: I cannot say enough good things about ynab. There‚Äôs a learning curve, but once I figured it out, it completely changed the way I manage my money. Im able to get ahead and make progress, while simultaneously able to spend on the things that I value. It‚Äôs worth the subscription cost.
title: YNAB for the win!

developerResponse: {'id': 4255677, 'body': "Hi Booboofoo2 - Thank you for the feedback - I've passed it along to our team.  I did want to address one point quickly: you need to account for all money spent on your credit card when you spend it so that you are always spending money you have available. Many YNAB users pay the statement balance in full, but allow the credit card payment category balance to roll over each money so that purchases made this month but on the next month's statement are already covered! \n\nWe can also help you out with those splits or business expenses if you'd like - just send us a quick message to help@youneedabudget.com.", 'modified': '2018-07-16T13:49:25Z'}
review: This app is not easy to get started on ‚Äî there are not clear directions for setting it up or how to use any/all of the features.  It‚Äôs also not helpful if you want to pay down your credit card balance each month in full, but don‚Äôt want to account for money beyond that month‚Äôs statement.  It‚Äôs also not helpful if you have a bunch of business expenses or split costs with others because you can‚Äôt account for the income that will pay for those expenses.  It‚Äôs also way too expensive.
title: Confusing

developerResponse: {'id': 41907254, 'body': "Thank you so much for leaving a review. It's great that YNAB has helped you so much! \\- Natalie @ YNAB", 'modified': '2024-02-12T19:57:00Z'}
review: I love this app and the flexibility within the software to do what you want. I also like that it works in multiple currencies since I work internationally. I like being able to manage every single line item and stay on top of goals and spending. I highly recommend.
title: Great app for the meticulous
