review: I love this system.  Flexible enough to assuage my guilt, yet clear enough to help me reign in my spending.  Mobile app is very handy for checking budget and adding transactions on-the-go, although some in-depth actions must be done on the desktop or tablet app.  I‚Äôve tried Mint and building my own spreadsheets and YNAB blows both those systems out of the water.
title: How did I make it this far without YNAB?

review: Keeps everyday life simple. Set your goals, priorities, ONLY budget money you HAVE NOW. Always budget From Your CATEGORIES ( you know, the amt. you put there that you‚Äôll need for your bills, goals)Never budget from your bank balance. Learn to live with what you have. Amazing to see the progress! And if you screw up and don‚Äôt do YNAB... we‚Äôll, you can‚Äôt fix stupid!üòã Best!
title: Works for Old People, Too!ü§£

review: YNAB is incredible. it can be a little confusing at first, it took me a week or two to really understand how to use it. but when you do it‚Äôs crazy how easy it makes budgeting for everything in your life. I feel like all my money is working for me, and I always know where I‚Äôm standing financially.
title: Greatest budgeting app

review: Yes, there‚Äôs a yearly fee, but you get what you pay for and this app has paid for itself many times over. It has completely transformed how we approach spending and most importantly had engaged both my husband and me in the budgeting process so we‚Äôre always on the same page. Thank you YNAB
title: Transformative

review: I love this app. It helps me stay on track and stay focused on my goals while still enjoying trips and vacations. Budgeting is so important it should be taught in schools. The app is very useful but takes a while getting used to it because there are so many features. Definitely recommend doing the trial period at least and get a feel for it.
title: Great!

review: Great interface and notifications that won‚Äôt go away until you fix a problem.  Won‚Äôt let you project where you are going to be in months to come,  but that didn‚Äôt work for me anyway.  The goal is to not spend what you don‚Äôt have and it does a good job of helping you stay on track!
title: Keeps you accountable

review:
I really love this budget app. It‚Äôs easy to use, it‚Äôs intuitive, and it has so many features that a budget needs. 

I would suggest two tweaks: 
1. The ability to hide or delete temporary budget categories (such as saving for a special event) without losing the history of that category forever.

2. Somehow make it more forgiving to change the amount of a budget category. I often find that when I am on my phone, it is too easy to accidentally make my change to the wrong line, and there‚Äôs no undo button. Once you start typing, it‚Äôs hard to se the line you are working on.

Otherwise I commend this app, and recommend it all the tine.
title: Love this app

review: When the new YNAB came out, I was disappointed. But I decided to give it another try since it has been out for a while and I got to say the features make it a lot easier to manage my debt and less confusing in other areas. Something I highly recommend everyone try at least for 34 days. Do what works for you but YNAB may help.
title: YNAB4 user

review:
I tell so many people about this app. Helped me get out of my car loan and student loans. 

This new version is a game changer because you can do everything from your iOS device and not rely on the computer. 

The notifications and import feature on iOS keeps me WAY more engaged and on top of where my budget stands. That means I‚Äôm actually making spending decisions based on how much i have in each category and rolling with the punches as unexpected stuff happens and I need to rearrange money (easily!) from other categories. 

FEATURE REQUEST: in iOS 11, it‚Äôd be SO COOL to be able to add a new transaction via Siri!!! All the other apps are adding Siri integration... just sayin‚Äô! üòá
title: Life changer!

review: This is the only tool that has been crucial for me/my family to have control in where my paycheck goes every month. It ensures that each cent is set aside intentionally and with a purpose. Even ‚Äúsurprise‚Äù expenses aren‚Äôt that scary anymore. I have suggested this app to every friend and will be using it for life. GET THIS APP!!
title: A Must Have Financial Tool

developerResponse: {'id': 41580668, 'body': "It sounds like you've got a manual system of budgeting in place that works well for you. Though YNAB isn't what you were looking for right now, we appreciate you giving it a try! \\- Aubrey @ YNAB", 'modified': '2024-01-28T18:59:49Z'}
review:
This ap is extremely frustrating and complicated. I cannot easily edit payments and targets, it will not pull all of my account info, it takes too long to update, it is overpriced and I can do a far better job just budgeting with a calculator and a written out budget. 

Budgeting is simple. Money comes in and goes out. I write out my budget on a simple word doc for next month and on any given day I know exactly how much I will have.

At the end of the month, I write my surplus and if I overspend, that surplus gets corrected. This simple act of seeing my surplus money disappear when I overspend is all I need to stay on task.

I dont need a fancy ap to do this and overcomplicate my life. Why did I spend 3 hours of my life setting this ap up and learning how to use it when it wont repay this time by making my life easier?
title: Overly complex and expensive

developerResponse: {'id': 31574280, 'body': "Ahh, thanks so much for the great review, CKDexter! I'm so glad that you've been able to achieve that higher level. It sounds like you've really been rocking it! ü§ò~Renae@YNAB", 'modified': '2022-08-21T12:06:46Z'}
review: We picked YNAB after trying 3 other apps. It is by far the most practical, intuitive, shortest learning curve, of all 4 apps. And to use the interface, is to learn a higher level of budgeting than we thought possible. Using it taught us budgeting at a higher level than we knew existed.

review: App is very easy to use. The philosophy of YNAB will change the way you budget and manage your money. Even if you have been budgeting for years, this program will make a difference. The podcast, book, emails, videos  and customer support are all very helpful and informative. Highly recommend!!
title: YNAB

review: I was massively disappointed since it was highly rated as the best paid app for personal budgeting. It has a terrible UI. I frequently got stuck in a ‚Äúyou have to do X‚Äù loop when I just wanted to look around. Hard to find my account and profile settings. After I linked a financial account, I started getting suspicious two-factor authentication pings randomly like someone was trying to hack that account. I watched the first video and thought I‚Äôd like it, but once I tried to use I hate it with the fire of a thousand burning suns.
title: Impenetrable UI

review: The target users for this budgeting app seems to be 20 and 30 year olds. I am 60 something and find it very useful to keep track of saving for future expenses as well as allowing me to manage monthly expenses. Since I pay for everything with a credit card, the app keeps me honest and debt free.
title: YNAB is for seniors too

review: Mixed opinions on many of the changes with the 3.0 update, but by far the largest problem is now every button press has a delay...I‚Äôm a nerd so used to love updating transactions in the app, but now I dread it. This is still the best budgeting app by a mile, but we need another update to fix the delay/lag!
title: 3.0 update is painfully laggy, but still love YNAB!

review: This app used to be so reliable and simple but with the new design offering automatic account downloads has made the program cumbersome, buggy and frustrating when it comes to understanding your real balance and where your money goes. I have had to reset my budget multiple times in the last year and no longer can justify the cost of YNAB. Going back to an old fashioned spreadsheet to manage my finances.
title: App no longer maintained and very buggy.

review: YNAB has completely changed my financial situation. Not only is the budgeting program and app sleek, easy to use, and visually appealing, their website and blog has tons of helpful videos, trainings, posts, lists, etc. ANY financial goal you have - YNAB will get you there. My husband and I are well on our way to paying off our student loan debt - and all our other debt too!
title: Life-Saver

review: Although the learning curve is steep, YNAB is certainly worth the investment. It has changed my financial life - no longer living paycheck to paycheck, and I feel in complete control and awareness of all my expenses. The app, both iPhone and web, are also expertly made - very intuitive to use and well designed.
title: YNAB will change your life

review: It‚Äôs not an intuitive way to budget and we had to watch several videos online but it has saved us so much money at this point I couldn‚Äôt see us going without it. It is worth the money but would recommend starting when you have some time to dedicate to it. Thanks YNAB!
title: Not easy at first... but it works, it really does

review: It is a great product with good functionality and a very helpful support staff. I have contacted ynab support a few times now via both email and in app chat. On each instance the representatives were thoughtful and helpful. They both answered my questions and directed me to additional resources on the subject. All told I am quite pleased with the product.
title: Good product by a great team

review: My wife and I have been users of YNAB for over 5 years now. It‚Äôs eliminated a lot of the uncertainty and issues that comes with dealing with money as a couple. It is the envelope system for the digital age. Love the new reflect tab on the app and looking forward to further enhancements to that tab!

After I set that up, I stopped manually entering purchases and it did not automatically track them, which is half the point of this app. I love the idea of giving every dollar a job, and really the whole YNAB philosophy, it‚Äôs just worth paying for a subscription if I have to manually enter data anyway
title: I really like the idea

review: Seriously NEEDS a due date column on the budget, because writing the due date next to the subcategories makes my budget hard to read. It would also be nice if the due date column allowed for a filter than listed subcategories by due date for quick budgeting. Not everyone pays the full amount of bills and bill amounts change monthly for items like electric so it‚Äôd be handy to have this column.
title: It‚Äôs great but...

review: I had used various budgeting tools over the years, including making my own spreadsheets, but they were all very labor intensive, time consuming and not reliable as they didn‚Äôt sync with my accounts. YNAB solved all those problems and allows me to manage my money to meet my financial goals.
title: Great Budgeting Tool

review: The app is not a replacement for the desktop experience. It does, however, help me keep up with categorization and updating my budget in a couple minutes every day, so I only need to log in to desktop a couple times a month.
title: I‚Äôve been a user for 9 years

review: The app works great for me, never crashed and it‚Äôs always up to date with the activity on the web version. I wish it was easier to edit the categories but they are aware that that experience is better in the web app.
title: The app is great, but the method has changed my life

review:
I‚Äôve used YNAB very happily for years. I didn‚Äôt even mind the price hike much as I easily got that much value (although I think you fumbled the messaging big time). Suddenly though, the app sync to PC is unreliable?!

I generally use the software on my PC but I travel often so count on the app to keep me on track. Now the two don‚Äôt match and I can‚Äôt seem to resolve it. THAT is not worth almost $100 bucks a year.

Should you risk it? Probably not. There are other alternatives that just like YNAB, if you invest the time to get it set up and commit to using it will do the trick without all the trickiness.

title: The Backbone of my Finances

review: YNAB user for over a year now. I love it.  It keeps me organized and has helped me plan better and use my money more wisely. title: Great app

review:
this app has the ability to change the course of your life. if you find it challenging, keep learning. if your budget gets confusing, start another one. if your budget is too tight, keep adjusting.

don't give up on this app. it's too good, and has done so much for my financial security.

all love for YNAB.
title: the best.

review: YNAB has been a big help in finally getting control over my debt. I‚Äôve been using it for almost 4 years and paid off student loans, credit cards and car loans much faster than I thought possible. Hope to be debt free before I retire in a few years.

title: Completely changed my financial life

title: Life changing

review: Makes budgeting a game. Seriously. review: I got this free trial, planning to keep it. But I lost my job and needed to save, and it was easy to cancel. title: They DO care about your budget

review:
This app is completely changing the way I use my earnings and has completely remapped the way I process my finances.

YNAB is a simple tool that does something incredibly well, and I wish more apps did the same in other areas of my life.
title: It‚Äôs early on, but...

review:

Reflect has been essential. I get to see where my money has been going and has allowed me to make strategic decisions! For example, maybe I‚Äôm spending too much in clothes, I could cut costs there and reallocate that money to a travel budget! It‚Äôs amazing.

Thank you YNAB!

review:

title: Nope

review: I downloaded this app based on all of the great reviews and painstakingly entered all of my monthly expenses and linked my accounts.  My linked accounts synced once and never synced again.  I‚Äôve deleted and reinstalled, waited over 48 hours as recommended by the app, and nothing has ever updated.  Not even the most important one, which is my account balance so that I can actually allocate expenses.  To me, this is a waste of an app.  I could manage in excel instead and would have the exact same features: none.
title: Doesn‚Äôt work?

review: YNAB has changed the way my husband and I look at and prioritize our money! Obviously the real work is done in learning and applying the 4 rules which doesn‚Äôt require the app, but I love have them YNAB team has built the app to make it easier for you. Their continued innovation is also so refreshing!
title: Life-changing

review: I‚Äôve tried many apps and systems over the years and YNAB has won me for the long hall. I have been using YNAB for about 4 years. It takes all the stress off spending. I know where I am with every category ALL the time. Budgets are only as good as the tracking system in place.
title: Best budget planning/tracking!

review: This is a true budgeting app to me rather than forecasting. There is a bit of a learning curve with some things, but overall it is fairly intuitive. There are minor things that  come up occasionally that I would change, but it is possible I have more to learn about the app.
title: Great budgeting app!

review: Very good and easy to use. Would be 5 stars if every few weeks there wasn‚Äôt a ‚ÄúDirect Connect Unavailable‚Äù message and I have to wait a week to get caught up on my transactions. I do a lot better budgeting if I can update my register daily. Waiting several days throws everything off and Im back to where I was overspending and not budgeting well.
title: Pretty Good!

review: For two years I‚Äôve been using YNAB and have completely changed the way I view money. I love the methodologies they teach and the tool they‚Äôve built to create lasting habits I use on an everyday basis. As a Behavioral Product Manager, I can truly say that YNAB is doing good, by making people better with their money.
title: The app that made me rich

review: I have used YNAB for several years and this latest update is a mess. I have tried to create new budgets and it just keeps messing up. I sang praises about YNAB to everyone but now, the only way I would even be able to use YNAB is if I don‚Äôt like my accounts.
title: Was soooooo much better before the latest updates

review: YNAB is no joke! We started this month with $400 in the bank and will end it with $2400 AND 4 debts paid off thanks to this app and the support! The free training courses on zoom are live courses with responses to your questions from a real person. If you‚Äôre serious about helping yourself financially, this app will pay for itself within 1 month.
title: Love this app!!

review: Been using YNAB for almost two years.  Has been an absolute game changer for us.  We‚Äôre now debt free and one month ahead on our monthly expenses.   It‚Äôs helped us better understand where our money went so we can now be more intentional on telling our money where to go!  Best personal finance system I‚Äôve used!
title: Best personal finance system I‚Äôve used!

review: We have been using this app since February, along with the debt snowball pay off method, and we have been able to pay off $25k in that time where before we were always living paycheck to paycheck. This program lets you see where you are spending your money and helps us make better financial decisions!
title: $25k debt gone

review: I used YNAB for years and they switched to a different platform for bank account syncing.  It has not worked for me since and I don‚Äôt have time to chase down their issues.  Good product but bad move.  I had to switch back to Quicken.  Good luck!
title: Used for years and had to leave

review: The YNAB method is the real win, but the app is seamless and does exactly what I expect as far as transaction entry, prediction of categories, a couple of key reports. Moving money can be a minor inconvenience or take an extra minute to figure out moving money between categories. I use the app consistently, my partner and I both do.
title: Best way to manage money thus far, aesthetically pleasing app!

review: I swore I would never give up the old YNAB(v4) for this version, but I‚Äôm glad I gave it a shot. I can manage almost all of my budget from my phone. The most helpful feature are the badges that let me know I have txs to classify. That alone keeps me engaged with my budget daily.
title: Manage your budget from your phone

review: I‚Äôm a huge Dave Ramsey fan.  But could not get a different DR budget app to work the way I needed it. YNAB budgets what you have today in your account, it‚Äôs so robust yet simple once you know the basics.  I LOVE LOVE that I can budget in the next month, make notes, set goals.  Awesome! And the mobile app is amazing- bringing all the simplicity yet comprehensive functionality of desktop YNAB to mobile.
title: YNAB exceeds all expectations

review:
Works great!  The most recent update is a major improvement although the old version was great too.  This version added ability to download transactions.  Well done devs!
I cant live without this app. It is simple but at the same time very powerful. Not loaded with features and bloatware like other financial apps (quicken).
title: Best budgeting app hands down!

review: Giving every dollar a job is the best way to budget in my opinion. When the money comes in, you tell it where to go! I love the updated app and I use YNAB on the computer also. Helps get us more focused on what we spend our money on (ie we eat out way too much!) The YNAB system takes a bit to get used to, but once I watched a few videos I got the hang of it.
title: A must for those who budget

review: This app is the best you will find. I teach budgeting to college students and have used this app daily for over 5 yrs and have found this to be the go-to budget tool if you really want to get control of your budget. Thank you YNAB for being awesome! Please do not sell out ever!
title: Only budgeting app and worth every dollar

title: Life Changing

developerResponse: {'id': 32213874, 'body': "Thanks for the great review, Dan! I'm so glad to hear that you've gotten out of credit card debt! I know you worked hard to achieve that‚Äîgreat job! üéá ~Renae@YNAB.com", 'modified': '2022-09-25T11:10:47Z'}
review: Sure it costs ~$100 a year, but it has saved me thousands upon thousands and helped me get out of credit card debt. It‚Äôs not some magic button, but it helps me realize where I‚Äôm spending my money and we‚Äôre it should actually go. I recommend YNAB to everyone

Yes, I can manually put in purchases but that kinda defeats the purpose of the app. I paid for a year subscription. Unfortunately, I will be canceling. title: Wish I could rate it higher

review: I was really looking forward to using a more convenient YNAB, I have used their original client for years, but they don‚Äôt support my bank anymore, so I can‚Äôt justify the subscription if I‚Äôm doing the same old thing as I was with the original by manually typing in. title: No Bank Support

review:
For starters, 
This app is awesome and I actually prefer to use the website version.  I will use the app to enter transactions as they come up.  However, I‚Äôm not sure why but there seems to be constant problems with transactions and budget balances not working in sync. And this can be a major problem if you‚Äôre working diligently with your budget.  

I recommend NOT linking your budget with any of your accounts. What you should do is ‚ÄúAdd Account‚Äù and select the unlinked option.  Then manually enter in your balances for all.

Maybe that will work maybe not.  But for now I have to give it 3 stars for the constant headaches this software is causing.  But also appreciate how convenient it is to use.
title: It‚Äôs good, BUT...Don‚Äôt Link Your Accounts and I‚Äôll explain why

review: For at least a year before we started using this app, all our friends told us to do it... and they were right. 7 months after starting we financed a wedding and a graduate degree with remarkably low stress and are now ONE TEAM working together harmoniously in pursuit of a whole rainbow of amazing future life goals. title: Grateful beyond words

review: YNAB is in a class by itself. Traditional budgeting software tells you where you‚Äôve been and what you hope will happen. YNAB is a ‚Äúreality‚Äù tool that helps you make smart decisions with the money you actually have in the bank today. I wasted decades keeping budgets that never really changed the outcome.
title: Best budgeting tool

review: I can‚Äôt figure out how to get something to be put into the credit card category as a transaction and I hate having something just sit there asking me to add a category when I can‚Äôt.  Very annoying.  It doesn‚Äôt factor in interest for credit debt either so the guesstimate it gives you is wrong. Besides that, it won‚Äôt stay hooked up to my account. I‚Äôd suggest to Make the app easier to search for the category so I can properly use this template more often and on the go.

review: I‚Äôve tried several budget applications, and YNAB is the only app that allows me to ‚Äúsee‚Äù exactly where my money needs to go and where I need to save for future expenses. title: I LOVE this app!

review:

review:

title: Life-changing and 100% worth the cost

review:
When you wanna make a Budget you do it theoretically and then you work on it and use it when you received the money that you have budgeted. review: YNAB makes budgeting a game, not a chore.  Their UI is fast, intuitive, and looks great.  Account syncing works well with all major credit cards and banks. For example, with credit cards a balance column would be beneficial for me so I can enter what the balance is and what my budget is for that particular card. The same could work for people that are trying to pay off debt. They could add the total amount due for the bill, the budgeted amount, and as they make payments, the balance column would adjust.

review:
I‚Äôve been an annual subscriber for two years. It‚Äôs a helpful app. But YNAB has raised their prices more than roughly 10% each year without offering anything new. It‚Äôs getting out of hand. I‚Äôve cancelled my subscription, and I‚Äôm going to let it expire. 

With the closure of the free Mint app alternative, these price increases are just going to continue. I recommend you try a different money management app. Don‚Äôt let YNAB take advantage of you.

review: I have been using this app since 2020 and I‚Äôve been able to pay credit card debts, budget for trips, start an emergency fund, put away in my savings to invest!! Can‚Äôt recommend it enough! I‚Äôve shared with many friends and family!

After doing the live workshops (a must!) and learning how YNAB wants you to think about budgeting, I started to see my finances in a whole new light ‚Äî or to put it more accurately, YNAB was the light at the end of a long dark tunnel! 

Now my money is ‚Äúaging‚Äù nicely, I‚Äôve got my financial priorities in order and I‚Äôm on the verge of leaving that tunnel in the dust. 

Thanks, YNAB for creating a great system and a perfect app to give me control over my money for the very first time. ‚ù§Ô∏è
title: YNAB changed my life!

Apart from whatsapp, app music, email and Netflix I use this app daily. All of us have nice to have apps and must have apps. YNAB is for me a must have app for everyone.

title: Can change your life, not an exaggeration

title: Great app and budgeting method

review: It‚Äôs completely changing the way I think about my money (for the better). Good thing is Jesse and team regularly help you get over the learning ‚Äúspeed bumps‚Äù in a very down to earth and easy way. I don‚Äôt say this casually. This (app and methodology) WILL change your life.

title: Great for realizing spending trends

review: This app is the backbone of my financial strategy. It has made me more aware and in control of my finances than any other app I‚Äôve used, and I‚Äôve tried all the other big players. It helped me shift from living off my credit cards every month to get rid of the credit card debt and live within a real budget. Get it.
title: Get it

review: As a former boss of mine said, Money is like people; it has to be somewhere. You decide where your money has to be‚Äîwhat job it has to do‚Äîwith YNAB. So instead of building an elaborate budget with a hoped-for ‚ÄúSurplus‚Äù at the bottom, you take greater control in advance. The process is effective, even fun. You can make adjustment and react to the unexpected easily.
title: Life-changing and fun

review: Let me start by saying that managing my money is my worst nightmare. I just hate it. YNAB is not just an app, it‚Äôs a philosophy and a system. While YNAB hasn‚Äôt yet cured me of my terrible habits, it‚Äôs gotten me through very tight situations. Plus the customer service is fantastic, the app keeps getting better and better, and the whole thing is done with a sense of humor. Love it.
title: Great app, great service

review: I‚Äôve attempted budgeting for years using apps that look back, the YNAB design of looking ahead and planning my spending based on what I have and want to save is a break through. Phone App is 100% useful, not like others. Love it, highly recommend.
title: Where have you been all my life!

review: I started using this app back in January and really like it. The free one year subscription for students has allowed me to give it a shot without breaking the bank. The free training webinars they offer were helpful and I‚Äôm using it for long term savings goals and loan repayment plans.

review: This is the best budgeting tool out there.  It leaves Mint and other account aggregators in the dust.  If you want to truly understand your inflows and outflows,  where it‚Äôs happening, what savings your building, etc. I recommend this app.   It‚Äôs been a great tool to bring mine and my husbands financial pictures together.
title: Best Budgeting tool

review: I‚Äôve tried many budgeting tools, and YNAB is the best budgeting tool ever! It‚Äôs very smart about how to deal with rolling over from past months and allocating ahead to next month. It‚Äôs great to always know the money is allocated where it‚Äôs needed in advance. The subscription is very reasonable ‚Äî you NEED a budget! Just get it!
title: Best budgeting ever!

review: I miss having the ability to select multiple lines and see their total. This was a part of my prior to my next paycheck routine to see if I‚Äôll have enough in a coming paycheck to cover that part of the month‚Äôs bills.
title: Bring back a feature

review: YNAB will deliver financial awareness, organization, and enthusiasm. The mantra ‚Äúgiver every dollar a job‚Äù is possible with YNAB. My mindset and engagement is totally different and better. No more guilt in spending, confidence in cash flow, and control of goals. It may take you a few weeks to become familiar with how the ‚Äúpiping‚Äù works, but will change your financial life.
title: YNAB is Awesome!

review: This is not a simple app, but it is extremely powerful. To understand how to use it you should watch the YNAB video tutorials, but if you do you‚Äôll be able to control your financial life in no time. So much stress disappeared from my life once I was confidently using YNAB to control and track my spending.
title: Life changing, if you put in the work

review: Been using YNAB off and on, but have stuck to it in the past year. Has helped me keep track of my money and plan for purchases instead of buying with credit. Only gripe I really have with the app, it has missing features that the website has. One thing that comes to mind is that you can‚Äôt reconcile, which idk why that is missing.
title: Helped my money

review: For a pricey subscription, the service is pretty good but the mobile app is pretty lacking. You cannot get a complete experience using the app on iPhone or iPad. There are only two‚Äîmostly useless-reports. If you want to see any of the rest, you have to go to the website. If you try to load the website on your mobile device, it launches the app. So you HAVE to use a desktop.
title: Incomplete Experience on Mobile

review: We started on Dave Ramsey baby steps and the budgeting part was onerous. YNAB gives you great visibility to upcoming bills and lets you incrementally track your improvement. Seeing that you have enough money to cover all your bills reduces stress. It also forces you to defer wants until needs are covered. Best $83 I ever spent.
title: Makes it all doable

review: I never leave reviews but this app is more than I expected. The entire idea behind this app/company is amazing. I have only had it for 2 months but it really helped me get things under control and I‚Äôve already figured out how to pay off $1500 in credit card debt! I wish I had found out sooner!
title: Amazing

review:
I‚Äôve just started using YNAB seriously for about 2 months, during this I paid my bills without stress and have budgeted money for food, cosmetics, etc. I‚Äôve always struggle with managing budget at the end of the month but not anymore. I also have more in saving than I ever did.

Just try it you won‚Äôt regret it.
title: It changed my life

review: Simple! Practical! Liberating! I got into YNAB about 5 months ago after finding some YNAB articles online that appealed to me. I love the simple and practical approach to budgeting which lines up with your life goals and values. I‚Äôve already saved so much and am due to pay down my enormous student loan debt (Med school...) YEARS earlier than I ever dreamed! You won‚Äôt regret using the YNAB method.
title: Liberating!

review: Doesn‚Äôt update to your linked accounts in real time so it makes it very confusing when trying to budget in real time. Also, the way they handle credit card accounts is absolutely confusing. They don‚Äôt show as a debt (which it need to be paid back so it should, yes?) it shows as a positive and just messes everything up. It‚Äôs nice that it links to all of your accounts so ideally you have a gross amount of your money, but it doesn‚Äôt translate that easily.
title: Does not update in real time

review:
This is the best budgeting system I‚Äôve ever used. It is perfect for folks on a variable income and is excellent at helping me save. It paid for itself in the first week. Believe me when I tell you: you need a budget.

We had tried Mint, and other ‚Äúbudgeting‚Äù apps, but none of them actually had anything to do with truly controlling our finances, they merely tracked how bad we were at predicting the future(no surprises there). When YNAB came along, we discovered how effective we could be at controlling our expenses, and saving a lot of money.

review:

It gets completely messed up if paying a credit card from a bank account and randomly double counts items so untrustworthy. The whole crux is tracking transactions but the Connections that sync are constantly broken and they could not successfully bring in transactions more than a day before needing to be reauthorized. Recommend anything else.
title: Syncs don‚Äôt work and horrible

review: Been using YNAB for a while and it is hands down the best budgeting philosophy I‚Äôve used. I do hope they consider adding additional features and I do believe it‚Äôs due for a small domestic makeover, but overall, if you can afford it, best budgeting app in the AppStore.
title: Best Budgeting App & Philosophy

review: I have been using YNAB since the beginning of 2020 and I will never go back. I tried several budgeting apps (EveryDollar, Mint, several others whose names I don‚Äôt remember) and YNAB is FAR superior. Yes, it costs money but the savings I have incurred since the beginning of 2020 far outweigh the $80/year that YNAB charges. You need a budget! Let this app save your finances!
title: YNAB has CHANGED MY LIFE

review: This has honestly changed my life. I thought I was budgeting in the past but really didn‚Äôt know where my money was. This has changed how I approach money and spending. Now I think before I spend. Since using this app for 6 months my debts have been reduced more than any other point in my life.
title: Life changing

review: I‚Äôve been using YNAB for over 10 years and can‚Äôt imagine getting by without it. Knowledge is power and YNAB makes it easy to know exactly where your money is and what it‚Äôs being used for.
title: Can‚Äôt manage without it!

review: This is such a lovely financial philosophy which is often overlooked by young ppl during their early ages. Once, I got onto this app I realized the value of spending less than you earn effectively and planning for it. This app has the potential to make you think about the long term and worth paying for!
title: One app worth paying for

review: I‚Äôve used an array of budgeting apps and services and so far YNAB is the most promising for me. I‚Äôm still learning the purpose of each feature (some are strange at first) but I trust that each one will prove its worth in time! Only complaint for now is that I cannot find the spending totals report that‚Äôs viewable on the web version, so in the app I can‚Äôt really get the full picture.
title: Robust but incomplete

review: ..on iPad Pro.  I decided to give a trial run. First obstacle was I can‚Äôt edit names of payees. And the categories are not to my liking. Now, I‚Äôll admit, these things could probably be edited but I live my life within the mouseless realm of iOS. There‚Äôs no clicking here.  If I needed to click or double click or right click, I can‚Äôt. And the layout and font was just too tiny to view comfortably. Sorry YNAB.  Sticking pad of lined ledger paper for now.
title: Tried for five minutes

review: Love being able to track every dollar I have and being able to set aside money for specific purposes. Helps me make sure I‚Äôm  saving for the most important things in my life. Much better than Mint but definitely more hands on. Worth the price for a subscription.
title: Wonderful app. Changed my life.

review: This app(along with the desktop versions/subscription) is worth every penny (and it is not a lot of pennies).  It will change the way you manage and relate to money.  I have been using it for about 6 years and it has helped me accomplish many goals would have never expected to tackle.
title: Worth every penny

We're honored to have played a part. - Jill@YNAB", 'modified': '2023-04-06T18:24:17Z'}
review: My wife and I have used YNAB for many years. It has been life changing. It revolutionized our finances and has enabled us to live a lot of adventures on a slim budget. At this point I plan to use it till I die. Not many products in this world that I feel that strongly about.
title: Life changing

developerResponse: {'id': 1461092, 'body': "Hey WeAreTheDeckers! We're so glad to hear that YNAB as made a difference for you! Thanks for using YNAB and letting us know how it's going for you.", 'modified': '2017-10-10T09:30:32Z'}
review:
I love YNAB. 
They keep adding fantastic features. I've learned more about the practicalities of personal finance from YNAB than anywhere else.
I also find myself often terribly frustrated by the service. Their automatic transaction synchronizing keeps breaking. Every couple of days I have to reconnect my bank accounts. It really defeats the purpose that YNAB is aiming toward of keeping the budget up to date.
I'm hopeful that they will resolve the  issues.
title: Fantastic app, agonizing flaw

review:
If you‚Äôre looking for the best budget app, stop looking this is it. Worth every penny. 
The only downside is that is missing additional key reporting and recently they raised their prices. One more price hike I might consider trying something else.
title: YNAB‚Ä¶ the only app / subscription worth paying for

review: This app is helping me so much with getting out of credit card debt. It helps me always know and visualize how much money I really have to spend in any given moment. I also love that I can budget over time for non-monthly purchases like an oil change.
title: Lifesaver

review: I‚Äôve been using the YNAB app for a few years now and it‚Äôs awesome! I love knowing how much I have for each thing in life. My finances are so much simpler now that I don‚Äôt have to separate everything in different accounts. This app lets me organize everything wherever I am. I ‚ù§Ô∏èYNAB!!
title: Keeps me on track!

developerResponse: {'id': 30679574, 'body': "We've got a help doc that goes over uncleared versus cleared transactions on the mobile app if you'd like to check it out: https://docs.youneedabudget.com/article/1674-colors-icons-register-mobile. We'd also be glad to help with any questions you have - and get your feedback on the UI. Send us an email at help@ynab.com. -Becca @ YNAB", 'modified': '2022-07-02T18:37:22Z'}
review:
Why can I not see uncleared transactions on the app? I‚Äôm shown some nebulous uncleared balance with no way to verify or correct it. The app lags a couple of days behind my bank, fine, but if my bank has had 100% cleared transactions for 3+ days, my uncleared should be zero. 
Any investigation needs to be done through the web UI, as the app is stripped of functionality for anything other than allocating money to categories.
title: Frustratingly limited!

review: YNAB has upped my budgeting game and I‚Äôm never going back! Spend time reading blogs & watching videos to learn the 4 Rules and overall philosophy and then BAM, you are good to go. The app is quick and simple and makes manually entering transactions a breeze. Worth double what a paid‚Ä¶no joke.
title: Budgeting like a Pro Now!!

review: I have been using the envelop system of budgeting for over 30 years, which is very similar to zero-based budgeting. Did it first by hand, then used several programs as they matured over the years. YNAB is smooth and elegant.  Tech support is the BEST!  Can‚Äôt beat it for the price.
title: Excellent Budget Tool

review: We‚Äôve been using YNAB for over 5 years now and it‚Äôs revolutionized how we look at and make decisions with our money. Every penny to our name has a job, and there is soooooo much peace of mind that comes with knowing our expenses AND goals are being funded... and that we spend our money on what actually matters to us. Love it love it love it.
title: Best Budgeting App ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è

review: We have been using YNAB for a number of years and it‚Äôs really made a difference to more than just our finances. We have been able to manage big purchases and cross continent moves without having to worry about finances. We run 3 budgets in 3 different currencies.
title: There is no better way to control your life

review: YNAB is amazing and worth every penny. However the iPad app is a mirror image of the iPhone app on a larger screen. The extra screen space is not utilized at all and the worst part is there is no portrait mode, which is quite annoying since there is no reason for it. In fact I believe it could show more information in portrait.
title: Great but iPad app needs more functionality

review:
The app has good UX and it‚Äôs as complicated as budgeting is... BUT I‚Äôm 6 months in and have totally changed my spending behavior for the first time in my life. 

Don‚Äôt bother trying till you‚Äôre actually ready to do it, but when you‚Äôre ready this app will empower you to make real progress. 

Thank you YNAB!
title: The app won‚Äôt work without you

review: What a great, functional budgeting app! Not only does it categorize every dollar in your linked account, it tracks the ‚Äúage of your money,‚Äù which looks at how close you are to living paycheck to paycheck. After YEARS of living that way, I‚Äôm proud to say this app has helped me look at money differently & I am now able to flourish financially! YNAB rocks!!!
title: I love this app!!!

review: The software can take time to completely understand, but if you stick with it, it will click. I love it and can‚Äôt imagine ever being without it. I appreciate knowing where every penny is and the way credit cards work. The team is responsive and helpful when needed.
title: Life changing

review: This app has matured significantly over the past two years.  It compliments the desktop/cloud program beautifully.  I can download and approve transactions within the app to keep my budget up to date via my phone or iPad and manually add transactions as well.  It‚Äôs an excellent companion to the YNAB program.
title: Much Improved!

review:
It‚Äôs been only one month and money is saved, bills are paid on time and my husband no longer panics at certain times of the month. 

We don‚Äôt transfer savings to cover our checking anymore. I assume it‚Äôs more of us that he app but I can‚Äôt complain at how VISIBLE the app makes every penny. 

Even my savings account has a budget to allocate for summer camp and Xmas and the ever-elusive 3 month emergency funds. 

Basically it makes you face your realities. Like when your food budget is as high as your mortgage you need to learn couponing. That was a big shocker and required a whole new kind of budgeting.
title: How did I save $ already?

review: I have used YNAB for years and have always loved it. Recently, my husband and reached a particularly big financial milestone in our budget and the YNAB support team sent us a lovely gift - a money tree! So on brand for them and just another example of the excellent care they take of their customers.
title: The BEST.

Sometimes it wouldn‚Äôt show any activity when in fact there was activity recorded in one of the categories. The money on hand is definitely unique but the functionality is flawed in a lot of ways.
title: Frustrating

review: I love my wife of 27 years more than words, but YNAB has saved us from years of unnecessary arguing when it comes to how we spend, allocate and save financially.  YNAB has taken the hassle and frustration out of a common stressor.  Set, budget and forget.  Could not function without YNAB!  Thank you!!
title: Marriage Saver

review: This program makes it easier to enter spending AND to plan!  Get this program to lead you to not only plan for what you will spend in each category for the next month, but also reach the point to have your funds there a month ahead of time!
title: Budget Assistant

review: I‚Äôve been a long time user of this app and the methodology is great, but at least 3 times a year there is some kind of issue that throws off all my budgets causing me to over spend and think I have more money than I do.  Whether it‚Äôs uncleared transactions, transfers coming from/to the wrong accounts or accounts that just stop importing: It‚Äôs always hard to find the error and difficult to fix.
title: Fails silently

review: I‚Äôve tried most budgeting apps out there. This is by far my favorite. Once you understand YNAB‚Äôs approach to budgeting, it can drastically change the way you view your monthly finances no matter your income level. I suggest it to all my family and friends!
title: My favorite budgeting app!

review: This app is not only changing my perspective on budgeting, but my whole life! They say it‚Äôs a game changer once your money reaches 30 days old. Our money is 20 days old after three months and the difference is already unbelievable. The stress level is dropping daily! Thank you YNAB!!!!
title: Budget Has Never Been Better!

review: I often find myself thinking, "what on *earth* did I do before YNAB?" I lost potential with my money, that's what. This app and online service have quite literally transformed the way I think about money and cash flow. There are only a few services in my life that I regularly try to "convert" people to; YNAB is one of them.
title: Transformative

review:
Shortly after I paid over $80 for this, the app stopped syncing with my bank. I had to verify via text message every day to see my transactions. That was six months ago. Recently they updated to a new login provider. The experience is even worse now. I have to log in with my bank password, and then text message TWICE every session to get my transactions, of which most don‚Äôt even sync at all. Just ridiculous.

This app is now just a fancy spreadsheet. Worth maybe $1, not $80/year.
title: Worse and worse

review: Before YNAB steps and software, our family constantly faced checking account over drafts and debt issues. It took awhile but after several weeks of using YNAB, our age of money is 99 days and haven‚Äôt used over draft line of credit for years.
title: From over drafts to 90 days ahead

review: It‚Äôs really frustrating that there has been so many issues lately with direct import. I was lucky and grandfathered in under the old price since I‚Äôve been using YNAB since YNAB 3 - however for the current price they are charging and for as great as the software is, having the direct import function start failing is disappointing. Also it would be really nice if the app was able to reconcile.
title: Direct Import issues

review: I really just want a simple way to keep on top of my finances while on the go. I‚Äôm currently still using Mint, but I‚Äôve literally tried every other app out there.  YNAB is the closet thing to simple that I‚Äôve found with the least amount of glitches. I really wish there was a calendar feature to remind me when certain bills are due.
title: Coming back

review:
I just recently started using YNAB after previously using Quicken and Personal Capital. So far I am enjoying YNAB as I find the connections to my various accounts more reliable.

I also love how the app works in tandem well with the website portal. That being said, one of my most frequently used reports is the income v. expense report which is not available on the app. Without this report, I cannot give the app a higher score.
title: Need to add income v. expense report

review: YNAB takes some time to adjust to, but after several months, I‚Äôm finding it amazing. It interfaces easily with bank accounts and credit cards‚ÄîI‚Äôve had no problems. The zero-based budgeting model is excellent. The learning curve is worth it!
title: Excellent Budgeting App!

review: YNAB has helped me so much! It keeps me within budget and helps me prepare for the future. Their methodology really works. review: Multiple difficulties, with very little technical support and customer service help. They need to have tech-support that is not just over chat, but over the phone. It‚Äôs ridiculous how difficult it is to get answers to questions we have.

review: I can‚Äôt believe how much this app has helped me and my family manage our finances! I would highly recommend to anyone using YNAB. I love how easy it is to navigate through the app. I also use the web version as well, but having the app is a must!!
title: Stress reliever

review:
The upcoming large price increase is disappointing. Especially since there are obvious QOL improvement still missing from the reporting and mobile app. 
- need category spending reports accessible on mobile
- ability to track trends in category assignment and not spending
- mortgage tracking doesn‚Äôt allow for inclusion of the asset‚Äôs worth for net worth 
- auto import constantly breaks, and doesn‚Äôt update when pending charges become posted charges at different amount (ex: when you write in a tip on your CC)

I haven‚Äôt found a better alternative, but if I do there won‚Äôt be love lost with me and YNAB.
title: I like YNAB but

review: Last month YNAB stopped syncing transactions with my bank. This month, I get an email (WITHOUT a notification in the app) that the subscription pricing is going UP for vague reasons. The company is screwing its long time users for no reason other than ‚Äúto reflect the value we deliver‚Äù. It‚Äôs really a shame that this is how they treat their customers. I would recommend checking out other alternatives. People use budgeting apps to SAVE money. Not to get fleeced out of spending more of it.
title: Subscription Price Hike

review: Even without considering the whole point of the app, which is perfectly designed and serves the exact purpose it sets out to do, the customer service is unbelievable. This is one of my favorite companies out there
title: Worth every penny!

review:
I haven‚Äôt paid one overdraft fee since I started using YNAB.
I have saved a ton of money due to awareness.
I have weekly budget meetings with my husband now and we don‚Äôt ever argue over money.
My financial goals have clarity which caused other goals to get clarified. 
The content and support is unparalleled.
I don‚Äôt forecast any longer with presumed money. I only budget my reality. That‚Äôs a game-changer right there.
I don‚Äôt throw my hands in the air when my overly ambitious plan changes. I roll woth it now.
I want to be a part of this team because I love it so much.
title: This Causes Extreme Ownership Over Your Money!

review:
This is my favorite budget app. It shows me truly where my money is going by showing me every transaction I make and allowing me to categorize them. 

I‚Äôm now learning to budget effectively and I‚Äôm learning where I need to make cuts to improve my finances and help work towards my goal of building a savings account.
title: So helpful

review: This is one of the only apps that I can think of that has a measurably meaningful impact in quality of life. This isn‚Äôt about entertainment or passing the day, this is about getting your spending straightened out, which relieves stress and improves financial well being. I would give six stars if I could.
title: Useful in a meaningful way

review: I‚Äôve been using YNAB for a couple years now, and it‚Äôs one of the best decisions of my life. I‚Äôve been able to completely change my relationship with money and realize it‚Äôs a tool, like anything else. I‚Äôve been able to focus on the things I truly want and eliminate the other stuff.
title: This is one great app!!!

review: Normally I wouldn't recommend paying for a service like this when there are free alternatives, but YNAB is worth it. I was able to ditch all my spreadsheets and other applications and it reduced my stress around money (and more importantly my wife's) significantly. YNAB also embeds good philosophy around money into software, which is really cool. Highly recommended!
title: Lifesaver!

review: I use this app every day. Don‚Äôt want to live without it. YNAB is excellent software for budgeting and this app is better than a great complement to it. Let‚Äôs me budget on the fly so that I can keep track of progress toward my goals. Easy to use, intuitive, interfaces with my bank, essential!
title: Essential

review: This is hands down the best system/app for budgeting that‚Äôs out there. I‚Äôve used them all and have been using them since the Microsoft money days. Our first month to use the app we had already saved up enough for the next months bills. Do yourself a favor and use this app!
title: Best budgeting app!!

review: This is an amazing tool for the beginner with a minimal budget, all the way to the expert with 100+ categories. I really love how much you can break apart your budget and how much easier it is to analyze spending. Highly recommend.
title: It works SO well for all levels of users

review:
When it works it‚Äôs great. But at the very least once a month the app has issues connecting to my bank account or PayPal. Makes keeping track of things frustrating and sometimes we forget what money was spent on what stores because so many days have passed between when the transaction happened and when the app corrects itself. 

Others might not have this issue.
title: Good and Bad

review: Please, please add an "undo" button to the mobile app. I make too many bonehead mistakes to work without "undo". And could you please add a way to see budget adjustments? For example, if I pull money from one category to cover over-spending from another, I really should be able to see where that budget amount came from and how much was pulled.
title: Love it, but please ...

review: Got this app 2 years ago and have been able to understand my own spending SO much better. Every transaction adds up, and now I can see where everything goes quickly and easily.

review: They make this app ‚Äúaddictive‚Äù in a good way to keep you coming back. Ynab superior to other budgeting apps like Mint because it is a  proactive budgeting system. Although I recommend you read the book first because there can be a bit of a learning curve.

title: Life changing

review: I am a long time user of YNAB who was grandfathered in at the $45/year rate. Apparently that was only temporary and the price for legacy users will double on Dec 1st. I understand the need to periodically increase prices over time but not for a group you promised static lifetime pricing to. There has also been no new substantial features added making the annual price (which is in line with an Office 365 subscription) ridiculous. It‚Äôs unfortunate but I will not renew going forward.
title: Price will Double with no Added Features

review: My wife and I had struggled for years (over a decade) with setting and staying on a budget. She decided to download this app and try it out. After the trial ended it became clear, for us, that the app was worth the money. We have had tremendous success staying on track ever since.
title: On the same page

review: This is a review more on the company and their budgeting philosophy rather than the app alone. To be honest, it took me 3 tries before YNAB‚Äôs budgeting philosophy finally stick. Even though I much prefer their web app, the iPhone app is good enough for me to enter my transactions immediately after a purchase when I‚Äôm on the go.
title: Life changing

review:
Great app. 

One suggestion: ability to decategorize a transaction on mobile. Sometimes I don‚Äôt know what I want to categorize something as but if it gets a category in there suddenly it‚Äôs taking money out of a category that shouldn‚Äôt be having money taken out for it.
title: Change your life amazing

review: When I first started using this app, I had a spreadsheet that tracked all my spending. This was a very manual process and it was blind to careless, impulse purchases. Now, I predict what my spending will be and the budget categories give me metrics I can use to track my spend during the month. It‚Äôs all automated and reduces my stress!
title: I‚Äôm in control!

review: It just makes sense. It really is an awesome product. I don‚Äôt have a ‚Äòthis got me out of debt and transformed my life‚Äô kind of story but it certainly makes it so I never have any surprises and I‚Äôve been more at ease with finances. I haven‚Äôt been in debt, always pay in full, but I still consider YNAB essential!
title: I‚Äôll keep it simple

review:
There have been bugs. And you should make sure your accounts will let you connect to this site to import, but as a lifetime budget-er this app makes it easier to approve and categorize transactions.
The desktop version is way better to use when moving monies around and budgeting but the app as an accessory is fab!
title: Using for years

review: This app is just a small part of a method of budgeting that has changed the way we handle our money. No more fights over spending. Debt soon to be a thing of the past. YNAB has us on a clearly laid out path to financial success. I can‚Äôt recommend it enough.
title: Life changer.

review: What a piece of friggin‚Äô art. I‚Äôve never consistently budgeted this long and seen the results of it like I have from using YNAB. While I found it a little confusing to use at first, it‚Äôs a life saver. Paid off old credit card debt because of it. This app will be a tremendous help in your life if you let it.

Seriously, YNAB makes budgeting easy, and even FUN! My family and I are so thankful for YNAB and whatever angel from God that created the app! ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è

It is unusual that you would have to reauthenticate each and every time you open the app - although depending on your bank, it may be necessary - we can definitely check into it for you though!", 'modified': '2018-07-16T13:57:53Z'}
review: The idea seems good but I‚Äôm glad I did not pay for the subscription. In the age of 2FA being enabled in all banks for security, this application should be handling that way better than any other free apps out there (see Mint). I would consider using and paying for it if I didn‚Äôt have to enter my credentials every time I tried to refresh my accounts (or every time I opened the app). I will not be using this or recommending this to anyone who is interested in keeping their bank accounts secure.
title: Useless with proper bank connections

review: I‚Äôve been searching for this App for over 2 years. YNAB has literally all the features I was looking for and more. This concept is simple and provides the maximum amount of visibility into our true financial situation all of the time. The app is easy to use and designed very well.
title: Finally

developerResponse: {'id': 2504914, 'body': "Hi The Bobbles! We'd love to talk a bit more about your experience and see if we can help you with some of the things you've mentioned here!  If you want to reach out to us at help@ynab.com we'd be happy to help!", 'modified': '2018-02-05T21:45:17Z'}
review:
I hate this app. Several of my bills are paid quarterly so I budget 1/3 of the amount each month. Then I‚Äôd get notices, ‚ÄúOh My God!!! Your payment is late!!! Make payment now!!!‚Äù Um, no. I have a handle on this.

Then the app would make decisions for me that because I had budgeted more than I needed to pay this month, next month it would budget less. No. For example electric is higher in the summer when the a/c is running so my bill may be higher or lower. Sheesh, you‚Äôd think the app would understand that.

Then the app completely deleted most of my budget and it was nowhere to be found. Or it would import bank balances that had already been accounted for. 

I wanted a simple budget app that would be in my phone so always available. Sadly this isn‚Äôt it.
title: Oh no...

developerResponse: {'id': 47457236, 'body': 'Hi Johnny, glad you found a tool that works for you! If you ever want to give YNAB and zero-based budgeting another go, our Support team is fantastic‚Äîreach out anytime from the app or at help@ynab.com. ~ Lauren @ YNAB', 'modified': '2024-10-15T04:48:54Z'}
review: I‚Äôm sure this works for others but after a whole year of using YNAB (bc Mint shutdown) this app is still like trying to read Japanese. The system is bizarre for me, and my connections and balances constantly require babysitting and reconciliation. Overall it was okay but it made tracking my expenses harder than I‚Äôd like. A week ago I found Quick Simplifi and that is what you want at 1/3 the price per year.
title: Mint Users Dont Bother

review: I wish it had more accounting type features and reporting, but what they have works extremely well.  I run my entire finances with YNAB.  If they would incorporate tags and a system for saving receipts etc, this would be just about perfect.
title: Best Out Ther

review: It‚Äôs been about six months and I was a former mint user. It was hard to get onto it first but now I am actually looking forward to the turn of the month so I can get everything green again.
title: I‚Äôm really getting into this app

That along with the continued price hikes has made it no longer an option.  I wish I could have kept an old version at a lower price.
title: Ok but too expensive

review: Love YNAB. The App is great and they keep working to improve it. I still use the desktop version for a deeper look at our budget, but the app is great for entering / approving transactions on the fly. Or when you are out and need to know how much money you have available.
title: YNAB is awesome!

review: Was an excellent service that I would recommend to anyone, except it does not work. If you have a non-major bank, get a different app. You will have connection issues, I‚Äôm going on a week without seeing any transaction from any accounts. They use a third party service to acquire their data from banks and it is CONSTANTLY DOWN. I really regret wasting money on this app, ironic for a app that‚Äôs supposed to save money. Can‚Äôt save money if it doesn‚Äôt work.

My partners bank account didn‚Äôt link automatically and months later they are still ‚Äúworking on it‚Äù. Obviously this is past the free trial period and now we‚Äôre paying an annual subscription for an app we can‚Äôt use. If your bank account doesn‚Äôt link right away, don‚Äôt bother.
title: Doesn‚Äôt work with all banks and customer service is a joke

review: Innovative, comprehensive, and practical. Customer service second to none plus weekly and sometimes daily hints from fantastic personalities. Easily the most useful app in our library. Thanks YNAB for changing our lives and easing our minds!
title: A game changer!

review: YNAB was the perfect implementation of the type (Envelope) of budget that I can work with. They keep up to date with bank sync problems and have regular updates pushed out to all apps. A great community backs it up and is always willing to help.
title: Just my style

review: Price is increasing to $99 a year starting Dec 1st. That‚Äôs over 100% increase for some people. It‚Äôs a great product but why set the increase to take effect the month of CHRISTMAS when people are spending more! 30 days notice is bad business for a price increase in my opinion, as well as many others on r/ynab. I can‚Äôt justify the new price to new people that need help budgeting. Good luck!
title: It‚Äôs great but it‚Äôs getting more expensive.

review: I used to absolutely love this app but the new update has rendered it completely unusable for the way that I‚Äôve been using it to budget for literally years. Very much preferred how the ‚ÄúTo be budgeted‚Äù category worked than the ‚Äúready to assign‚Äù. There‚Äôs no option to to turn off the ‚Äúauto assign‚Äù or move it to the next month. My inflow is all stuck in the wrong month and it‚Äôs made it impossible to track. Please go back to the way it was before YNAB!
title: Used to love it

review: The budgeting tool helps us stay on the same page about where our money is going and our financial goals.  It‚Äôs easy to use because you can link your financial accounts to import transactions.
title: Great for our marriage

review: I‚Äôve been using YNAB since 2017, and it is he best decision for my finances I‚Äôve ever made. Follow their method, check in with your budget regularly, and you‚Äôll be able to do more with your money than you ever thought possible.
title: Absolutely lifechanging system

review: I will change my rating when you update with a better numerical keypad. It is horrible! I regularly punch a couple numbers and look up and see only 1 out of 4 numbers registering that I punched then I have to backspace and put too much effort into making sure the numbers weee entered. If they were actual buttons instead of floating numerals it would be awesome. I love the new update but please address this terrible keypad. It just seems super finicky. Please fix! Thanks‚Ä¶
title: Numeric Keypad is a joke

review: This app has literally changed the way I manage my finances. The entire team at YNAB offer so much encouragement and resources for your financial journey, and the education alone is worth a subscription to the app. Definitely a worthwhile investment, and one I recommend to all my friends looking for a budgeting system!
title: Best budgeting App

review:
With YNAB the past 6 years I have been able to pay off all of our debt, buy without guilt, and prepare for my families future.

I lost my job in August and because of YNAB I was quickly able to reduce my spending and had the piece of mind that I will be able to make it through!
title: YNAB leads to success

review: YNAB helped us get our entire life under control. We‚Äôve been able to see where our finances are really at, save for expensive medical issues, house projects etc. it helps you prioritize your entire life. I love YNAB and would recommend it to anyone!
title: Get your life under control with YNAB

review: Probably great but was too complicated to set up. Locked me out of one bank for accessing too frequently from different devices.  Couldn‚Äôt figure out how to link a cc with no login (only have Touch ID enabled). The setup help had no links to what they were talking about (ie. ‚Äúadd an account‚Äù doesn‚Äôt take you to the page to add it).  Add the $84 cost and I‚Äôm not exactly thrilled particularly since hello, budget.  Confusing to cancel/delete. Help message service takes too long to reply.  Probably great, but I‚Äôll never know.
title: Probably great

review:
About two months ago, YNAB changed their import partner and since then I have been unable to pull data from USAA and my local credit union. YNAB support has been unable to help and only tells me to keep waiting. 

Not having a clear picture of my finances while YNAB fixes their backend issues is stressful. I expected support to offer a discount on service for the hassle, but they refused to even do that. I‚Äôve been a customer for years, and the situation is extremely disappointing.
title: Imports fail and no support

review:
I‚Äôm coming up on a year of YNAB with my family, and I can think of no greater thing that has given me as much piece of mind and clarity as YNAB has done for us. 

Those first few months are tough, but once you get in the groove, I don‚Äôt ever remember what life was like before YNAB.
title: Life changing.

review:
I tried YNAB 4 years ago and couldn‚Äôt get past the learning curve and extra steps that existed then. 

However, with the new mobile app and improved system and more budgeting savvy that was needed on my part, I find the application well suited for our needs.

I especially like being able to input all transactions to have a real time understanding of where my money is and the sync/match function that happens when the transaction is finally cleared and imported. 

It has been a very nice change for where we are financially. 

Thanks!
title: Meets my needs and wants very well

review: I‚Äôve been using YNAB for over a year now, and I so wish EVERYONE would have this budgeting app, I‚Äôve been able to increase the age of my money almost a whole month since I started. review: Great app, really like the interface, simplicity of inputting data, and the philosophy of budget management used by the developers.  I would like to see more report options, such as spending in a category or category group over time.

review: I‚Äôve tried most of the other budget apps and loved this one! I‚Äôve been using it over a year now and just when I think it couldn‚Äôt get any better, they release an update with amazing new features that I didn‚Äôt even know I needed! Seriously folks, this YNAB is the best!
title: Fantastic tool!

review: What a terrible bait and switch.  They mention ‚Äúin app purchases‚Äù but not the Subscription.  $84 dollars a year, and it‚Äôs NEVER mentioned until you create a login and gain access.  At that point they tell you that they have subscribed you to their yearly plan.  I never OK‚Äôd this and wasn‚Äôt asked.  It‚Äôs a major pain to unsubscribe.  Their privacy policies are a joke.  For an supposedly concerned with people‚Äôs financial well being, the developer sure is going out of its way to screw its downloaders as much as possible.  STAY FAR AWAY!

You literally have permission to read my bank information. NOT worth the price in my opinion. This has made budgeting more complicated than it has to be and wasted a lot of my time.

review:

review: YNAB is really the only way to manage finances that truly gets results (I‚Äôve tried them all). Having the full functionality everywhere I go in the mobile app is awesome to stay on top of the budget at all times. Want to feel empowered and in control of your financial life? Buy YNAB.

The desktop version seems to be more robust and is a little easier for me to follow and find things visually. So I‚Äôd recommend being set up on both because they complement each other well.
title: Good app

review: Love this app!!! Using YNAB has changed the course of our finances. I‚Äôve been consistently  using it for about 18 months, and I‚Äôve given up using Quicken which allowed me to track my finances after the fact . With YNAB, I‚Äôm pro-actively making spending decisions. We no longer live paycheck to paycheck.
title: Lifechanging

review: I really enjoy using YNAB online and in the app, but I really think they are missing out not having some sort of security on the app. If your login credentials are saved anyone can pickup your phone and log right into all of your financial accounts. At least put a passcode if you can‚Äôt use fingerprint or Face ID.
title: Great app overall, but missing security.

review: I really wanted this app to work for my husband and I to budget together. He was able to link his account but after several communications and attempts on my end including calls with my bank I was unable to link my account. The solution I was given was to input all my information manually each transaction- why would I pay an app for me to do all the work?!?! I found this useless and the run around I was given with no solid solution was time consuming and frustrating.
title: No go

review: I love YNAB and I do like the iOS app, but it could really use Touch ID. It would help both with security and convenience aspects of the app. Being able to quickly use the app when you are on the go is one of the features being advertised, but who wants to fuss with a password when you are in the middle of things? Not me.
title: No Touch ID

review: This app literally changed my life, now I can reliably predict how much I‚Äôll save every month and build resiliency. May seem complicated first time using it but spend 10 mins looking at the tutorial and it will be easy.

This app is excellent. I‚Äôve been doing envelope budgeting for years using a PC-based system that worked, but that did not allow me to easily enter transactions on the fly. I had the bad habit of waiting until the end of the month to batch enter transactions.

YNAB works well on my iPhone, and it‚Äôs so easy to be up-to-date every day on our spending. 

YNAB does a terrific job of handling the monthly accruals that I make for taxes, auto repairs, vacation, home maintenance, and the like. That‚Äôs a really important feature for me.

I love being in control of my finances and I love this app!

review: It‚Äôs been great to use overall and I feel that I have so much more control over my money! Most of  time, it‚Äôs pretty easy to use! I just wish there was an ‚Äúundo‚Äù button on the mobile app.

title: Life changing!

review: You need a budget‚Ä¶yes, you do. If you‚Äôre not budgeting, you‚Äôre doing it wrong. YNAB is a great program that has helped so many people, including me. Take control of your money and feel the freedom. Budgeting literally changed my life.

review: Love this app. It took me a while to figure out how to budget every single dollar. The key is knowing when to budget next months expenses. I always budget a month ahead, so in March I am budgeting my income for April expenses.

review: I make decent money, but could never figure where it went.  Even went so far as to start writing an app so I could understand what was going on.  Then I found this and scrapped the idea.  It was exactly what I was looking for and more.  Thanks YNAB!

review:
I love YNAB. There is no question there. However these linked accounts continually disconnecting is not working to your favor as a company.

review: This app has changed my life. I have control over my spending, and I feel far less stressed about my finances. I‚Äôve saved so much more money than I would have without it.

Thanks, YNAB

review: YNAB has been a game changer in how we budget! It has helped to streamline the process and make it so much easier to keep up with everything. Their support is great and always helpful if I have an issue. I would highly recommend YNAB to anyone needing a budgeting system.

review: An outstanding tool to allow you to control your money and, essentially, your life.  It takes a bit of time and patience to get used to YNAB‚Äôs unique approach to personal finance but eventually it clicks. Now I can‚Äôt imagine doing without it.

review: With YNAB, we have been able to pay off $67,000 + in debt! This system really helps make budgeting a piece of cake. It takes some trial and error at first, but it‚Äôs totally worth it. We feel in control of our money, and I love how easy it is to ‚Äúroll with the punches‚Äù! Thanks, YNAB!
title: Life changing

I‚Äôve been using YNAB for a few years and love it but recently it has stopped syncing with my bank (Wells Fargo). I‚Äôve reconnected and it says it has synced but the reality is it hasn‚Äôt in about a month. This makes it difficult to budget for me. 
I‚Äôve seen other reviews that have also said their sync stopped working with a different bank, so it seems the issue is not specific to one bank.
title: Troubles syncing with bank

review: I like the concept, and it‚Äôs a great idea but absolutely terrible bank connections make this very hard to use. Syncing is awful, rarely works, and some accounts simply can‚Äôt be setup. The same functionality on another solution tried worked quickly and flawlessly so I‚Äôm not keen to blame the bank here. More attention needs to be paid to these features.

review: I think this is only the second review I‚Äôve ever written since I‚Äôve had an iPod Touch which was 7th or 8th grade. This app is AMAZING and the program is worth the money. review:
YNAB as a program of money management is great in theory, and If I want to work off my computer and shuffle csv files to import, I would rate the YNAB website as great!

However, the app is another story. The app doesn‚Äôt play well with bank logins.

What‚Äôs worse, this has been a persistent third party issue before and after the use of Plaid as a third party partner.

And customer service is like a predictable broken record that writes lengthy instructions on how to get around their app shortcomings.

And they customer service doesn‚Äôt understand that it‚Äôs the app, with direct import, that I feel is *really* worth the price.

So the app is in the crapper for me until they get the direct import fixed.

- in the budget screen, when viewing info, you can‚Äôt tap somewhere else to close the info screen. üòí

I also wish there was an easier way to switch between budgets. ü§∑üèª‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è(I never use the lightning button, why not let the user choose what shortcut they want there?)

review: Your search stops here. This is the best budgeting app (and system) out there. I‚Äôve been a fan for almost 10 years now.
title: Life changing, incredible app

review:
After years of loyalty, this app is dead in the water. Do a twitter or Reddit search. All the most loyal users are abandoning ship after the company reneged on its pricing promise and doubled the pricing with less than 30 days notice.

The developers rarely improve the app. Changes are REALLY slow. If your bank stops syncing prepare for months of manual entry. In one case PayPal stopped syncing for over a year with no fix. 

Support is condescending and the entire culture around this app (which used to be amazing) has soured due to their poor treatment of the most loyal customers. 

My advice is to stay away. There are cheaper alternatives that accomplish the same thing.
title: Yikes 100% price increase
